English: With all the legitimate concerns about AIDS and avian flu -- and we'll hear about that from the brilliant Dr. Brilliant later today -- I want to talk about the other pandemic, which is cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension -- all of which are completely preventable for at least 95 percent of people just by changing diet and lifestyle.
Chinese: 所有對於愛滋病同禽流感嘅擔心 都係好合理嘅 而我哋稍後亦會從 Brilliant 醫生 聽到有關嘅嘢 不過，而家我想講嘅係另一啲流行病 就係心血管疾病、糖尿病同高血壓 而且對於 95% 以上嘅患者嚟講 只要改變飲食習慣同生活作息 呢啲病完全係可以預防嘅

English: And what's happening is that there's a globalization of illness occurring, that people are starting to eat like us, and live like us, and die like us. And in one generation, for example, Asia's gone from having one of the lowest rates of heart disease and obesity and diabetes to one of the highest. And in Africa, cardiovascular disease equals the HIV and AIDS deaths in most countries.
Chinese: 但現正發生嘅事就係慢性病開始全球化 其他國家嘅人嘅飲食同生活方式 甚至死亡方式 都開始同我哋相似 例如短短一代人嘅時間 亞洲已經由其中一個心臟病、肥胖 同糖尿病發病率極低嘅地區 變成發病率極高嘅地區 喺非洲，患心血管疾病嘅人數 等同於喺大多數國家 死於愛滋病嘅人數

English: So there's a critical window of opportunity we have to make an important difference that can affect the lives of literally millions of people, and practice preventive medicine on a global scale.
Chinese: 所以呢個係一個關鍵時刻 我哋必須做一個重要嘅改變 去影響幾百萬人嘅生命 同埋喺全球實施預防性醫學

English: Heart and blood vessel diseases still kill more people -- not only in this country, but also worldwide -- than everything else combined, and yet it's completely preventable for almost everybody.
Chinese: 心血管疾病導致嘅死亡人數 比其他疾病加起嚟仲要高 呢樣嘢唔單止喺我哋嘅國家 全世界亦一樣 不過對絕大多數人嚟講

English: It's not only preventable; it's actually reversible. And for the last almost 29 years, we've been able to show that by simply changing diet and lifestyle, using these very high-tech, expensive, state-of-the-art measures to prove how powerful these very simple and low-tech and low-cost interventions can be like -- quantitative arteriography, before and after a year, and cardiac PET scans.
Chinese: 心血管疾病係完全可以避免嘅 甚至可以醫好 喺過去接近二十九年 我哋以一啲高科技、昂貴 先進嘅方法證明咗 透過改變飲食同生活作息 呢啲非常簡單、原始、低成本嘅 治療方法有幾大嘅威力 例如對比一年前同一年後嘅 定量動脈造影術 同埋心臟正子掃描

English: We showed a few months ago -- we published the first study showing you can actually stop or reverse the progression of prostate cancer by making changes in diet and lifestyle, and 70 percent regression in the tumor growth, or inhibition of the tumor growth, compared to only nine percent in the control group.
Chinese: 幾個月前，我們發表第一份研究 指出只需透過改變飲食同生活習慣 你就能夠停止或者逆轉前列腺癌擴散 令到 70% 嘅癌細胞縮小 或者停止生長 相對之下，對照組只有 9%

English: And in the MRI and MR spectroscopy here, the prostate tumor activity is shown in red -- you can see it diminishing after a year.
Chinese: 喺呢啲磁力共振造影同埋光譜分析裏邊 紅色係前列腺癌細胞活動 可以見到佢喺一年後減少咗

English: Now there is an epidemic of obesity: two-thirds of adults and 15 percent of kids. What's really concerning to me is that diabetes has increased 70 percent in the past 10 years, and this may be the first generation in which our kids live a shorter life span than we do. That's pitiful, and it's preventable.
Chinese: 現時癡肥非常流行 影響到三份之二嘅成人同 15% 嘅兒童 特別令我擔心嘅係 過往十年糖尿病人數已經上升咗 70% 我哋可能係第一個代人 見到細路短命過我哋 咁係好可悲 而且呢個情況其實係可以避免

English: Now these are not election returns, these are the people -- the number of the people who are obese by state, beginning in '85, '86, '87 -- these are from the CDC website -- '88, '89, '90, '91 -- you get a new category -- '92, '93, '94, '95, '96, '97, '98, '99, 2000, 2001 -- it gets worse. We're kind of devolving. (Laughter) Now what can we do about this? Well, you know, the diet that we've found that can reverse heart disease and cancer is an Asian diet.
Chinese: 呢啲並唔係選舉結果 而係各州肥胖人口統計 由 85、86、87 年起計 呢啲資料取自美國疾病管制 暨預防中心網站—— 88、89、90、91 年 一個新嘅分類 —— 92、93、94、95、96 年 97、98、99、2000、2001 ——越嚟越差 我哋一直喺度退化（笑聲） 而家我哋可以為到呢樣做啲乜呢？ 我哋發現亞洲嘅飲食習慣 可以預防心臟病同癌症

English: But the people in Asia are starting to eat like we are, which is why they're starting to get sick like we are.
Chinese: 但亞洲人都開始食得好似我哋咁 因此佢哋都開始病到好似我哋咁

English: So I've been working with a lot of the big food companies. They can make it fun and sexy and hip and crunchy and convenient to eat healthier foods, like -- I chair the advisory boards to McDonald's, and PepsiCo, and ConAgra, and Safeway, and soon Del Monte, and they're finding that it's good business.
Chinese: 我一直有同好多大型飲食公司合作 佢哋可以令食用健康食品變得 樂趣、吸引、流行、有口感又方便 例如，我擔任麥當勞、百事可樂 康尼格拉食品、Safeway 嘅 諮詢董事會嘅主席 嚟緊仲會做埋台爾蒙食品 諮詢董事會主席 佢哋發現健康食品市場充滿商機

English: The salads that you see at McDonald's came from the work -- they're going to have an Asian salad. At Pepsi, two-thirds of their revenue growth came from their better foods.
Chinese: 你喺麥當勞見到嘅沙律 就係我哋嘅成果 佢哋將會有亞洲款式嘅沙律 喺百事可樂公司 三分二嘅營業增長 嚟自佢哋改良咗嘅食品

English: And so if we can do that, then we can free up resources for buying drugs that you really do need for treating AIDS and HIV and malaria and for preventing avian flu. Thank you.
Chinese: 所以如果我哋可以咁做 我哋就可以慳返好多資源 去買我哋真正需要嘅藥物 去治療愛滋病、瘧疾，或者禽流感 多謝各位！

English: On a warm August morning in Harare, Farai, a 24-year-old mother of two, walks towards a park bench.
Chinese: 喺八月嘅一個上晝 喺津巴布韋首都哈拉雷 有個叫法拉嘅女人 佢廿四歲，有兩個仔女 行去公園嘅一張長櫈度

English: She looks miserable and dejected.
Chinese: 佢望落去好鬱悶、好沮喪

English: Now, on the park bench sits an 82-year-old woman, better known to the community as Grandmother Jack.
Chinese: 嗰張公園長凳已經 有個八十二歲嘅婆婆坐喺度 人人都叫佢做 Jack 婆婆

English: Farai hands Grandmother Jack an envelope from the clinic nurse.
Chinese: 法拉遞畀 Jack 婆婆 一封診所護士畀佢嘅介紹信

English: Grandmother Jack invites Farai to sit down as she opens the envelope and reads.
Chinese: Jack 婆婆請佢坐低 然後打開個信封讀

English: There's silence for three minutes or so as she reads.
Chinese: 婆婆睇信嘅三分鐘裡邊，冇人講嘢

English: And after a long pause, Grandmother Jack takes a deep breath, looks at Farai and says, "I'm here for you.
Chinese: 隔咗一陣，Jack婆婆深呼吸 佢望住法拉講： 「我係來幫你嘅，

English: Would you like to share your story with me?"
Chinese: 你可唔可以講下你嘅事啊？」

English: Farai begins, her eyes swelling with tears.
Chinese: 法拉眼濕濕

English: She says, "Grandmother Jack, I'm HIV-positive.
Chinese: 佢話:「 Jack 婆婆啊， 我有愛滋病已經四年。

English: My husband left me a year ago.
Chinese: 老公一年前走咗佬。

English: I have two kids under the age of five.
Chinese: 我有兩個仔女， 佢哋都未到五歲。

English: I'm unemployed.
Chinese: 我失業，

English: I can hardly take care of my children."
Chinese: 我根本照顧唔嚟我啲仔女。 」

English: Tears are now flowing down her face.
Chinese: 佢淚流滿面

English: And in response, Grandmother Jack moves closer, puts her hand on Farai, and says, "Farai, it's OK to cry.
Chinese: 見到咁，Jack 婆婆坐埋過去 輕輕攬住法拉 話：「法拉，你可以喊㗎。

English: You've been through a lot.
Chinese: 你經歷咗好多事，

English: Would you like to share more with me?"
Chinese: 可唔可以再講多啲畀我聽？」

English: And Farai continues.
Chinese: 法拉繼續講：

English:
In the last three weeks, I have had recurrent thoughts of killing myself, taking my two children with me. 
I can't take it anymore. 
The clinic nurse sent me to see you.
Chinese: 「喺過去嘅三個禮拜， 我成日喺度諗自殺， 仲想帶埋啲仔女走。

English: There's an exchange between the two, which lasts about 30 minutes.
Chinese: 我頂唔順喇，

English: And finally, Grandmother Jack says, "Farai, it seems to me that you have all the symptoms of kufungisisa."
Chinese: 所以護士叫我嚟揾你 。」

English: The word "kufungisisa" opens up a floodgate of tears.
Chinese: 佢哋兩個傾咗大概半個鐘

English: So, kufungisisa is the local equivalent of depression in my country.
Chinese: 最尾，Jack 婆婆話： 「法拉， 睇嚟『Kufungisisa』 嘅病徵你都有曬。」

English: It literally means "thinking too much."
Chinese: 聽到呢個字，法拉又即刻喊番

English: The World Health Organization estimates that more than 300 million people globally, today, suffer from depression, or what in my country we call kufungisisa.
Chinese: 「Kufungisisa」 係當地話「抑鬱症」嘅意思

English: And the World Health Organization also tells us that every 40 seconds, someone somewhere in the world commits suicide because they are unhappy, largely due to depression or kufungisisa.
Chinese: 直譯就係「諗太多」

English: And most of these deaths are occurring in low- and middle-income countries.
Chinese: 世界衛生組織統計 依家全世界有多過三億人有抑鬱症 即係我個國家叫嘅 「Kufungisisa」

English: In fact, the World Health Organization goes as far as to say that when you look at the age group between 15 to 29, a leading cause of death now is actually suicide.
Chinese: 世界衛生組織又話 全世界每四十秒 就有一個人因為 抑鬱症，或者「Kufungisisa」 而自殺

English: But there are wider events that lead to depression and in some cases, suicide, such as abuse, conflict, violence, isolation, loneliness -- the list is endless.
Chinese: 呢啲自殺個案 多數出現喺中、低收入國家

English: But one thing that we do know is that depression can be treated and suicides averted.
Chinese: 事實上 世界衛生組織仲話 十五到二十九歲嘅年齡層 佢哋主要嘅死因係自殺

English: But the problem is we just don't have enough psychiatrists or psychologists in the world to do the job.
Chinese: 但係，導致抑鬱症 甚至自殺嘅原因有好多 例如虐待 衝突、暴力 隔離、孤獨等等

English: In most low- and middle-income countries, for instance, the ratio of psychiatrists to the population is something like one for every one and a half million people, which literally means that 90 percent of the people needing mental health services will not get it.
Chinese: 不過，我哋知道 抑鬱症有得醫，自殺可以避免

English: In my country, there are 12 psychiatrists, and I'm one of them, for a population of approximately 14 million.
Chinese: 問題係 全世界冇咁多 精神科醫生或者心理學家 來睇所有嘅病人

English: Now, let me just put that into context.
Chinese: 譬如，喺中、低收入國家 精神科醫生對人口嘅比例 大概係一對一百五十萬 即係話，九成需要心理服務嘅人 都得唔到幫助

English: One evening while I was at home, I get a call from the ER, or the emergency room, from a city which is some 200 kilometers away from where I live.
Chinese: 我哋成個國家 只有十二個精神科醫生 而我係其中嘅一個 我哋國家人口有一千四百萬

English: And the ER doctor says, "One of your patients, someone you treated four months ago, has just taken an overdose, and they are in the ER department.
Chinese: 我再畀多啲實際故事

English: Hemodynamically, they seem to be OK, but they will need neuropsychiatric evaluation."
Chinese: 有一晚，我喺屋企 收到 ER 打嚟嘅電話 ER 即係急症室 間急症室喺離我 兩百公里嘅一個城市度

English: Now, I obviously can't get into my car in the middle of the night and drive 200 kilometers.
Chinese: 個主診醫生話： 「你有個病人， 你四個月前醫過佢。 佢啱啱用藥過量， 依家入咗急症室。

English: So as best as we could, over the phone with the ER doctor, we come up with an assessment.
Chinese: 佢嘅血液動力正常， 不過需要神經心理科嘅檢查。 」

English: We ensure that suicidal observations are in place.
Chinese: 當然，我無可能半夜揸車 揸兩百公里去嗰度

English: We ensure that we start reviewing the antidepressants that this patient has been taking, and we finally conclude that as soon as Erica -- that was her name, 26-year-old -- as soon as Erica is ready to be released from the ER, she should come directly to me with her mother, and I will evaluate and establish what can be done.
Chinese: 所以，我哋唯有 喺電話度 諗出對應嘅辦法

English: And we assumed that that would take about a week.
Chinese: 我要確保有人觀察著病人嘅自殺傾向

English: A week passes.
Chinese: 要確保我哋審視返病人 服用抗抑鬱藥嘅劑量 最後得出嘅結論係 Erica —— 呢個係病人嘅名，佢廿六歲 喺 Erica 可以出院時 佢同佢媽媽就應該有直接來揾我 然後我就會對佢做檢查同評估 同決定下一步要點做

English: Three weeks pass.
Chinese: 我哋估計 Erica 大概一個禮拜之後就會來

English: No Erica.
Chinese: 過咗一個禮拜

English: And one day I get a call from Erica's mother, and she says, "Erica committed suicide three days ago.
Chinese: 過咗三個禮拜

English: She hanged herself from the mango tree in the family garden."
Chinese: 我都冇見到 Erica

English: Now, almost like a knee-jerk reaction, I couldn't help but ask, "But why didn't you come to Harare, where I live?
Chinese: 有一日，Erica 媽媽打電話畀我 佢話： 「Erica 三日前自殺咗。

English: We had agreed that as soon as you're released from the ER, you will come to me."
Chinese: 佢喺屋企花園 一樖芒果樹度吊頸。」

English: Her response was brief.
Chinese: 我本能反應噉忍唔住問： 「噉點解你哋冇嚟哈拉雷揾我？

English: We didn't have the 15 dollars bus fare to come to Harare.
Chinese: 我哋講好咗，Erica 一出院， 你哋就會嚟揾我 。」

English: Now, suicide is not an unusual event in the world of mental health.
Chinese: 佢解釋得好簡單：

English: But there was something about Erica's death that struck me at the core of my very being.
Chinese: 「去哈拉雷嘅車費要十五蚊， 我哋籌唔到錢。 」

English: That statement from Erica's mother: "We didn't have 15 dollars bus fare to come to you," made me realize that it just wasn't going to work, me expecting people to come to me.
Chinese: 喺精神科裏面 自殺唔算罕見

English: And I got into this state of soul-searching, trying to really discover my role as a psychiatrist in Africa.
Chinese: 但 Erica 嘅死 好震憾我

English: And after considerable consultation and soul-searching, talking to colleagues, friends and family, it suddenly dawned on me that actually, one the most reliable resources we have in Africa are grandmothers.
Chinese: 佢媽媽嗰句 「我哋籌錢唔到 十五蚊嘅車費嚟揾你。」 令我醒覺 等病人嚟揾我 呢個方法行唔通

English: Yes, grandmothers.
Chinese: 我開始自我反省 重新諗 我喺非洲做精神科醫生嘅職責

English: And I thought, grandmothers are in every community.
Chinese: 經過一番請教同思考 又同同事、家人、朋友傾過 我突然醒覺 其實非洲最多嘅資源 就喺啲婆婆

English: There are hundreds of them.
Chinese: 無錯，係婆婆

English: And -- (Laughter) And they don't leave their communities in search of greener pastures.
Chinese: 我喺度諗 每個社區都有好多婆婆

English: (Laughter) See, the only time they leave is when they go to a greener pasture called heaven.
Chinese: 有成幾百個

English: (Laughter) So I thought, how about training grandmothers in evidence-based talk therapy, which they can deliver on a bench?
Chinese: 仲有 （笑聲） 佢哋唔會離職， 唔會換工走人

English: Empower them with the skills to listen, to show empathy, all of that rooted in cognitive behavioral therapy; empower them with the skills to provide behavior activation, activity scheduling; and support them using digital technology.
Chinese: （笑聲） 佢哋唯一走佬會去嘅地方 就係天堂

English: You know, mobile phone technology.
Chinese: （笑聲） 所以我諗，不如訓練呢啲婆婆 教佢哋循證談話療法 等佢哋可以坐喺公園長櫈度幫人

English: Pretty much everyone in Africa has a mobile phone today.
Chinese: 根據認知行為療法 教佢哋聆聽嘅技巧 教佢哋表達同情心 教佢哋技巧來引導病人做正確行為 安排病人嘅活動 同埋教佢哋學識用數碼科技

English: So in 2006, I started my first group of grandmothers.
Chinese: 譬如︰手機

English: (Applause) Thank you.
Chinese: 依家, 喺非洲人人都有手機

English: (Applause) Today, there are hundreds of grandmothers who are working in more than 70 communities.
Chinese: 喺 2006 年 我組織到 第一班婆婆

English: And in the last year alone, more than 30,000 people received treatment on the Friendship Bench from a grandmother in a community in Zimbabwe.
Chinese: （掌聲） 多謝

English: (Applause) And recently, we published this work that is done by these grandmothers in the Journal of the American Medical Association.
Chinese: （掌聲） 今日，我哋有幾百個婆婆 分散喺七十幾個社區度做嘢

English: And -- (Applause) And our results show that six months after receiving treatment from a grandmother, people were still symptom-free: no depression, suicidal ideation completely reduced.
Chinese: 單單係舊年 已經有三萬以上嘅津巴布韋人 喺社區嘅「友誼長櫈」計劃度 接受咗一個婆婆嘅治療

English: In fact, our results -- this was a clinical trial -- in fact, this clinical trial showed that grandmothers were more effective at treating depression than doctors and -- (Laughter) (Applause) And so, we're now working towards expanding this program.
Chinese: （掌聲） 最近，我哋喺 美國醫學研究協會嘅雜誌 發表文章講述呢啲計劃同婆婆嘅工作

English: There are more than 600 million people currently aged above 65 in the world.
Chinese: 仲有 （掌聲） 我哋嘅研究結果顯示 接受過婆婆治療嘅病人 喺六個月後 依然無復發嘅徵像 無抑鬱 少咗好多自殺嘅傾向

English: And by the year 2050, there will be 1.5 billion people aged 65 and above.
Chinese: 我哋嘅研究顯示 —— 呢個係臨床試驗 臨床試驗結果顯示 婆婆醫抑鬱症仲有效過醫生 （笑聲） （掌聲） 所以 我哋依家努力擴展呢個計劃

English: Imagine if we could create a global network of grandmothers in every major city in the world, who are trained in evidence-based talk therapy, supported through digital platforms, networked.
Chinese: 依家，全球有六億 六十五歲以上嘅人口

English: And they will make a difference in communities.
Chinese: 到 2050 年 會有十五億 六十五歲以上嘅人口

English: They will reduce the treatment gap for mental, neurological and substance-use disorders.
Chinese: 想像一下, 如果我哋能夠 喺全世界所有主要城市 建立一個國際婆婆網絡 而啲婆婆又受過 循證談話療法嘅訓練 有電子平台支援佢哋 又有網絡將佢哋聯繫起來

English: Finally, this is a file photograph of Grandmother Jack.
Chinese: 佢哋會為社區做出好多貢獻

English: So, Farai had six sessions on the bench with Grandmother Jack.
Chinese: 佢哋會縮窄當地 心理、神經同濫用藥物問題上嘅 醫療供求差距

English: Today, Farai is employed.
Chinese: 最後 呢張係 Jack 婆婆嘅相

English: She has her two children at school.
Chinese: 法拉喺「友誼長櫈」 同婆婆有六次療程

English: And as for Grandmother Jack, one morning in February, we expected her to see her 257th client on the bench.
Chinese: 依家，法拉揾到工做

So what's a good definition for cyborg?

Chinese: 一般嚟講呢哋就係你可以聯繫到嘅人 同埋同你保持聯繫嘅朋友，家人。

English: They're not just sitting there.
Chinese: 隨之而嚟嘅係我哋會有一種心理效應。

English: And really, when you have no external input, that is a time when there is a creation of self, when you can do long-term planning, when you can try and figure out who you really are.
Chinese: 一種我好擔心嘅心理效應， 就係人類唔再花費時間嚟反省自己， 佢地唔再放慢節奏同埋停落嚟， 時刻同屋入面嘅人係埋一齊， 嘗試係同一時間內 獲得所有人嘅注意力， 同時活係研究 古生物學同埋面對恐慌嘅架構中。

English: And then, once you do that, you can figure out how to present your second self in a legitimate way, instead of just dealing with everything as it comes in -- and oh, I have to do this, and I have to do this, and I have to do this.
Chinese: 佢地唔止係坐埋一齊咁簡單。

English: And so this is very important.
Chinese: 講真果句，當你唔再受黎自外部嘅影響果陣， 你就有一段可以創造自我嘅時間， 一段可以作長遠計劃嘅時間， 嘗試發覺究竟自己係點樣一個人。

English: I'm really worried that, especially kids today, they're not going to be dealing with this down-time, that they have an instantaneous button-clicking culture, and that everything comes to them, and that they become very excited about it and very addicted to it.
Chinese: 而一旦你咁樣做，你就會搞清楚 應該點樣合理咁呈現第二個自己， 而唔係等所有嘢發生之後再臨時應對—— 哦，我要做呢個，我要做那個，我一定做呢個。

English: So if you think about it, the world hasn't stopped either.
Chinese: 所以呢一點係非常重要嘅。

English: It has its own external prosthetic devices, and these devices are helping us all to communicate and interact with each other.
Chinese: 我真係好擔心，尤其對依家嘅細路仔， 佢地冇靜低心嚟處理事情嘅時間， 因為佢地生活係一個不停點擊按鈕嘅文化中， 咩嘢都向佢地湧埋嚟， 佢地就會變得好興奮，甚至沉迷其中。

English: But when you actually visualize it, all the connections that we're doing right now -- this is an image of the mapping of the Internet -- it doesn't look technological.
Chinese: 你唸下，呢個世界都未試過停落嚟。

English: It actually looks very organic.
Chinese: 佢都有自己嘅外部修復設備， 而且呢啲設備都係度幫哽我哋 互相溝通同交流。

English: This is the first time in the entire history of humanity that we've connected in this way.
Chinese: 如果你可以見度呢啲 將我哋聯繫埋一齊嘅網路， 你會發覺呢個係一幅互聯網嘅地圖—— 佢睇起身無乜技術含量；

English: And it's not that machines are taking over.
Chinese: 不過事實上係有機化嘅。

English: It's that they're helping us to be more human, helping us to connect with each other.
Chinese: 呢個係人類歷史上第一次 以咁樣嘅方式嚟連接每個人。

English: The most successful technology gets out of the way and helps us live our lives.
Chinese: 而且唔係部機器係度話事，

English: And really, it ends up being more human than technology, because we're co-creating each other all the time.
Chinese: 而係佢幫我哽我哋變得更人性化， 更好咁同每個人溝通。

English: And so this is the important point that I like to study: that things are beautiful, that it's still a human connection -- it's just done in a different way.
Chinese: 最成功嘅技術係幫我哋排除障礙， 幫助我哋生活得更美好。

English: We're just increasing our humanness and our ability to connect with each other, regardless of geography.
Chinese: 確切嚟講， 機器令到我哋最後變得更人性化而非技術化， 因為我哋一路都係度互相合作，共同創造。

English: So that's why I study cyborg anthropology.
Chinese: 呢個就係我想研究嘅一個重點： 事物係美好嘅，不過依然需要人與人之間嘅聯繫； 只不過係以一種唔同嘅方式。

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 我哋正係度增強自身嘅特性， 聯繫彼此嘅能力，不受地域嘅限制。

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 呢個就係點解我要研究半機械人類學。
多謝噻！

English: I'm going to be talking to you about how we can tap a really underutilized resource in health care, which is the patient, or, as I like to use the scientific term, people.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: Because we are all patients, we are all people.
Even doctors are patients at some point.
Chinese: 我將會同大家講吓 我哋點樣可以有效利用 一種絕對被忽視嘅醫療上嘅資源。 呢種資源就係病人本身， 或者﹐以科學術語嚟講 —— 人。

English: So I want to talk about that as an opportunity that we really have failed to engage with very well in this country and, in fact, worldwide.
Chinese: 因為我哋都係病人，我們亦都係人。

English: If you want to get at the big part -- I mean from a public health level, where my training is -- you're looking at behavioral issues.
Chinese: 就連醫生﹐有時都可以係病人。

English: You're looking at things where people are actually given information, and they're not following through with it.
Chinese: 所以我想討論呢種資源 可帶嚟嘅良機﹐ 一項我哋國家﹐甚至全世界 都冇足夠善用到嘅良機。

English: It's a problem that manifests itself in diabetes, obesity, many forms of heart disease, even some forms of cancer -- when you think of smoking.
Chinese: 如果你想由大局嚟睇 -- 由公共醫療嘅角度﹐即係我嘅職業範圍 -- 我哋就見到行為上嘅問題，

English: Those are all behaviors where people know what they're supposed to do.
Chinese: 你會發現人得到訊息之後﹐ 並冇妥善跟進。

English: They know what they're supposed to be doing, but they're not doing it.
Chinese: 呢個問題﹐於糖尿病﹑ 肥胖症以及多種嘅心臟病﹐ 甚至﹐如果考慮到吸煙問題﹐於癌症方面﹐都有存在。

English: Now behavior change is something that is a long-standing problem in medicine.
Chinese: 所有人都知道應該要點樣做先至正確﹐

English: It goes all the way back to Aristotle.
Chinese: 雖然知道應該要點樣做﹐ 但佢哋冇去做到。

English: And doctors hate it, right?
Chinese: 要將行為改變﹐ 一直都係醫學上長期存在嘅問題。

English: I mean, they complain about it all the time.
Chinese: 遠至亞里士多德嘅時代都有存在。

English: We talk about it in terms of engagement, or non-compliance.
Chinese: 而且醫生都討厭呢種行為，係嗎？

English: When people don't take their pills, when people don't follow doctors' orders -- these are behavior problems.
Chinese: 我意思係﹐醫生經常都抱怨呢個問題。

English: But for as much as clinical medicine agonizes over behavior change, there's not a lot of work done in terms of trying to fix that problem.
Chinese: 我哋通常歸納為留心聽取﹐以及唔聽指示。

English: So the crux of it comes down to this notion of decision-making -- giving information to people in a form that doesn't just educate them or inform them, but actually leads them to make better decisions, better choices in their lives.
Chinese: 當有人唔食藥﹑ 唔聽醫生吩咐﹐ 呢啲都係行為問題。

English: One part of medicine, though, has faced the problem of behavior change pretty well, and that's dentistry.
Chinese: 但係無論臨床醫學專家點樣 為改變病人行為嘅問題而煩惱﹐ 要解決呢個問題﹐ 我哋能力根本有限。

English: Dentistry might seem -- and I think it is -- many dentists would have to acknowledge it's somewhat of a mundane backwater of medicine.
Chinese: 因此解決問題嘅關鍵 在於助人去作出正確嘅判斷 -- 即是於提供信息嘅時候﹐ 不單只教育病人﹐ 或者通知佢哋， 而係實際上引導佢哋去作更好嘅決定﹐ 於生活上作更好嘅選擇。

English: Not a lot of cool, sexy stuff happening in dentistry.
Chinese: 其實﹐喺醫學上有一個領域 已經比較成功解決到行為改變方面嘅問題﹐ 就係牙科。

English: But they have really taken this problem of behavior change and solved it.
Chinese: 好多人眼中﹐包括我自己﹐ 而且好多牙醫都承認， 牙科於某程度係醫學上一個沉悶嘅死角。

English: It's the one great preventive health success we have in our health care system.
Chinese: 牙科嘅領域一般都冇任何新奇有趣嘅事發生。

English: People brush and floss their teeth.
Chinese: 但係佢哋確實有將改變行為嘅問題作出研究 而且解決咗呢個問題。

English: They don't do it as much as they should, but they do it.
Chinese: 呢個係我哋嘅醫療保體系統中 一個非常成功嘅疾病預防嘅例子。

English: So I'm going to talk about one experiment that a few dentists in Connecticut cooked up about 30 years ago.
Chinese: 每個人都刷牙﹐而且用牙線剔牙。

English: So this is an old experiment, but it's a really good one, because it was very simple, so it's an easy story to tell.
Chinese: 佢哋雖然做得唔夠多﹐但係都總算有做。

English: So these Connecticut dentists decided that they wanted to get people to brush their teeth and floss their teeth more often, and they were going to use one variable: they wanted to scare them.
Chinese: 所以我就想同大家分享一個實驗。 呢個係一個30年前﹐幾個喺美國康州嘅牙醫 諗出嚟嘅實驗。

English: They wanted to tell them how bad it would be if they didn't brush and floss their teeth.
Chinese: 呢個實驗雖然古老，但係的確唔錯 因為佢非常簡單， 所以亦好容易說明。

English: They had a big patient population.
Chinese: 話說﹐呢班康州嘅牙醫決定 想令到病人更頻密地刷牙﹐而且用牙線清理牙齒。 而佢哋利用咗一個變量﹕ 佢哋想要令人驚怕。

English: They divided them up into two groups.
Chinese: 佢哋想講給病人知道 如果唔刷牙﹑唔用牙線﹐後果將會點樣嚴重。

English: They had a low-fear population, where they basically gave them a 13-minute presentation, all based in science, but told them that, if you didn't brush and floss your teeth, you could get gum disease. If you get gum disease, you will lose your teeth, but you'll get dentures, and it won't be that bad.
Chinese: 佢哋當時有好多病人。

English: So that was the low-fear group.
Chinese: 於是將呢些病人分成兩組。

English: The high-fear group, they laid it on really thick.
Chinese: 一組是低恐慌組， 佢哋比呢組人睇一段13分鐘 有科學根據嘅講解， 但係亦講比佢哋知道，如果唔刷牙﹑唔用牙線， 可能就會得到牙周病，而如果得到牙周病，就會失去牙齒， 但係重可以戴假牙，情況就唔會太差。

English: They showed bloody gums.
Chinese: 呢個就是低恐慌組嘅部份。

English: They showed puss oozing out from between their teeth.
Chinese: 對於高恐慌組﹐佢哋就落足料。

English: They told them that their teeth were going to fall out.
Chinese: 佢哋比呢一組睇見血淋淋嘅牙肉﹑

English: They said that they could have infections that would spread from their jaws to other parts of their bodies, and ultimately, yes, they would lose their teeth.
Chinese: 牙縫之間流膿嘅口腔。

English: They would get dentures, and if you got dentures, you weren't going to be able to eat corn-on-the-cob, you weren't going to be able to eat apples, you weren't going to be able to eat steak.
Chinese: 佢哋對實驗者講牙齒會脫落﹑

English: You'll eat mush for the rest of your life.
Chinese: 佢哋會受到細菌感染 而細菌會由嘴巴擴散到身體其他部份， 同埋最後﹐佢哋當然會失去牙齒。

English: So go brush and floss your teeth.
Chinese: 雖然都可以戴假牙，但是戴假牙 就再唔可以食原條粟米﹑ 唔可以食蘋果﹑ 唔可以食牛扒。

English: That was the message. That was the experiment.
Chinese: 下半世就只好食糊狀嘅食物。

English: Now they measured one other variable.
Chinese: 所以快去刷牙同埋用牙線啦。

English: They wanted to capture one other variable, which was the patients' sense of efficacy.
Chinese: 呢個就係其中嘅信息，實驗就係咁樣進行。

English: This was the notion of whether the patients felt that they actually would go ahead and brush and floss their teeth.
Chinese: 跟住佢哋測試咗另一個變量。

English: So they asked them at the beginning, "Do you think you'll actually be able to stick with this program?"
Chinese: 佢哋想要研究嘅變量就係 病人自認為嘅能動性。

English: And the people who said, "Yeah, yeah. I'm pretty good about that," they were characterized as high efficacy, and the people who said, "Eh, I never get around to brushing and flossing as much as I should," they were characterized as low efficacy.
Chinese: 即係話﹐病人自己認為佢哋會唔會 真係去刷牙同埋用牙線。

English: So the upshot was this.
Chinese: 所以於實驗嘅開始﹐佢哋問病人﹐ 「你哋認為自己的確會依照呢個計劃進行嗎？」

English: The upshot of this experiment was that fear was not really a primary driver of the behavior at all.
Chinese: 回答「會﹑一定會﹐呢方面我好在行」嘅參加者﹐ 都被列入高能動性嘅一組。 而回答「噢﹐我從來都無法養成 刷牙﹑用牙線嘅習慣」嘅人﹐ 都被列入缺乏能動性嘅一組。

English: The people who brushed and flossed their teeth were not necessarily the people who were really scared about what would happen -- it's the people who simply felt that they had the capacity to change their behavior.
Chinese: 終於得到嘅結論就係咁樣。

English: So fear showed up as not really the driver.
Chinese: 呢個實驗證實 恐懼其實完全唔係帶動行為的 主要因素。

English: It was the sense of efficacy.
Chinese: 照指示刷牙﹑用牙線嘅人 並唔一定係 對可能帶來嘅後果感到恐懼嘅人﹐ 而係只需要係認為自己有能力 去改變自己行為嘅人。

English: So I want to isolate this, because it was a great observation -- 30 years ago, right, 30 years ago -- and it's one that's laid fallow in research.
Chinese: 因此顯示到﹐能夠改變行為嘅原動力並唔係恐懼，

English: It was a notion that really came out of Albert Bandura's work, who studied whether people could get a sense of empowerment.
Chinese: 而係病人自認為嘅能動性。

English: The notion of efficacy basically boils down to one -- that if somebody believes that they have the capacity to change their behavior.
Chinese: 所以我想特別談及呢個例子， 因為呢個確實係非常唔錯嘅觀察結果， 30年前﹐冇錯﹐係30年前嘅結論﹐ 而一直冇被發揮﹑利用嘅﹐就係呢個結論。

English: In health care terms, you could characterize this as whether or not somebody feels that they see a path towards better health, that they can actually see their way towards getting better health, and that's a very important notion.
Chinese: 呢個想法其實起源於 Albert Bandura 嘅研究之中﹐ 佢曾研究 人是否可取得賦能感。

English: It's an amazing notion.
Chinese: 能動性嘅理念最後可以總結為﹕ 一個人是否相信﹐自己有能力去改變自己嘅行為。

English: We don't really know how to manipulate it, though, that well.
Chinese: 以醫療角度，我哋可以將呢個概括爲 人是否能夠意識到 佢哋改善健康狀況嘅途徑， 以至佢哋能夠確實為自己健康作出改善。 而呢個係非常重要嘅一個觀點。

English: Except, maybe we do.
Chinese: 係一個奇妙嘅觀點。

English: So fear doesn't work, right? Fear doesn't work.
Chinese: 只不過我哋未懂得點樣去有效利用佢。

English: And this is a great example of how we haven't learned that lesson at all.
Chinese: 又或者﹐我哋已經懂得。

English: This is a campaign from the American Diabetes Association.
Chinese: 恐懼起唔到作用。係﹐恐懼起唔到作用。

English: This is still the way we're communicating messages about health.
Chinese: 而呢個係個非常好嘅例子， 證明我哋完全唔會接受教訓。

English: I mean, I showed my three-year-old this slide last night, and he's like, "Papa, why is an ambulance in these people's homes?"
Chinese: 以下係美國糖尿病協會嘅一個宣傳活動。

English: And I had to explain, "They're trying to scare people."
Chinese: 亦都係目前醫療健康方面仍然採用來傳達信息嘅方法。

English: And I don't know if it works.
Chinese: 我想講嘅係，我昨晚比我三歲嘅孩子睇咗呢張幻燈片， 然後佢話：「爸爸，點解呢啲人屋企裡面會有救護車呢？」

English: Now here's what does work: personalized information works.
Chinese: 我只能解釋：「呢個只係用來嚇人。」

English: Again, Bandura recognized this years ago, decades ago.
Chinese: 我都唔知道呢個做法有效與否。

English: When you give people specific information about their health, where they stand, and where they want to get to, where they might get to, that path, that notion of a path -- that tends to work for behavior change.
Chinese: 而以下才是有效嘅方法。 就係個人化嘅信息。

English: So let me just spool it out a little bit.
Chinese: 又是 Bandura﹐喺幾十年前 認出了呢一點。

English: So you start with personalized data, personalized information that comes from an individual, and then you need to connect it to their lives.
Chinese: 當您向他人提供具體嘅﹑ 關乎佢哋健康嘅﹑佢哋目前病情嘅信息﹐ 以及佢哋可以達到嘅狀況﹑可能會出現嘅情況嘅信息﹐ 就是呢條路途﹑呢條路途嘅理念﹐ 令到人嘅行為作出改變。

English: You need to connect it to their lives, hopefully not in a fear-based way, but one that they understand.
Chinese: 請等我詳盡少少去解釋。

English: Okay, I know where I sit. I know where I'm situated.
Chinese: 您可以由一個人身上得到嘅 個人化嘅數據﹑個人化嘅資料開始﹐ 然後將呢啲跟每個人的生活聯繫起來。

English: And that doesn't just work for me in terms of abstract numbers -- this overload of health information that we're inundated with.
Chinese: 您要將資訊跟佢哋嘅生活聯繫起來。 最好係以一種唔會令人感到恐懼嘅方式﹐而係一種佢哋可以理解嘅方式。

English: But it actually hits home.
Chinese: 好喇﹐我已知道自己嘅立場。我已知道自己嘅位置。

English: It's not just hitting us in our heads; it's hitting us in our hearts.
Chinese: 而用抽象嘅數目子作根基的話﹐對我毫無意義﹐ 呢啲過多嘅有關健康嘅資訊 實在氾濫得令我哋應付不來﹐

English: There's an emotional connection to information because it's from us.
Chinese: 但係佢哋其實係解決問題嘅根源。

English: That information then needs to be connected to choices, needs to be connected to a range of options, directions that we might go to -- trade-offs, benefits.
Chinese: 佢哋不單止影響我哋嘅思想﹐亦都帶動我哋嘅情緒。

English: Finally, we need to be presented with a clear point of action.
Chinese: 我哋對呢啲信息有不解嘅情結， 因為呢啲信息起源自我哋本身。

English: We need to connect the information always with the action, and then that action feeds back into different information, and it creates, of course, a feedback loop.
Chinese: 然後﹐呢啲資料需要與選擇串連起來， 需要與各種各樣嘅選摘連貫起來， 包括有可能嘅發生嘅情況 -- 各種利弊。

English: Now this is a very well-observed and well-established notion for behavior change.
Chinese: 最後，我哋需要被清楚地告知﹐要採取點樣嘅行動。

English: But the problem is that things -- in the upper-right corner there -- personalized data, it's been pretty hard to come by.
Chinese: 我哋需要每次都將信息 跟行動串連起來﹐ 然後果個行動再反饋成 另一份信息 而當然，咁樣因此形成一個反饋循環。

English: It's a difficult and expensive commodity, until now.
Chinese: 其實呢一套理念﹐已經係一套相當有根據﹑廣泛被公認嘅﹑ 用作行為改變嘅理念。

English: So I'm going to give you an example, a very simple example of how this works.
Chinese: 但問題係，圖中右上角嘅 個人數據﹐因為通常都係難以取得嘅。

English: This is a pharmaceutical ad.

English: Nobody's had the brilliant idea of calling their drug Havidol quite yet.

English: But it looks completely right.

English: So it's exactly the way we get health information and pharmaceutical information, and it just sounds perfect.

English: And then we turn the page of the magazine, and we see this -- now this is the page the FDA requires pharmaceutical companies to put into their ads, or to follow their ads, and to me, this is one of the most cynical exercises in medicine.

English: Because we know.

English: Who among us would actually say that people read this?
Chinese: 跟住我哋翻到雜誌嘅下一頁， 係喇﹐我們可以見到呢個情況。 呢一頁就係食物及藥物管制局﹐要求製藥公司 放入廣告內或附加到廣告後面嘅說明。 而對我而言，呢個動作﹐係醫學界其中一種多餘嘅動作。

English: And who among us would actually say that people who do try to read this actually get anything out of it?
Chinese: 因為我哋知道

English: This is a bankrupt effort at communicating health information.
Chinese: 在座中﹐我哋邊個真係會去睇呢些啲說明呢？

English: There is no good faith in this.
Chinese: 又或者在座中﹐我哋邊個真係認為 會有人試圖去睇呢啲說明﹐ 而又真係從中獲益呢?

English: So this is a different approach.

English: This is an approach that has been developed by a couple researchers at Dartmouth Medical School, Lisa Schwartz and Steven Woloshin.

English: And they created this thing called the "drug facts box."

English: They took inspiration from, of all things, Cap'n Crunch.

English: They went to the nutritional information box and saw that what works for cereal, works for our food, actually helps people understand what's in their food.
Chinese: 佢哋將呢個發明稱之為藥物成分說明表。

English: God forbid we should use that same standard that we make Cap'n Crunch live by and bring it to drug companies.
Chinese: 有趣嘅係﹐佢哋主要係從 Cap'n Crunch 取得靈感。

English: So let me just walk through this quickly.
Chinese: 佢哋見到﹐穀類早餐上嘅營養標籤 就如其他食物標籤一樣﹐實際上真可以有效幫助人 去瞭解自己嘅食物存有甚麼成份。

English: It says very clearly what the drug is for, specifically who it is good for, so you can start to personalize your understanding of whether the information is relevant to you or whether the drug is relevant to you.
Chinese: 我哋點解未想過﹐ 將 Cap'n Crunch 嘅製造標準﹐ 帶到製藥公司﹖

English: You can understand exactly what the benefits are.
Chinese: 請等我簡短地講解。

English: It isn't this kind of vague promise that it's going to work no matter what, but you get the statistics for how effective it is.

English: And finally, you understand what those choices are.

English: You can start to unpack the choices involved because of the side effects.
Chinese: 唔再係以往一般﹑含糊地向您保證﹐藥物無論如何都一定有效﹐ 而係透過統計數據令您知道佢點樣有效。

English: Every time you take a drug, you're walking into a possible side effect.
Chinese: 最後，您就會明白應該作甚麼選擇。

English: So it spells those out in very clean terms, and that works.

English: So I love this. I love that drug facts box.
Chinese: 每次無論食乜嘢藥，都可能會產生副作用。

English: And so I was thinking about, what's an opportunity that I could have to help people understand information?
Chinese: 呢個模式﹐可以清晰令您瞭解佢哋。 而真係有效。

English: What's another latent body of information that's out there that people are really not putting to use?

English: And so I came up with this: lab test results.
Chinese: 跟住我開始思考， 我可以利用乜嘢良機 去幫其他人理解呢些信息呢？

English: Blood test results are this great source of information.
Chinese: 有乜嘢其他潛在嘅信息 係我哋未有善用呢﹖

English: They're packed with information.
Chinese: 於是我想到呢個：化驗結果。

English: They're just not for us. They're not for people. They're not for patients.
Chinese: 血液化驗報告就是這類相當有用嘅信息﹐

English: They go right to doctors.

English: And God forbid -- I think many doctors, if you really asked them, they don't really understand all this stuff either.

English: This is the worst presented information.
Chinese: 只有醫生才睇得明白。

English: You ask Tufte, and he would say, "Yes, this is the absolute worst presentation of information possible."
Chinese: 而天知曉﹐我覺得如果你真係問到，恐怕多數醫生 都未必一定明白呢堆資料。

English: What we did at Wired was we went, and I got our graphic design department to re-imagine these lab reports.
Chinese: 呢類嘅信息表達實在係最差嘅。

English: So that's what I want to walk you through.
Chinese: 您去問 Tufte﹐佢亦會話﹕ 「係呀﹐呢種信息表達﹐實在差到極點。」

English: So this is the general blood work before, and this is the after, this is what we came up with.
Chinese: 喺《連線》雜誌社， 我利用我哋嘅圖表設計部 去重新設計呢啲化驗報告。

English: The after takes what was four pages -- that previous slide was actually the first of four pages of data that's just the general blood work.
Chinese: 呢啲亦都係我想比在座各位見到嘅。

English: It goes on and on and on, all these values, all these numbers you don't know.
Chinese: 呢份係之前見到嘅血液化驗報告， 而呢張係經過我哋重新設計之後嘅報告。

English: This is our one-page summary.
Chinese: 後者將原來嘅四頁紙 -- 其實上一張幻燈片 只有顯示四頁資料嘅第一頁， 而呢份只不過係巡例嘅血液化驗部告。

English: We use the notion of color.

English: It's an amazing notion that color could be used.
Chinese: 而呢份就是我哋嘅一頁摘要。

English: So on the top-level you have your overall results, the things that might jump out at you from the fine print.
Chinese: 我哋用顔色加以區分。

English: Then you can drill down and understand how actually we put your level in context, and we use color to illustrate exactly where your value falls.

English: In this case, this patient is slightly at risk of diabetes because of their glucose level.
Chinese: 於最上面一欄﹐係您報告結果嘅概況， 呢啲通常係字裡行間最顯眼嘅要點。

English: Likewise, you can go over your lipids and, again, understand what your overall cholesterol level is and then break down into the HDL and the LDL if you so choose.

English: But again, always using color and personalized proximity to that information.
Chinese: 呢個例子裡面﹐據葡萄糖含量可見到 呢個病人存有輕微患糖尿病嘅風險。

English: All those other values, all those pages and pages of values that are full of nothing, we summarize.
Chinese: 同樣，您可以見到您嘅血脂含量， 然後瞭解您總體嘅膽固醇含量， 再有興趣的話﹐進一步得知高密度膽固醇及低密度膽固醇嘅程度。

English: We tell you that you're okay, you're normal.
Chinese: 但無論如何，都係以顔色 以及個人化關聯 去表達信息。

English: But you don't have to wade through it. You don't have to go through the junk.

English: And then we do two other very important things that kind of help fill in this feedback loop: we help people understand in a little more detail what these values are and what they might indicate.
Chinese: 我哋會比您知道你情況唔錯﹑一切正常。

English: And then we go a further step -- we tell them what they can do.
Chinese: 而您無須喺數字堆之中尋覓﹑無須理會雜亂﹑無意義嘅信息。

English: We give them some insight into what choices they can make, what actions they can take.
Chinese: 根住我哋還會做兩件非常重要嘅事， 去填補呢個反饋循環存在嘅空隙。 我哋令人明白一點更多嘅細節， 也即是呢啲數值代表甚麼﹑可能表明甚麼。

English: So that's our general blood work test.

English: Then we went to CRP test.
Chinese: 我哋會幫佢哋洞悉 從而更有效作出選擇﹑採取行動。

English: In this case, it's a sin of omission.
Chinese: 呢份就係我哋嘅基本血液報告。

English: They have this huge amount of space, and they don't use it for anything, so we do.

English: Now the CRP test is often done following a cholesterol test, or in conjunction with a cholesterol test.
Chinese: 今次就係一個嚴重缺失嘅例子。

English: So we take the bold step of putting the cholesterol information on the same page, which is the way the doctor is going to evaluate it.
Chinese: 呢度上面有一大片空白， 既然佢哋冇善用，我哋就嚟將空白加以利用。

English: So we thought the patient might actually want to know the context as well.
Chinese: 目前﹐C反應蛋白測試通常 都用作跟進膽固醇測試， 或者與膽固醇測試一齊進行。

English: It's a protein that shows up when your blood vessels might be inflamed, which might be a risk for heart disease.

English: What you're actually measuring is spelled out in clean language.
Chinese: 所以我哋都覺得﹐病人亦都或者想知道有關來龍去脈。

English: Then we use the information that's already in the lab report.
Chinese: 呢個係當您血管有炎症嘅時候， 一種會被驗出來嘅蛋白質， 亦可能係存有患心臟病風險嘅反映。

English: We use the person's age and their gender to start to fill in the personalized risks.
Chinese: 我哋用易明瞭嘅語言 去顯示報告上嘅信息。

English: So we start to use the data we have to run a very simple calculation that's on all sorts of online calculators to get a sense of what the actual risk is.

English: The last one I'll show you is a PSA test.

English: Here's the before, and here's the after.
Chinese: 我哋用手上掌握嘅数據 進行一個非常簡單嘅計算， 網上已經有各式各樣類似嘅計算器﹐ 從而對實際風險作出預測。

English: Now a lot of our effort on this one -- as many of you probably know, a PSA test is a very controversial test.

English: It's used to test for prostate cancer, but there are all sorts of reasons why your prostate might be enlarged.
Chinese: 呢份係修改之前嘅﹑呢份係修改之後嘅。

English: And so we spent a good deal of our time indicating that.
Chinese: 我哋喺呢一份化驗報告上﹐下咗好大功夫 -- 大概好多人都知道 前列腺特異性抗原測試﹐係一項具有極度爭議嘅測試。

English: We again personalized the risks.
Chinese: 佢係用來檢測病人是否患有前列腺癌﹐ 但實際上有各種原因 會導致前列腺腫脹。

English: So this patient is in their 50s, so we can actually give them a very precise estimate of what their risk for prostate cancer is.
Chinese: 因此我哋花咗好多時間 去指出呢一點。

English: In this case it's about 25 percent, based on that.
Chinese: 同樣我哋會根據個人情況﹐去評估風險。

English: And then again, the follow-up actions.
Chinese: 例如呢位病人50幾歲﹐ 我哋就能夠精確估計到 佢患前列腺癌嘅風險。

English: So our cost for this was less than 10,000 dollars, all right.
Chinese: 根據計算，呢個病例嘅風險大概係百分之二十五。

English: That's what Wired magazine spent on this.
Chinese: 然後又係要採取嘅對策。

English: Why is Wired magazine doing this?
Chinese: 我哋做這項工作嘅成本少於一萬美元。

English: (Laughter) Quest Diagnostics and LabCorp, the two largest lab testing companies -- last year, they made profits of over 700 million dollars and over 500 million dollars respectively.
Chinese: 呢個數目就係《連線》雜誌於呢方面所花嘅成本。

English: Now this is not a problem of resources; this is a problem of incentives.

English: We need to recognize that the target of this information should not be the doctor, should not be the insurance company.
Chinese: （笑聲） Quest Diagnostics 以及 LabCorp﹐ 兩間最大規模嘅化驗公司 去年，佢哋分別賺得超過7億 以及5億美元。

English: It should be the patient.
Chinese: 咁樣睇嚟﹐呢個根本唔係資源嘅問題， 而係動機嘅問題。

English: It's the person who actually, in the end, is going to be having to change their lives and then start adopting new behaviors.
Chinese: 我哋要認清楚﹐呢啲信息嘅目標 並唔應該係醫生，亦唔應該係保險公司，

English: This is information that is incredibly powerful.

English: It's an incredibly powerful catalyst to change.
Chinese: 最後始終都係病人本身﹐ 要去為自己嘅人生作出改變﹐ 而開始去養成新嘅行為習慣。

English: But we're not using it. It's just sitting there.
Chinese: 呢啲係具有無窮力量嘅信息。

English: It's being lost.
Chinese: 係能促使人類改變嘅強力催化劑。

English: So I want to just offer four questions that every patient should ask, because I don't actually expect people to start developing these lab test reports.

English: But you can create your own feedback loop.
Chinese: 佢不斷流失。

English: Anybody can create their feedback loop by asking these simple questions: Can I have my results?
Chinese: 所以我只想提出四個問題 每個病人都應該要問呢啲問題 因為我冇指望有人真的會 實質地去製造呢類化驗報告。

English: And the only acceptable answer is -- (Audience: Yes.) -- yes.
Chinese: 但係您可以創造屬於自己嘅反饋環。

English: What does this mean? Help me understand what the data is.

English: What are my options? What choices are now on the table?
Chinese: 而呢個問題只能有一個可接受嘅答案，就係 —— （觀眾：可以）—— 可以。

English: And then, what's next?

English: How do I integrate this information into the longer course of my life?
Chinese: 我有邊啲選擇？邊啲做法係可行？

English: So I want to wind up by just showing that people have the capacity to understand this information.
Chinese: 然後又點樣﹖

English: This is not beyond the grasp of ordinary people.
Chinese: 於未來嘅日子﹐我點樣可以將呢啲資料 運用於生活當中﹖

English: You do not need to have the education level of people in this room.

English: Ordinary people are capable of understanding this information, if we only go to the effort of presenting it to them in a form that they can engage with.

English: It works totally different from the way we talk about behavior in medicine today.

English: And this information is out there.

English: But there are all sorts of other bodies of information that are coming online, and we need to recognize the capacity of this information to engage people, to help people and to change the course of their lives.

English: Thank you very much.

多謝大家。

Oh, we're actually doing an art project and we are pasting an Israeli and a Palestinian doing the same job.

English: So the reactions in the street were kind of interesting.

English: And if you can do that, incredible things happen.
Chinese: 我們不需要因為 大把的空虛而感到慌張。

English: I was in Congo in February, dancing and celebrating with women who've survived the destruction of their selves in literally unthinkable ways -- destroyed because other brutalized, psychopathic selves all over that beautiful land are fueling our selves' addiction to iPods, Pads, and bling, which further disconnect ourselves from ever feeling their pain, their suffering, their death.
Chinese: 我們生存的狀態就是一個事實 僅僅系我們自己創造的。

English: Because, hey, if we're all living in ourselves and mistaking it for life, then we're devaluing and desensitizing life.
Chinese: 想像下，我們的生存方式會系點樣 如果我地能夠直面自我不可避免的死亡， 珍惜我們可以生存的權利 對即將發生的事情保持驚喜之心。

English: And in that disconnected state, yeah, we can build factory farms with no windows, destroy marine life and use rape as a weapon of war.
Chinese: 黎D簡單的意識，就是回歸根本的開始。

English: So here's a note to self: The cracks have started to show in our constructed world, and oceans will continue to surge through the cracks, and oil and blood, rivers of it.
Chinese: 感謝你地來聽我的演講。

English: Crucially, we haven't been figuring out how to live in oneness with the Earth and every other living thing.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: We've just been insanely trying to figure out how to live with each other -- billions of each other.
Only we're not living with each other; our crazy selves are living with each other and perpetuating an epidemic of disconnection.
Chinese: 今日嘅問題唔係︰ 點解我哋派兵阿富汗？

English: Let's live with each other and take it a breath at a time.
Chinese: 問題係︰ 點解十年後嘅今日 我哋仲喺阿富汗？

English: If we can get under that heavy self, light a torch of awareness, and find our essence, our connection to the infinite and every other living thing.
Chinese: 點解我哋仲要用 1350億美金？

English: We knew it from the day we were born.
Chinese: 點解仲有13萬地面軍隊？

English: Let's not be freaked out by our bountiful nothingness.
Chinese: 點解呢場衝突 上個月犧牲嘅人數 比起以前嘅月份都多？

English: It's more a reality than the ones our selves have created.
Chinese: 點解會咁？

English: Imagine what kind of existence we can have if we honor inevitable death of self, appreciate the privilege of life and marvel at what comes next.
Chinese: 過去20年 係干預嘅年代 阿富汗只係五幕悲劇中嘅 其中一幕

English: Simple awareness is where it begins.
Chinese: 我哋喺絕望中 由冷戰結束行出嚟

English: Thank you for listening.
Chinese: 我哋面對盧旺達 我哋面對波斯尼亞 然後我哋搵番自信

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 喺第三幕，我哋進入波斯尼亞同科索沃 而且我哋睇起嚟成功咗
喺第四幕 傲慢助長咗過度自信 我哋入侵咗伊拉克同阿富汗 而喺第五章 我哋趺入咗令人羞愧嘅混亂

English: The question today is not: Why did we invade Afghanistan?
Chinese: 所以個問題係︰我哋喺度做緊咩？

English: The question is: why are we still in Afghanistan one decade later?
Chinese: 點解我哋仲留喺阿富汗？

English: Why are we spending $135 billion?
Chinese: 答案，當然 正如人哋一直同我哋咁講︰ 我哋派兵阿富汗 係因為911 而軍隊仲留喺當地 係因為塔利班對全球嘅安全

English: Why have we got 130,000 troops on the ground?
Chinese: 存在威脅 用總統奧巴馬嘅說話︰ "如果塔利班再次掌控 佢哋會請阿爾蓋達組織番嚟 殺盡我哋嘅人"

English: Why were more people killed last month than in any preceding month of this conflict?
Chinese: 人哋話俾我哋聽 一開始只係一個"輕足印" – 即係話，當時嘅情況係 無足夠嘅軍隊 無足夠嘅資源 令阿富汗人失望 佢哋覺得經濟發展同保安 嘅進展都都唔夠 所以塔利班番咗嚟 – 於是我哋喺2005同2006年 以軍隊部署嚟回應 但係我哋嘅地面部隊都係唔夠

English: How has this happened?
Chinese: 直至2009年 總統奧巴馬簽署咗增加兵嘅方案 終於，我哋有啦 用美國國務卿希拉里嘅說話 "戰略、領導同資源"

English: The last 20 years has been the age of intervention, and Afghanistan is simply one act in a five-act tragedy.
Chinese: 所以總統依架同我哋保證 我哋向緊目標進發

English: We came out of the end of the Cold War in despair.
Chinese: 所有都係錯架

English: We faced Rwanda; we faced Bosnia, and then we rediscovered our confidence.
Chinese: 每一句都係錯架

English: In the third act, we went into Bosnia and Kosovo and we seemed to succeed.
Chinese: 阿富汗無對全球全球嘅安全 造成威脅

English: In the fourth act, with our hubris, our overconfidence developing, we invaded Iraq and Afghanistan, and in the fifth act, we plunged into a humiliating mess.
Chinese: 而塔利班 係其乎無可能奪得國家嘅控制權 – 佢哋無咩可能奪取喀布爾

English: So the question is: What are we doing?
Chinese: 佢哋根本無常規軍隊

English: Why are we still stuck in Afghanistan?
Chinese: 就算佢哋可以咁做，就算我錯 喺塔利班嘅角度嚟睇 塔利班都無咩可能

English: And the answer, of course, that we keep being given is as follows: we're told that we went into Afghanistan because of 9/11, and that we remain there because the Taliban poses an existential threat to global security.
Chinese: 請阿爾蓋達組織番嚟 呢個正係佢哋上次犯嘅最大錯誤

English: In the words of President Obama, "If the Taliban take over again, they will invite back Al-Qaeda, who will try to kill as many of our people as they possibly can."
Chinese: 如果佢哋無請阿爾蓋達組織番嚟 佢哋今日仲掌緊權

English: The story that we're told is that there was a "light footprint" initially -- in other words, that we ended up in a situation where we didn't have enough troops, we didn't have enough resources, that Afghans were frustrated -- they felt there wasn't enough progress and economic development and security, and therefore the Taliban came back -- that we responded in 2005 and 2006 with troop deployments, but we still didn't put enough troops on the ground.
Chinese: 如果呢兩點我都係錯 就算佢哋可以攞番個國家 就算佢哋請阿爾蓋達組織番嚟 阿爾蓋達組織都唔太可能 大幅增加實力 去危害美國 或者去危害歐洲

English: And that it wasn't until 2009, when President Obama signed off on a surge, that we finally had, in the words of Secretary Clinton, "the strategy, the leadership and the resources."
Chinese: 因為依架已經唔再係90年代

English: So, as the president now reassures us, we are on track to achieve our goals.
Chinese: 如果阿爾蓋達組織嘅基地 係喺加茲尼附近 我哋就可以大力打擊佢哋 而塔利班就好難，好難 保護佢哋

English: All of this is wrong.
Chinese: 再講，人哋話 喺阿富汗發生過嘅係輕足印 係錯架

English: Every one of those statements is wrong.
Chinese: 喺我嘅經驗嚟睇，事實上 輕足印係非常有幫助

English: Afghanistan does not pose an existential threat to global security.
Chinese: 我哋呢啲軍隊 – 將碧咸張靚相 放咗喺佢哋嘅衝鋒槍上 – 令到情況差咗，而唔係好咗

English: It is extremely unlikely the Taliban would ever be able to take over the country -- extremely unlikely they'd be able to seize Kabul.
Chinese: 喺2001到2002年嘅冬天 我徒步橫越阿富汗 我睇到嘅係咁樣嘅景象

English: They simply don't have a conventional military option.
Chinese: 如果你好彩嘅話會見到 一個女仔喺陰暗嘅房間角落 – 好好彩咁可以睇可蘭經

English: And even if they were able to do so, even if I'm wrong, it's extremely unlikely the Taliban would invite back Al-Qaeda.
Chinese: 但係之前 當我哋嘅軍隊同資源都唔夠嘅時候 我哋喺阿富汗嘅進展好好

English: From the Taliban's point of view, that was their number one mistake last time.
Chinese: 喺幾個月之內 多咗25萬個女仔入學

English: If they hadn't invited back Al-Qaeda, they would still be in power today.
Chinese: 2002年我喺Sangin嘅時候病咗 最近嘅診所 要行三日先到

English: And even if I'm wrong about those two things, even if they were able to take back the country, even if they were to invite back Al-Qaeda, it's extremely unlikely that Al-Qaeda would significantly enhance its ability to harm the United States or harm Europe.
Chinese: 今日，單單喺嗰個地區 就有14間診所

English: Because this isn't the 1990s anymore.
Chinese: 進展得好驚人

English: If the Al-Qaeda base was to be established near Ghazni, we would hit them very hard, and it would be very, very difficult for the Taliban to protect them.
Chinese: 阿富汗人由塔利班 幾乎無人有手提電話嘅時代 到差唔多一夜間 30萬阿富汗人都有手提電話

English: Furthermore, it's simply not true that what went wrong in Afghanistan is the light footprint.
Chinese: 我哋喺媒體自由方面都有進展

English: In my experience, in fact, the light footprint was extremely helpful.
Chinese: 選舉方面都有進展 – 呢啲就係所謂嘅輕足印

English: And these troops that we brought in -- it's a great picture of David Beckham there on the sub-machine gun -- made the situation worse, not better.
Chinese: 但係當我哋開始投放更多資金 當我哋投入更多資源 事情變壞，而無好到，點解？

English: When I walked across Afghanistan in the winter of 2001-2002, what I saw was scenes like this.
Chinese: 首先，如果你每年將1250億美金 投放喺阿富汗呢種國家 全國整體收入 每年只有10億美金 你就會掩蓋曬所有嘢

English: A girl, if you're lucky, in the corner of a dark room -- lucky to be able to look at the Koran.
Chinese: 你唔只造成貪污 同浪費 你根本上取代咗阿富汗政府嘅主要任務 選出嚟嘅阿富汗政府 傾向微觀管理 去短途旅行嘅外國人

English: But in those early days when we're told we didn't have enough troops and enough resources, we made a lot of progress in Afghanistan.
Chinese: 軍隊方面都係一樣道理

English: Within a few months, there were two and a half million more girls in school.
Chinese: 我行過阿富汗嘅時候 我同呢啲人一齊

English: In Sangin where I was sick in 2002, the nearest health clinic was within three days walk.
Chinese: 佢係喺 Kamenj 嘅 指揮官 Haji Malem Mohsin Khan

English: Today, there are 14 health clinics in that area alone.
Chinese: 佢係一個好好嘅主人

English: There was amazing improvements.
Chinese: 佢好慷慨 同好多我相處過嘅阿富汗人一樣

English: We went from almost no Afghans having mobile telephones during the Taliban to a situation where, almost overnight, three million Afghans had mobile telephones.
Chinese: 但係佢比我哋認為嘅 相對地更保守 相對更排斥外國 相對更相信伊斯蘭教

English: And we had progress in the free media.
Chinese: 例如呢個人 Mullah Mustafa 試過射殺我

English: We had progress in elections -- all of this with the so-called light footprint.
Chinese: 我喺呢張相入面望落有嘅困惑嘅原因 係我有啲嚇親 當時我好驚，唔敢問佢 佢用咗成個鐘跑過嗰沙漠 匿喺呢間屋 問佢點解會出現要我同佢合照

English: But when we began to bring more money, when we began to invest more resources, things got worse, not better. How?
Chinese: 但18個月之後，我問佢 點解要射殺我

English: Well first see, if you put 125 billion dollars a year into a country like Afghanistan where the entire revenue of the Afghan state is one billion dollars a year, you drown everything.
Chinese: Mullah Mustafa 解釋 因為佢係拎住紙同筆嘅人 而喺呢張相我嘅左手邊 Nadir Shah同佢輸賭佢傷唔到我

English: It's not simply corruption and waste that you create; you essentially replace the priorities of the Afghan government, the elected Afghan government, with the micromanaging tendencies of foreigners on short tours with their own priorities.
Chinese: 我嘅意思唔係話 阿富汗人都同 Mullah Mustafa 一樣

English: And the same is true for the troops.
Chinese: 唔係咁嘅 嗰個地方好美好 充滿活力同智慧

English: When I walked across Afghanistan, I stayed with people like this.
Chinese: 但係呢個地方 被投放咗軍隊 增加咗，而無減少到暴力

English: This is Commandant Haji Malem Mohsin Khan of Kamenj.
Chinese: 2005年 一位農業工程師 Anthony Fitzherbert 可以橫越赫爾曼德省 可以留喺 Nad Ali， Sangin 同 Ghoresh 呢啲哋方依架已經成為咗戰地

English: Commandant Haji Malem Mohsin Khan of Kamenj was a great host.
Chinese: 今日，佢唔再可以咁樣做

English: He was very generous, like many of the Afghans I stayed with.
Chinese: 所以我哋話以部處軍隊 嚟回應塔利班嘅叛亂 係錯架

English: But he was also considerably more conservative, considerably more anti-foreign, considerably more Islamist than we'd like to acknowledge.
Chinese: 部署軍隊唔係喺塔利班叛亂之後發生 而係隨之而嚟 依我睇 部署軍隊係塔利班回歸嘅原因

English: This man, for example, Mullah Mustafa, tried to shoot me.
Chinese: 呢個係一個新嘅講法？

English: And the reason I'm looking a little bit perplexed in this photograph is I was somewhat frightened, and I was too afraid on this occasion to ask him, having run for an hour through the desert and taken refuge in this house, why he had turned up and wanted to have his photograph taken with me.
Chinese: 唔係，喺過去嘅七年 已經有好多人談論呢個觀點

English: But 18 months later, I asked him why he had tried to shoot me.
Chinese: 喺 2008 至 2010 年我喺哈佛 管理過一個中心 嗰度嘅人，好似 Michael Semple 可以講流利嘅阿富汗語言 佢幾乎遊歷過阿富汗所有地區

English: And Mullah Mustafa -- he's the man with the pen and paper -- explained that the man sitting immediately to the left as you look at the photograph, Nadir Shah had bet him that he couldn't hit me.
Chinese: 例如 Andrew Wilder 喺巴基斯坦同伊朗邊境出世 佢一生 都為巴基斯坦同阿富汗工作

English: Now this is not to say Afghanistan is a place full of people like Mullah Mustafa.
Chinese: Paul Fishstein 喺 1978 年開始 喺阿富汗工作 – 喺救助兒童會做 負責當地嘅研究同評估小組

English: It's not; it's a wonderful place full of incredible energy and intelligence.
Chinese: 呢啲人 佢哋由始至終都係話 增加發展援助 令阿富汗無咁安全 而唔係更安全 – 而反叛亂策略 係行唔通，亦唔會行得通

English: But it is a place where the putting-in of the troops has increased the violence rather than decreased it.
Chinese: 但係，無人聽佢哋講

English: 2005, Anthony Fitzherbert, an agricultural engineer, could travel through Helmand, could stay in Nad Ali, Sangin and Ghoresh, which are now the names of villages where fighting is taking place.
Chinese: 反而 係一連串令人驚訝嘅樂觀主義

English: Today, he could never do that.
Chinese: 喺 2004 年開始 每一位上任嘅將軍都話 "我接手咗一個慘淡嘅局面 但最終當我有 適合嘅資源同啱嘅策略 會創造出" 用 Barno 將軍喺 2004 年嘅原話 “決定性嘅一年”

English: So the idea that we deployed the troops to respond to the Taliban insurgency is mistaken.
Chinese: 你估下點？事實唔係咁

English: Rather than preceding the insurgency, the Taliban followed the troop deployment, and as far as I'm concerned, the troop deployment caused their return.
Chinese: 但係咁並唔足以 阻止 Abuzaid 將軍話 佢有戰略同資源 喺 2005 年創造 "決定性嘅一年"

English: Now is this a new idea?
Chinese: 或者 David Richards 將軍 喺 2006 年上任嘅時候 話佢有戰略同資源 創造"關鍵嘅一年"

English: No, there have been any number of people saying this over the last seven years.
Chinese: 或者喺 2007 年 挪威副外交大臣 Espen Eide 話會創造"決定性嘅一年"

English: I ran a center at Harvard from 2008 to 2010, and there were people like Michael Semple there who speak Afghan languages fluently, who've traveled to almost every district in the country.
Chinese: 或者喺2008年 Champoux 少將上任 話佢會創造"決定性嘅一年"

English: Andrew Wilder, for example, born on the Pakistan-Iranian border, served his whole life in Pakistan and Afghanistan.
Chinese: 或者喺2009年，我嘅好朋友 Stanley McChrystal 將軍 話佢"非常關注決定性嘅一年"

English: Paul Fishstein who began working there in 1978 -- worked for Save the Children, ran the Afghan research and evaluation unit.
Chinese: 或者喺2010年 英國外相文禮彬話 最後我哋會創造"決定性嘅一年"

English: These are people who were able to say consistently that the increase in development aid was making Afghanistan less secure, not more secure -- that the counter-insurgency strategy was not working and would not work.
Chinese: 2011年嘅今日 你會好開心咁聽到 德國外交部長 Guido Westerwelle 同我哋保證 我哋處於"決定性嘅一年"

English: And yet, nobody listened to them.
Chinese: (掌聲) 我哋點會俾 呢啲嘢發生？

English: Instead, there was a litany of astonishing optimism.
Chinese: 個答案當然係 如果你一年喺一個國家 用1250或者1300億美金 你幾乎要說服所有人支持你

English: Beginning in 2004, every general came in saying, "I've inherited a dismal situation, but finally I have the right resources and the correct strategy, which will deliver," in General Barno's word in 2004, the "decisive year."
Chinese: 甚係援助機構 佢哋喺美國同歐洲政府度 收到巨額資助 用嚟起學校同診所 都會唔願意 去挑戰呢個諗法 話阿富汗係全球安全

English: Well guess what? It didn't.
Chinese: 存在威脅 換句話嚟講，佢哋擔心 如果有任何人相信根本無威脅 – 樂施會、救助兒童 就唔會拎到錢 去起醫院同學校

English: But it wasn't sufficient to prevent General Abuzaid saying that he had the strategy and the resources to deliver, in 2005, the "decisive year."
Chinese: 我哋都好難同一個 心口掛滿勛章嘅將軍對抗

English: Or General David Richards to come in 2006 and say he had the strategy and the resources to deliver the "crunch year."
Chinese: 對政客嚟講都好難 因為你驚好多人會白白浪費咗生命

English: Or in 2007, the Norwegian deputy foreign minister, Espen Eide, to say that that would deliver the "decisive year."
Chinese: 你深深感受到愧疚

English: Or in 2008, Major General Champoux to come in and say he would deliver the "decisive year."
Chinese: 你誇大你嘅恐懼 俾擊敗嘅屈辱嚇怕

English: Or in 2009, my great friend, General Stanley McChrystal, who said that he was "knee-deep in the decisive year."
Chinese: 有咩解決嘅方法呢？

English: Or in 2010, the U.K. foreign secretary, David Miliband, who said that at last we would deliver the "decisive year."
Chinese: 解決嘅方法係 我哋要搵到 好似 Michael Semple 或者其他會講真話嘅人 了解佢哋國家嘅情況 喺當地生活咗30年 – 更重要嘅係 缺乏嘅呢部份嘅正係 – 阿富汗人自己 佢哋明白發生緊咩事

English: And you'll be delighted to hear in 2011, today, that Guido Westerwelle, the German foreign minister, assures us that we are in the "decisive year."
Chinese: 我哋要將佢哋嘅信息 話俾制定政策嘅人知

English: (Applause) How do we allow any of this to happen?
Chinese: 呢點好難做到 因為我哋嘅體制

English: Well the answer, of course, is, if you spend 125 billion or 130 billion dollars a year in a country, you co-opt almost everybody.
Chinese: 我哋首先要改變嘅係 我哋政府嘅架構

English: Even the aid agencies, who begin to receive an enormous amount of money from the U.S. and the European governments to build schools and clinics, are somewhat disinclined to challenge the idea that Afghanistan is an existential threat to global security.
Chinese: 非常悲哀嘅係 我哋嘅大使館、聯合國 喺呢啲國家嘅軍隊 都唔了解當地嘅情況

English: They're worried, in other words, that if anybody believes that it wasn't such a threat -- Oxfam, Save the Children wouldn't get the money to build their hospitals and schools.
Chinese: 平均每個英國軍人駐紮6個月 意大利軍人駐紮4個月 美國軍隊駐紮12個月

English: It's also very difficult to confront a general with medals on his chest.
Chinese: 外交官又唔俾離開大使館

English: It's very difficult for a politician, because you're afraid that many lives have been lost in vain.
Chinese: 離開嘅時候 都喺坐呢啲唔尋常有武器嘅車 又會有啲嚇人嘅保鑣團隊 呢啲保鑣仲會早24小時準備好 佢哋只會俾你喺出面逗留1個鐘

English: You feel deep, deep guilt.
Chinese: 喺駐阿富汗嘅英國使館 喺2008年 成個使館入面350個工作人員 只有3個人識得講似樣嘅 阿富汗嘅主要語言達利語

English: You exaggerate your fears, and you're terrified about the humiliation of defeat.

English: In the middle of my traveling, I turned 40 and I began to hate my body, which was actually progress, because at least my body existed enough to hate it.

English: My life became about getting rid of it and obsessing about getting rid of it.

English: In fact, it became so extreme I wrote a play about it.

English: Then I went somewhere else.

English: I went outside what I thought I knew.

English: I went to the Democratic Republic of Congo.

English: There are thousands of these stories, and many of the women had holes in their bodies -- holes, fistula -- that were the violation of war -- holes in the fabric of their souls.

English: In his new and visionary book, "New Self, New World," the writer Philip Shepherd says, "If you are divided from your body, you are also divided from the body of the world, which then appears to be other than you or separate from you, rather than the living continuum to which you belong."

Chinese: 我鼓足勇氣鎮定甘問距， “系， 你可不可以話我知， 你地賣D咩？”

English: So I guess both Susan Boyle and this vegetable vendor in Shanghai belonged to otherness.
Chinese: 因為我當時完全唔知一間 五星級酒店內的銷售部要做D乜。

English: They were the least expected to be successful in the business called entertainment, yet their courage and talent brought them through.
Chinese: 黎個系我第一次進入 五星級酒店。

English: And a show and a platform gave them the stage to realize their dreams.
Chinese: 與此同時， 我參加咗由中國國家電視台 有史以來舉辦嘅 第一次公開面試 現場參賽上千名女大學生。

English: Well, being different is not that difficult.
Chinese: 製作人通告 距地要搵甜美，單純 同漂亮的新面孔。

English: We are all different from different perspectives.
Chinese: 當輪到我果陣，我起身問， “點解系電視上的女性個性 都要系靚，甜美，單純 仲要有配合度？

English: But I think being different is good, because you present a different point of view.
Chinese: 點解距地唔可以有自己的想法 同埋自己的聲音？”

English: You may have the chance to make a difference.
Chinese: 我以為我黎番話有點冒犯評委。

English: My generation has been very fortunate to witness and participate in the historic transformation of China that has made so many changes in the past 20, 30 years.
Chinese: 不過正系黎番話令距地留下印象。

English: I remember that in the year of 1990, when I was graduating from college, I was applying for a job in the sales department of the first five-star hotel in Beijing, Great Wall Sheraton -- it's still there.
Chinese: 所以我進入了第二回合比賽， 繼而第三，第四。

English: So after being interrogated by this Japanese manager for a half an hour, he finally said, "So, Miss Yang, do you have any questions to ask me?"
Chinese: 當完成第七回合比賽后， 我成為一位勝出者。

English: I summoned my courage and poise and said, "Yes, but could you let me know, what actually do you sell?"
Chinese: 因此我加入了國家電視台黃金檔一個節目。

English: I didn't have a clue what a sales department was about in a five-star hotel.
Chinese: 你可能唔相信 黎個節目系中國第一個 允許主持人 自由發揮表達自己的意見 而唔需要背經批准後D稿。

English: That was the first day I set my foot in a five-star hotel.
Chinese: （鼓掌） 當時每週的觀眾人數 高達200-300萬。

English: Around the same time, I was going through an audition -- the first ever open audition by national television in China -- with another thousand college girls.
Chinese: 幾年以後， 我確定要去美國哥倫比亞大學 繼續讀研， 同時創辦自己的媒體公司， 一個當我啱啱入行時 從來都無惗過嘅想法。

English: The producer told us they were looking for some sweet, innocent and beautiful fresh face.
Chinese: 公司項目分好多類，

English: So when it was my turn, I stood up and said, "Why [do] women's personalities on television always have to be beautiful, sweet, innocent and, you know, supportive?
Chinese: 我訪問過的人數過千。

English: Why can't they have their own ideas and their own voice?"
Chinese: 有時，有些年輕人他會同我講 “楊瀾， 你改變了我的人生，” 我會為黎D話感到自豪。

English: I thought I kind of offended them.
Chinese: 同時我地十分幸運地 見證整個國家的興起。

English: But actually, they were impressed by my words.
Chinese: 見證著北京奧運競標賽。

English: And so I was in the second round of competition, and then the third and the fourth.
Chinese: 代言上海世博會。

English: After seven rounds of competition, I was the last one to survive it.
Chinese: 我睇到中國正在擁抱全世界 也見到全世界在擁抱中國。

English: So I was on a national television prime-time show.
Chinese: 不過我亦系度惗， 當下的年輕人到底要做什麼？

English: And believe it or not, that was the first show on Chinese television that allowed its hosts to speak out of their own minds without reading an approved script.
Chinese: 距地有什麼不同之處， 他們會創造怎樣的不同 又會點樣改變中國未來, 甚至整個世界？

English: (Applause) And my weekly audience at that time was between 200 to 300 million people.
Chinese: 所以我今天的話題系關於年輕一代 通過社交網絡平台。

English: Well after a few years, I decided to go to the U.S. and Columbia University to pursue my postgraduate studies, and then started my own media company, which was unthought of during the years that I started my career.
Chinese: 首先， 他們是誰？他們做緊咩？

English: So we do a lot of things.
Chinese: 照片中黎位叫郭美美女仔 20歲，年輕貌美。

English: I've interviewed more than a thousand people in the past.
Chinese: 在距嘅微博上盡顯 距擁有的名牌袋， 衫同鞋， 微博即系中國版的Twitter。

English: And sometimes I have young people approaching me say, "Lan, you changed my life," and I feel proud of that.
Chinese: 距仲自稱系紅十字 商會經理。

English: But then we are also so fortunate to witness the transformation of the whole country.
Chinese: 距無惗到 自己的舉動引起民眾公憤 惹起全國大眾的質疑。 差D成為針對 紅十字會的騷亂。

English: I was in Beijing's bidding for the Olympic Games.
Chinese: 黎場爭論十分激烈 以至於紅十字會開記者招待會 來澄清“郭美美事件”， 此事件因此亦被不斷調查。

English: I was representing the Shanghai Expo.
Chinese: 現金為之， 公眾已知道郭美美系冒充紅十字商會經理職位 可能因為距覺得與慈善相關的為她帶了自豪感。

English: I saw China embracing the world and vice versa.
Chinese: 距果D奢侈品 同禮物 都系距男朋友送。 距的男朋友系紅十字商會 旗下部門的前任董事會成員。

English: But then sometimes I'm thinking, what are today's young generation up to?
Chinese: 黎個解釋起來有點困難。

English: How are they different, and what are the differences they are going to make to shape the future of China, or at large, the world?
Chinese: 儘管如此，公眾憤怒仍未平息。

English: So today I want to talk about young people through the platform of social media.
Chinese: 熱論還在進行。

English: First of all, who are they? [What] do they look like?
Chinese: 黎件事件講明民眾 對政府或有政府背景的機構唔信任， 因為黎D機構過去的不透明

English: Well this is a girl called Guo Meimei -- 20 years old, beautiful.
Chinese: 黎件事件亦講明 社交網站上的力量同影響 例如微博。

English: She showed off her expensive bags, clothes and car on her microblog, which is the Chinese version of Twitter.
Chinese: 微博在2010年興起， 訪客人數翻倍 瀏覽時間更系三倍增加。

English: And she claimed to be the general manager of Red Cross at the Chamber of Commerce.
Chinese: 單系新浪網， 一個主要的新聞網站， 就有超過1.4億微博用戶。

English: She didn't realize that she stepped on a sensitive nerve and aroused national questioning, almost a turmoil, against the credibility of Red Cross.
Chinese: 騰訊網，2億。

English: The controversy was so heated that the Red Cross had to open a press conference to clarify it, and the investigation is going on.
Chinese: 最多人關注的用戶 唔系我-- 系一位電影女演員， 距有超過九百五十萬粉絲。

English: So far, as of today, we know that she herself made up that title -- probably because she feels proud to be associated with charity.
Chinese: 大約有八成微博用戶都系年輕人， 年齡在30歲以下。

English: All those expensive items were given to her as gifts by her boyfriend, who used to be a board member in a subdivision of Red Cross at Chamber of Commerce.
Chinese: 正如大家所知， 傳統媒體依然由政府所控， 社交網絡提供一個開放平台 讓大家可以發表自己的意見。

English: It's very complicated to explain.
Chinese: 因為開放平台為數不多， 來自社交網站上的激憤 有時可以變得非常強烈，非常活躍 甚至帶有暴力。

English: But anyway, the public still doesn't buy it.
Chinese: 通過微博， 我地可以進一步了解中國年輕的一代。

English: It is still boiling.
Chinese: 我地有幾唔同？

English: It shows us a general mistrust of government or government-backed institutions, which lacked transparency in the past.
Chinese: 首先，大部分青年都生於 80， 90年代， 出生於獨生子女政策下。

English: And also it showed us the power and the impact of social media as microblog.
Chinese: 因為有了選擇性流產 很多家長重男輕女， 造成我地現今 男性數量比女性超出3千萬人口。

English: Microblog boomed in the year of 2010, with visitors doubled and time spent on it tripled.
Chinese: 黎個可能會對 社會存在潛在危機， 但無人能確定； 我地生活系個全球化嘅世界， 男性可以到其他國家結識女朋友。

English: Sina.com, a major news portal, alone has more than 140 million microbloggers.
Chinese: 年輕人裡大多數都受過不錯的教育。

English: On Tencent, 200 million.
Chinese: 喺黎一代，中國文盲人數 已少於百分之一。

English: The most popular blogger -- it's not me -- it's a movie star, and she has more than 9.5 million followers, or fans.
Chinese: 在城市， 有80%的學生上大學。

English: About 80 percent of those microbloggers are young people, under 30 years old.
Chinese: 不過他們正面對一個老年化的中國 今年，年齡超過65歲人口 已達到百分之7點幾， 到2030年 人口老年化將達到15%。

English: And because, as you know, the traditional media is still heavily controlled by the government, social media offers an opening to let the steam out a little bit.
Chinese: 大家也許知道我們的傳統 年輕人一代有義務供養長輩， 在生病時照顧他們。

English: But because you don't have many other openings, the heat coming out of this opening is sometimes very strong, active and even violent.
Chinese: 這意味著已成家的年輕人 要供養四位長輩 其預期壽命將會是73歲。

English: So through microblogging, we are able to understand Chinese youth even better.
Chinese: 所以許多年輕一代的 日子不輕鬆過得並不輕鬆。

English: So how are they different?
Chinese: 面對大學畢業生供過於求。

English: First of all, most of them were born in the 80s and 90s, under the one-child policy.
Chinese: 喺城市， 大學畢業生起薪點 大致系400美金一個月， 平均租金 都超過500美金。

English: And because of selected abortion by families who favored boys to girls, now we have ended up with 30 million more young men than women.
Chinese: 他們點樣生活呢？ 他們只能合租 逼系一個窄小嘅空間 甘來悭钱-- 黎群人自稱“蟻族”。

English: That could pose a potential danger to the society, but who knows; we're in a globalized world, so they can look for girlfriends from other countries.
Chinese: 至於果D打算結婚 同賣屋嘅人 距地明白要打工 30，40年 先可以買得起第一間公寓。

English: Most of them have fairly good education.
Chinese: 美國的比例系 一對夫妻5年嘅人工就可買一間屋， 不過要係中國需要30 - 40 年先至做到 因為房價高漲。

English: The illiteracy rate in China among this generation is under one percent.
Chinese: 做兩億離鄉打工族中， 60%系年輕人。

English: In cities, 80 percent of kids go to college.
Chinese: 他們覺得自己系夾心族 夾隔在城市同鄉村之間。

English: But they are facing an aging China with a population above 65 years old coming up with seven-point-some percent this year, and about to be 15 percent by the year of 2030.
Chinese: 距地大多數都唔想返鄉下， 不過他們又無城市歸屬感。

English: And you know we have the tradition that younger generations support the elders financially, and taking care of them when they're sick.
Chinese: 他們長時間工作 收入相對較少，社會福利也不多。

English: So it means young couples will have to support four parents who have a life expectancy of 73 years old.
Chinese: 很多因素會影響他們 例如失業， 通貨膨脹， 銀行貸款政策緊縮， 人民幣升值， 又或者歐美國家對 中國產品的需求 減少。

English: So making a living is not that easy for young people.
Chinese: 上年，一場令人震驚 的悲劇 喺中國南方嘅設備加工廠發生咗 13名年輕工人 年齡大致20歲左右 相繼自殺， 就似一場傳染病甘

English: College graduates are not in short supply.
Chinese: 距地自殺的原因各不同。

English: In urban areas, college graduates find the starting salary is about 400 U.S. dollars a month, while the average rent is above $500.
Chinese: 整個事件 引起社會的關注 大家開始關心 黎D工人嘅 身體同心理上的孤單。

English: So what do they do? They have to share space -- squeezed in very limited space to save money -- and they call themselves "tribe of ants."
Chinese: 果D選擇返鄉下嘅人， 當地人十分歡迎他們回鄉， 因為他們在城市獲得了知識，技能同人脈 距地系城市學識， 通過互聯網的幫助， 距地可以創作更多工作， 升級當地農業技術同埋製造商機 喺相對落後的市場。

English: And for those who are ready to get married and buy their apartment, they figured out they have to work for 30 to 40 years to afford their first apartment.
Chinese: 在過去數年，沿海地帶， 出現勞工短缺的現象。

English: That ratio in America would only cost a couple five years to earn, but in China it's 30 to 40 years with the skyrocketing real estate price.
Chinese: 黎D圖表顯示 一個更廣泛的社會背景。

English: Among the 200 million migrant workers, 60 percent of them are young people.
Chinese: 第一個系恩格爾系數， 解釋了每天生活必須的花費 百分點有所減少 在過去十年內 對比人均家庭收入 下降了37%。

English: They find themselves sort of sandwiched between the urban areas and the rural areas.
Chinese: 不過就係過去兩年間， 黎個比例又上漲39%, 甘樣來講生活花費正在上升。

English: Most of them don't want to go back to the countryside, but they don't have the sense of belonging.
Chinese: 吉尼系數顯示 已經超過0.4的警戒線。

English: They work for longer hours with less income, less social welfare.
Chinese: 宜家系0.5 -- 仲差過美國-- 說明了收入不平等。

English: And they're more vulnerable to job losses, subject to inflation, tightening loans from banks, appreciation of the renminbi, or decline of demand from Europe or America for the products they produce.
Chinese: 你可以睇到整個社會 逐漸感到沮喪 因為他們失去一部分流動性。

English: Last year, though, an appalling incident in a southern OEM manufacturing compound in China: 13 young workers in their late teens and early 20s committed suicide, just one by one like causing a contagious disease.
Chinese: 同時，仇富和仇權情緒 逐以升高 並開始蔓延。

English: But they died because of all different personal reasons.
Chinese: 所以各種對腐敗 或者官商勾結的指控 都會造成社會譴責 甚至動亂。

English: But this whole incident aroused a huge outcry from society about the isolation, both physical and mental, of these migrant workers.
Chinese: 通過觀察微博上一些最熱門的話題， 我地可以更了解年輕的一代。

English: For those who do return back to the countryside, they find themselves very welcome locally, because with the knowledge, skills and networks they have learned in the cities, with the assistance of the Internet, they're able to create more jobs, upgrade local agriculture and create new business in the less developed market.
Chinese: 社會公正與政府責任 系他們最關心的問題。

English: So for the past few years, the coastal areas, they found themselves in a shortage of labor.
Chinese: 在過去十年裡， 大量嘅城市化發展 令我地睇到好多關於 強拆民宅 的報到。

English: These diagrams show a more general social background.
Chinese: 黎D新聞都引起了 年輕人不滿和失望。

English: The first one is the Engels coefficient, which explains that the cost of daily necessities has dropped its percentage all through the past decade, in terms of family income, to about 37-some percent.
Chinese: 過程中有時有身亡， 亦有人用自焚嘅形式來抗議。

English: But then in the last two years, it goes up again to 39 percent, indicating a rising living cost.
Chinese: 當黎類報導 越來越常見於互聯網上 人們強烈要求政府出面阻止。

English: The Gini coefficient has already passed the dangerous line of 0.4.
Chinese: 今年早輪有好消息， 國務院在房屋申請同拆建方面 頒發咗新政策 同時允許法庭 傳喚果D強拆的地方政府 上法院。

English: Now it's 0.5 -- even worse than that in America -- showing us the income inequality.
Chinese: 仲有好多其他令民眾擔憂嘅問題 系互聯網上熱議。

English: And so you see this whole society getting frustrated about losing some of its mobility.
Chinese: 大家都聽過空氣污染， 水源污染，有毒食品。

English: And also, the bitterness and even resentment towards the rich and the powerful is quite widespread.
Chinese: 但應該不知道我地還發明了假牛肉。

English: So any accusations of corruption or backdoor dealings between authorities or business would arouse a social outcry or even unrest.
Chinese: 黎種牛肉精包含多種成分 如果你把距塗喺雞魚肉 睇落就似牛肉。

English: So through some of the hottest topics on microblogging, we can see what young people care most about.
Chinese: 最近， 民眾又開始擔心食用油， 原因上千人發現 來自餐館嘅 食用油系加工過的地溝油。

English: Social justice and government accountability runs the first in what they demand.
Chinese: 黎類現象 在互聯網引起公眾強烈不滿。

English: For the past decade or so, a massive urbanization and development have let us witness a lot of reports on the forced demolition of private property.
Chinese: 幸運地是， 我地睇到政府 更及時同更頻繁地 對應民眾的擔憂。

English: And it has aroused huge anger and frustration among our young generation.
Chinese: 雖然年輕一代睇落相信 他們的參與影響到 政策制定， 不過，在生活上的追求 他們卻有點迷失。

English: Sometimes people get killed, and sometimes people set themselves on fire to protest.
Chinese: 中國很快就會超越美國

English: So when these incidents are reported more and more frequently on the Internet, people cry for the government to take actions to stop this.
Chinese: 成為第一大 奢侈消費品市場。 黎果唔包括中國人 喺歐洲或其他地方消費。

English: So the good news is that earlier this year, the state council passed a new regulation on house requisition and demolition and passed the right to order forced demolition from local governments to the court.
Chinese: 但或許你唔知，其中一半的消費者 系收入不到2000美金。

English: Similarly, many other issues concerning public safety is a hot topic on the Internet.
Chinese: 距地並不富裕。

English: We heard about polluted air, polluted water, poisoned food.
Chinese: 不過距地買名牌手袋同衣服 來作為距地身份的象徵。

English: And guess what, we have faked beef.
Chinese: 黎個女仔上一個相親節目 公開表明 距情願坐系寶馬車度喊， 都唔要坐系單車上笑。

English: They have sorts of ingredients that you brush on a piece of chicken or fish, and it turns it to look like beef.
Chinese: 當然，我地還有年輕人 只要開心 坐寶馬或騎單車都無所謂。

English: And then lately, people are very concerned about cooking oil, because thousands of people have been found [refining] cooking oil from restaurant slop.
Chinese: 黎張圖片裡，你見到宜家好風行的一個現象 叫做“裸婚”。

English: So all these things have aroused a huge outcry from the Internet.
Chinese: 距地唔系話喺婚禮上么都唔著， 不過黎D年輕人決定 就算無屋，無車，無鑽戒 同無婚禮都願意 為真愛結婚。

English: And fortunately, we have seen the government responding more timely and also more frequently to the public concerns.
Chinese: 通過社交媒體，人們做咗好多有意義的事。

English: While young people seem to be very sure about their participation in public policy-making, but sometimes they're a little bit lost in terms of what they want for their personal life.
Chinese: 黎張圖片展示 500只被困卡車將要被加工食物的 流浪或綁架狗。 在高速公路上被發現， 截停 整個國家都在微博上 見證事件發展。

English: China is soon to pass the U.S.
Chinese: 有人捐錢，捐狗糧 仲有志願者去截停部貨車。

English: as the number one market for luxury brands -- that's not including the Chinese expenditures in Europe and elsewhere.
Chinese: 幾小時協商後， 500只狗獲救。

English: But you know what, half of those consumers are earning a salary below 2,000 U.S. dollars.
Chinese: 同時亦有人幫助搵走失兒童。

English: They're not rich at all.
Chinese: 黎位爸爸將個仔張相放上網。

English: They're taking those bags and clothes as a sense of identity and social status.
Chinese: 在上千萬次轉發後， 小朋友被搵到。 我地通過微博 見證了家庭團聚。

English: And this is a girl explicitly saying on a TV dating show that she would rather cry in a BMW than smile on a bicycle.
Chinese: 幸福 - 系近兩年 最常聽到上嘅熱門詞。

English: But of course, we do have young people who would still prefer to smile, whether in a BMW or [on] a bicycle.
Chinese: 幸福不靜只 同個人經歷和價值觀相關， 我們生活的環境同樣息息相關。

English: So in the next picture, you see a very popular phenomenon called "naked" wedding, or "naked" marriage.
