English: This thing was 300 kilometers across -- 200 miles -- an enormous crater that excavated out vast amounts of earth that splashed around the globe and set fires all over the planet, threw up enough dust to block out the sun.
Chinese: 因為當時 攝影機啱啱開始流行 啲人呢就會將佢哋帶喺身邊 爹地媽咪帶住攝像機 去拍仔女嘅足球比賽

English: It wiped out 75 percent of all species on Earth.
Chinese: 星期五嗰晚呢個小行星落咗落來 所以啲人可以捕捉到小行星墜落 一路穿過西維珍尼亞州、馬里蘭州 賓夕法尼亞州同新澤西州 直到佢擊中咗一部紐約嘅車

English: Now, not all asteroids are that big.
Chinese: （笑） 依家，呢個唔係一個 200 英里寬嘅坑 但跟住落來你哋可以睇到 粒隕石同一個足球差唔多大 擊中咗嗰部車

English: Some of them are smaller.
Chinese: 不過當呢粒小行星進入地球時 可能係一部校車嘅晒士 由於高温擦過大氣壓

English: Here is one that came in over the United States in October of 1992.
Chinese: 佢開始燃燒、解體 解體之後嘅石頭 只係對地面造成咗一啲破壞

English: It came in on a Friday night.
Chinese: 你哋唔會希望石頭落喺你嘅腳或者頭 因為會好痛

English: Why is that important?
Chinese: 但係你知細細嚿石 唔會毀滅所有地球上嘅生命

English: Because back then, video cameras were just starting to become popular, and parents would bring them to their kids' football games to film their kids playing football.
Chinese: 之不過 唔使六英里寬嘅小行星 都可以造成好大破壞

English: And since this came in on a Friday, they were able to get this great footage of this thing breaking up as it came in over West Virginia, Maryland, Pennsylvania and New Jersey until it did that to a car in New York.
Chinese: 喺分類上，除咗細隕石同大隕石之外 有中型隕石 如果你有去過亞利桑那州 溫斯洛附近嘅沙漠 嗰度有個中型隕石嘅坑 因為佢太標誌性 所以佢嘅名叫流星坑

English: (Laughter) Now, this is not a 200-mile-wide crater, but then again, you can see the rock, which is sitting right here, about the size of a football, that hit that car and did that damage.
Chinese: 爲咗讓你哋對晒士有個概念 呢個就有 1 英里寬

English: Now, this thing was probably about the size of a school bus when it first came in.
Chinese: 如果你望上高，嗰個係停車場 而嗰啲就係旅行車

English: It broke up through atmospheric pressure, it crumbled, and then the pieces fell apart and did some damage.
Chinese: 所以佢有 1 英里寬，600 英尺深

English: Now, you wouldn't want that falling on your foot or your head, because it would do that to it.
Chinese: 形成呢個坑嘅小行星 大概有 30 到 50 碼寬 差唔多係呢度麥基禮堂嘅晒士

English: But it won't wipe out, you know, all life on Earth, so that's fine.
Chinese: 當時小行星以高速衝落來 撞擊地面 以近二千萬噸原子彈嘅能量爆炸 係一個重磅炸彈

English: But it turns out, you don't need something six miles across to do a lot of damage.
Chinese: 呢件事發生喺 5 萬年前 令一啲水牛或者羚羊 或者生活喺沙漠嘅動物消失 但佢唔太可能毀滅成個地球

English: There is a median point between tiny rock and gigantic rock, and in fact, if any of you have ever been to near Winslow, Arizona, there is a crater in the desert there that is so iconic that it is actually called "Meteor Crater."
Chinese: 因為我哋發現 要造成大損傷，唔一定要撞落地面度

English: To give you a sense of scale, this is about a mile wide.
Chinese: 喺 1908 年，西伯利亞上空 近通古斯卡地區—— 對於係丹．艾克羅伊德支持者 同時睇過《捉鬼特工隊》嘅人來講 當丹．艾克羅伊德講到 1909 年西伯利亞爆炸以來 最大嘅交叉維度裂縫—— 佢講錯咗日期，不過冇影響（笑）

English: If you look up at the top, that's a parking lot, and those are recreational vehicles right there.
Chinese: 其實事情發生喺 1908 年 不過我可以當佢冇錯——

English: So it's about a mile across, 600 feet deep.
Chinese: （笑） 當時另一粒殞石進入地球嘅大氣層 而且喺上空離地面幾英里爆炸

English: The object that formed this was probably about 30 to 50 yards across, so roughly the size of Macky Auditorium here.
Chinese: 爆炸釋放出來嘅熱量引發地面森林大火 而且衝擊波將幾百平方英里嘅樹推倒

English: It came in at speeds that were tremendous, slammed into the ground, blew up, and exploded with the energy of roughly a 20-megaton nuclear bomb -- a very hefty bomb.
Chinese: 造成巨大嘅破壞

English: This was 50,000 years ago, so it may have wiped out a few buffalo or antelope, or something like that out in the desert, but it probably would not have caused global devastation.
Chinese: 呢次嘅隕石 差唔多係我哋依家坐嘅演講廳嘅大細

English: It turns out that these things don't have to hit the ground to do a lot of damage.
Chinese: 隕石由金屬構成 因為金屬更加硬 所以殞石先可以落到地面

English: Now, in 1908, over Siberia, near the Tunguska region -- for those of you who are Dan Aykroyd fans and saw "Ghostbusters," when he talked about the greatest cross-dimensional rift since the Siberia blast of 1909, where he got the date wrong, but that's OK.
Chinese: 通古斯卡上空嘅石頭 好可能係由岩石構成 於是乎易碎 所以至會喺空中爆炸

English: (Laughter) It was 1908. That's fine. I can live with that.
Chinese: 呢兩次隕石事件 都引起相等於二千萬噸嘅大爆炸

English: (Laughter) Another rock came into the Earth's atmosphere and this one blew up above the ground, several miles up above the surface of the Earth.
Chinese: 當呢啲隕石爆炸時 佢哋唔會破壞全球生態

English: The heat from the explosion set fire to the forest below it, and then the shock wave came down and knocked down trees for hundreds of square miles.
Chinese: 佢哋唔係毀滅恐龍嗰類嘢

English: This did a huge amount of damage.
Chinese: 佢哋唔夠大

English: And again, this was a rock probably roughly the size of this auditorium that we're sitting in.
Chinese: 但係佢哋會破壞全球經濟 因為佢哋唔使撞擊都能夠破壞經濟

English: In Meteor Crater, it was made of metal, and metal is much tougher, so it made it to the ground.
Chinese: 佢哋唔使毀滅全球都已經有破壞力

English: The one over Tunguska was probably made of rock, and that's much more crumbly, so it blew up in the air.
Chinese: 如果任何一粒小行星求其撞向一笪地方 就會引起恐慌

English: Either way, these are tremendous explosions -- 20 megatons.
Chinese: 但係如果佢撞落一個重要城市—— 雖然唔係最重要嘅城市 但係撞落全球經濟裏邊 比較重要嘅城市—— 咁對我哋文明嚟講 就係大破壞

English: Now, when these things blow up, they're not going to do global ecological damage.
Chinese: 我依家已經嚇到你連屎都出咗來 （笑） 我哋可以做啲咩嘢？

English: They're not going to do something like the dinosaur killer did.
Chinese: 呢個係潛在威脅嚟

English: They're just not big enough.
Chinese: 而其實 我哋已經有 6,500 萬年 冇遇到毀滅恐龍嘅巨大能量

English: But they will do global economic damage, because they don't have to hit, necessarily, to do this kind of damage.
Chinese: 畢竟大行星撞地球係好罕見

English: They don't have to do global devastation.
Chinese: 但行星越細，就越有可能撞擊地球 但小行星撞地球一般都講緊千年一次 或者每幾百年或者幾千年一次

English: If one of these things were to hit pretty much anywhere, it would cause a panic.
Chinese: 就算係咁，我哋都要小心啲先得

English: But if it came over a city, an important city -- not that any city is more important than others, but some of them we depend on more on the global economic basis -- that could do a huge amount of damage to us as a civilization.
Chinese: 咁，我哋要對行星做啲乜嘢呢？

English: So, now that I've scared the crap out of you -- (Laughter) what can we do about this?
Chinese: 第一件事係要搵佢哋

English: This is a potential threat.
Chinese: 呢張相影 2009 年 一粒經過地球嘅小行星

English: Let me note that we have not had a giant impact like the dinosaur killer for 65 million years.
Chinese: 佢就喺呢度

English: They're very rare.
Chinese: 但你哋會發現佢係非常細

English: The smaller ones happen more often, but probably on the order of a millennium, every few centuries or every few thousand years.
Chinese: 我都唔知坐喺最後嗰排嘅你哋 係咪可以睇到佢

English: But it's still something to be aware of.
Chinese: 呢啲只係星星

English: Well, what do we do about them?
Chinese: 呢個係一個 30 碼寬嘅岩石 差唔多同 5 萬年前 喺通古斯卡上空爆炸 然後撞擊亞利桑那州嗰啲隕石一樣大

English: The first thing we have to do is find them.
Chinese: 呢啲行星好細、好難發現

English: This is an image of an asteroid that passed us in 2009.
Chinese: 而且天空實在太大嘞

English: It's right here.
Chinese: 但我哋必須搵到佢哋

English: But you can see that it's extremely faint.
Chinese: 好消息係，我哋已經搵緊佢哋啦

English: I don't know if you can see that in the back row.
Chinese: NASA 出資咗做呢件事 國家科學基金同埋其他國家 都對呢件事有興趣

English: These are just stars.
Chinese: 我哋製造緊可以察覺威脅嘅太空望遠鏡

English: This is a rock that was about 30 yards across, so roughly the size of the ones that blew up over Tunguska and hit Arizona 50,000 years ago.
Chinese: 係好大嘅進步來 不過下一步又係咩嘢呢？

English: These things are faint.
Chinese: 第二步就係如果我哋發現 一粒小行星撞向地球時

English: They're hard to see, and the sky is really big.
Chinese: 我哋要阻止佢。咁點做呢？ 你哋好可能聽過小行星阿波菲斯

English: We have to find these things first.
Chinese: 如果你冇，你好快會聽到

English: Well, the good news is, we're looking for them.
Chinese: 如果你聽過瑪雅 2012 預言 你就會聽到小行星阿波菲斯 因為你哋無論如何 都走唔甩世界末日

English: NASA has devoted money to this; the National Science Foundation and other countries are interested in doing this.
Chinese: 阿波菲斯小行星喺 2004 年被發現

English: We're building telescopes that are looking for the threat.
Chinese: 佢差唔多有 250 米寬 所以佢好大。你哋知喇，係大晒士 仲大過足球場

English: That's a great first step. But what's the second step?
Chinese: 佢仲會喺 2029 年 4 月經過地球

English: The second step is if we see one heading toward us, we have to stop it.
Chinese: 佢靠得咁近 甚至乎會來到氣象衛星下面

English: What do we do?
Chinese: 如果佢正常運動 地球嘅重力會扭曲佢嘅軌道 如果佢穿過一個區域空間 一個叫做鎖匙眼嘅豆角形狀區域 地球重力就會令佢扭曲 恰恰七年之後 喺 2036 年 4 月 13 號 即係一個星期五……（笑） 你一定預唔到咁嘅事︰ 阿波菲斯將會撞埋來我哋度

English: If you haven't yet, you will.
Chinese: 佢有 250 米寬 所以將會造成巨大破壞

English: If you've heard about the Mayan 2012 apocalypse, you're going to hear about Apophis, because you're keyed in to all the doomsday networks, anyway.
Chinese: 依家好消息係 佢穿過鎖匙眼同撞到我哋嘅幾率 係百萬分之一 係非常非常之細嘅幾率 所以我自己唔會因為擔心佢而瞓唔著

English: (Laughter) Apophis is an asteroid that was discovered in 2004.
Chinese: 我唔認為阿波菲斯係一個問題 事實上，塞翁失馬焉知非福

English: It's roughly 250 [meters] across, so it's pretty big -- bigger than a football stadium.
Chinese: 阿波菲斯令我哋認識小行星嘅危險

English: And it's going to pass by the Earth in April of 2029.
Chinese: 阿波菲斯喺幾年前被發現 當時仲諗幾年後可能會撞落地球

English: And it's going to pass us so close that it's actually going to come underneath our weather satellites.
Chinese: 但宜家佢唔會 而且仲畀咗我哋一個機會 來研究呢類小行星

English: The Earth's gravity is going to bend the orbit of this thing so much that if it's just right, if it passes through this region of space, this kidney-bean-shaped region called the keyhole, the Earth's gravity will bend it just enough that seven years later, on April 13 -- which is a Friday, I'll note -- in the year 2036 -- (Laughter) you can't plan that kind of stuff -- (Laughter) Apophis is going to hit us.
Chinese: 我哋過去對鎖匙眼認知甚少 不過依家已經好清楚嘞 而且我哋明白到了解小行星係非常重要 因為如果唔係 你點阻止呢類小行星呢——

English: And it's 250 meters across, so it would do unbelievable damage.
Chinese: 等我問你，如果你企喺路上 突然有部車衝來你度，你會點做呢？

English: The good news is that the odds of it actually passing through this keyhole and hitting us next go-around are one in a million, roughly -- very, very low odds.
Chinese: 你會咁做

English: I don't think Apophis is a problem.
Chinese: 係咪？走。部車剛好同你擦身而過

English: In fact, Apophis is a blessing in disguise, because it woke us up to the dangers of these things.
Chinese: 但係我哋唔可以移走地球 至少冇咁易，但係我哋可以移走小行星

English: This thing was discovered just a few years ago and could hit us a few years from now.
Chinese: 而且睇來，我哋甚至已經移走過小行星

English: It won't, but it gives us a chance to study these kinds of asteroids.
Chinese: 2005 年，NASA 發射咗 一個叫深層衝擊嘅探測器 探測器其中一部份 撞入咗一粒彗星嘅核心

English: We didn't really necessarily understand these keyholes, and now we do, and it turns out that's really important, because how do you stop an asteroid like this?
Chinese: 彗星好似小行星

English: Well, let me ask you: What happens if you're standing in the road and a car's headed for you?
Chinese: 嗰次目的唔係要將佢推到第二度 而係造一個坑挖掘 以瞭解彗星表面之下係咩嘢物質 我哋嗰次從中的確學到啲嘢

English: What do you do?
Chinese: 我哋的確將小行星移動咗小小 雖然唔多，但唔係重點

English: You do this. Right? Move, and the car goes past you.
Chinese: 不過，諗下 呢個每秒圍繞太陽 10-20 英里

English: But we can't move the Earth, at least not easily, but we can move a small asteroid.
Chinese: 而我哋發射咗一部太空探測器 而且擊中佢

English: And it turns out, we've even done it.
Chinese: 雖然件事好難，但係我哋做到

English: In the year 2005, NASA launched a probe called Deep Impact, which slammed a piece of itself into the nucleus of a comet.
Chinese: 即係話我哋可以繼續做

English: Comets are very much like asteroids.
Chinese: 如果我哋見到一粒小行星撞埋來 而且正正咁對住我哋咁 而我哋有兩年時間？ 唔驚！我哋會擊中佢

English: The purpose wasn't to push it out of the way; the purpose was to make a crater to excavate the material and see what was underneath the surface of this comet, which we learned quite a bit about.
Chinese: 如果你哋睇開戲 可能會諗 點解我哋唔用核武？

English: We did move the comet a little tiny bit -- not very much, but that wasn't the point.
Chinese: 係可以嘅，但問題係時間

English: However, think about this: This thing is orbiting the Sun at 10, 20 miles per second.
Chinese: 如果你用核武來打佢 你要喺幾百萬分之秒裏邊引爆原子彈 如果唔係就打唔中 而且仲有好多其他問題

English: We shot a space probe at it and hit it, OK?
Chinese: 核武好高難度 如果只係要去撞呢？咁就易好多

English: Imagine how hard that must be, and we did it.
Chinese: 我諗 NASA 可以做到

English: That means we can do it again.
Chinese: 佢哋證明咗佢哋係得（笑）

English: If we see an asteroid that's coming toward us, headed right for us, and we have two years to go?
Chinese: 問題係如果撞到小行星 你就會改變佢嘅軌道 然之後你再測量佢嘅軌道，卻發現 弊！我哋將佢推入咗鎖匙眼 即係話佢將會係三年之後撞擊我哋！

English: You know, if you watch the movies -- (Laughter) you might think: Why don't we use a nuclear weapon?
Chinese: 我嘅觀點係，唔緊要

English: Well, you can try that, but the problem is timing.
Chinese: 佢唔會喺六個月之內撞到我哋 咁就好啦

English: Shoot a nuclear weapon at this thing, you have to blow it up within a few milliseconds of tolerance, or else you'll miss it.
Chinese: 依家我哋有 3 年去做嘢

English: And there are a lot of other problems with that; it's very hard to do.
Chinese: 你可以再次擊中佢

English: But just hitting something? That's pretty easy.
Chinese: 但咁樣係一件好蠢嘅事 因為你會推佢入第三個鎖匙眼 所以你唔會咁做

English: I think even NASA can do that, and proved that they can.
Chinese: 跟住係我鍾意嘅部份︰

English: (Laughter) The problem is, if you hit this asteroid, you've changed the orbit, you measure the orbit, then you find out, oh yeah, we just pushed it into a keyhole, and now it's going to hit us in three years.
Chinese: （笑） 「呯一聲！ 我哋正面迎擊小行星之後， 我哋就有咗天鵝絨手套！」

English: Well, my opinion is: fine!
Chinese: （笑） 有一群科學家、工程師同埋太空人 自稱係 B612 基金會

English: It's not hitting us in six months -- that's good.
Chinese: 但對於讀過《小王子》嘅人 你會明白意思︰ 小王子住喺 一個叫做 B612 嘅小行星上 上邊有好多聰明人，有男有女

English: Now we have three years to do something else.
Chinese: 太空人、工程師

English: And you can hit it again.
Chinese: 阿波羅 9 號太空人 拉塞爾．施威卡特都喺上面

English: That's kind of ham-fisted; you might just push it into a third keyhole or whatever, so you don't do that.
Chinese: 我朋友丹．德達整咗呢幅圖 佢依家就喺博爾德核桃街嘅 西南研究中心工作

English: And this is the part -- it's the part I just love.
Chinese: 佢為呢樣嘢做咗一幅圖

English: (Laughter) After the big macho "Grr ... bam! We're gonna hit this thing in the face," then we bring in the velvet gloves.
Chinese: 同時佢就係為佢哋做嘢嘅 其中一位太空人

English: (Laughter) There's a group of scientists and engineers and astronauts, and they call themselves The B612 Foundation.
Chinese: 如果我哋發現 一粒即將撞擊地球嘅小行星 而我哋有足夠嘅時間嘅話 我哋可以移佢去一個更安全嘅軌道

English: For those of you who've read "The Little Prince," you understand that reference, I hope -- the little prince lived on an asteroid called B612.
Chinese: 但我哋依家做緊嘅係發射 一粒 1-2 噸重嘅探測器

English: These are smart guys -- men and women -- astronauts, like I said, engineers.
Chinese: 佢唔一定要幾噸咁大 你只要將佢停近小行星

English: Rusty Schweickart, who was an Apollo 9 astronaut, is on this.
Chinese: 你唔需要登陸小行星 因為小行星來回震動，所以好難登陸

English: Dan Durda, my friend who made this image, works here at Southwest Research Institute in Boulder, on Walnut Street.
Chinese: 不如先靠近佢哋

English: He created this image for this.
Chinese: 小行星嘅重力會拉埋探測器

English: He's actually one of the astronomers who works for them.
Chinese: 而探測器又只有幾噸重

English: If we see an asteroid that's going to hit the Earth and we have enough time, we can hit it to move it into a better orbit.
Chinese: 探測器嘅重力細 但足以拉動小行星 再加上本身嘅火箭裝置—— 噢，你雖然睇唔到佢 但係嗰度有火箭嘅噴焰—— 小行星同探測器之間嘅重力 將兩者連埋起來 如果你慢慢移動探測器 而又非常非常細力嘅話 你就可以好輕鬆咁將小行星 送入地球上一個安全軌道

English: But then what we do is launch a probe that has to weigh a ton or two.
Chinese: 甚至可以上去採集礦物 但係嗰個完全係另一件事 我唔會深入呢個話題（笑）

English: It doesn't have to be huge -- a couple of tons, not that big -- and you park it near the asteroid.
Chinese: 但係我哋會因此暴富！

English: And not only do they learn it as well, but actually it's more interesting.

English: Because with Duolingo, people are learning with real content.
Chinese: 相對於用教材寫嘅句子 人哋學緊真實嘅內容 從本質上就有趣好多

English: As opposed to learning with made-up sentences, people are learning with real content, which is inherently interesting.
Chinese: 人哋真係學習一種語言

English: So people really do learn a language.
Chinese: 可能更令人驚奇嘅係 用緊哩個網站嘅人 ——即使佢哋只係初學者 所寫嘅翻譯同嗰啲專業嘅翻譯家 竟然一樣準確 等我舉個例子

English: But perhaps more surprisingly, the translations that we get from people using the site, even though they're just beginners, the translations that we get are as accurate as those of professional language translators, which is very surprising.
Chinese: 哩個係一個從德文翻譯成英文嘅句子

English: This is a sentence that was translated from German into English.
Chinese: 上面係德文 中間係由專業譯者做嘅英文翻譯 我哋為哩個翻譯嘅每個字使咗 20 美仙

English: The top is the German. The middle is an English translation that was done by a professional translator who we paid 20 cents a word for this translation.
Chinese: 最下面嘅翻譯係由之前完全唔識德文嘅 我哋網站嘅用戶做嘅翻譯

English: And the bottom is a translation by users of Duolingo, none of whom knew any German before they started using the site.
Chinese: 你哋可以見到，哩個翻譯係幾完美嘅

English: If you can see, it's pretty much perfect.
Chinese: 當然，我哋用咗一啲方法 令哩個翻譯同專業翻譯一樣咁好

English: Of course, we play a trick here to make the translations as good as professional language translators.
Chinese: 我哋集合多個用戶嘅翻譯 來得到一個專業譯者水準嘅翻譯

English: We combine the translations of multiple beginners to get the quality of a single professional translator.
Chinese: 而即使我哋綜合多個譯者 哩個網站嘅翻譯其實幾快

English: Now, even though we're combining the translations, the site actually can translate pretty fast.
Chinese: 等我展示一下 哩個係估算我哋可以幾快咁將維基百科 從英文翻譯為西班牙文

English: So let me show you, this is our estimates of how fast we could translate Wikipedia from English into Spanish.
Chinese: 留意，哩度有五千萬美元嘅價值

English: Remember, this is 50 million dollars' worth of value.
Chinese: 如果我哋想將維基百科翻譯為西班牙文 以 10 萬活躍用戶來計 我哋可以係 5 星期內完成

English: So if we wanted to translate Wikipedia into Spanish, we could do it in five weeks with 100,000 active users.
Chinese: 以 100 萬活躍用戶來計 我哋可以喺 80 個鐘之內完成

English: And we could do it in about 80 hours with a million active users.
Chinese: 既然我嘅團隊接觸嘅所有項目 都達到百萬用戶 我哋希望可以用哩個項目極快咁翻譯

English: Since all the projects my group has worked on so far have gotten millions of users, we're hopeful that we'll be able to translate extremely fast.
Chinese: 我對 Duolingo 最為興奮嘅係 佢為語言教育提供咗 一種公平交易嘅商業模式

English: Now, the thing that I'm most excited about with Duolingo is I think this provides a fair business model for language education.
Chinese: 係咁樣嘅： 目前嘅語言教育模式係學生畀錢 即係學生會畀 500 美元 Rosetta Stone

English: So here's the thing: The current business model for language education is the student pays, and in particular, the student pays Rosetta Stone 500 dollars.
Chinese: （笑聲） 哩就係目前嘅商業模式

English: (Laughter) That's the current business model.
Chinese: 哩種商業模式嘅問題係 95% 嘅人口連 500 美元都冇

English: The problem with this business model is that 95 percent of the world's population doesn't have 500 dollars.
Chinese: 所以佢對貧窮人口係極唔公平嘅

English: So it's extremely unfair towards the poor.
Chinese: 佢完全偏向富裕人口

English: This is totally biased towards the rich.
Chinese: 而且，因為你學緊語言嘅時候 你實際上創造緊價值—— 你翻譯緊嗰啲本來需要錢翻譯嘅嘢 哩個就係我哋貨幣化學習嘅方法

English: Now, see, in Duolingo, because while you learn, you're actually creating value, you're translating stuff -- which, for example, we could charge somebody for translations, so this is how we could monetize this.
Chinese: 既然佢哋學習嘅時候創造緊價值 佢哋無需付出金錢 只需要付出佢哋嘅時間

English: Since people are creating value while they're learning, they don't have to pay with their money, they pay with their time.
Chinese: 神奇在於你付出嘅時間 本來就係要來學語言嘅 所以我講 Duolingo 做嘅一件好事 就係提供咗一個公平嘅商業模式

English: But the magical thing here is that is time that would have had to have been spent anyways learning the language.
Chinese: 一個唔歧視貧窮嘅模式

English: So the nice thing about Duolingo is, I think, it provides a fair business model -- one that doesn't discriminate against poor people.
Chinese: Duolingo 就係哩個網站。多謝

English: So here's the site. Thank you.
Chinese: （掌聲） 我哋仲未正式發佈 但係如果你去哩個網站 你可以註冊成為非公開測試版本嘅一員 測試版本可能喺未來三四個星期 就會開始

English: (Applause) We haven't yet launched, but if you go there, you can sign up to be part of our private beta, which is probably going to start in three or four weeks.
Chinese: Duolingo 仲未有得用著

English: We haven't yet launched it.
Chinese: 順便講一句，雖然係我喺度做哩個演講 但實際上 Duolingo 係一個出色團隊嘅產品 哩個團隊中嘅一些人今日都係哩度

English: By the way, I'm the one talking here, but Duolingo is the work of a really awesome team, some of whom are here. So thank you.
Chinese: 多謝！ （掌聲）

English: (Applause)

Chinese: 我喺度想講蜘蛛有幾勁 同埋我哋可以 從呢種動物身上學幾多嘢

English: I'm here to spread the word about the magnificence of spiders and how much we can learn from them.
Chinese: 蜘蛛真係世界公民

English: Spiders are truly global citizens.
Chinese: 你差唔多可以 喺所有陸生生境上面揾到蜘蛛

English: You can find spiders in nearly every terrestrial habitat.
Chinese: 呢個紅點就係北美洲大盤地 喺嗰度，我同埋我班同事 參與一個高山生物多樣性嘅研究

English: This red dot marks the Great Basin of North America, and I'm involved with an alpine biodiversity project there with some collaborators.
Chinese: 呢個係我哋其中一個野外考察點 畀你睇下係點嘅樣 呢！呢個藍色點係我一個同事

English: Here's one of our field sites, and just to give you a sense of perspective, this little blue smudge here, that's one of my collaborators.
Chinese: 呢道雖然寸草不生 但係都有幾多蜘蛛㗎

English: This is a rugged and barren landscape, yet there are quite a few spiders here.
Chinese: 翻轉嚿石頭 睇下呢隻蟹蛛同隻甲蟲玩雙撲

English: Turning rocks over revealed this crab spider grappling with a beetle.
Chinese: 蜘蛛唔單止周圍都係 而且仲好多種

English: Spiders are not just everywhere, but they're extremely diverse.
Chinese: 有記錄嘅都超過四萬種

English: There are over 40,000 described species of spiders.
Chinese: 為咗明白個數字 呢幅圖比較四萬種蜘蛛 同四百種靈長類動物

English: To put that number into perspective, here's a graph comparing the 40,000 species of spiders to the 400 species of primates.
Chinese: 蜘蛛種類差唔多 係靈長類種類嘅百幾倍

English: There are two orders of magnitude more spiders than primates.
Chinese: 蜘蛛算係好古老嘅生物

English: Spiders are also extremely old.
Chinese: 下面呢道，呢個係地質學嘅時標尺度 上面嘅數字代表幾百萬年前 所以零就代表今日

English: On the bottom here, this is the geologic timescale, and the numbers on it indicate millions of years from the present, so the zero here, that would be today.
Chinese: 咁，呢個數字指出 蜘蛛可以追溯到 差唔多三億八千萬年前

English: So what this figure shows is that spiders date back to almost 380 million years.
Chinese: 又咁講 呢條打直嘅紅色線 就係人類喺七百萬年前 從猿人分咗出嚟

English: To put that into perspective, this red vertical bar here marks the divergence time of humans from chimpanzees, a mere seven million years ago.
Chinese: 所有蜘蛛喺一生之中總會吐過絲

English: All spiders make silk at some point in their life.
Chinese: 大部分蜘蛛會用上大量嘅絲 而且，蜘蛛絲 對蜘蛛求生同繁殖都幾重要

English: Most spiders use copious amounts of silk, and silk is essential to their survival and reproduction.
Chinese: 遠古嘅蜘蛛都可以做絲 因為我哋可以從石化咗嘅蜘蛛 身上嘅吐絲頭略知一二

English: Even fossil spiders can make silk, as we can see from this impression of a spinneret on this fossil spider.
Chinese: 所以，蜘蛛同埋蜘蛛絲 已經存在咗三億八千萬年

English: So this means that both spiders and spider silk have been around for 380 million years.
Chinese: 你唔使同蜘蛛相處太耐 就可以明白到蜘蛛絲 對蜘蛛一生有幾重要

English: It doesn't take long from working with spiders to start noticing how essential silk is to just about every aspect of their life.
Chinese: 蜘蛛用絲有好多原因 例如搖曳安全拖絲 包裹蜘蛛蛋以供繁殖 保護性撤退 同埋獵食

English: Spiders use silk for many purposes, including the trailing safety dragline, wrapping eggs for reproduction, protective retreats and catching prey.
Chinese: 蜘蛛絲有好多種

English: There are many kinds of spider silk.
Chinese: 譬如，呢隻園蛛可以做 七種唔同嘅蜘蛛絲

English: For example, this garden spider can make seven different kinds of silks.
Chinese: 當你睇呢個環形蜘蛛網時 你其實睇緊好多種蜘蛛絲纖維

English: When you look at this orb web, you're actually seeing many types of silk fibers.
Chinese: 網圈同網輻係由一種蜘蛛絲做 但螺旋捕網卻係由兩種唔同嘅蜘蛛絲： 小絲體同埋粘滴組成

English: The frame and radii of this web is made up of one type of silk, while the capture spiral is a composite of two different silks: the filament and the sticky droplet.
Chinese: 蜘蛛係點樣整到咁多種蜘蛛絲呢？

English: How does an individual spider make so many kinds of silk?
Chinese: 要揾答案，你就要睇埋啲蜘蛛嘅吐絲頭

English: To answer that, you have to look a lot closer at the spinneret region of a spider.
Chinese: 蜘蛛絲從吐絲頭嗰度出嚟 對於我哋蜘蛛絲生物學家嚟講 吐絲頭就係蜘蛛嘅「生意」來源 （笑聲） 我哋用咗好長日子……

English: So silk comes out of the spinnerets, and for those of us spider silk biologists, this is what we call the "business end" of the spider. (Laughter) We spend long days ...
Chinese: 嘻，唔好笑，我嘅生活係咁

English: Hey! Don't laugh. That's my life.
Chinese: （笑聲） 我哋日以繼夜盯實蜘蛛呢部分

English: (Laughter) We spend long days and nights staring at this part of the spider.
Chinese: 以下就係我睇到嘅嘢

English: And this is what we see.
Chinese: 好多纖維從吐絲頭嗰度出嚟 再深入啲睇 每個吐絲頭上面有好多個咀

English: You can see multiple fibers coming out of the spinnerets, because each spinneret has many spigots on it.
Chinese: 每款絲纖維喺唔同嘅咀度噴出嚟 如果你從纖維追溯入返蜘蛛身體 你揾到嘅係 每一個咀連接住獨立嘅絲腺體 絲腺體好似一個裝住好多絲蛋白嘅囊

English: Each of these silk fibers exits from the spigot, and if you were to trace the fiber back into the spider, what you would find is that each spigot connects to its own individual silk gland. A silk gland kind of looks like a sac with a lot of silk proteins stuck inside.
Chinese: 如果你有機會解剖圓網蜘蛛 我希望你有機會揾到 一個好靚、半透明嘅絲腺體

English: So if you ever have the opportunity to dissect an orb-web-weaving spider, and I hope you do, what you would find is a bounty of beautiful, translucent silk glands.
Chinese: 每隻蜘蛛裡面，有幾百個絲腺體 有時，甚至成千個

English: Inside each spider, there are hundreds of silk glands, sometimes thousands.
Chinese: 呢啲絲腺體可以分為七類

English: These can be grouped into seven categories.
Chinese: 佢哋大細、外形唔同 有時顏色都唔同

English: They differ by size, shape, and sometimes even color.
Chinese: 喺圓網蜘蛛裡面 你可以揾到七種絲腺體 即係我喺呢張圖描述咁 我哋從一點鐘位置開始睇 嗰啲係小管狀嘅絲腺體 負責製造卵囊體外絲

English: In an orb-web-weaving spider, you can find seven types of silk glands, and what I have depicted here in this picture, let's start at the one o'clock position, there's tubuliform silk glands, which are used to make the outer silk of an egg sac.
Chinese: 呢啲係聚狀絲腺同埋鞭狀絲腺 聚狀絲腺同鞭狀絲腺一齊製造 圓網蜘蛛網上面好黐嘅螺旋捕網

English: There's the aggregate and flagelliform silk glands which combine to make the sticky capture spiral of an orb web.
Chinese: 梨渦狀絲腺製造黐固劑 即係黐住蜘蛛絲同埋基質嘅嘢

English: Pyriform silk glands make the attachment cement -- that's the silk that's used to adhere silk lines to a substrate.
Chinese: 葡萄串狀絲用嚟包住獵物

English: There's also aciniform silk, which is used to wrap prey.
Chinese: 小壺腹狀絲用嚟起網

English: Minor ampullate silk is used in web construction.
Chinese: 研究得最多嘅絲： 大壺腹狀絲

English: And the most studied silk line of them all: major ampullate silk.
Chinese: 呢種絲用嚟做圈、輻，同搖曳安全拖絲

English: This is the silk that's used to make the frame and radii of an orb web, and also the safety trailing dragline.
Chinese: 咁蜘蛛絲究竟係點㗎呢？

English: But what, exactly, is spider silk?
Chinese: 蜘蛛絲差唔多全部由蛋白質造成

English: Spider silk is almost entirely protein.
Chinese: 絕大部分呢啲蛋白質 都能夠由單基因家族解釋 所以，我哋今日睇到不同種類嘅蜘蛛絲 都係由單基因家族所編碼而成 因此，可以假設 原始蜘蛛祖先只係做一種絲 同埋喺過去嘅三億八千萬年 有一種蜘蛛絲基因複製咗 跟着，分開演變、專門化 同一條基因不停不停咁重複以上 最後演化出大量唔同樣嘅蜘蛛絲

English: Nearly all of these proteins can be explained by a single gene family, so this means that the diversity of silk types we see today is encoded by one gene family, so presumably the original spider ancestor made one kind of silk, and over the last 380 million years, that one silk gene has duplicated and then diverged, specialized, over and over and over again, to get the large variety of flavors of spider silks that we have today.
Chinese: 但所有呢啲蜘蛛絲都有幾個共同點 譬如佢哋都係好長 同其他蛋白質比較，佢哋長得出奇

English: There are several features that all these silks have in common. They all have a common design, such as they're all very long -- they're sort of outlandishly long compared to other proteins.
Chinese: 佢哋又高度重複 同埋擁有好多甘氨酸 同丙氨酸類型嘅氨基酸

English: They're very repetitive, and they're very rich in the amino acids glycine and alanine.
Chinese: 為咗將一粒蜘蛛絲蛋白形象化 呢條係拖絲蛋白 正確啲嚟講 係黑寡婦蜘蛛吐出嚟嘅 拖絲蛋白嘅其中一部分

English: To give you an idea of what a spider silk protein looks like, this is a dragline silk protein, it's just a portion of it, from the black widow spider.
Chinese: 呢款蛋白序列，我好鐘意日日夜夜睇住 （笑聲） 你呢道睇到嘅字母係氨基酸嘅簡寫 我用綠色標示甘氨酸 紅色標示丙氨酸 你會睇到好多 G 呀同 A 呀

English: This is the kind of sequence that I love looking at day and night. (Laughter) So what you're seeing here is the one letter abbreviation for amino acids, and I've colored in the glycines with green, and the alanines in red, and so you can see it's just a lot of G's and A's.
Chinese: 同埋好多短又重複嘅序列 所以舉例嚟講 有好多多聚丙氨酸 或者寫做 A，就係 AAAAA 亦都有 GGQ，同埋有 GGY

English: You can also see that there's a lot of short sequence motifs that repeat over and over and over again, so for example there's a lot of what we call polyalanines, or iterated A's, AAAAA. There's GGQ. There's GGY.
Chinese: 你想像呢啲短嘅序列組成詞語 而詞言轉過嚟又組成句子

English: You can think of these short motifs that repeat over and over again as words, and these words occur in sentences.
Chinese: 舉個例，呢道等如一句句子 綠色呢部分同埋紅色呢部分嘅 多聚丙氨酸會不斷重複 以至你會見到一條絲分子裡面 有幾何級數嘅氨基酸序列

English: So for example this would be one sentence, and you would get this sort of green region and the red polyalanine, that repeats over and over and over again, and you can have that hundreds and hundreds and hundreds of times within an individual silk molecule.
Chinese: 同一隻蜘蛛吐嘅絲 可以有好唔同嘅重複序列

English: Silks made by the same spider can have dramatically different repeat sequences.
Chinese: 喺熒光幕頂上面 你見到園金蛛嘅拖絲嘅重複單位

English: At the top of the screen, you're seeing the repeat unit from the dragline silk of a garden argiope spider.
Chinese: 個重複單位好短 喺下面，呢個就係同一隻蜘蛛嘅 卵鞘或者小管狀絲蛋白嘅重複序列 你可以見到呢啲絲蛋白有幾唔同 所以，呢個就係 蜘蛛絲基因家族多元化嘅美 重複單位唔單止每個長度不一

English: It's short. And on the bottom, this is the repeat sequence for the egg case, or tubuliform silk protein, for the exact same spider. And you can see how dramatically different these silk proteins are -- so this is sort of the beauty of the diversification of the spider silk gene family.
Chinese: 佢哋嘅序列都唔同

English: You can see that the repeat units differ in length. They also differ in sequence.
Chinese: 而家，我再將甘氨酸填上綠色 丙氨酸填紅色 絲氨酸，即係大楷 S，填紫色 咁樣，你能夠見到 上面嗰啲重複單位 差唔多都係綠色、紅色 同埋下面嘅重複單位好多都係紫色

English: So I've colored in the glycines again in green, alanine in red, and the serines, the letter S, in purple. And you can see that the top repeat unit can be explained almost entirely by green and red, and the bottom repeat unit has a substantial amount of purple.
Chinese: 我哋生物學家嘗試用 呢啲序列、呢啲氨基酸序列 去解釋絲纖維嘅機械特性

English: What silk biologists do is we try to relate these sequences, these amino acid sequences, to the mechanical properties of the silk fibers.
Chinese: 蜘蛛將佢哋啲絲全部用喺身體出面 對我哋嚟講真係好方便

English: Now, it's really convenient that spiders use their silk completely outside their body.
Chinese: 因為咁樣令測試蜘蛛絲超簡單 要知道，我哋喺實驗室度 係喺空氣之中測試蜘蛛絲嘅 務求同實際蜘蛛 用佢哋嘅絲蛋白環境一模一樣

English: This makes testing spider silk really, really easy to do in the laboratory, because we're actually, you know, testing it in air that's exactly the environment that spiders are using their silk proteins.
Chinese: 量度蜘蛛絲特性嘅定量方法 包括有延展測試 亦即係拉痕纖維兩端，令佢好貼服咁

English: So this makes quantifying silk properties by methods such as tensile testing, which is basically, you know, tugging on one end of the fiber, very amenable.
Chinese: 呢個應力應變曲線 由測試同一隻蜘蛛製造嘅 五條纖維所產生

English: Here are stress-strain curves generated by tensile testing five fibers made by the same spider.
Chinese: 喺度，你見到五種纖維有唔同特性

English: So what you can see here is that the five fibers have different behaviors.
Chinese: 你睇下條縱軸嗰個應力 如果你睇呢啲纖維嘅最大應力值 你就睇到真係好多變化 事實上，拖絲或者壺腹狀絲 係呢啲纖維裡面最強嘅

English: Specifically, if you look on the vertical axis, that's stress. If you look at the maximum stress value for each of these fibers, you can see that there's a lot of variation, and in fact dragline, or major ampullate silk, is the strongest of these fibers.
Chinese: 我哋諗，因為拖絲 係用嚟做蜘蛛網嘅圈同輻 所以要好強

English: We think that's because the dragline silk, which is used to make the frame and radii for a web, needs to be very strong.
Chinese: 但如果你睇張力 即係纖維可以拉幾長 如果你睇著個最大數值 呢道，又係好多變化 好明顯，係鞭毛狀絲或者捕旋小絲勝出

English: On the other hand, if you were to look at strain -- this is how much a fiber can be extended -- if you look at the maximum value here, again, there's a lot of variation and the clear winner is flagelliform, or the capture spiral filament.
Chinese: 實際上，鞭毛狀纖維 可以真係拉長超過一倍

English: In fact, this flagelliform fiber can actually stretch over twice its original length.
Chinese: 所以絲纖維有唔同嘅強度 同埋唔同嘅伸展能力

English: So silk fibers vary in their strength and also their extensibility.
Chinese: 至於螺旋捕網 佢要夠延伸力 去吸收飛行獵物嘅衝擊

English: In the case of the capture spiral, it needs to be so stretchy to absorb the impact of flying prey.
Chinese: 如果佢唔能夠延伸好多 咁當昆蟲撞埋蜘蛛網嗰陣 就會彈翻出去

English: If it wasn't able to stretch so much, then basically when an insect hit the web, it would just trampoline right off of it.
Chinese: 所以如果成個蜘蛛網都係用拖絲所做 昆蟲只會成日彈入又彈出 但係，如果真係用 超級伸展嘅捕蟲螺旋絲 個網就有能力吸收衝擊、捕著獵物

English: So if the web was made entirely out of dragline silk, an insect is very likely to just bounce right off. But by having really, really stretchy capture spiral silk, the web is actually able to absorb the impact of that intercepted prey.
Chinese: 由於蜘蛛造嘅纖維當中有唔細嘅變化

English: There's quite a bit of variation within the fibers that an individual spider can make.
Chinese: 所以我哋戲稱蜘蛛個肚為「工具箱」

English: We call that the tool kit of a spider.
Chinese: 令佢哋有足夠款式嘅纖維同環境互動

English: That's what the spider has to interact with their environment.
Chinese: 但係，蜘蛛種類之間嘅差異係點嘅呢？ 不如睇下唔同蜘蛛但同一種嘅絲？

English: But how about variation among spider species, so looking at one type of silk and looking at different species of spiders?
Chinese: 呢個領域大部分地方都未探討過 但係，我呢道有啲數據可以畀你睇

English: This is an area that's largely unexplored but here's a little bit of data I can show you.
Chinese: 呢道比較 21 種蜘蛛所吐嘅拖絲

English: This is the comparison of the toughness of the dragline spilk spun by 21 species of spiders.
Chinese: 有啲係圓網蜘蛛 有啲唔係圓網蜘蛛

English: Some of them are orb-weaving spiders and some of them are non-orb-weaving spiders.
Chinese: 有人曾經假設過 圓網蜘蛛好似金蛛咁擁有最韌嘅拖絲 因為佢哋一定要捕捉飛行獵物

English: It's been hypothesized that orb-weaving spiders, like this argiope here, should have the toughest dragline silks because they must intercept flying prey.
Chinese: 呢道你睇緊嘅韌度圖 圖上面黑點越高，代表越韌

English: What you see here on this toughness graph is the higher the black dot is on the graph, the higher the toughness.
Chinese: 呢道幅進化樹圖係說明 21 種蜘蛛基因關係 我填咗圓網蜘蛛黃色

English: The 21 species are indicated here by this phylogeny, this evolutionary tree, that shows their genetic relationships, and I've colored in yellow the orb-web-weaving spiders.
Chinese: 而兩個紅箭咀就指向 新婦蛛同埋十字園蛛嘅韌度值

English: If you look right here at the two red arrows, they point to the toughness values for the draglines of nephila clavipes and araneus diadematus.
Chinese: 講開新婦蛛同埋十字園蛛 合成蜘蛛絲嘅研究嘅大部分時間同金錢 都用喺複製呢兩種蜘蛛嘅拖絲蛋白

English: These are the two species of spiders for which the vast majority of time and money on synthetic spider silk research has been to replicate their dragline silk proteins.
Chinese: 但係，佢哋嘅拖絲唔係最韌嘅

English: Yet, their draglines are not the toughest.
Chinese: 事實上，呢個調查發現最韌嘅拖絲 係白色呢部分，一種圓網蜘蛛造嘅拖絲

English: In fact, the toughest dragline in this survey is this one right here in this white region, a non orb-web-weaving spider.
Chinese: 呢條拖線由花皮蛛所吐

English: This is the dragline spun by scytodes, the spitting spider.
Chinese: 花皮蛛根本唔用網嚟捕獵 而係潜伏一旁 等待獵物慢慢走近自己 然後噴啲好似絲嘅毒液落昆蟲度

English: Scytodes doesn't use a web at all to catch prey. Instead, scytodes sort of lurks around and waits for prey to get close to it, and then immobilizes prey by spraying a silk-like venom onto that insect.
Chinese: 令獵物唔郁得 花皮蜘蛛就係用絲線捕獵

English: Think of hunting with silly string.
Chinese: 我哋唔知點解花皮蛛需要咁韌嘅拖絲 但就係好似呢啲不尋常發現 令生物勘探咁刺激同有價值

English: We don't really know why scytodes needs such a tough dragline, but it's unexpected results like this that make bio-prospecting so exciting and worthwhile.
Chinese: 不尋常發現幫我哋衝破想像嘅限制

English: It frees us from the constraints of our imagination.
Chinese: 而家，我準備標上 尼龍纖維、蠶蟲絲 羊毛、克維拉 同埋炭纖維嘅韌值

English: Now I'm going to mark on the toughness values for nylon fiber, bombyx -- or domesticated silkworm silk -- wool, Kevlar, and carbon fibers.
Chinese: 你可以見到 差唔多所有蜘蛛嘅拖絲都比以上物料韌

English: And what you can see is that nearly all the spider draglines surpass them.
Chinese: 蜘蛛絲之所以咁特別 同吸引仿生學家注意 係因為佢柔合強度、伸展度，同埋韌度 亦因為咁，人類轉向 從大自然尋找解决方法

English: It's the combination of strength, extensibility and toughness that makes spider silk so special, and that has attracted the attention of biomimeticists, so people that turn to nature to try to find new solutions.
Chinese: 蜘蛛絲嘅強度、伸展度，同埋韌度 加上蜘蛛絲唔會引致免疫反應嘅特點 令到蜘蛛絲應用喺生物醫學上相當吸引 例如，作為人造肌腱嘅物料 用於引導神經再生 同作為組織生長嘅支架

English: And the strength, extensibility and toughness of spider silks combined with the fact that silks do not elicit an immune response, have attracted a lot of interest in the use of spider silks in biomedical applications, for example, as a component of artificial tendons, for serving as guides to regrow nerves, and for scaffolds for tissue growth.
Chinese: 蜘蛛絲嘅防彈特性亦都非常有應用潛力

English: Spider silks also have a lot of potential for their anti-ballistic capabilities.
Chinese: 蜘蛛絲可以用於盔甲同裝備保護上 令佢哋更輕、更柔韌

English: Silks could be incorporated into body and equipment armor that would be more lightweight and flexible than any armor available today.
Chinese: 蜘蛛絲除咗有仿生學應用價值之外 蜘蛛絲仲會令人陶醉

English: In addition to these biomimetic applications of spider silks, personally, I find studying spider silks just fascinating in and of itself.
Chinese: 我好鍾意當我喺實驗室嗰時 有一條新嘅蜘蛛絲序列送入嚟

English: I love when I'm in the laboratory, a new spider silk sequence comes in.
Chinese: 呢樣嘢係最正嘅 （笑聲） 我覺得，蜘蛛好似 同我分享緊一個遠古秘密 所以我會用我嘅餘生研究蜘蛛絲

English: That's just the best. (Laughter) It's like the spiders are sharing an ancient secret with me, and that's why I'm going to spend the rest of my life studying spider silk.
Chinese: 下次，當你見到蜘蛛網時 唔該，停一停 睇埋啲一種人類已知最高性能嘅材料

English: The next time you see a spider web, please, pause and look a little closer.
Chinese: 借用文學嘅一句話 一隻叫夏洛特嘅蜘蛛話︰ 「蜘蛛絲係偉大嘅。」 多謝 （鼓掌）

English: To borrow from the writings of a spider named Charlotte, silk is terrific.
Chinese: （鼓掌）

English: Thank you. (Applause) (Applause)

Chinese: 好多好多年前 我就以阿富汗為終點開始旅行 旅程由我嘅國家 波蘭嘅東邊界開始

English: My travels to Afghanistan began many, many years ago on the eastern border of my country, my homeland, Poland.
Chinese: 我行過 嫲嫲故仔入邊嘅森林

English: I was walking through the forests of my grandmother's tales.
Chinese: 個森林周圍都係墓地 墓地背後，代表 20 世紀 成千上萬嘅人 被放逐或殺害

English: A land where every field hides a grave, where millions of people have been deported or killed in the 20th century.
Chinese: 但係喺生靈塗炭之外 我發現咗一片温暖嘅土地

English: Behind the destruction, I found a soul of places.
Chinese: 我遇到謙遜嘅人

English: I met humble people.
Chinese: 我聽到佢哋祈禱 我食佢哋食嘅麵包

English: I heard their prayer and ate their bread.
Chinese: 從東歐到中亞 我行咗 20 年 我穿過高加索山脈 行過咗中東 北非 同俄羅斯

English: Then I have been walking East for 20 years -- from Eastern Europe to Central Asia -- through the Caucasus Mountains, Middle East, North Africa, Russia.
Chinese: 喺呢啲地方我仲遇到更加多謙遜嘅人

English: And I ever met more humble people.
Chinese: 我食佢哋嘅麵包，聽佢哋祈禱

English: And I shared their bread and their prayer.
Chinese: 依個就係我去阿富汗嘅原因

English: This is why I went to Afghanistan.
Chinese: 有一日，我行過 奧克蘇斯河上條橋

English: One day, I crossed the bridge over the Oxus River.
Chinese: 我獨自一人行

English: I was alone on foot.
Chinese: 個阿富汗士兵見到我嘅時候都好驚訝 甚至唔記得喺我嘅護照上蓋章

English: And the Afghan soldier was so surprised to see me that he forgot to stamp my passport.
Chinese: 但係佢哋畀咗杯茶我

English: But he gave me a cup of tea.
Chinese: 我覺得 佢嘅驚訝反而保護咗我

English: And I understood that his surprise was my protection.
Chinese: 由阿富汗接壤伊朗邊境 到阿富汗嘅瓦罕走廊 我騎過馬 撐過艇，搭過順風車

English: So I have been walking and traveling, by horses, by yak, by truck, by hitchhiking, from Iran's border to the bottom, to the edge of the Wakhan Corridor.
Chinese: 通過依種方式 我發現咗阿富汗神秘嘅一面

English: And in this way I could find noor, the hidden light of Afghanistan.
Chinese: 我僅有嘅物件 就係本筆記簿同部相機

English: My only weapon was my notebook and my Leica.
Chinese: 我聽到伊斯蘭教蘇菲派祈禱 蘇菲派係一班謙遜嘅穆斯林 但係塔利班分子好憎佢哋

English: I heard prayers of the Sufi -- humble Muslims, hated by the Taliban.
Chinese: 仲有不為人知嘅河流 從直布羅陀到印度 扯上好多神秘嘅嘢

English: Hidden river, interconnected with the mysticism from Gibraltar to India.
Chinese: 喺清真寺，信徒 會以淚水祝福 恭敬嘅外國人 而且會當係寶咁歡迎佢哋

English: The mosque where the respectful foreigner is showered with blessings and with tears, and welcomed as a gift.
Chinese: 關於依個國家同人民 我哋知道幾多？ 我哋只係假扮保護佢哋 我哋又有幾瞭解啲鄉鎮？ 嗰度唯一嘅止痛藥 唯一止餓嘅食物 係鴉片

English: What do we know about the country and the people that we pretend to protect, about the villages where the only one medicine to kill the pain and to stop the hunger is opium?
Chinese: 依班身處喀布爾屋頂上嘅人 係戰爭 10 年後 染上鴉片癮

English: These are opium-addicted people on the roofs of Kabul 10 years after the beginning of our war.
Chinese: 依啲係遊牧民族嘅女仔 佢哋成為咗阿富汗商人嘅性工具

English: These are the nomad girls who became prostitutes for Afghan businessmen.
Chinese: 戰爭 10 年後 我哋對呢度嘅女性瞭解幾多？

English: What do we know about the women 10 years after the war?
Chinese: 佢哋身上套住個中國造嘅 尼龍袋 係所謂嘅穆斯林傳統波卡服裝

English: Clothed in this nylon bag, made in China, with the name of burqa.
Chinese: 有一日 我見到阿富汗最大嘅學校 係間女校

English: I saw one day, the largest school in Afghanistan, a girls' school.
Chinese: 有一萬三千個女仔 喺依度返學 佢哋喺地牢一間房上堂 入邊周圍滿佈蝎子

English: 13,000 girls studying here in the rooms underground, full of scorpions.
Chinese: 但係佢哋對學習嘅熱愛 令我熱淚盈眶

English: And their love [for studying] was so big that I cried.
Chinese: 我哋又知道幾多 嗰啲夠膽送自己個女去返學嘅家長 受到幾多 阿富汗恐怖分子嘅死亡恐嚇？

English: What do we know about the death threats by the Taliban nailed on the doors of the people who dare to send their daughters to school as in Balkh?
Chinese: 依個地區好危險，周圍都係塔利班份子 但係啲女仔都讀到書

English: The region is not secure, but full of the Taliban, and they did it.
Chinese: 我想幫啲無辦法出聲嘅人 講出佢哋嘅故仔 向外界展示佢哋不為人知嘅一面 展示喺依場遊戲嘅帷幕後邊 被媒體、全世界 所遺忘嘅小小世界

English: My aim is to give a voice to the silent people, to show the hidden lights behind the curtain of the great game, the small worlds ignored by the media and the prophets of a global conflict.
Chinese: 多謝

English: Thanks.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: (Applause)

Chinese: 我喺呢度同大家討論 大自然嘅無形性經濟

English: I'm here to talk to you about the economic invisibility of nature.
Chinese: 但壞消息係 大自然嘅後勤部門其實未運作 所以仲未出發票

English: The bad news is that mother nature's back office isn't working yet, so those invoices don't get issued.
Chinese: 但我哋需要處理呢個問題

English: But we need to do something about this problem.
Chinese: 我一出嚟就從事市場專業 一直都冇改 不過最近我大部分精力都投放到 研究人類開採返嚟嘅自然資源嘅價值 但佢哋仍然未有所謂嘅價錢牌

English: I began my life as a markets professional and continued to take an interest, but most of my recent effort has been looking at the value of what comes to human beings from nature, and which doesn't get priced by the markets.
Chinese: 一個名為 TEEB 嘅計劃喺 2007 年開始 由一班 G8+5 嘅環保官員成立

English: A project called TEEB was started in 2007, and it was launched by a group of environment ministers of the G8+5.
Chinese: 佢哋嘅理念 源自斯特恩勳爵嘅苛刻見解

English: And their basic inspiration was a stern review of Lord Stern.
Chinese: 佢哋問咗自己一個問題： 如果經濟可以說服到人 及早對抗氣候變化 咁點解唔可以說服人類做保育？

English: They asked themselves a question: If economics could make such a convincing case for early action on climate change, well why can't the same be done for conservation?
Chinese: 點解同一道理唔可以套用到大自然呢？

English: Why can't an equivalent case be made for nature?
Chinese: 而答案係：無錯，可以

English: And the answer is: Yeah, it can.
Chinese: 但並唔係咁直接

English: But it's not that straightforward.
Chinese: 生物多樣性係地球上活生生嘅結構 而並非死沉沉嘅氣體

English: Biodiversity, the living fabric of this planet, is not a gas.
Chinese: 佢存在嘅層面有 生態系統、物種同基因 規模又以國際、國內、本地、社區計 斯特恩勳爵同佢嘅團隊 為自然界付出嘅努力殊不簡單

English: It exists in many layers, ecosystems, species and genes across many scales -- international, national, local, community -- and doing for nature what Lord Stern and his team did for nature is not that easy.
Chinese: 而我哋開始咗第一步

English: And yet, we began.
Chinese: 個計劃由一份中期報告開始 喺短時間之內綜合咗 大量由研究員搜集返嚟 關於呢個課題嘅資料

English: We began the project with an interim report, which quickly pulled together a lot of information that had been collected on the subject by many, many researchers.
Chinese: 而喺我哋編輯嘅結果之中 有一個驚人嘅發現 就係其實我哋損失緊自然資源 即係從大自然畀我哋嘅恩賜縮細緊

English: And amongst our compiled results was the startling revelation that, in fact, we were losing natural capital -- the benefits that flow from nature to us.
Chinese: 原來我哋以驚人嘅速度消耗嘅自然資源 價值高達 2 至 4 萬億美元

English: We were losing it at an extraordinary rate -- in fact, of the order of two to four trillion dollars-worth of natural capital.
Chinese: 報告喺 2008 年發表 亦即係金融海嘯嘅時候 當時市場已經虧損達 2.5 萬億美元

English: This came out in 2008, which was, of course, around the time that the banking crisis had shown that we had lost financial capital of the order of two and a half trillion dollars.
Chinese: 自然資源損耗嘅規模亦達到同一規模

English: So this was comparable in size to that kind of loss.
Chinese: 於是我哋開始 為國際社會 為各個政府 為本地政府同商界 為全球人類，為你同我 喺去年喺聯合國 針對大自然嘅無形性經濟同解決方法 發表咗呢堆報告

English: We then have gone on since to present for [the] international community, for governments, for local governments and for business and for people, for you and me, a whole slew of reports, which were presented at the U.N. last year, which address the economic invisibility of nature and describe what can be done to solve it.
Chinese: 究竟係咩呢？

English: What is this about?
Chinese: 一幅大家好熟悉嘅圖片 亞馬遜雨林

English: A picture that you're familiar with -- the Amazon rainforests.
Chinese: 佢係一個巨大嘅碳庫存 一個擁有生物多樣性嘅庫存 但好多人都唔知 佢亦係一個雨水工廠

English: It's a massive store of carbon, it's an amazing store of biodiversity, but what people don't really know is this also is a rain factory.
Chinese: 因為當東北信風橫過亞馬遜嘅時候 會有效咁收集水氣

English: Because the northeastern trade winds, as they go over the Amazonas, effectively gather the water vapor.
Chinese: 每日大約二百億噸水氣被東北信風吸走 慢慢冷卻成雨水 落到拉普拉塔河盆

English: Something like 20 billion tons per day of water vapor is sucked up by the northeastern trade winds, and eventually precipitates in the form of rain across the La Plata Basin.
Chinese: 呢個降雨循環、呢個雨水工廠 有效咁孕育著 一個價值達 2,400 千億美元 位處拉丁美洲嘅農業經濟

English: This rainfall cycle, this rainfall factory, effectively feeds an agricultural economy of the order of 240 billion dollars-worth in Latin America.
Chinese: 但有一個問題 究竟烏拉圭、巴拉圭、阿根廷 仲有巴西嘅馬托格羅索州 為呢個咁重要嘅經濟來源 或者為亞馬遜生產雨水畀咗幾多錢呢？

English: But the question arises: Okay, so how much do Uruguay, Paraguay, Argentina and indeed the state of Mato Grosso in Brazil pay for that vital input to that economy to the state of Amazonas, which produces that rainfall?
Chinese: 答案係冇 係零

English: And the answer is zilch, exactly zero.
Chinese: 呢個就係大自然嘅無形性經濟

English: That's the economic invisibility of nature.
Chinese: 呢個情況唔可以持續落去 因為經濟誘因同經濟不利因素好強大

English: That can't keep going on, because economic incentives and disincentives are very powerful.
Chinese: 經濟已經成為政策嘅籌碼

English: Economics has become the currency of policy.
Chinese: 除非我哋正視呢個無形性經濟 否則我哋會面對一如所料嘅後果 目送珍貴嘅天然財產逐漸惡化同消失

English: And unless we address this invisibility, we are going to get the results that we are seeing, which is a gradual degradation and loss of this valuable natural asset.
Chinese: 呢個唔單止關係到亞馬遜同雨林

English: It's not just about the Amazonas, or indeed about rainforests.
Chinese: 無論邊個層面 無論係生態系統、物種定係基因層面 呢個問題都係存在

English: No matter what level you look at, whether it's at the ecosystem level or at the species level or at the genetic level, we see the same problem again and again.
Chinese: 雨林嘅雨水循環同水調節 係屬於生態系統層

English: So rainfall cycle and water regulation by rainforests at an ecosystem level.
Chinese: 喺物種層 有人估計過昆蟲傳播花粉 蜜蜂為果實授粉等等 價值約為 1,900 億美元

English: At the species level, it's been estimated that insect-based pollination, bees pollinating fruit and so on, is something like 190 billion dollars-worth.
Chinese: 呢個差不多相當於 全球總農產量百分之 8

English: That's something like eight percent of the total agricultural output globally.
Chinese: 但我哋完全忽略咗呢點

English: It completely passes below the radar screen.
Chinese: 但蜜蜂幾時有開過張發票畀我哋？

English: But when did a bee actually ever give you an invoice?
Chinese: 或者，從基因層面睇嘅話 六成藥物都係從雨林或暗礁中提煉出嚟

English: Or for that matter, if you look at the genetic level, 60 percent of medicines were prospected, were found first as molecules in a rainforest or a reef.
Chinese: 同樣人類唔洗一分一毫就得到

English: Once again, most of that doesn't get paid.
Chinese: 呢樣帶我去問題嘅另一面 就係應該邊個收錢？

English: And that brings me to another aspect of this, which is, to whom should this get paid?
Chinese: 呢啲基因物質如果屬於任何人嘅話 大概屬於貧窮社區嘅人 佢哋嘅知識幫研究員搵到化學分子 令化學分子最終成為藥物

English: That genetic material probably belonged, if it could belong to anyone, to a local community of poor people who parted with the knowledge that helped the researchers to find the molecule, which then became the medicine.
Chinese: 但現實佢哋一無所得

English: They were the ones that didn't get paid.
Chinese: 如果你睇下物種層次 你見到魚類

English: And if you look at the species level, you saw about fish.
Chinese: 今日，海洋漁產嘅損耗非常顯著 迅速危及窮人、漁民嘅生計

English: Today, the depletion of ocean fisheries is so significant that effectively it is effecting the ability of the poor, the artisanal fisher folk and those who fish for their own livelihoods, to feed their families.
Chinese: 全球大約 10 億人依賴海裏邊嘅魚為生

English: Something like a billion people depend on fish, the quantity of fish in the oceans.
Chinese: 10 億人依賴魚類 作為動物蛋白質嘅主要來源

English: A billion people depend on fish for their main source for animal protein.
Chinese: 目前魚類損耗速度係一個巨大嘅人禍 會造成一個前所未有嘅健康問題

English: And at this rate at which we are losing fish, it is a human problem of enormous dimensions, a health problem of a kind we haven't seen before.
Chinese: 最後，喺生態系統層面 無論講緊樹林嘅防洪或者防旱功能 以至貧困嘅農民外出收集枯枝落葉 供家畜家畜用 或者佢哋嘅妻子去樹林執柴 到最後窮人係最依賴生態系統嘅一班人

English: And finally, at the ecosystem level, whether it's flood prevention or drought control provided by the forests, or whether it is the ability of poor farmers to go out and gather leaf litter for their cattle and goats, or whether it's the ability of their wives to go and collect fuel wood from the forest, it is actually the poor who depend most on these ecosystem services.
Chinese: 我哋研究估計 喺巴西、印度、印尼等國家 縱使生態系統服務 呢類從大自然免費流到人類嘅資源 或者佔國內生產總值百分比唔多 由百分之 2 到 15 不等 但係如果呢啲國家計埋大自然資源 對貧窮人口嘅價值 得出嘅數字係佔國內生產總值 百分之 45、75 甚至 90

English: We did estimates in our study that for countries like Brazil, India and Indonesia, even though ecosystem services -- these benefits that flow from nature to humanity for free -- they're not very big in percentage terms of GDP -- two, four, eight, 10, 15 percent -- but in these countries, if we measure how much they're worth to the poor, the answers are more like 45 percent, 75 percent, 90 percent.
Chinese: 差異就係呢度

English: That's the difference.
Chinese: 因為佢哋對貧窮嘅人嚟講好重要

English: Because these are important benefits for the poor.
Chinese: 如果你破壞呢個珍貴資源 亦即係生態系統 或者任由佢惡化 你就唔可以指望有正常嘅發展模式

English: And you can't really have a proper model for development if at the same time you're destroying or allowing the degradation of the very asset, the most important asset, which is your development asset, that is ecological infrastructure.
Chinese: 情況將會有幾壞？

English: How bad can things get?
Chinese: 呢度有張叫做平均物種豐度度嘅圖片

English: Well here a picture of something called the mean species abundance.
Chinese: 基本上量度老虎、蟾蜍、壁蝨 諸如此類嘅數量 又或者計唔同物種嘅生物質

English: It's basically a measure of how many tigers, toads, ticks or whatever on average of biomass of various species are around.
Chinese: 綠色部分代表百分比

English: The green represents the percentage.
Chinese: 先睇綠色嘅話 呢度大概有百分之 80 至 100

English: If you start green, it's like 80 to 100 percent.
Chinese: 再睇黃色，就有百分之 40 至 60

English: If it's yellow, it's 40 to 60 percent.
Chinese: 呢個係對比原有數量嘅百分比 即係工業化前，1750年

English: And these are percentages versus the original state, so to speak, the pre-industrial era, 1750.
Chinese: 而家我會畀大家睇 目前情況不變會造成咩後果

English: Now I'm going to show you how business as usual will affect this.
Chinese: 只需要留意印度、中國、歐洲 同非洲撒哈拉以南嘅顏色改變 我哋以不可持續嘅速度消耗全球生物質

English: And just watch the change in colors in India, China, Europe, sub-Saharan Africa as we move on and consume global biomass at a rate which is actually not going to be able to sustain us.
Chinese: 再睇

English: See that again.
Chinese: 僅存綠色嘅地方，好遺憾 只係類似戈壁沙漠嘅地方 譬如苔原同撒哈拉

English: The only places that remain green -- and that's not good news -- is, in fact, places like the Gobi Desert, like the tundra and like the Sahara.
Chinese: 不過無用，因為呢啲地方物種好少 生物量又唔多

English: But that doesn't help because there were very few species and volume of biomass there in the first place.
Chinese: 呢個就係挑戰所在

English: This is the challenge.
Chinese: 之所以有轉變，歸根究底 我認為係一個基本問題 我哋忽視咗公共利益同私人利益嘅差別

English: The reason this is happening boils down, in my mind, to one basic problem, which is our inability to perceive the difference between public benefits and private profits.
Chinese: 我哋一向漠視公共財富 純粹因為大家覺得係公共嘅 所以就冇理

English: We tend to constantly ignore public wealth simply because it is in the common wealth, it's common goods.
Chinese: 泰國有一個例子 由於嗰度紅樹林價值唔高 以佢哋九年生命大概值 600 美元 相比作為養蝦場嘅價值 約莫係 9,600 美元 啲人就將紅樹林改為養蝦場 紅樹林就係咁逐漸絕跡

English: And here's an example from Thailand where we found that, because the value of a mangrove is not that much -- it's about $600 over the life of nine years that this has been measured -- compared to its value as a shrimp farm, which is more like $9,600, there has been a gradual trend to deplete the mangroves and convert them to shrimp farms.
Chinese: 如果仔細睇下得出嚟 嗰 9,000 美元嘅獲利 當中接近 8,000 美元其實都係補貼

English: But of course, if you look at exactly what those profits are, almost 8,000 of those dollars are, in fact, subsidies.
Chinese: 所以權衡利弊嘅時候 就會發現實際利潤分別係 1,200 美元同 600 美元

English: So you compare the two sides of the coin and you find that it's more like 1,200 to 600.
Chinese: 咁樣唔難明白

English: That's not that hard.
Chinese: 另外 如果計算將養蝦場嘅土地恢復生產用途 代價將會係幾多？

English: But on the other hand, if you start measuring, how much would it actually cost to restore the land of the shrimp farm back to productive use?
Chinese: 一旦土地裏邊嘅鹽同化學起咗作用 恢復成本大概係 12,000 美元

English: Once salt deposition and chemical deposition has had its effects, that answer is more like $12,000 of cost.
Chinese: 但保留紅樹林嘅好處 包括抵禦風暴、颱風同為窮人提供漁獲 價值有成 11,000 美元

English: And if you see the benefits of the mangrove in terms of the storm protection and cyclone protection that you get and in terms of the fisheries, the fish nurseries, that provide fish for the poor, that answer is more like $11,000.
Chinese: 試下從另一角度去睇

English: So now look at the different lens.
Chinese: 如果從公共財富出發 而非私人利益 我哋會得到一個好唔同嘅答案︰ 就係好明顯，保育比破壞更加合理

English: If you look at the lens of public wealth as against the lens of private profits, you get a completely different answer, which is clearly conservation makes more sense, and not destruction.
Chinese: 但呢個係咪只係泰國南部嘅情況？

English: So is this just a story from South Thailand?
Chinese: 唔係，呢個係全世界嘅狀況

English: Sorry, this is a global story.
Chinese: 以同一條數計…… 過去十年有一個組織 TRUCOST 以同一條數計

English: And here's what the same calculation looks like, which was done recently -- well I say recently, over the last 10 years -- by a group called TRUCOST.
Chinese: 佢哋為最頂尖 3,000 家公司 計經濟外部性

English: And they calculated for the top 3,000 corporations, what are the externalities?
Chinese: 換句話說 如果照正常營商，成本係幾多？

English: In other words, what are the costs of doing business as usual?
Chinese: 呢度唔係指非法勾當 而係講一般營商會排放氣體、改變氣候

English: This is not illegal stuff, this is basically business as usual, which causes climate-changing emissions, which have an economic cost.
Chinese: 因此一般營商會附帶著經濟成本 一般營商會放出污染物 所以附帶著經濟成本、健康成本等等

English: It causes pollutants being issued, which have an economic cost, health cost and so on.
Chinese: 至於淡水利用

English: Use of freshwater.
Chinese: 如果你喺鄉村耕地旁邊 鑽鑿水源去煉焦炭 雖然無違法，但的確賠上社區

English: If you drill water to make coke near a village farm, that's not illegal, but yes, it costs the community.
Chinese: 我哋可以阻止嗎？點樣阻止？

English: Can we stop this, and how?
Chinese: 我認為第一件事係需要認識自然資源

English: I think the first point to make is that we need to recognize natural capital.
Chinese: 簡單講生物就係自然資源 我哋需要認識自然資源 同埋將佢擺入我哋嘅模式入面

English: Basically the stuff of life is natural capital, and we need to recognize and build that into our systems.
Chinese: 當量度國民生產總值 呢個作為國家經濟表現嘅指標時 我哋並無包括最珍貴嘅自然界資源

English: When we measure GDP as a measure of economic performance at the national level, we don't include our biggest asset at the country level.
Chinese: 當我哋睇公司業績 我哋亦無包括公司對大自然嘅影響 以及營商帶嚟嘅社會代價

English: When we measure corporate performances, we don't include our impacts on nature and what our business costs society.
Chinese: 咁嘅計算方法一定要停用

English: That has to stop.
Chinese: 呢個亦係我目前最有興趣嘅嘢

English: In fact, this was what really inspired my interest in this phase.
Chinese: 之前我搞咗一個綠色審計計劃

English: I began a project way back called the Green Accounting Project.
Chinese: 大約喺 2000 年代初 當時印度一心想 令國內生產總值呯呯聲咁上 藉此推動發展 同時眼看著中國 有百分之 8 至 10 嘅增長 佢哋問，點解我哋做唔到？

English: That was in the early 2000s when India was going gung-ho about GDP growth as the means forward -- looking at China with its stellar growths of eight, nine, 10 percent and wondering, why can we do the same?
Chinese: 我同幾個朋友都覺得成件事唔合理

English: And a few friends of mine and I decided this doesn't make sense.
Chinese: 認為追上國內生產總值 只會為社會帶嚟更多代價同損失

English: This is going to create more cost to society and more losses.
Chinese: 於是我哋決定做大規模審計 為印度同佢各個邦做綠色審計

English: So we decided to do a massive set of calculations and started producing green accounts for India and its states.
Chinese: 我嘅興趣就係咁樣開始 後來演變成 TEEB 計劃

English: That's how my interests began and went to the TEEB project.
Chinese: 終於，可以喺國家層面 審計呢種綠色帳單！

English: Calculating this at the national level is one thing, and it has begun.
Chinese: 而世界銀行亦確認咗呢個計畫 開展名為 WAVES 嘅計劃 全名叫生態系統價值審計及估值計劃

English: And the World Bank has acknowledged this and they've started a project called WAVES -- Wealth Accounting and Valuation of Ecosystem Services.
Chinese: 但審計生態層對上嘅商界層面都重要嘅

English: But calculating this at the next level, that means at the business sector level, is important.
Chinese: 事實上我哋亦都喺 TEEB 計劃裏邊做過

English: And actually we've done this with the TEEB project.
Chinese: 我哋做咗一個好棘手嘅個案︰ 中國嘅伐林問題

English: We've done this for a very difficult case, which was for deforestation in China.
Chinese: 呢個問題係重要嘅 因為中國喺 1997 年 黃河足足乾涸咗九個月 造成農業嚴重損失 對社會帶嚟損失同禍害

English: This is important, because in China in 1997, the Yellow River actually went dry for nine months causing severe loss of agriculture output and pain and loss to society.
Chinese: 一年後長江泛濫 造成差唔多 5,500 人死亡

English: Just a year later the Yangtze flooded, causing something like 5,500 deaths.
Chinese: 好明顯，伐林就係問題根源

English: So clearly there was a problem with deforestation.
Chinese: 伐林好大程度上同建造業有關

English: It was associated largely with the construction industry.
Chinese: 之後中國政府明智作出回應 禁止咗砍伐林木

English: And the Chinese government responded sensibly and placed a ban on felling.
Chinese: 回顧 40 年 如果當初我哋有計埋呢啲大自然成本 包括表土流失、水道乾涸 同生產力損失 因為上述原因以及伐木等等 對本地社區造成嘅損失 呢啲成本幾乎係 木材市價嘅兩倍

English: A retrospective on 40 years shows that if we had accounted for these costs -- the cost of loss of topsoil, the cost of loss of waterways, the lost productivity, the loss to local communities as a result of all these factors, desertification and so on -- those costs are almost twice as much as the market price of timber.
Chinese: 北京市場上嘅木材價格 理應因此上漲到三倍 以反映中國社會付出嘅天然代價

English: So in fact, the price of timber in the Beijing marketplace ought to have been three-times what it was had it reflected the true pain and the costs to the society within China.
Chinese: 當然，經一事長一智

English: Of course, after the event one can be wise.
Chinese: 應對嘅辦法就係喺公司嘅層面做 並且由公司帶頭做起 盡可能為包含自然成本嘅界別審計 同埋披露當中嘅自然成本

English: The way to do this is to do it on a company basis, to take leadership forward, and to do it for as many important sectors which have a cost, and to disclose these answers.
Chinese: 有人曾經問我 若果考慮對印尼雨林嘅影響 聯合利華定係寶潔比較傷害低？

English: Someone once asked me, "Who is better or worse, is it Unilever or is it P&G when it comes to their impact on rainforests in Indonesia?"
Chinese: 我唔識答，因為呢兩家公司雖然好專業 但都無計算或披露過經濟外部性

English: And I couldn't answer because neither of these companies, good though they are and professional though they are, do not calculate or disclose their externalities.
Chinese: 如果我哋睇下彪馬等嘅公司 佢哋嘅行政總裁兼董事長 Jochen Zeitz 曾經喺一個活動同我講 佢會比我更加早落實個計劃

English: But if we look at companies like PUMA -- Jochen Zeitz, their CEO and chairman, once challenged me at a function, saying that he's going to implement my project before I finish it.
Chinese: 我哋大概同期落實咗個計劃 而佢真係有做

English: Well I think we kind of did it at the same time, but he's done it.
Chinese: 佢基本上為彪馬計算自然成本

English: He's basically worked the cost to PUMA.
Chinese: 彪馬有 27 億美元營業額 有 3 億美元利潤 除稅後有 2 億美元 同埋有 9,400 萬美元 經濟外部性同營商成本

English: PUMA has 2.7 billion dollars of turnover, 300 million dollars of profits, 200 million dollars after tax, 94 million dollars of externalities, cost to business.
Chinese: 情况雖然不利 但佢哋有信心同勇氣講︰ 「我哋計緊呢樣嘢呀，

English: Now that's not a happy situation for them, but they have the confidence and the courage to come forward and say, "Here's what we are measuring.
Chinese: 因為我哋深知， 唔去計永遠都管理唔到。」

English: We are measuring it because we know that you cannot manage what you do not measure."
Chinese: 呢個例子，可以作為大家示範

English: That's an example, I think, for us to look at and for us to draw comfort from.
Chinese: 亦令我哋感到安慰 如果更多公司都願意做 如果更多界別參與 分析員、企業分析員 好似我哋咁嘅人、消費者 或者非牟利組織 去審視同比較企業嘅社會表現

English: If more companies did this, and if more sectors engaged this as sectors, you could have analysts, business analysts, and you could have people like us and consumers and NGOs actually look and compare the social performance of companies.
Chinese: 雖然未成事，但已經有例可循

English: Today we can't yet do that, but I think the path is laid out.
Chinese: 係可以做到嘅！

English: This can be done.
Chinese: 我好慶幸英國特許會計師公會

English: And I'm delighted that the Institute of Chartered Accountants in the U.K.
Chinese: 已經成立一個國際聯盟進行計算工作

English: has already set up a coalition to do this, an international coalition.
Chinese: 另一個我喜歡嘅方法 就係創造綠色碳市場

English: The other favorite, if you like, solution for me is the creation of green carbon markets.
Chinese: 講開又講，我真係好鐘意 經濟外部性嘅計數同綠色碳市場

English: And by the way, these are my favorites -- externalities calculation and green carbon markets.
Chinese: TEEB 有超過 12 組不同方案 包括評估保護區、為生態系統服務結算 同埋生態驗證

English: TEEB has more than a dozen separate groups of solutions including protected area evaluation and payments for ecosystem services and eco-certification and you name it, but these are the favorites.
Chinese: 而上述呢三樣係我最鐘意嘅 咁咩係綠色碳？

English: What's green carbon?
Chinese: 而家我哋有嘅係啡色碳市場

English: Today what we have is basically a brown carbon marketplace.
Chinese: 呢個市場不斷排放二氧化碳

English: It's about energy emissions.
Chinese: 歐盟排放交易體系就係其中主要市場

English: The European Union ETS is the main marketplace.
Chinese: 由於發行過度，呢個體系表現唔理想

English: It's not doing too well. We've over-issued.
Chinese: 有啲似通脹：你大量發鈔 然後一如所料，價格下降

English: A bit like inflation: you over-issue currency, you get what you see, declining prices.
Chinese: 呢啲全都同能源、工業有關

English: But that's all about energy and industry.
Chinese: 但我哋忽略咗其他排放 例如黑色碳，即係煤煙

English: But what we're missing is also some other emissions like black carbon, that is soot.
Chinese: 我哋亦忽略咗藍色碳 即係最大嘅碳庫存 佔總碳庫存超過百分之 55

English: What we're also missing is blue carbon, which, by the way, is the largest store of carbon -- more than 55 percent.
Chinese: 所謂藍色碳 係指海洋同大氣層之間嘅流動 好欣慰，藍色碳差不多係收支平衡

English: Thankfully, the flux, in other words, the flow of emissions from the ocean to the atmosphere and vice versa, is more or less balanced.
Chinese: 事實上，海洋吸收嘅 大約係我哋排放嘅四分一 吸收會導致海洋酸化 或者鹼度下降

English: In fact, what's being absorbed is something like 25 percent of our emissions, which then leads to acidification or lower alkalinity in oceans.

English: While I was pondering this question, I came across this urban legend about Ernest Hemingway, who allegedly said that these six words here: "For sale: baby shoes, never worn," were the best novel he had ever written.
Chinese: 我仲見過一個「六字傳記」計劃 所有人都用六個英文字總結佢哋嘅生平 譬如： 「搵到真愛，卻同另一個結緍。」

English: And I also encountered a project called Six-Word Memoirs where people were asked, take your whole life and please sum this up into six words, such as these here: "Found true love, married someone else."
Chinese: 「生活空虛，好弊。」

English: Or "Living in existential vacuum; it sucks."
Chinese: ——我好鐘意第二個

English: I actually like that one.
Chinese: 如果一篇小說可以濃縮成六個英文字 人嘅一生可以用六個英文字黎總結 咁一個演講都只需要六個英文字

English: So if a novel can be put into six words and a whole memoir can be put into six words, you don't need more than six words for a TED Talk.
Chinese: 中午飯之前就可以聽曬 今日所有演講喇！

English: We could have been done by lunch here.
Chinese: （笑聲） 如果將所有演講進行濃縮 就可以由 230 萬英文字減到 6,000

English: (Laughter) And if you did this for all thousand TED Talks, you would get from 2.3 million words down to 6,000.
Chinese: 我覺得幾好啊

English: So I thought this was quite worthwhile.
Chinese: 然後我就開始嗌我所有嘅朋友 用六個英文字總結佢哋最鐘意嘅演講

English: So I started asking all my friends, please take your favorite TED Talk and put that into six words.
Chinese: 依啲就係其中一啲例子，我覺得都幾好

English: So here are some of the results that I received.
Chinese: 譬如話 Dan Pink 關於動機嘅演講︰ 「唔要紅蘿蔔，唔要棍，淨係要意義。」

English: I think they're quite nice.
Chinese: 佢講得幾好，未睇過嘅快啲去睇下 依三句基本上就係佢十八分半鐘講嘅嘢

English: For example, Dan Pink's talk on motivation, which was pretty good, if you haven't seen it: "Drop carrot. Drop stick. Bring meaning."
Chinese: 仲有人直接引用演講者嘅說話

English: It's what he's basically talking about in those 18,5 minutes.
Chinese: 例如 Nathan Myhrvold 嘅風格演講 同埋 Tim Ferriss 嘅演講 Tim Ferriss 嘅演講有時比較激動 宜家嘅問題係 如果我想有系統咁總結啲演講

English: Or some even included references to the speakers, such as Nathan Myhrvold's speaking style, or the one of Tim Ferriss, which might be considered a bit strenuous at times.
Chinese: 我應該會有好多概要 不過會有好多敵人 所以我需要一個新方法

English: The challenge here is, if I try to systematically do this, I would probably end up with a lot of summaries, but not with many friends in the end.
Chinese: 最好係只需要陌生人嘅

English: So I had to find a different method, preferably involving total strangers.
Chinese: 好好彩，有一個叫做 Mechanical Turk 嘅網站 你可以喺上邊發佈你唔想自己做嘅嘢 譬如話「唔該幫我用三個英文字 總結依篇文章」

English: And luckily, there's a website for that, called Mechanical Turk, which is a website where you can post tasks that you don't want to do yourself, such as "Please summarize this text for me in six words."
Chinese: 我無通過任何低成本國家 嚟完成依個任務 不過我發現我淨係需要用 10 美分 我覺得好鬼平

English: And I didn't allow any low-cost countries to work on this, but I found out I could get a six-word summary for just 10 cents, which I think is a pretty good price.
Chinese: 但係就算係咁 都無可能逐個濃縮曬所有演講

English: Even then, unfortunately, it's not possible to summarize each TED Talk individually.
Chinese: 因為如果你計下，有一千個演講 一個演講 10 美分 一個演講需要至少寫兩個概要 因為買返嚟嘅概要有可能質素好差

English: Because if you do the math, you have a thousand TED Talks, you pay 10 cents each; you have to do more than one summary for each of those talks, because some of them will probably be, or are, really bad.
Chinese: 結果就會變成我要畀幾百蚊美金

English: So I would end up paying hundreds of dollars.
Chinese: 所以我又諗到個新方法 我就諗所有演講都係關於 幾個固定嘅話題

English: So I thought of a different way, by thinking, well, the talks revolve around certain themes.
Chinese: 如果我唔使人逐個總結 而係一次過畀佢哋 10 個演講 然後要佢哋用六個英文字 總結依 10 個演講

English: So what if I don't let people summarize individual TED Talks to six words, but give them 10 TED Talks at the same time and say, "Please do a six-word summary for that one."
Chinese: 我就可以將成本減少百分之九十

English: I would cut my costs by 90 percent.
Chinese: 用 60 蚊美金 我就可以將一千個演講 濃縮成 600 個概要 幾好啊！

English: So for $60, I could summarize a thousand TED Talks into just 600 summaries, which would actually be quite nice.
Chinese: 你哋可能會覺得 10 個演講變成 6 個英文字 根本無可能

English: Some of you might actually right now be thinking, it's downright crazy to have 10 TED Talks summarized into just six words.
Chinese: 事實係有可能嘅 統計學教授 Hans Rosling 嘅例子 可以證明

English: But it's actually not, because there's an example by statistics professor Hans Rosling.
Chinese: ——我諗你哋都睇過佢嘅演講

English: I guess many of you have seen one or more of his talks.
Chinese: 佢喺網上有 8 個演講 全部基本上可以用一句話嚟總結 所有演講都係想話我哋知︰ 「我哋嘅直覺一啲都唔準。

English: He's got eight talks online, and those can basically be summed up into just four words, because that's all he's basically showing us, our intuition is really bad.
Chinese: 佢次次都證明我哋係錯嘅。」

English: He always proves us wrong.
Chinese: 講返網上請嘅人 佢哋做出嚟嘅嘢唔係太好

English: So people on the Internet, some didn't do so well.
Chinese: 當我嗌佢哋將 10 個演講 縮成 6 個英文字嘅時候 有啲人就偷懶喇！ 佢哋都畀啲好行嘅嘢

English: And when I asked them to summarize the 10 TED Talks at the same time, some took the easy route out.
Chinese: 有哋仲好無恥用六個英文字駁返我 問我最近係咪沉迷於網絡搜尋

English: There were others -- and I found this quite cheeky -- They used their six words to talk back to me and ask me if I'd been too much on Google lately.
Chinese: 我諗唔明點解有人會咁做 有人甚至憑空作個總結出嚟

English: (Laughter) And finally also, I never understood this, some people really came up with their own version of the truth.
Chinese: 我唔知啲演講係咪真係有依啲內容

English: I don't know any TED Talk that contains this.
Chinese: 不過 結果真係好令人驚奇

English: But, oh well.
Chinese: 所有我請求嘅演講批次 都得到好多有意義嘅概要

English: In the end, however, and this is really amazing, for each of those 10 TED Talk clusters that I submitted, I actually received meaningful summaries.
Chinese: 依啲係我比較鐘意嘅

English: Here are some of my favorites.
Chinese: 例如所有關於食物嘅演講 有人總結成： 「食物塑造身體、大腦同環境」 我覺得唔錯 關於幸福感嘅：

English: For example, for the TED Talks about food, someone summed this up into: "Food shaping body, brains and environment," which I think is pretty good.
Chinese: 「努力得到幸福等如邁向不幸。」

English: Or happiness: "Striving toward happiness = moving toward unhappiness."
Chinese: 到依度 我係由一千個演講開始 濃縮到 600 組六個英文字概要

English: So here I was.
Chinese: 聽落幾好 但係當你望住依 600 個概要 其實都幾多

English: Actually, it sounded nice in the beginning, but when you look at 600 summaries, it's quite a lot, it's a huge list.
Chinese: 然後我就諗，或者可以再濃縮 製造一個概要嘅概要 ——我的確做咗依件事

English: (Laughter) So I thought, I probably have to take this one step further here and create summaries of the summaries, and this is exactly what I did.
Chinese: 我將依 600 個概要 根據網上評分分成 9 組 然後搵人將佢哋濃縮

English: So I took the 600 summaries that I had, put them into nine groups according to the ratings that the talks had originally received on TED.com and asked people to do summaries of those.
Chinese: 今次又有誤解喇！

English: Again, there were some misunderstandings.
Chinese: 有人以為我想喺依啲咁精彩嘅演講入邊 搵一句好易上口嘅口號

English: For example, when I had a cluster of all the "Beautiful" talks, someone thought I was just trying to find the ultimate pick-up line.
Chinese: 不過令我驚訝嘅係 再一次，我請嘅人都做到嘢

English: But in the end, amazingly, again, people were able to do it.
Chinese: 例如所有有關膽量嘅演講 總結成「人亡」或者「人受難」 或者「總有簡單嘅解決方法」

English: For example, all the courageous TED Talks: "People dying" or "People suffering" was also one, "with easy solutions around."
Chinese: 仲有個令人詫異嘅演講總結成： 「星際古典樂作曲家嘅相。」

English: Or the recipe for the ultimate jaw-dropping TED Talk: "Flickr photos of intergalactic classical composer."
Chinese: 依嗰就係精粹所在

English: I mean that's the essence of it all.
Chinese: 宜家我有 9 組非常概要

English: Now I had my nine groups, but, I mean, it's already quite a reduction.
Chinese: 但係當你做得越耐，你就越唔滿足

English: But of course, once you are that far, you're not really satisfied.
Chinese: 就好似精餾釀酒一樣 你想得到最精餾嘅 所以我由一千個演講開始

English: I wanted to go all the way, all the way down the distillery, starting out with a thousand TED Talks.
Chinese: 我想將一千個演講濃縮成六個英文字 百分之 99.9997 嘅縮減率

English: I wanted to have a thousand TED Talks summarized into just six words -- which would be a 99.9997 percent reduction in content.
Chinese: 不過我凈係畀咗 99.5 美金 總經費少於一百美金

English: And I would only pay $99.50 -- so stay even below $100 for it.
Chinese: 今次一共有 50 個概要

English: So I had 50 overall summaries done.
Chinese: 25 美分一篇 因為我諗著今次難啲，所以費用會多啲

English: This time I paid 25 cents because I thought the task was a bit harder.
Chinese: 但不幸，我最初收到嘅結果 其中六個令我有啲失望

English: And unfortunately, when I first received the answers -- and here, you'll see six of the answers -- I was a bit disappointed.
Chinese: 你哋應該會同意 佢哋都總結咗 TED 嘅某啲方面 但係感覺佢哋有啲平淡 有或者佢哋都分別總結咗 TED 嘅一個方面

English: Because I think you'll agree, they all summarize some aspect of TED, but to me, they felt a bit bland, or they just had a certain aspect of TED in them.
Chinese: 然後我差唔多要放棄喇！ 直到有一晚，我開始組合依啲字 結果發現咗一個好好嘅方法

English: So I was almost ready to give up when one night, I played around with these sentences and found out that there's actually a beautiful solution in here.
Chinese: 依個就係 通過眾籌力量、價值 99.5 美金嘅 一千演講六個英文字概要： Why the worry? I'd rather wonder （譯︰憂乜鬼？噢就算）

English: So here it is, a crowd-sourced, six-word summary of a thousand TED Talks at the value of $99.50: "Why the worry? I'd rather wonder."
Chinese: 多謝

English: Thank you very much.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: (Applause)

Chinese: 我哋唔會投資喺受害者身上 我哋投資喺生還者身上

English: We do not invest in victims, we invest in survivors.
Chinese: 無論受害者嘅故事係點 始終影響我哋對女性嘅睇法 只不過影響可以係大或者細咁解

English: And in ways both big and small, the narrative of the victim shapes the way we see women.
Chinese: 我哋唔會相信未見過嘅嘢

English: You can't count what you don't see.
Chinese: 所以我哋唔會投資喺見唔到嘅嘢

English: And we don't invest in what's invisible to us.
Chinese: 但呢個就係對抗逆境嘅面孔

English: But this is the face of resilience.
Chinese: 六年前，我開始撰寫 關於女性企業家 面對逆境時同面對完逆境嘅報導

English: Six years ago, I started writing about women entrepreneurs during and after conflict.
Chinese: 我打算寫一個好鼓舞嘅經濟故事 一個背後有著勁人 但未為人所知 而應該受關注嘅故事

English: I set out to write a compelling economic story, one that had great characters, that no one else was telling, and one that I thought mattered.
Chinese: 而嗰啲勁人全部都係女性嚟

English: And that turned out to be women.
Chinese: 我三十歲時離開 美國廣播公司新聞部我鍾意嘅崗位 去咗讀商學院 一個我冇乜認識嘅方向

English: I had left ABC news and a career I loved at the age of 30 for business school, a path I knew almost nothing about.
Chinese: 喺馬利蘭州同我一齊成長嘅女性 無一個大學畢業 更遑論係商學院畢業

English: None of the women I had grown up with in Maryland had graduated from college, let alone considered business school.
Chinese: 佢哋為咗子女、屋租張羅 而喺出邊賺錢

English: But they had hustled to feed their kids and pay their rent.
Chinese: 從小我就睇到 一份可以帶嚟富足收入嘅工 對經濟上過得非常之艱難嘅家庭嚟講 可以帶嚟莫大轉變

English: And I saw from a young age that having a decent job and earning a good living made the biggest difference for families who were struggling.
Chinese: 講起工作 就先要講企業家

English: So if you're going to talk about jobs, then you have to talk about entrepreneurs.
Chinese: 而如果你講緊 逆境之中同經歷逆境之後嘅企業家 就不得不提女性 因為佢哋一向都被忽略

English: And if you're talking about entrepreneurs in conflict and post-conflict settings, then you must talk about women, because they are the population you have left.
Chinese: 盧旺達經歷完種族屠殺之後 有 77% 人口係女性

English: Rwanda in the immediate aftermath of the genocide was 77 percent female.
Chinese: 我想介紹我遇過嘅女性企業家 以及佢哋過去以嚟教我嘅嘢

English: I want to introduce you to some of those entrepreneurs I've met and share with you some of what they've taught me over the years.
Chinese: 2005 年我喺阿富汗 為《金融時報》做採訪 我喺當地認識咗 Kamila 一位啱啱拒絕咗 國際組織一份月薪接近二千美元嘅工 嘅年輕女子

English: I went to Afghanistan in 2005 to work on a Financial Times piece, and there I met Kamila, a young women who told me she had just turned down a job with the international community that would have paid her nearly $2,000 a month -- an astronomical sum in that context.
Chinese: 佢拒絕 係因為要開展佢嘅事業 向阿富汗人提供企業顧問服務 傳授營商技巧

English: And she had turned it down, she said, because she was going to start her next business, an entrepreneurship consultancy that would teach business skills to men and women all around Afghanistan.
Chinese: 佢認為商業發展對佢國家嘅前途好重要

English: Business, she said, was critical to her country's future.
Chinese: 因為各國撤出阿富汗之後 營商可以為國家帶嚟和平同安全

English: Because long after this round of internationals left, business would help keep her country peaceful and secure.
Chinese: 而且營商對女性尤為重要 因為有收入就令佢哋獲得尊重 對女性嚟講，金錢就等如權力

English: And she said business was even more important for women because earning an income earned respect and money was power for women.

English:
