English: (Applause)
Chinese: 仲有 30 億第一次接觸互聯網嘅人 嚟幫我哋解決艱鉅嘅難題 做我哋應該做嘅嘢
未來嘅黃金年代等緊我哋

English: This may sound strange, but I'm a big fan of the concrete block.
Chinese: 多謝

English: The first concrete blocks were manufactured in 1868 with a very simple idea: modules made of cement of a fixed measurement that fit together.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: Very quickly concrete blocks became the most-used construction unit in the world.
They enabled us to to build things that were larger than us, buildings, bridges, one brick at a time.
Chinese: 你哋可能會覺得好奇怪 但我實在太鍾意水泥磚喇

English: Essentially concrete blocks had become the building block of our time.
Chinese: 世界上第一嚿水泥磚喺 1868 年製造 當時生產水泥磚得一個要求： 就係要有固定嘅尺寸 因為咁樣先能夠磚搭磚

English: Almost a hundred years later in 1947, LEGO came up with this.
Chinese: 好快咁，水泥磚變成咗 世界上最常用嘅建築材料

English: It was called the Automatic Binding Brick.
Chinese: 我哋可以用佢嚟起建築物，例如屋、橋 一磚一磚咁建造

English: And in a few short years, LEGO bricks took place in every household.
Chinese: 水泥磚已經成為現今嘅建材

English: It's estimated that over 400 billion bricks have been produced -- or 75 bricks for every person on the planet.
Chinese: 大約一百年之後，喺 1947 年 樂高生產出呢個

English: You don't have to be an engineer to make beautiful houses, beautiful bridges, beautiful buildings.
Chinese: 佢哋稱為「自動組裝積木」嘅嘢

English: LEGO made it accessible.
Chinese: 短短幾年後 樂高積木成為咗每個家庭必備嘅玩具

English: LEGO has essentially taken the concrete block, the building block of the world, and made it into the building block of our imagination.
Chinese: 據估計，樂高生產咗超過四千億嚿積木 平均全球每個人有 75 嚿積木

English: Meanwhile the exact same year, at Bell Labs the next revolution was about to be announced, the next building block.
Chinese: 你唔需要係工程師 都可以起到靚屋、靚橋 或者其它好靚嘅建築

English: The transistor was a small plastic unit that would take us from a world of static bricks piled on top of each other to a world where everything was interactive.
Chinese: 樂高令你嘅想像變成實物

English: Like the concrete block, the transistor allows you to build much larger, more complex circuits, one brick at a time.
Chinese: 樂高運用水泥磚嘅概念 將佢轉化成發揮我哋想像力嘅積木

English: But there's a main difference: The transistor was only for experts.
Chinese: 喺同一年 貝爾實驗室準備發表 一個電路組件嘅革新︰電晶體

English: I personally don't accept this, that the building block of our time is reserved for experts, so I decided to change that.
Chinese: 電晶體係一樣塑膠製嘅電子元件 佢會帶領我哋進入一個 積木靜止堆埋一齊 但係積木之間會產生作用嘅世界

English: Eight years ago when I was at the Media Lab, I started exploring this idea of how to put the power of engineers in the hands of artists and designers.
Chinese: 雖然電晶體同水泥磚一樣 畀到你整更大、更複雜嘅電路

English: A few years ago I started developing littleBits.
Chinese: 但佢哋最大嘅差別係 電晶體係專門畀專家玩嘅

English: Let me show you how they work.
Chinese: 但我唔係好同意呢個講法 所以我想推翻呢個講法

English: LittleBits are electronic modules with each one specific function.
Chinese: 八年前我喺媒體實驗室 著手開發呢個計畫 就係點樣將工程師嘅技術 畀到藝術家同設計師用到？

English: They're pre-engineered to be light, sound, motors and sensors.
Chinese: 幾年前我開始研發 littleBits

English: And the best part about it is they snap together with magnets.
Chinese: 我畀你哋睇下佢點運作

English: So you can't put them the wrong way.
Chinese: littleBits 係電子元件 每一小嚿都有特定嘅功能

English: Green is output, blue is power, pink is input and orange is wire.
Chinese: 佢哋設計成會發光、發聲 有電動功能同感應功能

English: So all you need to do is snap a blue to a green and very quickly you can start making larger circuits.
Chinese: 而佢最好玩嘅部分就係 佢哋靠磁鐵連接埋一齊

English: You put a blue to a green, you can make light.
Chinese: 所以你唔會搞錯佢哋嘅方向

English: You can put a knob in between and now you've made a little dimmer.
Chinese: 佢哋用顏色嚟區分 綠色係輸出，藍色係電源 粉紅色係輸入，橙色係電線

English: Switch out the knob for a pulse module, which is here, and now you've made a little blinker.
Chinese: 只要將藍色同綠色連埋一齊 你就可以開始做啲大啲嘅電路

English: Add this buzzer for some extra punch and you've created a noise machine.
Chinese: 藍色同綠色接埋一齊，佢就會發光

English: So beyond simple play, littleBits are actually pretty powerful.
Chinese: 當你將旋鈕駁喺中間，你就可以較光暗

English: Instead of having to program, to wire, to solder, littleBits allow you to program using very simple intuitive gestures.
Chinese: 攞走旋鈕，換做脈衝元件 咁樣，你就可以整到閃光

English: So to make this blink faster or slower, you would just turn this knob and basically make it pulse faster or slower.
Chinese: 再加上一個聲音元件 咁你就整咗一個警報器

English: The idea behind littleBits is that it's a growing library.
Chinese: 不過佢好嘈呀 雖然呢啲示範睇落簡單 但 littleBits 其實好強大

English: We want to make every single interaction in the world into a ready-to-use brick.
Chinese: 要編寫 littleBits 我哋唔需要識寫程式 接電線或者焊接 只要做好簡單嘅直覺動作就得嘞

English: Lights, sounds, solar panels, motors -- everything should be accessible.
Chinese: 要令佢閃得快啲或慢啲 你只需要轉下呢個掣就可以

English: We've been giving littleBits to kids and seeing them play with them.
Chinese: littleBits 個構思係 佢係一個愈做愈大嘅知識庫

English: And it's been an incredible experience.
Chinese: 我哋都想呢一嚿現成嘅積木 做到各式各樣嘅功能︰

English: The nicest thing is how they start to understand the electronics around them from everyday that they don't learn at schools.
Chinese: 光、聲音、太陽能板、摩打等等

English: For example, how a nightlight works, or why an elevator door stays open, or how an iPod responds to touch.
Chinese: 我哋畀過小朋友玩 littleBits

English: We've also been taking littleBits to design schools.
Chinese: 呢個對小朋友嚟講真係好難得嘅體驗

English: So for example, we've had designers with no experience with electronics whatsoever start to play with littleBits as a material.
Chinese: 好處係佢哋開始了解 每日圍繞佢哋 而學校又唔會教嘅嘅電子設備

English: Here you see, with felt and paper water bottles, we have Geordie making ...
Chinese: 譬如一盞夜燈係點樣運作 或者電梯門點樣維持開住嘅狀態 又或者 iPod 嘅螢幕點樣對觸控有反應

English: (Clanging) (Buzzing) A few weeks ago we took littleBits to RISD and gave them to some designers with no experience in engineering whatsoever -- just cardboard, wood and paper -- and told them "Make something."
Chinese: 我哋都會將 littleBits 拎畀設計學校使用

English: Here's an example of a project they made, a motion-activated confetti canon ball.
Chinese: 我哋仲令到一啲 完全無電子相關經驗嘅設計師 開始將 littleBits 當成一種材料

English: (Laughter) But wait, this is actually my favorite project.
Chinese: 你睇，絨布同紙做嘅水瓶 喬迪整咗呢樣嘢⋯

English: It's a lobster made of playdough that's afraid of the dark.
Chinese: （鈴聲） （叭 ~ 叭叭） 幾個禮拜前我哋將 littleBits 帶到 羅德島設計學院 介紹畀一啲同樣 無工程學相關經驗嘅設計師玩 我哋畀啲硬紙板、木板同紙佢哋 等佢哋做啲嘢

English: (Laughter) To these non-engineers, littleBits became another material, electronics became just another material.
Chinese: 畀一樣佢哋整嘅嘢你哋睇 「天女散花加農砲」

English: And we want to make this material accessible to everyone.
Chinese: （笑聲） 但呢個真係我最鍾意嘅一個

English: So littleBits is open-source.
Chinese: 佢係用泥膠做嘅龍蝦 佢好怕黑

English: You can go on the website, download all the design files, make them yourself.
Chinese: （笑聲） 對唔係工程師嘅人嚟講 littleBits 成為咗另一種材料 電子零件變咗一種材料

English: We want to encourage a world of creators, of inventors, of contributors, because this world that we live in, this interactive world, is ours.
Chinese: 我哋希望呢種材料人人都用得到

English: So go ahead and start inventing.
Chinese: littleBits 係個共享資源

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 你可以去我哋嘅網站下載設計稿 自己郁手做

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 我哋想啟發創作者、發明家同貢獻者 因為我哋住嘅呢個互動嘅世界 係屬於我哋嘅
所以，我哋一齊開始發明喇！

English: Hi, my name is Frank, and I collect secrets.
Chinese: 多謝

English: It all started with a crazy idea in November of 2004.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: I printed up 3,000 self-addressed postcards, just like this.
They were blank on one side, and on the other side I listed some simple instructions.
Chinese: 大家好，我叫 Frank 我收集人哋嘅秘密

English: I asked people to anonymously share an artful secret they'd never told anyone before.
Chinese: 而一切都源於我 2004 年 11 月一個瘋狂嘅諗法

English: And I handed out these postcards randomly on the streets of Washington, D.C., not knowing what to expect.
Chinese: 我當時打印咗三千張 已經印好回郵地址嘅明信片 就好似呢張一樣咁

English: But soon the idea began spreading virally.
Chinese: 呢啲明信片一面係空白嘅 而另一面有啲簡單指引

English: People began to buy their own postcards and make their own postcards.
Chinese: 我叫每個人匿名寫上 一個佢哋從未話過俾人知嘅秘密

English: I started receiving secrets in my home mailbox, not just with postmarks from Washington, D.C., but from Texas, California, Vancouver, New Zealand, Iraq.
Chinese: 而我喺華盛頓街頭 隨機派發呢啲明信片 當時我都唔知結果會點

English: Soon my crazy idea didn't seem so crazy.
Chinese: 但無幾耐呢個主意非常快傳出去

English: PostSecret.com is the most visited advertisement-free blog in the world.
Chinese: 大家開始買同整自己嘅明信片

English: And this is my postcard collection today.
Chinese: 我開始喺我屋企信箱收到明信片 唔單只嚟自華盛頓 仲有德州、加州、溫哥華 紐西蘭、伊拉克呢啲地方

English: You can see my wife struggling to stack a brick of postcards on a pyramid of over a half-million secrets.
Chinese: 再過多一陣 我呢個瘋狂主意開始無咁瘋狂

English: What I'd like to do now is share with you a very special handful of secrets from that collection, starting with this one.
Chinese: PostSecret.com 係世界上 最多人訪問嘅零廣告博客

English:
I found these stamps as a child, and I have been waiting all my life to have someone to send them to. 
I never did have someone.
Chinese: 而呢個，就係我目前收集過嘅明信片

English: Secrets can take many forms.
Chinese: 你可以睇到我老婆 好努力咁將一磚明信片 放上一個有超過 50 萬 秘密明信片金字塔上

English: They can be shocking or silly or soulful.
Chinese: 而我宜家想做嘅事 係同你哋分享嗰啲明信片入邊 一啲非常特別嘅秘密 我哋從呢個開始啦

English: They can connect us to our deepest humanity or with people we'll never meet.
Chinese: 「我細個揾到呢啲郵票。 我等咗一世人， 去等我可以將郵票寄俾某個人。

English: (Laughter) Maybe one of you sent this one in.
Chinese: 而我一直都無等到呢個人。」

English: This one does a great job of demonstrating the creativity that people have when they make and mail me a postcard.
Chinese: 秘密有好多種形態

English: This one obviously was made out of half a Starbucks cup with a stamp and my home address written on the other side.

English:
Dear Birthmother, I have great parents.

English: Secrets can remind us of the countless human dramas, of frailty and heroism, playing out silently in the lives of people all around us even now.

English: Everyone who knew me before 9/11 believes I'm dead.

English: I used to work with a bunch of uptight religious people, so sometimes I didn't wear panties, and just had a big smile and chuckled to myself.
Chinese: 呢個好明顯用半個星巴克咖啡杯整 杯嘅另一面係一張郵票加我屋企地址

English: (Laughter) This next one takes a little explanation before I share it with you.
Chinese: 「親愛嘅生母，我有好好嘅養父母，

English: I love to speak on college campuses and share secrets and the stories with students.
Chinese: 我搵到愛，我非常開心。」

English: And sometimes afterwards I'll stick around and sign books and take photos with students.
Chinese: 秘密可以令我哋諗起 無數同脆弱或者英雄主義有關 而又無聲無色喺身邊發生嘅人生戲劇 即使係今時今日亦都一樣

English: And this next postcard was made out of one of those photos.
Chinese: 「所有喺九一一之前識得我嘅人， 都以為我死咗。」

English: And I should also mention that, just like today, at that PostSecret event, I was using a wireless microphone.
Chinese: 「我曾經同一班 好嚴謹嘅宗教人士一齊工作， 所以我有時會唔著底褲， 然後對自己偷笑。」

English:
Your mic wasn't off during sound check.

Chinese: （笑聲） 跟住呢個，喺分享之前需要講解少少

English: (Laughter) This was really embarrassing when it happened, until I realized it could have been worse.

English: Right. You know what I'm saying.

English: (Laughter) "Inside this envelope is the ripped up remains of a suicide note I didn't use.
Chinese: 跟住落嚟呢張明信片 就係從其中一張相製作而成

English: I feel like the happiest person on Earth (now.)" "One of these men is the father of my son.

English: He pays me a lot to keep it a secret."

English: It's in my pocket right now."

English: I had this postcard posted on the PostSecret blog two years ago on Valentine's Day.

English: It was the very bottom, the last secret in the long column.

English: He said, "My knees are still shaking."
Chinese: （笑聲） 「你估緊我去邊度嘅嗰個星期六， 其實我喺度買戒指俾你。

English: He said, "For three years, my girlfriend and I, we've made it this Sunday morning ritual to visit the PostSecret blog together and read the secrets out loud.

English: He says, "It's really brought us closer together through the years.

English: So I emailed him back and I said, "Please share with me an image, something, that I can share with the whole PostSecret community and let everyone know your fairy tale ending."

English: I finally got the pictures developed and I'd love to give them to you."
Chinese: 又讀多一次。」 然後女朋友轉身對住佢講 「唔係我哋嘅貓咩？」

English: This picture never got returned back to the people who lost it, but this secret has impacted many lives, starting with a student up in Canada named Matty.

Chinese: 最尾大團圓結局 所以我回覆佢話︰ 「唔該寄畀我一張相，或者乜都好， 我想將呢件事同 成個 PostSecret 社區分享， 等大家知道你哋個童話故事結局。」

English: And Matty takes the pictures off these cameras and posts them on his website every week.

English: And people come to visit to see if they can identify a picture they've lost or help somebody else get the photos back to them that they might be desperately searching for.
Chinese: （笑聲） 「我喺 Lollapalooza 揾到你部相機，

English: This one's my favorite.

English: (Laughter) Matty has found this ingenious way to leverage the kindness of strangers.

English: And it might seem like a simple idea, and it is, but the impact it can have on people's lives can be huge.

English: Matty shared with me an emotional email he received from the mother in that picture.

English:
That's me, my husband and son.

Chinese: 所以我一直研究緊呢種怕被人審嘅恐懼 即係你唔做嘢係因為驚被人審 你怕因為講唔出 「正確創意嘅嘢」而被審

English: So he'd take people to this two-way mirror looking into the room where the snake was.
Chinese: 當我見過心理學家阿爾波特．班杜拉 我有一個大突破

English: And he'd get them comfortable with that.
Chinese: 我唔知你識唔識阿爾波特．班杜拉 但係你去睇下維基百科 維基百科話，佢係歷史上 第四個最重要嘅心理學家 好似弗洛伊德、史金納、某學者 同埋班都那咁重要

English: Then through a series of steps, he'd move them and they'd be standing in the doorway with the door open, and they'd be looking in there.

English: And he'd get them comfortable with that.
Chinese: 佢真係好得意

English: And then many more steps later, baby steps, they'd be in the room, they'd have a leather glove like a welder's glove on, and they'd eventually touch the snake.

English: And when they touched the snake, everything was fine. They were cured.
Chinese: 佢發展咗呢種方法 可以喺好短時間入面醫好病人 喺四個鐘頭入面 佢醫好恐懼症嘅比率相當之高

English: In fact, everything was better than fine.
Chinese: 我同佢講到蛇 但我唔知點解我哋會講蛇 我哋講到蛇同怕蛇嘅恐懼症

English: These people who had lifelong fears of snakes were saying things like, "Look how beautiful that snake is."

English: And they were holding it in their laps.
Chinese: 佢同我講，佢曾經召募過參加者 然後同佢哋講︰「你知嘛， 隔離房有條蛇喺度， 而家我哋準備入去。」

English: Bandura calls this process "guided mastery."
Chinese: 佢話，大多數嘅受訪者回答 「千奇唔好。如果入面有條蛇喺度， 我肯定唔會入去㗎。」

English: I love that term: guided mastery.
Chinese: 但係班都那有一個百發百中嘅方法

English: And something else happened.
Chinese: 可以一步一步帶啲參加者 去到呢塊單向透明鏡 望入去有條蛇嘅嗰間房

English: These people who went through the process and touched the snake ended up having less anxiety about other things in their lives.
Chinese: 等佢哋覺得自在啲

English: They tried harder, they persevered longer, and they were more resilient in the face of failure.
Chinese: 然後經過一連串嘅步驟 佢帶啲人企喺門口，打開度門 畀佢哋望入去房入面 令佢哋感覺自在啲

English: They just gained a new confidence.
Chinese: 之後佢仲一步一步做咗好多微小嘅嘢

English: And Bandura calls that confidence "self-efficacy," the sense that you can change the world and that you can attain what you set out to do.

English: Well, meeting Bandura was really cathartic for me, because I realized that this famous scientist had documented and scientifically validated something that we've seen happen for the last 30 years: that we could take people who had the fear that they weren't creative, and we could take them through a series of steps, kind of like a series of small successes, and they turn fear into familiarity.
Chinese: 當佢哋摸條蛇嗰時，一切正常

English: That transformation is amazing.
Chinese: 佢哋嘅恐懼症冇咗 所有嘢都解決晒

English: We see it at the d.school all the time.
Chinese: 呢班人以前成日都驚蛇 依家就講「睇下條蛇幾靚」

English: People from all different kinds of disciplines, they think of themselves as only analytical.
Chinese: 佢哋仲擺條蛇响膝頭度

English: And they come in and they go through the process, our process, they build confidence and now they think of themselves differently.

English: And they're totally emotionally excited about the fact that they walk around thinking of themselves as a creative person.

English: So I thought one of the things I'd do today is take you through and show you what this journey looks like.
Chinese: 呢班經歷咗個過程同埋摸過條蛇嘅人

English: To me, that journey looks like Doug Dietz.

English: Doug Dietz is a technical person.
Chinese: 佢哋更加努力、更加堅持 而且面對失敗時更加有韌性

English: He designs large medical imaging equipment.
Chinese: 佢哋得到「新嘅自信」

English: He's worked for GE, and he's had a fantastic career.
Chinese: 班都那叫呢種自信做自我效能 嗰種感覺係，你能夠改變世界 同埋你可以達到嗰啲定咗嘅目標

English: But at one point, he had a moment of crisis.
Chinese: 同班都那見面，真係舒暢 因為我知道呢個出名嘅科學家 用文獻記低同埋用科學方法證明咗 一件我哋三十年嚟見到嘅嘢 就係我哋可以通過一系列步驟 好似係一連串小小嘅創舉 令嗰啲一路覺得自己唔夠創意嘅人 睇住自己可以有幾咁創意

English: He was in the hospital looking at one of his MRI machines in use, when he saw a young family, and this little girl.
Chinese: 所以呢個轉變真係勁

English: And that little girl was crying and was terrified.
Chinese: 我哋喺史丹福大學設計學院 成日都見到唔同學科嘅人

English: And Doug was really disappointed to learn that nearly 80 percent of the pediatric patients in this hospital had to be sedated in order to deal with his MRI machine.
Chinese: 佢哋覺得自己剩係得分析能力

English: And this was really disappointing to Doug, because before this time, he was proud of what he did.

English: He was saving lives with this machine.
Chinese: 每次佢哋諗自己係有創意嘅人嘅時候 佢哋都會好開心

English: But it really hurt him to see the fear that this machine caused in kids.
Chinese: 所以我諗我今日做嘅其中一樣嘢 就係帶你哋體驗下呢個轉變嘅歷程

English: About that time, he was at the d.school at Stanford taking classes.
Chinese: 對我嚟講，個歷程好似 Doug Dietz 一樣

English: He was learning about our process, about design thinking, about empathy, about iterative prototyping.
Chinese: Doug Dietz 係一個科技人員

English: And he would take this new knowledge and do something quite extraordinary.
Chinese: 佢設計大型醫學影像設備

English: He would redesign the entire experience of being scanned.
Chinese: 佢喺通用電汽返工，佢嘅事業無可限量

English: And this is what he came up with.
Chinese: 但係有一次，佢經歷過一刹那嘅危機

English: (Laughter) He turned it into an adventure for the kids.
Chinese: 當佢喺醫院睇住佢設計嘅 磁力共振掃描機運作 佢遇見一個年輕家庭 當中有個細路女

English: He painted the walls and he painted the machine, and he got the operators retrained by people who know kids, like children's museum people.
Chinese: 個細路女好驚、喺度喊

English: And now when the kid comes, it's an experience.

English: And they talk to them about the noise and the movement of the ship.
Chinese: 因為一路而嚟 佢都為佢所做啲嘢感到自豪

English: And when they come, they say, "OK, you're going to go into the pirate ship, but be very still, because we don't want the pirates to find you."
Chinese: 佢以為佢一直用緊呢部機拯救生命

English: And the results were super dramatic: from something like 80 percent of the kids needing to be sedated, to something like 10 percent of the kids needing to be sedated.
Chinese: 但當佢見到部磁力共振掃描機 嚇親啲小朋友

English: So the quantitative results were great.
Chinese: 佢學緊我哋關於設計思考、同情心 同迭代原形嘅方法

English: But Doug's results that he cared about were much more qualitative.
Chinese: 佢想用呢啲新知識去做一啲非凡嘅嘢

English: He was with one of the mothers waiting for her child to come out of the scan.
Chinese: 於是佢重新設計成個掃描過程

English: And when the little girl came out of her scan, she ran up to her mother and said, "Mommy, can we come back tomorrow?"
Chinese: 呢個就係佢用嘅新方法

English: (Laughter) And so, I've heard Doug tell the story many times of his personal transformation and the breakthrough design that happened from it, but I've never really seen him tell the story of the little girl without a tear in his eye.

English: Doug's story takes place in a hospital.
Chinese: 佢畫啲公仔喺幅牆同埋喺部掃描機度 佢叫識得氹細路嘅人 例如兒童博物館嘅工作人員 去訓練操作員

English: I know a thing or two about hospitals.
Chinese: 依家啲細路嚟到好似一個遊樂場咁

English: A few years ago, I felt a lump on the side of my neck.

English: It was my turn in the MRI machine.
Chinese: 所以當啲細路嚟到，佢哋會同佢哋講 「你一陣入去嗰隻海盜船度， 但係要好靜，唔好郁， 因為我哋唔想海盜揾到你。」

English: It was cancer, it was the bad kind.
Chinese: 個效果超好 由八成細路需要食鎮靜劑 到而家只有一成細路要食鎮靜劑

English: I was told I had a 40 percent chance of survival.

English: So while you're sitting around with the other patients, in your pajamas, and everybody's pale and thin -- (Laughter) you know? -- and you're waiting for your turn to get the gamma rays, you think of a lot of things.

English: And I thought a lot about: What was my daughter's life going to be like without me?
Chinese: 但係 Doug Dietz 關心嘅係質量嘅結果

English: But you think about other things.
Chinese: 於是佢陪其中一個媽媽 等佢個細路女掃描完出嚟

English: I thought a lot about: What was I put on Earth to do?
Chinese: 當細路女出嚟嘅時候 細路女走去媽媽度，問媽媽 「媽咪，我哋聽日可唔可以再嚟過呀？」

English: What was my calling? What should I do?
Chinese: （笑聲） Doug Dietz 講過好多次 佢嘅個人轉變 同埋之後嘅突破性設計 每次佢講呢個細路女嘅故仔 佢都眼濕濕

English: I was lucky because I had lots of options.

English: We'd been working in health and wellness, and K-12, and the developing world.
Chinese: 我對醫院都咯知一二

English: so there were lots of projects that I could work on.
Chinese: 幾年前，我條頸側邊有塊腫肉

English: But then I decided and committed at this point, to the thing I most wanted to do, which was to help as many people as possible regain the creative confidence they lost along their way.
Chinese: 嗰時輪到我去做磁力共振掃描

English: And if I was going to survive, that's what I wanted to do.
Chinese: 嚿腫肉係腫瘤，係好惡嗰種

English: I survived, just so you know.
Chinese: 有人同我講，我嘅生存率剩得四成

English: (Laughter) (Applause) I really believe that when people gain this confidence -- and we see it all the time at the d.school and at IDEO -- that they actually start working on the things that are really important in their lives.
Chinese: 所以當你着著件睡衣 坐喺其他病人嘅身邊 見到個個都面黃肌瘦 而你喺度等緊電療 你會諗好多嘢 你哋經常諗嘅係，我會唔會生存落去？

English: We see people quit what they're doing and go in new directions.
Chinese: 而我諗得最多嘅係 我個女無咗我會點？

English: We see them come up with more interesting -- and just more -- ideas, so they can choose from better ideas.
Chinese: 但係你哋會諗下其他嘅嘢

English: And they just make better decisions.
Chinese: 我諗咗好多嘢，譬如︰ 我嚟呢個世界係做咩嘢㗎

English: I know at TED, you're supposed to have a change-the-world kind of thing, isn't that -- everybody has a change-the-world thing?
Chinese: 我有咩使命；我應該做啲咩嘢…

English: If there is one for me, this is it, to help this happen.
Chinese: 我好幸運，因為我有好多選擇

English: So I hope you'll join me on my quest, you as, kind of, thought leaders.
Chinese: 我做過醫療保健界 做過幼兒園到中六嘅教育 仲有發展中國家嘅工作

English: It would be really great if you didn't let people divide the world into the creatives and the non-creatives, like it's some God-given thing, and to have people realize that they're naturally creative, and that those natural people should let their ideas fly; that they should achieve what Bandura calls self-efficacy, that you can do what you set out to do, and that you can reach a place of creative confidence and touch the snake.
Chinese: 所以我有好多項目可以做

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 但係呢一刻 我決定要專注做我最想做嘅嘢 就係盡量幫最多嘅人 令佢地重拾失去咗嘅創作自信

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 如果我有命生存落去 呢樣就係我想做嘅嘢
我依然生存，正如你所見

English: When I was a child growing up in Maine, one of my favorite things to do was to look for sand dollars on the seashores of Maine, because my parents told me it would bring me luck.
Chinese: （笑聲） （掌聲） 我真係相信 當人重拾呢份自信心 即係我哋成日喺史丹福設計學院 同 IDEO 見到嘅自信心 佢哋就會認真開始做 一啲佢哋生命中重要嘅嘢

English: But you know, these shells, they're hard to find.
Chinese: 我哋見到啲人唔再做舊嘅嘢 開始新嘅嘢

English: They're covered in sand, they're difficult to see.
Chinese: 並且有更加有趣、更加多嘅諗法 從而可以揀比較好嘅諗法

English: However, over time, I got used to looking for them.
Chinese: 做更加好嘅決定

English: I started seeing shapes and patterns that helped me to collect them.
Chinese: 我知道喺 TED，你係想做嘢改變世界 每個人都有啲嘢想改變世界

English: This grew into a passion for finding things, a love for the past and archaeology.
Chinese: 對我來講，呢樣嘢係幫人重拾創作自信

English: And eventually, when I started studying Egyptology, I realized that seeing with my naked eyes alone wasn't enough.
Chinese: 我希望你哋可以成為有諗頭嘅人 同我一齊令呢樣嘢發生

English: Because all of the sudden, in Egypt, my beach had grown from a tiny beach in Maine to one eight hundred miles long, next to the Nile.
Chinese: 如果你哋令呢個世界 唔再分為有創意同無創意 令人相信創意變成係天賦嘅 咁世界就美妙嘞 讓所有人嘅意念都可以隨意飛揚 真正實現班都那講嗰種自我效能 令每個人都能夠做到訂下嘅目標 並且做到創作自信 所以，去摸下條蛇啦！

English: And my sand dollars had grown to the size of cities.
Chinese: 多謝

English: This is really what brought me to using satellite imagery.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: For trying to map the past, I knew that I had to see differently.
So I want to show you an example of how we see differently using the infrared.
Chinese: 我從小喺緬因州長大 細個嗰時我最愛做嘅一件事 就係到海邊執海錢 因為父母話執到海錢會帶嚟好運

English: This is a site located in the eastern Egyptian delta called Mendes.
Chinese: 但要知道海錢好難搵

English: And the site visibly appears brown, but when we use the infrared and we process it, all of the sudden, using false color, the site appears as bright pink.
Chinese: 佢哋畀沙遮住，好難被發現

English: What you are seeing are the actual chemical changes to the landscape caused by the building materials and activities of the ancient Egyptians.
Chinese: 只不過，一段時間之後 我已經識點樣搵到佢哋

English: What I want to share with you today is how we've used satellite data to find an ancient Egyptian city, called Itjtawy, missing for thousands of years.
Chinese: 我開始憑形狀同紋理嚟搵佢哋

English: Itjtawy was ancient Egypt's capital for over four hundred years, at a period of time called the Middle Kingdom, about four thousand years ago.
Chinese: 我因此開始熱愛尋寶 亦迷上咗研究事物嘅過去同學習考古學

English: The site is located in the Faiyum of Egypt, and the site is really important, because in the Middle Kingdom there was this great renaissance for ancient Egyptian art, architecture and religion.
Chinese: 終於，喺我開始埃及古物學的研究之後 我發覺齋用肉眼搵嘢係唔夠

English: Egyptologists have always known the site of Itjtawy was located somewhere near the pyramids of the two kings who built it, indicated within the red circles here, but somewhere within this massive flood plain.
Chinese: 因為喺我去到埃及之後 我研究嘅沙灘忽然間 由緬因州一個好細嘅沙灘 變成一條八百英哩長嘅尼羅河沙灘

English: This area is huge -- it's four miles by three miles in size.
Chinese: 而我要搵嘅嘢亦都由海錢變咗古城

English: The Nile used to flow right next to the city of Itjtawy, and as it shifted and changed and moved over time to the east, it covered over the city.
Chinese: 亦因為咁，我開始利用衛星圖片

English: So, how do you find a buried city in a vast landscape?
Chinese: 我知道如果要將事物的過去完整地呈現出嚟 就要用第二種方法去觀測

English: Finding it randomly would be the equivalent of locating a needle in a haystack, blindfolded, wearing baseball mitts.
Chinese: 所以喺呢度，我會畀大家睇睇 我哋用紅外線進行觀測

English: (Laughter) So what we did is we used NASA topography data to map out the landscape, very subtle changes.
Chinese: 呢個係尼羅河三角洲東部嘅 Mendes

English: We started to be able to see where the Nile used to flow.
Chinese: 呢個地方就咁睇起嚟係啡色 但如果我哋用紅外線去睇呢個地點 再加上假色 , 突然變成鮮粉紅

English: But you can see in more detail, and even more interesting, this very slight raised area seen within the circle up here which we thought could possibly be the location of the city of Itjtawy.
Chinese: 宜家你哋睇到嘅 係古代埃及人嘅建築材料 同活動對地表造成嘅化學影響

English: So we collaborated with Egyptian scientists to do coring work, which you see here.
Chinese: 今天我想同各位分享嘅係 我哋點樣利用衛星資料 搵到一座消失咗幾千年嘅 埃及古城伊塔威

English: When I say coring, it's like ice coring, but instead of layers of climate change, you're looking for layers of human occupation.
Chinese: 伊塔威屬於四千幾年前 古埃及中王國時期 做過超過四百年首都

English: And, five meters down, underneath a thick layer of mud, we found a dense layer of pottery.
Chinese: 伊塔威位於埃及嘅法尤姆市 伊塔威非常重要 因為喺中王國時期，古埃及曾經有過 藝術、建築同宗教方面嘅重大嘅文藝復興

English: What this shows is that at this possible location of Itjtawy, five meters down, we have a layer of occupation for several hundred years, dating to the Middle Kingdom, dating to the exact period of time we think Itjtawy is.
Chinese: 埃及學家早就知道伊塔威嘅大概位置 約莫位於兩個法老所起嘅呢個城嘅 金字塔附近 就係圖中紅色圈裡邊 即係喺呢個廣闊沖積平原嘅某處

English: We also found work stone -- carnelian, quartz and agate that shows that there was a jeweler's workshop here.
Chinese: 呢個區域非常寬廣 長同闊有成四英哩乘三英哩

English: These might not look like much, but when you think about the most common stones used in jewelry from the Middle Kingdom, these are the stones that were used.
Chinese: 尼羅河曾經流經伊塔威西面 但後嚟流經東面 於是覆蓋咗成個城市

English: So, we have a dense layer of occupation dating to the Middle Kingdom at this site.
Chinese: 我哋係點樣喺咁大嘅平原裏面 搵一座埋喺地底嘅城市？

English: We also have evidence of an elite jeweler's workshop, showing that whatever was there was a very important city.

English: The next day, the land looked like this.
Chinese: 呢個係我一班眾籌贊助者 喺柏林開嘅派對

English: Where had that water gone?
Chinese: 派對結束嗰陣 我除衫畀人哋喺我身上畫畫

English: Some of it ran off as flooding, but most of the water that soaked into the soil simply evaporated out again, exactly as it does in your garden if you leave the soil uncovered.
Chinese: 我話你知，如果你想領會 信陌生人係點嘅感覺 我推薦呢個活動 尤其當陌生人都係飲醉咗嘅德國人

English: Now, because the fate of water and carbon are tied to soil organic matter, when we damage soils, you give off carbon.
Chinese: （笑聲） 呢個係忍者大師級嘅歌迷交流 因為我真正想講嘅係 我好信任你哋

English: Carbon goes back to the atmosphere.
Chinese: 我應該咁樣做？話畀我聽呀

English: Now you're told over and over, repeatedly, that desertification is only occurring in arid and semi-arid areas of the world, and that tall grasslands like this one in high rainfall are of no consequence.
Chinese: 人類歷史上嘅大部分時間 音樂人、藝術家都係社群嘅一部分

English: But if you do not look at grasslands but look down into them, you find that most of the soil in that grassland that you've just seen is bare and covered with a crust of algae, leading to increased runoff and evaporation.
Chinese: 佢哋扮演著連繫同開拓者角色 而唔係無法觸及嘅明星

English: That is the cancer of desertification that we do not recognize till its terminal form.
Chinese: 以前，成為名人意味著 有啲人隔著好遠鍾意你 但宜家，網絡同網路上面嘅內容 拉返近明星同樂迷嘅距離

English: Now we know that desertification is caused by livestock, mostly cattle, sheep and goats, overgrazing the plants, leaving the soil bare and giving off methane.
Chinese: 宜家係講緊細細班人 可以近距離見到心愛嘅明星 細細班人已經可以養活到你

English: Almost everybody knows this, from nobel laureates to golf caddies, or was taught it, as I was.
Chinese: 所以好多人唔理解冇標準定價係咩回事

English: Now, the environments like you see here, dusty environments in Africa where I grew up, and I loved wildlife, and so I grew up hating livestock because of the damage they were doing.
Chinese: 佢哋認為冇標準定價 會帶嚟無法預料嘅風險 但我做嘅嘢 包括眾籌、街頭募款、㩒陌生人門鐘 都唔係風險

English: And then my university education as an ecologist reinforced my beliefs.
Chinese: 我視呢啲嘢為一種對人嘅信任

English: Well, I have news for you.
Chinese: 宜家，網路工具 令呢種歌手同樂迷之間嘅交易 同喺街頭求助一樣直接、簡單 而且呢種轉變就快成為潮流

English: We were once just as certain that the world was flat.
Chinese: 但如果我哋無辦法見到人 而係怕付出、接收、同求人 咁呢個完美嘅工具就幫唔到我哋

English: We were wrong then, and we are wrong again.
Chinese: 喺我嘅音樂生涯裏邊 我一直嘗試用我企喺箱 同人交流嘅方法同人喺網上交流

English: And I want to invite you now to come along on my journey of reeducation and discovery.
Chinese: 所以部落格同推文 唔單止講到我嘅巡迴演出日期 同我新嘅音樂錄影 仲有講到我哋嘅作品、我哋嘅藝術 我哋嘅恐懼、醉酒同過失 咁樣我哋就能夠明白對方

English: When I was a young man, a young biologist in Africa, I was involved in setting aside marvelous areas as future national parks.
Chinese: 當我哋真正了解大家 我哋就會想幫人

English: Now no sooner — this was in the 1950s — and no sooner did we remove the hunting, drum-beating people to protect the animals, than the land began to deteriorate, as you see in this park that we formed.
Chinese: 我認為人哋一直問咗一個錯嘅問題︰ 「我哋點樣令人哋畀錢買音樂？」

English: Now, no livestock were involved, but suspecting that we had too many elephants now, I did the research and I proved we had too many, and I recommended that we would have to reduce their numbers and bring them down to a level that the land could sustain.
Chinese: 點解唔一開始問： 「我哋點樣令人自發買音樂？」

English: Now, that was a terrible decision for me to have to make, and it was political dynamite, frankly.
Chinese: 多謝

English: So our government formed a team of experts to evaluate my research.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: They did. They agreed with me, and over the following years, we shot 40,000 elephants to try to stop the damage.
And it got worse, not better.
Chinese: 最大、最勁抽嘅海嘯風暴 就快將我哋打低

English: Loving elephants as I do, that was the saddest and greatest blunder of my life, and I will carry that to my grave.
Chinese: 依場咁堅嘅完美風暴 將現實變得越嚟越難搞 我哋面對依個現實嘅時候 我哋要相信我哋可以 用技術去解決依啲問題 依樣嘢大家都可以明白嘅

English: One good thing did come out of it.
Chinese: 我哋依家面對緊嘅完美風暴 就係由人口增長引致嘅 人口向 100 億增長嘅同時 土地變成荒漠 氣候變化更不在話下

English: It made me absolutely determined to devote my life to finding solutions.
Chinese: 而我哋可以解決嘅問題就只有 點樣用科技去取代石化燃料

English: When I came to the United States, I got a shock, to find national parks like this one desertifying as badly as anything in Africa.
Chinese: 石化燃料、碳、煤同埋天然氣 並唔係唯一導致氣候變化嘅嘢

English: And there'd been no livestock on this land for over 70 years.
Chinese: 荒漠化表面上係一嗰好鬼靚嘅詞語 用嚟形容土地逐漸變成荒漠 佢嘅發生係因為我哋製造太多荒地

English: And I found that American scientists had no explanation for this except that it is arid and natural.
Chinese: 無其他原因

English: So I then began looking at all the research plots I could over the whole of the Western United States where cattle had been removed to prove that it would stop desertification, but I found the opposite, as we see on this research station, where this grassland that was green in 1961, by 2002 had changed to that situation.
Chinese: 我將重點放喺世界上 大部份變緊做沙漠嘅土地

English: And the authors of the position paper on climate change from which I obtained these pictures attribute this change to "unknown processes."
Chinese: 但係我要畀你哋一個好簡單嘅信息 當中畀到你嘅希望比你哋所想像嘅仲多

English: Clearly, we have never understood what is causing desertification, which has destroyed many civilizations and now threatens us globally.
Chinese: 有啲環境全年嘅濕度都有保證

English: We have never understood it.
Chinese: 依啲地方幾乎無可能 有大面積嘅荒地形成

English: Take one square meter of soil and make it bare like this is down here, and I promise you, you will find it much colder at dawn and much hotter at midday than that same piece of ground if it's just covered with litter, plant litter.
Chinese: 因為無論你點做，植物又會好快生長返

English: You have changed the microclimate.
Chinese: 又有啲環境幾個月會有雨水 然之後會有幾個月乾旱 荒漠化就響依度發生

English: Now, by the time you are doing that and increasing greatly the percentage of bare ground on more than half the world's land, you are changing macroclimate.
Chinese: 好彩，依家通過太空技術 我哋可以從太空睇到依啲地方 仲可以睇到佢哋嘅比例

English: But we have just simply not understood why was it beginning to happen 10,000 years ago?
Chinese: 總之呢，綠色嘅地方係唔會荒漠化嘅 而啡色嘅地方就會荒漠化 而啡色依啲係目前地球地表最大嘅部分

English: Why has it accelerated lately?
Chinese: 我估計地球上 有三分二嘅地方正荒漠化緊

English: We had no understanding of that.
Chinese: 依幅相係我響提哈馬沙漠拍嘅 落緊 25 毫米、一吋嘅雨

English: What we had failed to understand was that these seasonal humidity environments of the world, the soil and the vegetation developed with very large numbers of grazing animals, and that these grazing animals developed with ferocious pack-hunting predators.
Chinese: 你哋可以將佢諗成係裝響桶裡面嘅水 每桶有 200 升

English: Now, the main defense against pack-hunting predators is to get into herds, and the larger the herd, the safer the individuals.
Chinese: 每日會有一千桶水落響每公頃嘅土地

English: Now, large herds dung and urinate all over their own food, and they have to keep moving, and it was that movement that prevented the overgrazing of plants, while the periodic trampling ensured good cover of the soil, as we see where a herd has passed.
Chinese: 到咗第二日，土地就會好似咁樣

English: This picture is a typical seasonal grassland.
Chinese: 咁啲水去咗邊度呢？

English: It has just come through four months of rain, and it's now going into eight months of dry season.
Chinese: 有一啲流失咗 不過大多數會滲入泥土，跟住又蒸發咗 同花園土壤無遮掩嘅下場一樣

English: And watch the change as it goes into this long dry season.
Chinese: 因為水同碳嘅命運 同土壤裏面嘅有機物質有關 如果我哋破壞土壤，碳元素就會釋出

English: Now, all of that grass you see aboveground has to decay biologically before the next growing season, and if it doesn't, the grassland and the soil begin to die.
Chinese: 碳元素就會返到大氣層

English: Now, if it does not decay biologically, it shifts to oxidation, which is a very slow process, and this smothers and kills grasses, leading to a shift to woody vegetation and bare soil, releasing carbon.
Chinese: 我已經講咗好多次 荒漠化只會出現響 地球上乾旱同半乾旱嘅地方 所以好似依個咁嘅高原唔會有事

English: To prevent that, we have traditionally used fire.
Chinese: 不過當你唔只睇個草原 睇下土壤嘅表面 你會發現草原裡面大部份嘅土壤 除咗光禿禿之外，就只有一層藻類遮住 亦都係咁加快咗水份流失同蒸發

English: But fire also leaves the soil bare, releasing carbon, and worse than that, burning one hectare of grassland gives off more, and more damaging, pollutants than 6,000 cars.
Chinese: 而依樣就係荒漠化嘅致命成因 但我哋成日到咗荒漠化後期 先會發現得到

English: And we are burning in Africa, every single year, more than one billion hectares of grasslands, and almost nobody is talking about it.
Chinese: 依家我哋知道荒漠化係由家畜導致嘅 大多數係由於牛、綿羊同山羊 過度放牧而食晒啲植物 令土壤外露同釋放甲烷而導致

English: We justify the burning, as scientists, because it does remove the dead material and it allows the plants to grow.
Chinese: 呢樣嘢幾乎係人都知道 由諾貝爾獎得主到高爾夫球球僮 都同我一樣知道呢個常識

English: Now, looking at this grassland of ours that has gone dry, what could we do to keep that healthy?
Chinese: 你哋響度睇到嘅環境 塵土飛揚嘅非洲，就係我成長嘅地方 我鐘意野生動物 我細個已經討厭畜牧 因為畜牧破壞生態

English: And bear in mind, I'm talking of most of the world's land now.
Chinese: 我喺大學修讀生態學加強咗我嘅信念

English: Okay? We cannot reduce animal numbers to rest it more without causing desertification and climate change.
Chinese: 依家，我有好消息畀你哋

English: We cannot burn it without causing desertification and climate change.
Chinese: 我哋曾經相信世界係平坦嘅

English: What are we going to do?
Chinese: 以前我哋錯咗，依家又錯多次

English: There is only one option, I'll repeat to you, only one option left to climatologists and scientists, and that is to do the unthinkable, and to use livestock, bunched and moving, as a proxy for former herds and predators, and mimic nature.
Chinese: 我想請你哋加入我再教育同探索之旅

English: There is no other alternative left to mankind.
Chinese: 我後生嗰陣時係非洲年輕嘅生物學家 我曾經參與將一啲壯麗嘅地方 規劃成未來嘅國家公園

English: So on this bit of grassland, we'll do it, but just in the foreground.
Chinese: 冇幾耐之後，大概響 1950 年代 我哋禁止咗打獵 反而鼓動大家保護動物 跟住土地開始惡化 就好似依個我哋建立嘅公園咁

English: We'll impact it very heavily with cattle to mimic nature, and we've done so, and look at that.
Chinese: 依家嗰度搵唔到牲畜 於是我哋懷疑嗰度大象嘅數目太多 經我調查，佢哋數量確實太多 我建議將佢哋嘅數量減少 下降到土地能承受嘅水平

English: All of that grass is now covering the soil as dung, urine and litter or mulch, as every one of the gardeners amongst you would understand, and that soil is ready to absorb and hold the rain, to store carbon, and to break down methane.
Chinese: 對我嚟講依個係好可怕嘅決定 老實講仲係一個政治炸彈

English: And we did that, without using fire to damage the soil, and the plants are free to grow.
Chinese: 所以我哋嘅政府組織咗 一個專家團隊嚟評估我嘅研究

English: When I first realized that we had no option as scientists but to use much-vilified livestock to address climate change and desertification, I was faced with a real dilemma.
Chinese: 佢哋評估之後都同意我嘅觀點 之後嘅幾年 我哋射殺四萬隻大象嚟停止土地惡化

English: How were we to do it?
Chinese: 只不過情況冇好到，反而轉差

English: We'd had 10,000 years of extremely knowledgeable pastoralists bunching and moving their animals, but they had created the great manmade deserts of the world.
Chinese: 我好鐘意大象 但射殺大象係我人生中 最悲傷同做得最錯嘅事 我會一生悔恨至死

English: Then we'd had 100 years of modern rain science, and that had accelerated desertification, as we first discovered in Africa and then confirmed in the United States, and as you see in this picture of land managed by the federal government.
Chinese: 但咁樣帶出咗一件事

English: Clearly more was needed than bunching and moving the animals, and humans, over thousands of years, had never been able to deal with nature's complexity.
Chinese: 呢件事令我下定決心 全情投入去搵出解決方案

English: But we biologists and ecologists had never tackled anything as complex as this.
Chinese: 當我去到美國時，我好震驚 我見到國家公園荒漠化嘅程度 同非洲一樣咁大

English: So rather than reinvent the wheel, I began studying other professions to see if anybody had.
Chinese: 依塊土地已經超過 70 年無家畜存在

English: And I found there were planning techniques that I could take and adapt to our biological need, and from those I developed what we call holistic management and planned grazing, a planning process, and that does address all of nature's complexity and our social, environmental, economic complexity.
Chinese: 而且我發現美國嘅科學家 除咗話依個係自然現象之外 就無其他解釋

English: Today, we have young women like this one teaching villages in Africa how to put their animals together into larger herds, plan their grazing to mimic nature, and where we have them hold their animals overnight -- we run them in a predator-friendly manner, because we have a lot of lands, and so on -- and where they do this and hold them overnight to prepare the crop fields, we are getting very great increases in crop yield as well.
Chinese: 所以我用盡心機去搵針對美國西部 因牛隻遷移而令荒漠化停止嘅證明 但係我卻搵到完全相反嘅證明 就好似我哋響依個研究站見到嘅咁 當年 1961 年仲係一大片青草地 但係到 2002 年已經變成咁樣

English: Let's look at some results.
Chinese: 我從一份關於氣候改變嘅報告 揾到依啲相 個作者話依個係解釋唔到嘅現象

English: This is land close to land that we manage in Zimbabwe.
Chinese: 但好明顯係我哋唔知道乜嘢導致荒漠化 但就係依樣嘢毀滅咗好多文明 而且威脅緊全球

English: It has just come through four months of very good rains it got that year, and it's going into the long dry season.
Chinese: 我哋根本對依樣嘢唔了解

English: But as you can see, all of that rain, almost of all it, has evaporated from the soil surface.
Chinese: 將一平方米嘅土壤就咁光禿禿咁擺響度 相比起用枯枝落葉去覆蓋佢 我保證你會發現光禿禿咁嘅泥土 日出時份會更加凍 到中午時份就會更加熱

English: Their river is dry despite the rain just having ended, and we have 150,000 people on almost permanent food aid.
Chinese: 因為你哋改變咗微觀氣候

English: Now let's go to our land nearby on the same day, with the same rainfall, and look at that.
Chinese: 而家，當你哋繼續增加荒地比率 去到超過世界一半嘅土地 咁你哋就係改變緊全球大氣候

English: Our river is flowing and healthy and clean.
Chinese: 但係我哋仍然唔明白 點解依個現象會響一萬年前發生

English: The production of grass, shrubs, trees, wildlife, everything is now more productive, and we have virtually no fear of dry years.
Chinese: 同埋點解依家會加劇惡化呢

English: And we did that by increasing the cattle and goats 400 percent, planning the grazing to mimic nature and integrate them with all the elephants, buffalo, giraffe and other animals that we have.
Chinese: 我哋真係乜都唔知企咗響度

English: But before we began, our land looked like that.
Chinese: 我哋完全無了解到 依啲隨季節改變濕度嘅環境 佢哋嘅土壤同植物發展 同過度放牧有關 而依啲被放牧嘅牲畜 同群體狩獵嘅掠食動物有關

English: This site was bare and eroding for over 30 years regardless of what rain we got.
Chinese: 要對抗群體狩獵掠食動物嘅主要方法 就係集合成群 群體愈大，個體就愈安全

English: Okay? Watch the marked tree and see the change as we use livestock to mimic nature.
Chinese: 依家大群動物因為 響佢哋嘅食物上面排便排尿 於是佢哋需要遷徙 就係咁樣遷徙 避免咗因過度放牧、動物食曬啲植物 有秩序嘅週期遷徙 可以確保土壤有足夠植被 就好似見到依群動物走過嘅地方一樣

English: This was another site where it had been bare and eroding, and at the base of the marked small tree, we had lost over 30 centimeters of soil. Okay?
Chinese: 依幅係典型嘅季節性草原嘅相

English: And again, watch the change just using livestock to mimic nature.
Chinese: 嗰度啱啱落咗四個月雨 亦都開始為期八個月嘅旱季

English: And there are fallen trees in there now, because the better land is now attracting elephants, etc.
Chinese: 留意下佢經歷長期旱季嘅轉變

English: This land in Mexico was in terrible condition, and I've had to mark the hill because the change is so profound.
Chinese: 依家你見到所有地上曝露喺空氣嘅草 都需要響下個生長周期前自然腐爛 如果唔係，成塊草地同土壤都會死

English: (Applause) I began helping a family in the Karoo Desert in the 1970s turn the desert that you see on the right there back to grassland, and thankfully, now their grandchildren are on the land with hope for the future.
Chinese: 如果佢哋無腐爛，佢哋就會慢慢氧化 最終啲草會窒息同死亡 亦剩返木本植物先生存到 土地就會無遮掩，釋出碳元素

English: And look at the amazing change in this one, where that gully has completely healed using nothing but livestock mimicking nature, and once more, we have the third generation of that family on that land with their flag still flying.
Chinese: 為咗阻止發生依個情況 我哋傳統上會用火燒

English: The vast grasslands of Patagonia are turning to desert as you see here.
Chinese: 不過火都會令到土地無遮掩 亦會釋放出碳元素 更差嘅係 只要燒走一公頃嘅草地 就會釋放出比六千架車更加多嘅污染物

English: The man in the middle is an Argentinian researcher, and he has documented the steady decline of that land over the years as they kept reducing sheep numbers.
Chinese: 我哋每年都響非洲燒走 超過十億公頃嘅草地 但幾乎無人關心依件事

English: They put 25,000 sheep in one flock, really mimicking nature now with planned grazing, and they have documented a 50-percent increase in the production of the land in the first year.
Chinese: 作為科學家，我哋認為用火燒係啱 因為咁樣可以消除啲廢物 畀啲植物生長

English: We now have in the violent Horn of Africa pastoralists planning their grazing to mimic nature and openly saying it is the only hope they have of saving their families and saving their culture.
Chinese: 睇下我哋依片枯乾嘅草地 我哋點樣做先可以令佢健康呢？

English: Ninety-five percent of that land can only feed people from animals.
Chinese: 提一提，我係講緊世上大部份嘅土地

English: I remind you that I am talking about most of the world's land here that controls our fate, including the most violent region of the world, where only animals can feed people from about 95 percent of the land.
Chinese: 我哋唔可以一邊減低動物嘅數量 去畀啲植物復原 一邊唔造成沙漠化同氣候變遷

English: What we are doing globally is causing climate change as much as, I believe, fossil fuels, and maybe more than fossil fuels.
Chinese: 我哋無辦法燒走啲植物 而又確保唔會發生荒漠化同氣候變化

English: But worse than that, it is causing hunger, poverty, violence, social breakdown and war, and as I am talking to you, millions of men, women and children are suffering and dying.
Chinese: 咁點算？

English: And if this continues, we are unlikely to be able to stop the climate changing, even after we have eliminated the use of fossil fuels.

Chinese: 哩啲書可以係有關人物 [ 沃爾特 · 以撒森《本傑明 · 佛蘭克林》、 大衛 · 麥考夫《約翰 · 亞當》] 而哩啲人物都經歷過同樣嘅事件 或者做過朋友，共過患難

English: (Applause)
Chinese: [ 凱薩琳 · 格雷厄姆《個人歷史》、 愛麗絲 · 施羅德《滾雪球：巴菲特自傳》] 我亦都會比較相同情節 但唔同敍事手法嘅文學作品（笑聲） [ 金 · 詹姆斯版本《聖經》、 克里斯多夫 · 摩爾《羔羊》] 又或者嚟自唔同文化但相似內容嘅故事 就好似約瑟夫 · 坎貝爾 喺佢嗰本書《神話嘅力量》中提到 例如，耶穌同佛陀 兩個人都曾經遇到過三種誘惑
對耶穌嚟講，誘惑都係 經濟、政治、精神上嘅

English: So what does it mean for a machine to be athletic?
Chinese: 對於佛陀嚟講，誘惑都係心理嘅： 情慾、恐懼、社會責任 ——都幾有趣

English: We will demonstrate the concept of machine athleticism and the research to achieve it with the help of these flying machines called quadrocopters, or quads, for short.
Chinese: 所以如果你識得一門外語 咁將原文同譯文一齊讀都極有意思

English: Quads have been around for a long time.
Chinese: [ 湯瑪斯 · 梅頓翻譯嘅《莊子》、 艾倫 · 華特斯譯嘅《道德經》] 有人覺得翻譯會令文字嘅意藴損失 但我反而覺得有收穫

English: They're so popular these days because they're mechanically simple.
Chinese: 例如，通過翻譯 我意識到中文嘅 「 快樂 」 字面上可以理解成 「短暫嘅愉悅」。嗯！

English: By controlling the speeds of these four propellers, these machines can roll, pitch, yaw, and accelerate along their common orientation.
Chinese: 中文「新娘」字面上解 「新嘅媽媽」。哦！

English: On board are also a battery, a computer, various sensors and wireless radios.
Chinese: （笑聲） 書本係我哋同古人、現代人 溝通聯繫嘅一個神奇通道

English: Quads are extremely agile, but this agility comes at a cost.
Chinese: 我知道我唔應該再覺得寂寞或者弱小

English: They are inherently unstable, and they need some form of automatic feedback control in order to be able to fly.
Chinese: 相較於其他人經歷過嘅嘢 一個夢想破碎其實都唔係啲乜

English: So, how did it just do that?
Chinese: 我開始相信夢想並唔剩係用嚟實現

English: Cameras on the ceiling and a laptop serve as an indoor global positioning system.
Chinese: 佢最重要嘅一個意義就係 可以畀我哋嚟到夢想來源嘅地方 熱情嘅源頭、同快樂嘅根源

English: It's used to locate objects in the space that have these reflective markers on them.
Chinese: 就算一個已經破碎嘅夢想 都可以有咁嘅意義

English: This data is then sent to another laptop that is running estimation and control algorithms, which in turn sends commands to the quad, which is also running estimation and control algorithms.
Chinese: 因為書本 我今日大部分時間先可以開心咁生活 我嘅生命先可以有返目標同埋變得清晰

English: The bulk of our research is algorithms.
Chinese: 但願書籍永遠陪伴著你

English: It's the magic that brings these machines to life.
Chinese: 多謝

English: So how does one design the algorithms that create a machine athlete?
Chinese: （掌聲） 多謝 （掌聲） 多謝 （掌聲）

English: We use something broadly called model-based design.
We first capture the physics with a mathematical model of how the machines behave.
Chinese: 所有嘢都係有關係嘅

English: We then use a branch of mathematics called control theory to analyze these models and also to synthesize algorithms for controlling them.
Chinese: 作為一個辛納科克印度人 我從小就知道呢一點

English: For example, that's how we can make the quad hover.
Chinese: 我哋喺一個細嘅釣魚部落 就近紐約南安普敦、長島嘅東南部

English: We first captured the dynamics with a set of differential equations.
Chinese: 我細嘅時候 我爺爺會喺夏天帶我坐喺太陽之下

English: We then manipulate these equations with the help of control theory to create algorithms that stabilize the quad.
Chinese: 天空完全冇雲

English: Let me demonstrate the strength of this approach.
Chinese: 過咗一段時間，我開始流汗

English: Suppose that we want this quad to not only hover but to also balance this pole.
Chinese: 我爺爺就向天指著話： 「你睇下，見唔見到嗰個啊？

English: With a little bit of practice, it's pretty straightforward for a human being to do this, although we do have the advantage of having two feet on the ground and the use of our very versatile hands.
Chinese: 嗰個就係你嘅一部分。

English: It becomes a little bit more difficult when I only have one foot on the ground and when I don't use my hands.
Chinese: 嗰嚿就係由你汗水形成嘅雲， 將來化成雨來灌溉植物，同養動物。」

English: Notice how this pole has a reflective marker on top, which means that it can be located in the space.
Chinese: 之後我繼續探索大自然裏面 「生命互連」嘅事物 我個女同我講： 「媽媽，妳應該去追風」 所以 2008 年，我就開始追風

English: (Audience) Oh!
Chinese: 因此我三日之後，渣得好快 為嘅就係追一個叫「超大胞」嘅巨雲 呢種巨雲能夠製造柚咁大嘅冰雹 同壯觀嘅龍捲風 但其實只有 2% 「超大胞」 落到大冰雹

English: (Applause) (Applause ends) You can notice that this quad is making fine adjustments to keep the pole balanced.
Chinese: 呢的雲可以闊成 50 英里 高度可以有 65,000 呎

English: How did we design the algorithms to do this?
Chinese: 佢哋大到可以阻擋所有陽光 令到下面嘅事物好黑暗、好不祥

English: We added the mathematical model of the pole to that of the quad.
Chinese: 追風係一個非常有質感嘅經驗

English: Once we have a model of the combined quad-pole system, we can use control theory to create algorithms for controlling it.
Chinese: 溫暖同潮濕嘅風吹著你嘅背脊 泥土、小麥、青草和帶電粒子帶住氣味

English: Here, you see that it's stable, and even if I give it little nudges, it goes back -- to the nice, balanced position.
Chinese: 雲層呈現唔同色彩 形成冰雹嘅雲層，有綠色、綠松藍

English: We can also augment the model to include where we want the quad to be in space.
Chinese: 我學識咗對閃電產生敬畏

English: Using this pointer, made out of reflective markers, I can point to where I want the quad to be in space a fixed distance away from me.
Chinese: 因為我嘅頭髮以前係直㗎

English: (Laughter) The key to these acrobatic maneuvers is algorithms, designed with the help of mathematical models and control theory.
Chinese: （笑聲） 講笑咋

English: Let's tell the quad to come back here and let the pole drop, and I will next demonstrate the importance of understanding physical models and the workings of the physical world.
Chinese: （笑聲） 真正令我興奮嘅係風暴嘅動態 即佢哋會同熔岩燈形狀嘅乳狀雲 一齊旋動、自轉同起伏

English: Notice how the quad lost altitude when I put this glass of water on it.
Chinese: 佢哋就好似可愛嘅怪獸一樣

English: Unlike the balancing pole, I did not include the mathematical model of the glass in the system.
Chinese: 當我影相嘅時候 我無啦啦記返我爺爺教過我嘅嘢

English: In fact, the system doesn't even know that the glass is there.
Chinese: 當我企喺雲嘅下面 我唔單止見到一嚿雲 我仲明白到我有幸目睹嘅現象 係由製造我哋銀河、太陽系、太陽 甚至我哋地球嘅同一個力量所造成 雲團只係呢股力量嘅迷你版

English: Like before, I could use the pointer to tell the quad where I want it to be in space.
Chinese: 所以全部嘢都係有關嘅。多謝

English: (Applause) (Applause ends) Okay, you should be asking yourself, why doesn't the water fall out of the glass?
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: Two facts.
The first is that gravity acts on all objects in the same way.
Chinese: 如果呢台機器可以做運動 意味著乜嘢？

English: The second is that the propellers are all pointing in the same direction of the glass, pointing up.
Chinese: 我哋會借助四旋翼飛行器（四旋翼） 去展示機器運動嘅概念 同埋我哋喺機器運動方面嘅研究

English: You put these two things together, the net result is that all side forces on the glass are small and are mainly dominated by aerodynamic effects, which at these speeds are negligible.
Chinese: 四旋翼已經面世好耐

English: And that's why you don't need to model the glass.
Chinese: 佢哋最近大熱嘅原因 係因為佢哋嘅機械原理簡單

English: It naturally doesn't spill, no matter what the quad does.
Chinese: 只要控制呢四個螺旋槳嘅轉速 呢部機器就可以翻側、俯仰、偏航 仲可以向任何一個方向加速

English: (Applause) (Applause ends) The lesson here is that some high-performance tasks are easier than others, and that understanding the physics of the problem tells you which ones are easy and which ones are hard.
Chinese: 呢部機器有電池、微型電腦 各種傳感器同無線電收發器

English: In this instance, carrying a glass of water is easy.
Chinese: 四旋翼靈活係有代價嘅

English: Balancing a pole is hard.
Chinese: 佢天生唔夠穩定 所以需要自動反饋控制 至保證可以飛得到

English: We've all heard stories of athletes performing feats while physically injured.
Chinese: 咁點樣做到自動反饋呢？

English: Can a machine also perform with extreme physical damage?
Chinese: 天花板嘅攝像鏡頭同呢部手提電腦 形成咗室內嘅定位系統

English: Conventional wisdom says that you need at least four fixed motor propeller pairs in order to fly, because there are four degrees of freedom to control: roll, pitch, yaw and acceleration.
Chinese: 用嚟定位空間入面嘅物件 每件物件都有呢種反光標記

English: Hexacopters and octocopters, with six and eight propellers, can provide redundancy, but quadrocopters are much more popular because they have the minimum number of fixed motor propeller pairs: four.
Chinese: 收集到嘅定位數據會發送去 另一部手提電腦 執行估算同控制算法 跟住電腦會發送控制指令畀四旋翼 四旋翼亦都會執行計算同控制算法

English: Or do they?
Chinese: 我哋研究嘅重點就係算法

English: (Laughter) If we analyze the mathematical model of this machine with only two working propellers, we discover that there's an unconventional way to fly it.
Chinese: 算法賦予呢啲機器活力

English: We relinquish control of yaw, but roll, pitch and acceleration can still be controlled with algorithms that exploit this new configuration.
Chinese: 咁係點樣設計出算法 令機器可以郁嘅呢？

English: Mathematical models tell us exactly when and why this is possible.
Chinese: 我哋利用廣義稱為 「以模型為基礎嘅設計方法」

English: In this instance, this knowledge allows us to design novel machine architectures or to design clever algorithms that gracefully handle damage, just like human athletes do, instead of building machines with redundancy.
Chinese: 我哋首先利用數學模型 掌握機器運動嘅物理數據

English: We can't help but hold our breath when we watch a diver somersaulting into the water, or when a vaulter is twisting in the air, the ground fast approaching.
Chinese: 然後用數學嘅一個細分學科 叫做控制理論，分析模型同合成算法 從而控制四旋翼

English: Will the diver be able to pull off a rip entry?
Chinese: 例如，我哋係咁樣控制四旋翼︰

English: Will the vaulter stick the landing?
Chinese: 首先，用一系列微分方程 掌握佢嘅運動數據

English: Suppose we want this quad here to perform a triple flip and finish off at the exact same spot that it started.
Chinese: 藉著控制理論，我哋修改呢啲方程式 得出一啲算法嚟穩定四旋翼

English: This maneuver is going to happen so quickly that we can't use position feedback to correct the motion during execution.
Chinese: 等我示範下呢種方法有幾厲害啦

English: There simply isn't enough time.
Chinese: 假設我哋想四旋翼停喺空中之外 仲要穩定一轆棍

English: Instead, what the quad can do is perform the maneuver blindly, observe how it finishes the maneuver, and then use that information to modify its behavior so that the next flip is better.
Chinese: 經過簡單練習 人類已經可以做到呢個動作 雖然我哋比四旋翼有優勢 我哋可以雙腿掂地 有好靈活嘅雙手輔助

English: Similar to the diver and the vaulter, it is only through repeated practice that the maneuver can be learned and executed to the highest standard.
Chinese: 但如果我金雞獨立嘅話，咁就有啲難

English: (Laughter) (Applause) Striking a moving ball is a necessary skill in many sports.
Chinese: 注意轆棍頂部有反光標記 用嚟判斷轆棍嘅空間座標

English: How do we make a machine do what an athlete does seemingly without effort?
Chinese: （觀眾）哦！

English: (Laughter) (Applause) (Applause ends) This quad has a racket strapped onto its head with a sweet spot roughly the size of an apple, so not too large.
Chinese: （掌聲） 大家可以睇到部四旋翼一直喺度微調 令轆棍平衡

English: The following calculations are made every 20 milliseconds, or 50 times per second.
Chinese: 我哋係點樣設計算法搞掂嘅呢？

English: We first figure out where the ball is going.
Chinese: 我哋將轆棍嘅數學模型輸入到四旋翼

English: We then next calculate how the quad should hit the ball so that it flies to where it was thrown from.
Chinese: 只要我哋個模型有齊 四旋翼同轆棍嘅資料 我哋就可以利用控制理論 建立控制算法去控制四旋翼

English: Third, a trajectory is planned that carries the quad from its current state to the impact point with the ball.
Chinese: 睇下，就算我郁佢一下 佢都穩如泰山，都會返到去平衡點

English: Fourth, we only execute 20 milliseconds' worth of that strategy.
Chinese: 我哋仲可以修改模型 加入四旋翼預定嘅空間座標

English: Twenty milliseconds later, the whole process is repeated until the quad strikes the ball.
Chinese: 用著呢條有反光標記嘅指揮棒 就可以點四旋翼去任何我想嘅位置 而且同我保持特定嘅距離

English: (Applause) Machines can not only perform dynamic maneuvers on their own, they can do it collectively.
Chinese: （笑聲） 呢啲特技動作嘅關鍵係算法 算法依賴數學模型同控制理論

English: These three quads are cooperatively carrying a sky net.
Chinese: 等我指部四旋翼返嚟先 畀四旋翼放低轆棍 宜家我會講解 理解物理模型 同現實世界運作規律嘅重要

English: (Applause) (Applause ends) They perform an extremely dynamic and collective maneuver to launch the ball back to me.
Chinese: 留意喺我放杯水上去嘅時候 四旋翼嘅高度下降咗

English: Notice that, at full extension, these quads are vertical.
Chinese: 唔似轆棍咁樣 我無喺四旋翼系統度 加入杯水嘅數學模型

English: (Applause) In fact, when fully extended, this is roughly five times greater than what a bungee jumper feels at the end of their launch.
Chinese: 事實上，系統根本唔知道杯水喺度

English: The algorithms to do this are very similar to what the single quad used to hit the ball back to me.
Chinese: 同之前一樣，我可以用指揮棒 指揮四旋翼嘅走向

English: Mathematical models are used to continuously re-plan a cooperative strategy 50 times per second.
Chinese: （掌聲） 大家可能會問 點解玻璃杯嘅水唔會倒出嚟？

English: Everything we have seen so far has been about the machines and their capabilities.
Chinese: 原因有兩個：

English: What happens when we couple this machine athleticism with that of a human being?
Chinese: 第一，重力對所有物體嘅作用都係一樣

English: What I have in front of me is a commercial gesture sensor mainly used in gaming.
Chinese: 第二，所有螺旋槳都指向 同玻璃杯一樣嘅方向︰指向上

English: It can recognize what my various body parts are doing in real time.
Chinese: 呢兩點加埋，結果就係 杯水打側方向嘅作用力太細 四旋翼亦因此主要受到空氣動力控制 所以向側邊嘅力都可以忽略

English: Similar to the pointer that I used earlier, we can use this as inputs to the system.
Chinese: 亦因為咁，你無需為玻璃杯整數學模型

English: We now have a natural way of interacting with the raw athleticism of these quads with my gestures.
Chinese: 因為無論四旋翼做咩，水都唔會漏出嚟

English: (Applause) Interaction doesn't have to be virtual.
Chinese: （掌聲） 喺度想講嘅係 某啲高性能任務簡單過其他任務 同埋，理解問题背後嘅物理 你就可以知道邊樣簡單、邊樣難

English: Take this quad, for example.
Chinese: 呢個例子裏面 四旋翼頂住杯水飛就簡單

English: It's trying to stay at a fixed point in space.
Chinese: 平衡轆棍就難

English: If I try to move it out of the way, it fights me, and moves back to where it wants to be.
Chinese: 我哋都聽過運動員受傷都可以完成壯舉

English: We can change this behavior, however.
Chinese: 咁機器可唔可以 喺極度損壞嘅情況下運作？

English: We can use mathematical models to estimate the force that I'm applying to the quad.
Chinese: 傳統科學認為，你要飛 起碼要四塊固定螺旋槳 因為要控制四範嘢︰ 滾轉、俯仰、偏航同加速

English: Once we know this force, we can also change the laws of physics, as far as the quad is concerned, of course.
Chinese: 六旋同八旋飛行器 分別有六同八塊螺旋槳 佢哋嘅螺旋槳足以應付所需 但係四旋更加受歡迎 因為佢有最少嘅螺旋槳：四套

English: Here, the quad is behaving as if it were in a viscous fluid.
Chinese: 係咪？

English: We now have an intimate way of interacting with a machine.
Chinese: 如果我哋分析呢台 只用兩個螺旋槳嘅機器嘅數學模型 我哋發現有種新嘅方式可以令佢飛起嚟

English: I will use this new capability to position this camera-carrying quad to the appropriate location for filming the remainder of this demonstration.
Chinese: 就係只要算法容許嘅話 我哋放棄控制偏航 但係我哋仍然控制滾轉、俯仰同加速

English: So we can physically interact with these quads and we can change the laws of physics.
Chinese: 數學模型精確咁話畀我哋知 幾時同點解呢種配置係有可能

English: Let's have a little bit of fun with this.
Chinese: 喺呢個例子，數學模型嘅知識 令我哋設計出全新嘅機器結構 或者好似人類運動員一樣聰明 應對損害嘅算法 而無需整多餘嘅部件

English: For what you will see next, these quads will initially behave as if they were on Pluto.
Chinese: 當我哋睇到跳水運動員空翻入水 或者撐杆跳運動員喺空中翻轉 然後快速著地，我哋一定會屏息以待

English: As time goes on, gravity will be increased until we're all back on planet Earth, but I assure you we won't get there.
Chinese: 睇下究竟跳水嘅可唔可以壓住水花

English: Okay, here goes.
Chinese: 撐杆跳嘅可唔可以站立著地

English: (Laughter) (Laughter) (Applause) Whew!
Chinese: 假設我哋希望呢台四旋翼表演三個空翻 然後停喺佢原來嘅位置

English: You're all thinking now, these guys are having way too much fun, and you're probably also asking yourself, why exactly are they building machine athletes?
Chinese: 但呢個動作快到 我哋用唔到定位反饋信息 糾正執行過程嘅動作

English: Some conjecture that the role of play in the animal kingdom is to hone skills and develop capabilities.
Chinese: 時間根本唔夠

English: Others think that it has more of a social role, that it's used to bind the group.
Chinese: 所以四旋翼只能夠盲目執行動作 執行完之後 睇下自己點樣完成呢個動作 然後修改自己嘅動作 令到下一個翻轉好啲

English: Similarly, we use the analogy of sports and athleticism to create new algorithms for machines to push them to their limits.
Chinese: 呢個類似跳水同撐杆跳運動員 只有通過反覆練習 先可以學好動作，做到最好

English: What impact will the speed of machines have on our way of life?
Chinese: （笑聲） （掌聲） 好多運動入面，擊球係一項必須嘅技能

English: Like all our past creations and innovations, they may be used to improve the human condition or they may be misused and abused.
Chinese: 我哋點樣令機器做到 運動員隨便就做到嘅動作？

English: This is not a technical choice we are faced with; it's a social one.
Chinese: （笑聲） （掌聲） 呢部四旋翼個頭綁咗塊球拍 而最有效擊球點同蘋果差唔多大

English: Let's make the right choice, the choice that brings out the best in the future of machines, just like athleticism in sports can bring out the best in us.
Chinese: 所以唔係好大 部機嘅計算頻率係 20 毫秒一次 亦即係每秒 50 次

English: Let me introduce you to the wizards behind the green curtain.

English: They're the current members of the Flying Machine Arena research team.

English: (Applause) Federico Augugliaro, Dario Brescianini, Markus Hehn, Sergei Lupashin, Mark Muller and Robin Ritz.
Chinese: 第三步，計算出一條從四旋翼 到擊球點嘅飛行軌跡

English: Look out for them. They're destined for great things.

English: Thank you.

（掌聲） 機器唔單止可以獨立運動 佢哋仲可以一齊嚟

English: I was born and raised in North Korea.

English: Although my family constantly struggled against poverty, I was always loved and cared for first, because I was the only son and the youngest of two in the family.

English: My sister and I would go searching for firewood starting at 5 in the morning and come back after midnight.

English: Hunger is humiliation. Hunger is hopelessness.

English: On my ninth birthday, my parents couldn't give me any food to eat.

English: But even as a child, I could feel the heaviness in their hearts.

English: Over a million North Koreans died of starvation in that time, and in 2003, when I was 13 years old, my father became one of them.

English: I saw my father wither away and die.

English: In the same year, my mother disappeared one day, and then my sister told me that she was going to China to earn money, but that she would return with money and food soon.

English: Since we had never been separated, and I thought we would be together forever, I didn't even give her a hug when she left.

English: It was the biggest mistake I have ever made in my life.

English: But again, I didn't know it was going to be a long goodbye.

English: I have not seen my mom or my sister since then.

English: Suddenly, I became an orphan and homeless.

English: My daily life became very hard, but very simple.

English: My goal was to find a dusty piece of bread in the trash.

English: But that is no way to survive.
Chinese: 而我哋依家可以好親密咁同機器互動

English: I started to realize, begging would not be the solution.

English: So I started to steal from food carts in illegal markets.

English: Sometimes, I found small jobs in exchange for food.

English: Once, I even spent two months in the winter working in a coal mine, 33 meters underground without any protection for up to 16 hours a day.

English: I was not uncommon.

English: Many other orphans survived this way, or worse.

English: When I could not fall asleep from bitter cold or hunger pains, I hoped that, the next morning, my sister would come back to wake me up with my favorite food.

English: That hope kept me alive.
Chinese: 你哋一定諗緊四旋翼嘅 開發人員有太多娛樂 你都可能會問自己 點解佢哋要整運動機械人？

English: I don't mean big, grand hope.
Chinese: 有人一口咬定話 「玩」嘅功能就係磨練 包括人在內嘅動物嘅技藝同埋能力

English: I mean the kind of hope that made me believe that the next trash can had bread, even though it usually didn't.

English: But if I didn't believe it, I wouldn't even try, and then I would die.

English: Hope kept me alive.
Chinese: 機器嘅速度 對我哋嘅生活方式有咩影響？

English: Every day, I told myself, no matter how hard things got, still I must live.
Chinese: 同我哋以前所有嘅創造發明一樣 佢哋可能用嚟改善人類嘅生活條件 亦都可能俾人誤用或者濫用

English: After three years of waiting for my sister's return, I decided to go to China to look for her myself.
Chinese: 我哋面對嘅，唔係技術決定 而係社會決定

English: I realized I couldn't survive much longer this way.
Chinese: 等我哋做個正確決定 令最好嘅機器可以喺將來問世 就好似崇向運動嘅精神 發掘到運動潛能最勁嘅人咁

English: I knew the journey would be risky, but I would be risking my life either way.

English: I could die of starvation like my father in North Korea, or at least I could try for a better life by escaping to China.
Chinese: 佢哋係飛行器競技場 研究小組嘅現任成員

English: I had learned that many people tried to cross the border to China in the nighttime to avoid being seen.
Chinese: （掌聲） Federico Augugliaro, Dario Brescianini Markus Hehn, Sergei Lupashin Mark Muller 同 Robin Ritz

English: North Korean border guards often shoot and kill people trying to cross the border without permission.
Chinese: 請留意佢哋 佢哋日後一定會有偉大嘅成就

English: Chinese soldiers will catch and send back North Koreans, where they face severe punishment.
Chinese: 多謝大家 （掌聲）

English: I decided to cross during the day, first because I was still a kid and scared of the dark, second because I knew I was already taking a risk, and since not many people tried to cross during the day, I thought I might be able to cross without being seen by anyone.
I made it to China on February 15, 2006.
Chinese: 我喺北韓出世

English: I was 16 years old.
Chinese: 雖然我嘅家庭一直處於貧困狀態 但係我仲係得到屋企人對我嘅關愛 因為我係家中唯一嘅男丁 亦係兩個細路當中細嗰個

English: I thought things in China would be easier, since there was more food.
Chinese: 但係 1994 嗰年，大饑荒爆發

English: I thought more people would help me.

English: But it was harder than living in North Korea, because I was not free.

English: I was always worried about being caught and sent back.
Chinese: 我為咗搵嘢食而喺街上遊蕩 我見過一個母親孭住一個細路 個細路喺母親背脊食緊薯仔 我當時想偷佢薯仔

English: By a miracle, some months later, I met someone who was running an underground shelter for North Koreans, and was allowed to live there and eat regular meals for the first time in many years.
Chinese: 飢餓係虐待人、令人覺得絕望嘅一樣嘢

English: Later that year, an activist helped me escape China and go to the United States as a refugee.
Chinese: 對於一個受盡飢餓折磨嘅細路嚟講 政治同自由係根本諗都唔使諗

English: I went to America without knowing a word of English, yet my social worker told me that I had to go to high school.

English: Even in North Korea, I was an F student.
Chinese: 即使我當時仲好細 我可以感受到父母沉重嘅心

English: (Laughter) And I barely finished elementary school.
Chinese: 大約有一百萬北韓人因為嗰次饑荒餓死 而喺 2003 年，我 13 歲嗰年 我父親亦成為饑荒嘅受害者

English: And I remember I fought in school more than once a day.
Chinese: 我親眼目睹父親慢慢衰退嘅死亡

English: Textbooks and the library were not my playground.
Chinese: 喺同一年嘅某日，我嘅母親突然消失咗 然後我姐姐講比我知 母親去咗中國打工搵錢 但係佢會好快帶著金錢同食物返嚟

English: My father tried very hard to motivate me into studying, but it didn't work.
Chinese: 因為我哋之前從未分開過 而且我覺得我哋會永遠喺埋一齊 於是佢離開嘅時候 我甚至連擁抱過佢都冇

English: At one point, my father gave up on me.
Chinese: 呢個係我生命中犯咗嘅最大錯誤

English: He said, "You're not my son anymore."

English: I was only 11 or 12, but it hurt me deeply.

English: But nevertheless, my level of motivation still didn't change before he died.

English: So in America, it was kind of ridiculous that they said I should go to high school.

English: I didn't even go to middle school.

English: I decided to go, just because they told me to, without trying much.

English: But one day, I came home and my foster mother had made chicken wings for dinner.
Chinese: 我開始意識到，乞討解決唔到問題

English: And during dinner, I wanted to have one more wing, but I realized there were not enough for everyone, so I decided against it.

English: When I looked down at my plate, I saw the last chicken wing, that my foster father had given me his.

English: I was so happy.
Chinese: 有一次，我甚至喺一個煤礦度 工作咗兩個月 位於地底 33 米，無任何保護措施 每日工作 16 個鐘

English: I looked at him sitting next to me.

English: He just looked back at me very warmly, but said no words.

English: Suddenly I remembered my biological father.

English: My foster father's small act of love reminded me of my father, who would love to share his food with me when he was hungry, even if he was starving.

English: I felt so suffocated that I had so much food in America, yet my father died of starvation.

English: My only wish that night was to cook a meal for him, and that night I also thought of what else I could do to honor him.
Chinese: 我講緊嘅希望係令我相信 可以喺下一堆垃圾度搵到麵包 即使有時真係搵唔到

English: And my answer was to promise to myself that I would study hard and get the best education in America to honor his sacrifice.
Chinese: 但係如果我無呢個信念 我連試都唔去試嘅話 我就會死

English: I took school seriously, and for the first time ever in my life, I received an academic award for excellence, and made dean's list from the first semester in high school.

English: (Applause) That chicken wing changed my life.

English: (Laughter) Hope is personal. Hope is something that no one can give to you.

English: You have to choose to believe in hope.

English: You have to make it yourself.

English: Hope brought me to America.

English: My foster father at that dinner gave me a direction, and he motivated me and gave me a purpose to live in America.

English: I did not come here by myself.

English: Many people helped me along the way to get here.

English: North Koreans are fighting hard to survive.

English: Have hope for yourself, but also help each other.

English: Life can be hard for everyone, wherever you live.

English: My foster father didn't intend to change my life.

English: In the same way, you may also change someone's life with even the smallest act of love.

English: A piece of bread can satisfy your hunger, and having the hope will bring you bread to keep you alive.

English: But I confidently believe that your act of love and caring can also save another Joseph's life and change thousands of other Josephs who are still having hope to survive.

English: Thank you.

English: Joseph Kim: In Korean?

English: AH: You can do English, then Korean as well.

English: (Laughter) JK: Okay, I'm not going to make it any longer in Korean because I don't think I can make it without tearing up.

English: Nuna, it has been already 10 years that I haven’t seen you.

English: (Laughter) Yes, I'm just looking forward to seeing you, and if you can't find me, I will also look for you, and I hope to see you one day.

English: JK: I haven't spent much time with you, but I know that you still love me, and you probably still pray for me and think about me.

English: I just wanted to say thank you for letting me be in this world.

English: Thank you.

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 我養父對我嘅愛令我諗起我嘅父親 即使挨餓，甚至極寒交迫 父親都願意將佢嘅食物畀咗我先
美國有咁多嘢食令我好唔習慣 因為畢竟我嘅父親死於饑荒

English: I'll never forget that day back in the spring of 2006.

English: I was a surgical resident at The Johns Hopkins Hospital, taking emergency call.

English: I got paged by the E.R. around 2 in the morning to come and see a woman with a diabetic ulcer on her foot.

English: I can still remember sort of that smell of rotting flesh as I pulled the curtain back to see her.

English: And everybody there agreed this woman was very sick and she needed to be in the hospital.

English: That wasn't being asked.

English: The question that was being asked of me was a different one, which was, did she also need an amputation?

English: Now, looking back on that night, I'd love so desperately to believe that I treated that woman on that night with the same empathy and compassion I'd shown the 27-year-old newlywed who came to the E.R. three nights earlier with lower back pain that turned out to be advanced pancreatic cancer.
Chinese: 喺北韓，我令自己相信咗希望

English: In her case, I knew there was nothing I could do that was actually going to save her life.
