English: The cancer was too advanced.
Chinese: 但喺美國，我迷失咗，我唔知應該做咩 因為突然間我得到咁多自由

English: But I was committed to making sure that I could do anything possible to make her stay more comfortable. I brought her a warm blanket and a cup of a coffee.
Chinese: 嗰次晚飯我嘅養父畀咗我方向 佢鼓勵我，畀咗我嚟美國生活嘅目的

English: I brought some for her parents.
Chinese: 我並唔係自己一個人就嚟到呢度

English: But more importantly, see, I passed no judgment on her, because obviously she had done nothing to bring this on herself.
Chinese: 我雖然帶著希望嚟到美國 但係希望本身並唔夠嘅

English: So why was it that, just a few nights later, as I stood in that same E.R. and determined that my diabetic patient did indeed need an amputation, why did I hold her in such bitter contempt?
Chinese: 一路上，有好多人幫我嚟到呢度

English: You see, unlike the woman the night before, this woman had type 2 diabetes.
Chinese: 北韓人為咗生存而奮鬥

English: And we all know that's from eating too much and not exercising enough, right?
Chinese: 佢哋要強迫自己去生活落去 強迫自己抱著對生存嘅希望 但係如果無人幫手，係無法實現嘅

English: I mean, how hard can it be?
Chinese: 我留畀大家嘅說話就係︰

English: As I looked down at her in the bed, I thought to myself, if you just tried caring even a little bit, you wouldn't be in this situation at this moment with some doctor you've never met about to amputate your foot.
Chinese: 對自己要有希望，同時要彼此守望相助

English: Why did I feel justified in judging her?
Chinese: 無論你住邊度，生活都可以艱難

English: I'd like to say I don't know.
Chinese: 我嘅養父當時並無諗過改變我嘅人生

English: But I actually do.
Chinese: 但小小嘅關愛 你都可以改變一個人嘅一生

English: You see, in the hubris of my youth, I thought I had her all figured out.
Chinese: 一片麵包可以令你消除飢餓感 擁有希望可以為你帶嚟食物 令你繼續生存落去

English: She ate too much. She got unlucky.
Chinese: 我好相信 你嘅愛同關心 可以救到一個北韓人嘅生命 同改變成千上萬個 仍然抱著生存希望嘅北韓人

English: She got diabetes. Case closed.
Chinese: 多謝

English: Ironically, at that time in my life, I was also doing cancer research, immune-based therapies for melanoma, to be specific, and in that world I was actually taught to question everything, to challenge all assumptions and hold them to the highest possible scientific standards.
Chinese: （掌聲） 主持人： Joseph 多謝你同大家分享 非常私人而且特別嘅故事

English: Yet when it came to a disease like diabetes that kills Americans eight times more frequently than melanoma, I never once questioned the conventional wisdom.
Chinese: 我知道你一直無見過你嘅姐姐 正如你話齋將近有十年嘞 考慮到佢有可能睇到呢個大會 我哋想畀你同你姐姐講幾句

English: I actually just assumed the pathologic sequence of events was settled science.
Chinese: 講者︰用韓文嗎？

English: Three years later, I found out how wrong I was.
Chinese: 主持︰你可以先用英文然後再用韓文

English: But this time, I was the patient.
Chinese: (笑聲） 講者︰好嘅 但我覺得我唔會用韓文講好多 因為一講我就會淚流不止

English: Despite exercising three or four hours every single day, and following the food pyramid to the letter, I'd gained a lot of weight and developed something called metabolic syndrome.
Chinese: 努娜，已經有將近十年我無見到你喇

English: Some of you may have heard of this.
Chinese: 我只係想講我好掛住你，我愛你 你一定要嚟搵我，一定要好好生存

English: I had become insulin-resistant.
Chinese: 而且我…

English: You can think of insulin as this master hormone that controls what our body does with the foods we eat, whether we burn it or store it.
Chinese: 我仍然冇放棄再見到你嘅希望

English: This is called fuel partitioning in the lingo.
Chinese: 喺我見到你之前 我都會幸福咁生活落去 同埋努力讀書 而且我保證我唔會再喊

English: Now failure to produce enough insulin is incompatible with life.
Chinese: （笑聲） 係嘅，我只係希望能夠再見到你 如果你搵唔到我，我都會去搵你 我希望有一日會見返你

English: And insulin resistance, as its name suggests, is when your cells get increasingly resistant to the effect of insulin trying to do its job.
Chinese: 我可以同我媽咪都講兩句嗎？

English: Once you're insulin-resistant, you're on your way to getting diabetes, which is what happens when your pancreas can't keep up with the resistance and make enough insulin.
Chinese: 主持︰當然，請講

English: Now your blood sugar levels start to rise, and an entire cascade of pathologic events sort of spirals out of control that can lead to heart disease, cancer, even Alzheimer's disease, and amputations, just like that woman a few years earlier.
Chinese: 講者︰雖然我哋相處嘅時間唔多 但係我知道你依然愛我 並且你可能依然仲為我祈禱同掛住我

English: With that scare, I got busy changing my diet radically, adding and subtracting things most of you would find almost assuredly shocking.
Chinese: 我只係想多謝你將我帶嚟呢個世界

English: I did this and lost 40 pounds, weirdly while exercising less.
Chinese: 多謝

English: I, as you can see, I guess I'm not overweight anymore.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: More importantly, I don't have insulin resistance.
But most important, I was left with these three burning questions that wouldn't go away: How did this happen to me if I was supposedly doing everything right?
Chinese: 2006 年嘅春天 發生咗一件無辦法忘記嘅事

English: If the conventional wisdom about nutrition had failed me, was it possible it was failing someone else?
Chinese: 我當時係約翰斯 · 霍普金斯醫院 外科駐院醫生 負責急症

English: And underlying these questions, I became almost maniacally obsessed in trying to understand the real relationship between obesity and insulin resistance.
Chinese: 有朝凌晨兩點 急症室打嚟，叫我返去醫院 睇一個隻腳患咗糖尿病潰瘍嘅女病人

English: Now, most researchers believe obesity is the cause of insulin resistance.
Chinese: 我到而家都仲記得拉開塊簾 聞到一陣潰爛味

English: Logically, then, if you want to treat insulin resistance, you get people to lose weight, right?
Chinese: 所有人都認為呢位女士 病情嚴重，需要留醫

English: You treat the obesity.
Chinese: 咁呢當然啦仲使問

English: But what if we have it backwards?
Chinese: 但我當時仲有一個疑問 佢駛唔駛做切肢手術？

English: What if obesity isn't the cause of insulin resistance at all?
Chinese: 而家，諗返嗰晚嘅事 我拼命令自己相信 我對待呢一位女病人嘅心 同對另一位女病人嘅心，都係一樣 第二位病人 27 歲、結婚冇耐 就喺第一位病人入嚟急症室前嘅三日 因為下腰痛嚟到急症室 結果驗出比較後期嘅胰腺癌

English: In fact, what if it's a symptom of a much deeper problem, the tip of a proverbial iceberg?
Chinese: 我知道我做唔到咩保住佢嘅性命

English: I know it sounds crazy because we're obviously in the midst of an obesity epidemic, but hear me out.
Chinese: 癌症已經好後期

English: What if obesity is a coping mechanism for a far more sinister problem going on underneath the cell?
Chinese: 但我仍然向佢保證 我會盡一切努力令佢更加舒服 我帶咗佢一張毯同一杯咖啡

English: I'm not suggesting that obesity is benign, but what I am suggesting is it may be the lesser of two metabolic evils.
Chinese: 我亦都帶咗啲畀佢父母

English: You can think of insulin resistance as the reduced capacity of our cells to partition fuel, as I alluded to a moment ago, taking those calories that we take in and burning some appropriately and storing some appropriately.
Chinese: 但更重要嘅係，我冇批評過佢 因為好明顯，佢患呢個病係無辜嘅

English: When we become insulin-resistant, the homeostasis in that balance deviates from this state.
Chinese: 咁點解，幾晚之後，我喺同一間急症室 決定我嘅糖尿病人需要截肢？ 點解我會咁樣睇低佢呢？

English: So now, when insulin says to a cell, I want you to burn more energy than the cell considers safe, the cell, in effect, says, "No thanks, I'd actually rather store this energy."
Chinese: 同第二位女病人唔同 第一位病人有第二類糖尿病，而且肥胖

English: And because fat cells are actually missing most of the complex cellular machinery found in other cells, it's probably the safest place to store it.
Chinese: 我哋都知道第二類糖尿病 係因為食太多 同唔夠運動引起，係咪？

English: So for many of us, about 75 million Americans, the appropriate response to insulin resistance may actually be to store it as fat, not the reverse, getting insulin resistance in response to getting fat.
Chinese: 我嘅意思係 食少啲同做運動有幾難呢？

English: This is a really subtle distinction, but the implication could be profound.
Chinese: 我望住佢瞓喺床，心諗 如果你以前關心自己多啲 你而家就唔會俾醫生截肢

English: Consider the following analogy: Think of the bruise you get on your shin when you inadvertently bang your leg into the coffee table.
Chinese: 點解我會覺得咁樣評價佢係合理呢？

English: Sure, the bruise hurts like hell, and you almost certainly don't like the discolored look, but we all know the bruise per Se is not the problem.
Chinese: 我想答我唔知道

English: In fact, it's the opposite. It's a healthy response to the trauma, all of those immune cells rushing to the site of the injury to salvage cellular debris and prevent the spread of infection to elsewhere in the body.
Chinese: 但我其實心裏面係有原因

English: Now, imagine we thought bruises were the problem, and we evolved a giant medical establishment and a culture around treating bruises: masking creams, painkillers, you name it, all the while ignoring the fact that people are still banging their shins into coffee tables.
Chinese: 你睇下，年輕嘅我幾咁傲慢 覺得自己好了解病人

English: How much better would we be if we treated the cause -- telling people to pay attention when they walk through the living room -- rather than the effect?
Chinese: 認為病人因為食得太多，同埋唔好彩

English: Getting the cause and the effect right makes all the difference in the world.
Chinese: 所以患上糖尿病。完

English: Getting it wrong, and the pharmaceutical industry can still do very well for its shareholders but nothing improves for the people with bruised shins.
Chinese: 諷刺嘅係我當時做緊癌症研究 研究以免疫系統為本嘅黑色素瘤療法 研究裏面，我學到要凡事問問題 質疑所有假設 同埋將研究保持喺最高嘅科學標準

English: Cause and effect.
Chinese: 但講到一啲好似糖尿病咁嘅病 比黑色素瘤奪去多八倍美國人嘅病 我從未懷疑過前人知識

English: So what I'm suggesting is maybe we have the cause and effect wrong on obesity and insulin resistance.
Chinese: 我假設咗以前讀到嘅 病理發展次序係成形嘅科學

English: Maybe we should be asking ourselves, is it possible that insulin resistance causes weight gain and the diseases associated with obesity, at least in most people?
Chinese: 三年後，我終於明白自己有幾錯

English: What if being obese is just a metabolic response to something much more threatening, an underlying epidemic, the one we ought to be worried about?
Chinese: 但今次，我係一個病人

English: Let's look at some suggestive facts.
Chinese: 雖然我每日都會做三至四個鐘運動 並且不折不扣跟足食物金字塔 我嘅體重仍然增加 而且患上咗代謝症候群

English: We know that 30 million obese Americans in the United States don't have insulin resistance.
Chinese: 可能在座有人會聽過呢個病

English: And by the way, they don't appear to be at any greater risk of disease than lean people.
Chinese: 我個身體突然抗拒胰島素

English: Conversely, we know that six million lean people in the United States are insulin-resistant, and by the way, they appear to be at even greater risk for those metabolic diseases I mentioned a moment ago than their obese counterparts.
Chinese: 各位可以想像胰島素係一種主要激素 控制身體對食咗嘅食物作出反應 話畀身體知消耗定儲存食物

English: Now I don't know why, but it might be because, in their case, their cells haven't actually figured out the right thing to do with that excess energy.
Chinese: 呢個生理反應叫能量分區

English: So if you can be obese and not have insulin resistance, and you can be lean and have it, this suggests that obesity may just be a proxy for what's going on.
Chinese: 產生唔到足夠胰島素係難以令人生活

English: So what if we're fighting the wrong war, fighting obesity rather than insulin resistance?
Chinese: 而抗胰島素，顧名思義 就係細胞對胰島素所做嘅嘢愈嚟愈抗拒

English: Even worse, what if blaming the obese means we're blaming the victims?
Chinese: 當你係抗胰島素，糖尿病就會埋你身 你嘅胰腺就會因為抗胰島素嘅關係 製造唔到足夠嘅胰島素

English: What if some of our fundamental ideas about obesity are just wrong?
Chinese: 血糖於是會上升 然後病情就會失控 最終引致心臟病、癌症 阿爾茨海默氏病，同埋截肢 即係好似幾年前嗰位女士咁樣

English: Personally, I can't afford the luxury of arrogance anymore, let alone the luxury of certainty.
Chinese: 因為我好驚會變成咁 所以我徹底改變咗飲食習慣 飲食上開始食加同減一啲 大部分人會驚訝嘅嘢

English: I have my own ideas about what could be at the heart of this, but I'm wide open to others.
Chinese: 做咗之後令我輕咗 40 磅 奇怪嘅係我做少咗運動

English: Now, my hypothesis, because everybody always asks me, is this.
Chinese: 大家見到，我已經唔再超重

English: If you ask yourself, what's a cell trying to protect itself from when it becomes insulin resistant, the answer probably isn't too much food.
Chinese: 更重要嘅係，抗胰島素無再發生

English: It's more likely too much glucose: blood sugar.
Chinese: 但最重要嘅係 我仲有三個急需解決嘅問題︰ 假如我嘅生活習慣係健康 咁點解呢個病係會發生喺我身上呢？

English: Now, we know that refined grains and starches elevate your blood sugar in the short run, and there's even reason to believe that sugar may lead to insulin resistance directly.
Chinese: 如果有關營養嘅舊有知識 對我唔適用嘅話 會唔會對其他人都係咁？

English: So if you put these physiological processes to work, I'd hypothesize that it might be our increased intake of refined grains, sugars and starches that's driving this epidemic of obesity and diabetes, but through insulin resistance, you see, and not necessarily through just overeating and under-exercising.
Chinese: 問咗呢啲問題之後 我更加想了解 肥胖同抗胰島素之間嘅真正關係

English: When I lost my 40 pounds a few years ago, I did it simply by restricting those things, which admittedly suggests I have a bias based on my personal experience.
Chinese: 如今，大部分學者都相信 肥胖係抗胰島素嘅原因

English: But that doesn't mean my bias is wrong, and most important, all of this can be tested scientifically.
Chinese: 咁照邏輯推理，如果想醫好抗胰島素 我哋就要鼓勵啲人減肥，係咪？

English: But step one is accepting the possibility that our current beliefs about obesity, diabetes and insulin resistance could be wrong and therefore must be tested.
Chinese: 所以我哋要醫肥胖

English: I'm betting my career on this.
Chinese: 但係如果個關係調轉呢？

English: Today, I devote all of my time to working on this problem, and I'll go wherever the science takes me.
Chinese: 如果肥胖根本唔係抗胰島素嘅原因？

English: I've decided that what I can't and won't do anymore is pretend I have the answers when I don't.
Chinese: 如果肥胖反映緊一個更深嘅問題？

English: I've been humbled enough by all I don't know.
Chinese: 我知咁講好似好癲 因為我哋都經歷梗肥胖流行病嘅爆發 但請先聽我講

English: For the past year, I've been fortunate enough to work on this problem with the most amazing team of diabetes and obesity researchers in the country, and the best part is, just like Abraham Lincoln surrounded himself with a team of rivals, we've done the same thing.
Chinese: 如果肥胖係一個機制 畀我哋抵禦更加兇險嘅細胞問題？

English: We've recruited a team of scientific rivals, the best and brightest who all have different hypotheses for what's at the heart of this epidemic.
Chinese: 我唔係講緊肥胖係好事 但我認為肥胖係兩種代謝問題之中 影響比較輕微嗰個

English: Some think it's too many calories consumed.
Chinese: 你可以將抗胰島素諗成 細胞獲取能量嘅能力下降 就好似我頭先提到 當我哋攝取卡路里嘅時候 我哋會將部分消耗同部分儲存

English: Others think it's too much dietary fat.
Chinese: 當我哋患上抗胰島素時 消耗同儲存嘅平衡就會消失

English: Others think it's too many refined grains and starches.
Chinese: 宜家當胰島素同細胞講 「我要你消耗更多能量」 但因為細胞覺得消耗率大過安全水平 所以會話「唔駛啦，我會蓄能量」

English: But this team of multi-disciplinary, highly skeptical and exceedingly talented researchers do agree on two things.
Chinese: 而由於脂肪細胞欠缺 其他細胞大部分複雜嘅細胞機制 所以佢哋係一個安全嘅地方儲存能量

English: First, this problem is just simply too important to continue ignoring because we think we know the answer.
Chinese: 所以對於我哋好多美國人嚟講 即係七千五百萬人嚟講 對抗胰島素最合適嘅做法 反而係我哋儲存脂肪 而唔係因為肥胖所以有抗胰島素

English: And two, if we're willing to be wrong, if we're willing to challenge the conventional wisdom with the best experiments science can offer, we can solve this problem.
Chinese: 呢兩個次序雖然分別唔大，但意義深遠

English: I know it's tempting to want an answer right now, some form of action or policy, some dietary prescription -- eat this, not that — but if we want to get it right, we're going to have to do much more rigorous science before we can write that prescription.
Chinese: 大家嘗試諗下以下比喻： 當你唔小心俾茶几撞到隻腳時 皮膚會有瘀傷

English: Briefly, to address this, our research program is focused around three meta-themes, or questions.
Chinese: 當然，瘀傷係好痛 你亦都唔會鍾意變咗色嘅皮膚 但我哋知道瘀傷唔係問題

English: First, how do the various foods we consume impact our metabolism, hormones and enzymes, and through what nuanced molecular mechanisms?
Chinese: 相反，佢係對創傷嘅一個健康反應 所有免疫細胞趕去受傷嘅地方 阻止細胞殘骸擴散 同埋防止身體其他部位受到感染

English: Second, based on these insights, can people make the necessary changes in their diets in a way that's safe and practical to implement?
Chinese: 而家，假設我哋覺得瘀傷係一個問題 而且研發到一種醫學技術 同埋形成一種文化去治療瘀傷 當中包括有掩蔽霜、止痛藥 各種你哋諗到嘅嘢都有 但係我哋忽略咗 人仍然會撞到茶几呢個事實

English: And finally, once we identify what safe and practical changes people can make to their diet, how can we move their behavior in that direction so that it becomes more the default rather than the exception?
Chinese: 如果我哋根治呢個原因 叫人喺客廳行嘅時候小心啲 而唔係對付個後果 你話係咪好得多呢？

English: Just because you know what to do doesn't mean you're always going to do it.
Chinese: 搞清原因同後果，世界從此會好唔同

English: Sometimes we have to put cues around people to make it easier, and believe it or not, that can be studied scientifically.
Chinese: 攪錯咗嘅話 醫藥行業可以仍然會發展得好好 但人嘅小腿嘅瘀傷點都唔會有改善

English: I don't know how this journey is going to end, but this much seems clear to me, at least: We can't keep blaming our overweight and diabetic patients like I did.
Chinese: 講到因果關係

English: Most of them actually want to do the right thing, but they have to know what that is, and it's got to work.
Chinese: 所以我要講嘅係 可能我哋攪錯咗 肥胖同抗胰島素嘅因果關係

English: I dream of a day when our patients can shed their excess pounds and cure themselves of insulin resistance, because as medical professionals, we've shed our excess mental baggage and cured ourselves of new idea resistance sufficiently to go back to our original ideals: open minds, the courage to throw out yesterday's ideas when they don't appear to be working, and the understanding that scientific truth isn't final, but constantly evolving.
Chinese: 我哋可能要問問自己 喺至少大部分人當中 抗胰島素有冇可能導致肥胖 同各種同肥胖相關嘅疾病呢？

English: Staying true to that path will be better for our patients and better for science.
Chinese: 肥胖會唔會只係一樣 對更有威脅嘅嘢嘅反應呢？ 例如隱性病 咁我哋需唔需要擔心呢？

English: If obesity is nothing more than a proxy for metabolic illness, what good does it do us to punish those with the proxy?
Chinese: 我哋睇下一啲事實

English: Sometimes I think back to that night in the E.R.
Chinese: 有三千萬肥胖嘅美國人係無抗胰島素

English: I wish I could speak with that woman again.
Chinese: 佢哋唔會比瘦嘅人有更大嘅疾病風險

English: I'd like to tell her how sorry I am.
Chinese: 相反，美國有六百萬瘦嘅人有抗胰島素 佢哋比肥胖嘅人更加易患上 剛才提及嘅代謝性疾病嘅風險

English: I'd say, as a doctor, I delivered the best clinical care I could, but as a human being, I let you down.
Chinese: 我唔知原因，但有可能因為 佢哋嘅細胞唔知點樣應對多咗嘅能量

English: You didn't need my judgment and my contempt.

English: The problem I see is that, ultimately, the clash of how we solve that problem of serving those three billion people that need a home, and climate change, are a head-on collision about to happen, or already happening.

English: When a tree grows in the forest and gives off oxygen and soaks up carbon dioxide, and it dies and it falls to the forest floor, it gives that carbon dioxide back to the atmosphere or into the ground.
If it burns in a forest fire, it's going to give that carbon back to the atmosphere as well.

English: It just happens to be that Mother Nature holds the patent, and we don't really feel comfortable with it.

English: The first was that sleep disruption actually precedes certain types of mental illness, and we've shown that in those young individuals who are at high risk of developing bipolar disorder, they already have a sleep abnormality prior to any clinical diagnosis of bipolar.

English: And the third, which I think is the most exciting, is that we can think of the sleep centers within the brain as a new therapeutic target.

English: And we finished by saying that an understanding of the neuroscience of sleep is really informing the way we think about some of the causes of mental illness, and indeed is providing us new ways to treat these incredibly debilitating conditions.

English: Then I realized, maybe that's a little bit lofty for now.

English: And today, we hope to convince you that now we are actually able to activate a memory in the brain at the speed of light.

English: XL: When you zoom in into the hippocampus, of course you will see lots of cells, but we are able to find which cells are involved in a particular memory, because whenever a cell is active, like when it's forming a memory, it will also leave a footprint that will later allow us to know these cells are recently active.
Chinese: 只要我哋穩定 容易患精神病嘅人嘅睡眠質量 佢哋就肯定會更加健康 同時可以減輕部份嚇人嘅精神病症狀

English: SR: So the same way that building lights at night let you know that somebody's probably working there at any given moment, in a very real sense, there are biological sensors within a cell that are turned on only when that cell was just working.

English: XL: So we clipped part of this sensor, and attached that to a switch to control the cells, and we packed this switch into an engineered virus and injected that into the brain of the mice.

English: So whenever a memory is being formed, any active cells for that memory will also have this switch installed.

English: (Laughter) Even harder was getting paint to stick to the acid in a grapefruit.
Chinese: 宜家，實驗室人員 甚至可以喺雄性老鼠當中 啟動佢哋對雌性老鼠嘅記憶 有流傳話人員有好愉快嘅經歷

English: It just would erase my brush strokes like invisible ink.
Chinese: 劉︰我哋正生活喺一個好開心嘅時刻 因為呢一刻科學除咗受制於 我哋嘅想像力之外，就再冇限制

English: I'd put something down, and instantly it would be gone.
Chinese: 史︰最後，我哋做到啲咩呢？

English: And if I wanted to paint on people, well, I was a little bit embarrassed to bring people down into my studio and show them that I spent my days in a basement putting paint on toast.
Chinese: 我哋點樣繼續發展呢一個技術？

English: It just seemed like it made more sense to practice by painting on myself.
Chinese: 呢啲問題唔應該剩係留返畀 實驗室嘅人解答 我哋今日演講嘅目的就係令所有人 知道現代神經科學有可能嘅事 但宜家重要嘅係 令所有人都參與個討論

English: One of my favorite models actually ended up being a retired old man who not only didn't mind sitting still and getting the paint in his ears, but he also didn't really have much embarrassment about being taken out into very public places for exhibition, like the Metro.
Chinese: 等我哋好似一個團隊咁一齊諗下 神經科學可以做到啲咩 我哋可以點樣繼續往前走 因為劉同我都認為 我哋所有人面前都有一啲重大決定要做

English: I was having so much fun with this process.
Chinese: 史、劉︰多謝

English: I was teaching myself how to paint in all these different styles, and I wanted to see what else I could do with it.
Chinese: （鼓掌）

English: I came together with a collaborator, Sheila Vand, and we had the idea of creating paintings in a more unusual surface, and that was milk.
We got a pool. We filled it with milk.
Chinese: 仔細睇下

English: We filled it with Sheila. And I began painting.
Chinese: 呢幅畫其實唔只表面咁簡單

English: And the images were always completely unexpected in the end, because I could have a very specific image about how it would turn out, I could paint it to match that, but the moment that Sheila laid back into the milk, everything would change.
Chinese: 雖然，呢幅係畫一個男人嘅亞加力畫 但係我冇畫喺畫布上

English: It was in constant flux, and we had to, rather than fight it, embrace it, see where the milk would take us and compensate to make it even better.
Chinese: 我直接畫喺嗰個男人身上

English: Sometimes, when Sheila would lay down in the milk, it would wash all the paint off of her arms, and it might seem a little bit clumsy, but our solution would be, okay, hide your arms.
Chinese: 我唔用畫布 如果我想畫你嘅肖像 我會直接畫喺你身上

English: And one time, she got so much milk in her hair that it just smeared all the paint off of her face.
Chinese: 即係話你會被搽上好多顏料 包括你嘅耳仔 因為我需要喺你嘅耳仔上面畫你嘅耳仔

English: All right, well, hide your face.
Chinese: 呢度所有嘢︰人、衫、凳、牆 全都油上一層顏料 咁樣係為咗直接模仿人同物件 透過呢一種方式 我就可以將一個立體環境整到平面畫咁

English: And we ended up with something far more elegant than we could have imagined, even though this is essentially the same solution that a frustrated kid uses when he can't draw hands, just hiding them in the pockets.
Chinese: 就算我由唔同角度影相 出嚟嘅效果都仍然係平面咁

English: When we started out on the milk project, and when I started out, I couldn't have foreseen that I would go from pursuing my dream in politics and working at a desk to tripping over a shadow and then turning people into paintings and painting on people in a pool of milk.
Chinese: Photoshop 我都冇用過

English: But then again, I guess it's also not unforeseeable that you can find the strange in the familiar, as long as you're willing to look beyond what's already been brought to light, that you can see what's below the surface, hiding in the shadows, and recognize that there can be more there than meets the eye.
Chinese: 呢張係我其中一幅立體畫嘅相

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 你可能會問︰ 點解我會有呢啲諗法將人變成畫

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 但其實一開始嘅時候 我冇諗過對人或者顏料做啲乜嘢
最初諗法只係同影有關

English: I have a confession to make.
Chinese: 我覺得冇光線呢樣嘢好吸引 我想搵一種方法可以令影實物化 喺影改變之前將佢定型

English: But first, I want you to make a little confession to me.
Chinese: 於我就想畫低啲影

English: In the past year, I want you to just raise your hand if you've experienced relatively little stress.
Chinese: 我好想可以喺影裏面 收埋油上咗顏料嘅我 令我可以幾乎隱形 直至光線唔同咗，然後突然間 我嘅影會出現喺光線之下

English: Anyone?
Chinese: 我想睇下仲有咩地方我可以畫影嘅 然後我諗起我朋友 Bernie

English: How about a moderate amount of stress?
Chinese: 但我唔只想畫影，我仲想做到加強

English: Who has experienced a lot of stress?
Chinese: 同埋喺佢身上用灰階顏色畫

English: Yeah. Me too.
Chinese: 我好清楚作品會係點嘅樣 所以當我畫緊佢嘅時候 我好小心跟足我嘅構思去畫

English: But that is not my confession.
Chinese: 但有啲嘢一直喺我眼前閃

English: My confession is this: I am a health psychologist, and my mission is to help people be happier and healthier.
Chinese: 我當時唔係好清楚我睇到嘅係咩嘢

English: But I fear that something I've been teaching for the last 10 years is doing more harm than good, and it has to do with stress.
Chinese: 然後當我褪後去睇嗰陣 神奇嘅嘢就發生咗

English: For years I've been telling people, stress makes you sick.
Chinese: 我將我嘅朋友變成咗一幅畫

English: It increases the risk of everything from the common cold to cardiovascular disease.
Chinese: 我最初諗唔到當我畫影嘅時候 我會將另一個空間成個帶咗出嚟 然後再將個人融返入去 估唔到我畫畫會變成畫我嘅朋友 甚至將朋友擺返落畫裡邊

English: Basically, I've turned stress into the enemy.
Chinese: 我心裡面有啲矛盾 因為一方面我為到 我自己發現嘅嘢覺得興奮 但另一方面，我嗰時啱啱大學畢業 攞咗政治學學位 以前成日夢想去華盛頓做政府工

English: But I have changed my mind about stress, and today, I want to change yours.
Chinese: （笑聲） 為咩我會提起呢件事呢？

English: Let me start with the study that made me rethink my whole approach to stress.
Chinese: 係因為我做咗個好艱難嘅決定 決定畢業之後放棄到美國國會工作 反而返咗去我父母屋企嘅地下室學畫畫

English: This study tracked 30,000 adults in the United States for eight years, and they started by asking people, "How much stress have you experienced in the last year?"
Chinese: 我當時唔知道邊度入手

English: They also asked, "Do you believe that stress is harmful for your health?"
Chinese: 對上一次我畫畫嘅時候係 16 歲 當時喺夏令營裡面 當時我唔想透過抄襲以前大師作品 或係攤開畫布反複咁喺畫布上面畫 嚟自學畫畫 因為對我嚟講，畫畫唔應該係咁

English: And then they used public death records to find out who died.
Chinese: 畫畫應該係關於空間同光線

English: (Laughter) Okay.
Chinese: 我早期嘅畫布都係啲你諗唔到嘅嘢 就好似用煎炸食物做畫布咁

English: People who experienced a lot of stress in the previous year had a 43 percent increased risk of dying.
Chinese: 所以係幾乎冇可能 將顏料搽上雞蛋嘅油脂度

English: But that was only true for the people who also believed that stress is harmful for your health.
Chinese: （笑聲） 更加難去將顏料黐喺柚子嘅果酸度

English: (Laughter) People who experienced a lot of stress but did not view stress as harmful were no more likely to die.
Chinese: 因為果酸只會抹走筆觸嘅顏料 就好似隱形墨水一樣

English: In fact, they had the lowest risk of dying of anyone in the study, including people who had relatively little stress.
Chinese: 當我畫一筆，顏料就咁唔見咗

English: Now the researchers estimated that over the eight years they were tracking deaths, 182,000 Americans died prematurely, not from stress, but from the belief that stress is bad for you.
Chinese: 假如我想喺人上面畫… 我會帶人嚟我嘅工作室 畀佢哋知道我嘅日子喺地下室過 畀佢哋知道我喺多士上面油顏料 但咁樣我會覺得尷尬

English: (Laughter) That is over 20,000 deaths a year.
Chinese: 似乎喺我身上練習畫畫更加適當

English: Now, if that estimate is correct, that would make believing stress is bad for you the 15th largest cause of death in the United States last year, killing more people than skin cancer, HIV/AIDS and homicide.
Chinese: 其中一個我最鍾意嘅模特兒 係一位退休老人 佢不但唔介意坐定定唔郁 由得顏料搽喺佢耳仔裏面 而且仲冇因為我帶佢出去公眾場所 好似地鐵咁——展出而尷尬

English: (Laughter) You can see why this study freaked me out.
Chinese: 成個過程中我有好多樂趣

English: Here I've been spending so much energy telling people stress is bad for your health.
Chinese: 我教自己點樣用唔同風格畫 同時我想知道我仲有咩可以試

English: So this study got me wondering: Can changing how you think about stress make you healthier?
Chinese: 我今日帶咗一位拍檔，Sheila Vand 我哋都覺得畫 可以喺唔平凡嘅介面上面畫 嗰個係牛奶

English: And here the science says yes.
Chinese: 我哋搵嚟咗一個水池 我哋將牛奶倒入去

English: When you change your mind about stress, you can change your body's response to stress.
Chinese: Sheila 都走埋入去 然後我開始畫

English: Now to explain how this works, I want you all to pretend that you are participants in a study designed to stress you out.
Chinese: 畫出嚟嘅嘢永遠都係意想不到 雖然我腦裏面有一幅好確切嘅圖 好清楚會畫成點 我亦會跟著幅圖去畫出嚟 但係當 Sheila 用背脊 浸入牛奶嘅一刻 所有嘢都變

English: It's called the social stress test.
Chinese: 啲嘢流動緊 而我哋用「既來之，則安之」 嘅方式處理 唔係要同牛奶抗衡 而係順著牛奶嘅流動作出修補 令幅畫更加好

English: You come into the laboratory, and you're told you have to give a five-minute impromptu speech on your personal weaknesses to a panel of expert evaluators sitting right in front of you, and to make sure you feel the pressure, there are bright lights and a camera in your face, kind of like this.
Chinese: 有時 Sheila 成個人浸入牛奶 牛奶會沖走佢手臂嘅顏料 令到睇起嚟有啲笨拙 我哋嘅解決方法係，將佢嘅手臂都遮住

English: (Laughter) And the evaluators have been trained to give you discouraging, non-verbal feedback, like this.
Chinese: 仲有一次，佢嘅頭髮吸咗好多牛奶 令面上面嘅顏料通通都溶咗

English: (Exhales) (Laughter) Now that you're sufficiently demoralized, time for part two: a math test.
Chinese: 所以我嗰陣話︰ 「好，咁嘅話，將你塊臉遮著。」

English: And unbeknownst to you, the experimenter has been trained to harass you during it.
Chinese: 最後我哋嘅作品比當初構思嘅更加靚 呢個方法同小朋友因為畫唔到手 所以將手畫到插咗入袋一樣

English: Now we're going to all do this together.
Chinese: 當我哋開始牛奶計劃時 我預料唔到我嘅將來 會由我追政治夢、坐喺辦公室工作 到誤打誤撞發現「影子」呢個概念 繼而將人哋變成畫作 喺牛奶池裡面畫人

English: It's going to be fun.
Chinese: 話說回來，我諗 你喺熟識嘅事物裡面 搵到奇怪嘅嘢根本係有可能 只要你唔好剩係望擺喺眼前嘅事物 而係望事物蘊藏咗嘅嘢 埋藏喺陰影嘅嘢 你會發現更多嘅可能

English: Okay.
Chinese: 多謝各位

English: (Laughter) I want you all to count backwards from 996 in increments of seven.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: You're going to do this out loud, as fast as you can, starting with 996.
Go!
Chinese: 我要坦白一個事實

English: (Audience counting) Go faster. Faster please.
Chinese: 但係首先，我希望你哋能夠對我坦白

English: You're going too slow.
Chinese: 喺過去嘅一年裡面——舉手就得喇 你有冇經歷過相對較小嘅壓力？

English: (Audience counting) Stop. Stop, stop, stop.
Chinese: 有冇人？

English: That guy made a mistake.
Chinese: 咁中等嘅壓力呢？

English: We are going to have to start all over again.
Chinese: 邊個又經歷過好大嘅壓力？

English: (Laughter) You're not very good at this, are you?
Chinese: 好嘅。我都有

English: Okay, so you get the idea.
Chinese: 但係呢樣唔係我要坦白嘅

English: If you were actually in this study, you'd probably be a little stressed out.
Chinese: 我要坦白嘅係：我係一個健康心理學家 我嘅任務係令人哋更加嘅開心同健康

English: Your heart might be pounding, you might be breathing faster, maybe breaking out into a sweat.
Chinese: 但係，我恐怕過去十年我一直所教嘅嘢 壞處多過好處 當中原由同壓力有關

English: And normally, we interpret these physical changes as anxiety or signs that we aren't coping very well with the pressure.
Chinese: 多年嚟，我一直話畀人哋聽 壓力令你病

English: But what if you viewed them instead as signs that your body was energized, was preparing you to meet this challenge?
Chinese: 壓力增加患上所有疾病嘅風險： 從普通感冒到心血管疾病

English: Now that is exactly what participants were told in a study conducted at Harvard University.
Chinese: 所以，我將壓力當作係敵人

English: Before they went through the social stress test, they were taught to rethink their stress response as helpful.
Chinese: 但係，我已經改咗對壓力嘅睇法 而且我想你哋改變對壓力嘅睇法

English: That pounding heart is preparing you for action.
Chinese: 等我哋由呢一個 令我重新思考壓力嘅研究開始

English: If you're breathing faster, it's no problem.
Chinese: 呢個研究用八年時間 追蹤咗三萬個美國成年人 研究問嘅問題係︰ 「喺過去嘅一年裡面， 你經歷過幾多壓力？」

English: It's getting more oxygen to your brain.
Chinese: 研究又問：「你哋相唔相信 壓力對你嘅健康有害？」

English: And participants who learned to view the stress response as helpful for their performance, well, they were less stressed out, less anxious, more confident, but the most fascinating finding to me was how their physical stress response changed.
Chinese: 之後，研究員翻查公眾死亡記錄 嚟確定邊個死亡

English: Now, in a typical stress response, your heart rate goes up, and your blood vessels constrict like this.
Chinese: （笑聲） 先講一啲壞消息

English: And this is one of the reasons that chronic stress is sometimes associated with cardiovascular disease.
Chinese: 嗰啲喺過去嘅一年經歷好多壓力嘅人 死亡風險增加咗 43%

English: It's not really healthy to be in this state all the time.
Chinese: 但係呢個結果係講緊嗰啲 相信壓力對健康有害嘅人

English: But in the study, when participants viewed their stress response as helpful, their blood vessels stayed relaxed like this.
Chinese: （笑聲） 嗰啲經歷好多壓力 但唔認為壓力對身體有害嘅人 唔會話容易死亡

English: Their heart was still pounding, but this is a much healthier cardiovascular profile.
Chinese: 實際上，佢哋嘅死亡風險 喺呢個研究嘅所有對象當中 包括嗰啲經歷相對少壓力嘅人當中

English: It actually looks a lot like what happens in moments of joy and courage.
Chinese: 係最低嘅 目前，研究員估計 喺過去佢哋追蹤死亡嘅八年當中 有 182,000 個美國人 冇因為壓力而提早死亡 而係因為信咗壓力對佢哋嘅健康有害

English: Over a lifetime of stressful experiences, this one biological change could be the difference between a stress-induced heart attack at age 50 and living well into your 90s.
Chinese: （笑聲） 即係話，每年會有 超過二萬人因為咁而死亡

English: And this is really what the new science of stress reveals, that how you think about stress matters.
Chinese: 如果呢一估計係正確嘅話 相信壓力對身體有害呢一個觀念 就會變成舊年美國第十五大死亡原因 排喺皮膚癌、愛滋病同謀殺前面

English: So my goal as a health psychologist has changed.
Chinese: （笑聲） 可想而知我睇到 呢個研究嗰陣有幾錯愕

English: I no longer want to get rid of your stress.
Chinese: 過去，我一直花費大量精神話畀人知 壓力對你嘅健康有害

English: I want to make you better at stress.
Chinese: 所以呢個研究令我諗： 改變你對壓力嘅態度 會唔會令你更加健康？

English: And we just did a little intervention.
Chinese: 科學話畀我哋聽的確係咁

English: If you raised your hand and said you'd had a lot of stress in the last year, we could have saved your life, because hopefully the next time your heart is pounding from stress, you're going to remember this talk and you're going to think to yourself, this is my body helping me rise to this challenge.
Chinese: 當你改變對壓力嘅睇法時 你就能夠改變身體對壓力嘅反應

English: And when you view stress in that way, your body believes you, and your stress response becomes healthier.
Chinese: 要解釋個原理 我想你哋都想像自己參與 一個特登令到你感覺到壓力嘅研究

English: Now I said I have over a decade of demonizing stress to redeem myself from, so we are going to do one more intervention.
Chinese: 呢一個研究叫做社會壓力測試

English: I want to tell you about one of the most under-appreciated aspects of the stress response, and the idea is this: Stress makes you social.
Chinese: 你入去實驗室 你被告知要坐喺你專家評委面前 即場做一個五分鐘嘅演講 講你嘅性格弱點 為咗等你感受到壓力 會有好強嘅燈光同攝影機 好似咁樣

English: To understand this side of stress, we need to talk about a hormone, oxytocin, and I know oxytocin has already gotten as much hype as a hormone can get.
Chinese: （笑聲） 呢啲評委，事先訓練好 畀你非言語上嘅消極反應 好似咁樣（吸氣）

English: It even has its own cute nickname, the cuddle hormone, because it's released when you hug someone.
Chinese: （笑聲） 宜家，你已經夠曬失落 然後你就要嚟到第二部分：數學測驗

English: But this is a very small part of what oxytocin is involved in.
Chinese: 令你措手不及嘅係 實驗人員喺過程中不斷咁騷擾你

English: Oxytocin is a neuro-hormone.
Chinese: 宜家等我哋一齊嚟做呢個實驗

English: It fine-tunes your brain's social instincts.
Chinese: 對我嚟講會係好歡樂嘅時刻

English: It primes you to do things that strengthen close relationships.
Chinese: （笑聲）

English: Oxytocin makes you crave physical contact with your friends and family.
Chinese: 我希望你哋所有人倒數數字 由 996 開始以 7 遞減

English: It enhances your empathy.
Chinese: 你哋必須大聲講出嚟 盡可能嘅快，由 996 開始

English: It even makes you more willing to help and support the people you care about.
Chinese: 開始！

English: Some people have even suggested we should snort oxytocin...
Chinese: （聽眾倒數） 快啲。快啲

English: to become more compassionate and caring.
Chinese: 你哋太慢喇（聽眾倒數）

English: But here's what most people don't understand about oxytocin.
Chinese: 停，停，停，停，停

English: It's a stress hormone.
Chinese: 呢位男士數錯咗

English: Your pituitary gland pumps this stuff out as part of the stress response.
Chinese: 我哋必須從新開始

English: It's as much a part of your stress response as the adrenaline that makes your heart pound.
Chinese: 你哋都唔擅於減數，係嗎？

English: And when oxytocin is released in the stress response, it is motivating you to seek support.
Chinese: 所以，你哋宜家知道嗰種感覺喇

English: Your biological stress response is nudging you to tell someone how you feel, instead of bottling it up.
Chinese: 如果你哋真係參與呢個研究 你哋應該會有一啲壓力

English: Your stress response wants to make sure you notice when someone else in your life is struggling so that you can support each other.
Chinese: 你嘅心臟或者會砰砰跳 呼吸可能加快，亦可能會流汗

English: When life is difficult, your stress response wants you to be surrounded by people who care about you.

Chinese: 我曾經喺聯合國組織 做過發展同農業嘅工作

English: The old-fashioned lightbulbs, the incandescent bulbs -- I'm not going to ask for a show of hands of how many of you still have them in your homes, wasting energy every time you switch them on -- change them after this -- or whether we have them on the stage here at TED or not -- but those old incandescent light bulbs really should have been sold as heaters.
Chinese: 經過一共 25 年嘅工作 三年前，我同宜家家居嘅總裁講 想加入佢嘅隊伍

English: They were mis-sold for more than a hundred years.
Chinese: 好似在座各位一樣 我想對世界有最大嘅影響 我會解釋點解我加入嗰個隊伍

English: They produced heat and a little bit of light on the side.
Chinese: 但首先，等我哋睇下￼三個數字

English: Now we have lights that produce light and a little bit of heat on the side.
Chinese: 第一個數字係三 代表三十億人

English: You save 85 percent of the electricity with an LED that you would have done in an old incandescent.
Chinese: 呢個數字表示到 2030 年 全球將會有三十億人脫離貧窮 加入中產階級

English: And the best thing is, they'll also last for more than 20 years.
Chinese: 對於佢哋同佢哋家人嚟講，係非常好 但全世界已經有二十億中產人士 所以總數會增加到五十億 喺我哋資源缺乏下，情況更加嚴峻

English: So think about that.
Chinese: 第二個數字係六 六表示温度 指全球變暖嘅温度

English: You'll change your smartphone seven or eight times, probably more if you're in this audience.
Chinese: 我哋唔係增加一度、三度或者四度 而係增加六度

English: You'll change your car, if you have one, three or four times.
Chinese: 當你認真諗下，我哋係過去幾年 所經歷嘅極端天氣 大部分都只係因為一度 就算我哋想全球 二氧化碳排放量減少 都要等呢個十年結束之前 達到最高峰 先至可以回落

English: Your kids could go to school, go to college, go away and have kids of their own, come back, bring the grandkids, you'll have the same lightbulb saving you energy.
Chinese: 呢個唔係無可避免，但我哋要果斷行動

English: So LEDs are fantastic.
Chinese: 第三個數字係十二 即係我阿嫲出世嗰陣 世界上擁有一百萬 或以上人口嘅城市數量

English: What we decided to do was not to sell LEDs on the side marked up high and continue to push all the old bulbs, the halogens and the CFLs.
Chinese: 你可以見到我阿嫲係￼度

English: We decided, over the next two years, we will ban the halogens and the CFLs ourselves.
Chinese: 講緊係上個世紀頭嘅時候 只有十二個城市

English: We will go all in.
Chinese: 我阿嫲喺曼徹斯特出世 曼徹斯特係嗰時 全世界第九大城市

English: And this is what business needs to do: go all-in, go 100 percent, because then you stop investing in the old stuff, you invest in the new stuff, you lower costs, you use your supply chain and your creativity and you get the prices down so everybody can afford the best lights so they can save energy.
Chinese: 但全世界而家就有大概五百個 一百萬或以上人口嘅城市

English: (Applause) It's not just about products in people's homes.
Chinese: 當你睇返 1950 年 到 2050 年嘅一百年間 喺呢段時間裏面 我哋起咗全世界所有城市 而我哋正處於呢一百年嘅中間

English: We've got to think about the raw materials that produce our products.
Chinese: 每一個世紀都好似有一樣嘢要做 呢個世紀就係我哋定下 下一幅生活藍圖

English: Obviously there's fantastic opportunities with recycled materials, and we can and will go zero waste.
Chinese: 諗下啦

English: And there's opportunities in a circular economy.
Chinese: 我哋前所未有咁起城市 前所未有咁令人脫離貧窮 同時前所未有咁改變氣候

English: But we're still dependent on natural, raw materials.
Chinese: 可持續發展已經由「做下都唔錯」 變成「必須要做」

English: Let's take cotton.
Chinese: 關乎到我哋而家 同埋我哋工作裡面要做嘅嘢

English: Cotton's brilliant. Probably many people are wearing cotton right now.
Chinese: 所以我會講下企業可以做乜 同埋好似宜家咁嘅企業可以做乜 我哋有一個可持續發展策略 叫「人類同地球嘅希望」 希望企業可以 為世界帶嚟正面影響

English: It's a brilliant textile in use.
Chinese: 點解我哋企業唔想 為世界帶嚟正面影響呢？

English: It's really dirty in production.
Chinese: 其他公司亦都有 可持續發展嘅策略

English: It uses lots of pesticides, lots of fertilizer, lots of water.
Chinese: 我會講其中一啲策略 我只會講當中嘅一啲承諾

English: So we've worked with others, with other businesses and NGOs, on the Better Cotton Initiative, working right back down to the farm, and there you can halve the amount of water and halve the chemical inputs, the yields increase, and 60 percent of the costs of running many of these farms with farmers with low incomes can be chemical imports.
Chinese: 但首先，等我哋諗下消費者

English: Yields increase, and you halve the input costs.
Chinese: 我哋訪問中國同美國嘅人

English: Farmers are coming out of poverty. They love it.
Chinese: 佢哋大部分人面對日常問題之餘 都會關心可持續發展 日常問題指，點樣送我嘅細路返學？

English: Already hundreds of thousands of farmers have been reached, and now we've got 60 percent better cotton in our business.
Chinese: 我月尾還唔還得曬帳單？

English: Again, we're going all-in.
Chinese: 之後佢哋就關心大問題，例如氣候變化

English: By 2015, we'll be 100 percent Better Cotton.
Chinese: 但希望解決方法會簡單 可以負擔得到同吸引 佢哋希望企業會幫手 但今時今日，佢哋有啲失望

English: Take the topic of 100 percent targets, actually.
Chinese: 所以我哋返轉頭去諗 第一個環保產品

English: People sometimes think that 100 percent's going to be hard, and we've had the conversation in the business.
Chinese: 我哋嘅洗衣產品 可以將白衫洗成灰色

English: Actually, we found 100 percent is easier to do than 90 percent or 50 percent.
Chinese: 我哋有早期需要五分鐘 去預熱嘅省電膽 而之後你只會睇到一種奇怪嘅顏色

English: If you have a 90 percent target, everyone in the business finds a reason to be in the 10 percent.
Chinese: 我哋有粗糙、可回收廁紙

English: When it's 100 percent, it's kind of clear, and businesspeople like clarity, because then you just get the job done.
Chinese: 所以無論你著上一件襯衫 或者開燈，或者去廁所 或者三樣一齊做 你都會記得可持續發展 指生活上嘅讓步

English: So, wood. We know with forestry, it's a choice.
Chinese: 但咁樣似乎唔係 可持續發展嘅好開始

English: You've got illegal logging and deforestation still on a very large scale, or you can have fantastic, responsible forestry that we can be proud of.
Chinese: 今日我哋有各種選擇

English: It's a simple choice, so we've worked for many years with the Forest Stewardship Council, with literally hundreds of other organizations, and there's a point here about collaboration.
Chinese: 我哋可以將產品做得 好靚或者好醜 環保或者唔環保 實惠或者昂貴 實用或者無用

English: So hundreds of others, of NGOs, of forest workers' unions, and of businesses, have helped create the Forest Stewardship Council, which sets standards for forestry and then checks the forestry's good on the ground.
Chinese: 所以我哋一齊製造 又靚，又實用 又實惠，又環保嘅產品

English: Now together, through our supply chain, with partners, we've managed to certify 35 million hectares of forestry.
Chinese: 睇下 LED 燈

English: That's about the size of Germany.
Chinese: LED 係僅次於日光嘅最好發光物體

English: And we've decided in the next three years, we will double the volume of certified material we put through our business.
Chinese: 而舊式燈泡，鎢絲燈膽… 我唔係叫你哋舉手 話俾我知你屋企係唔係仲用緊 每次用都浪費能源，今日之後要換啦咁 或者 TED 個台有冇舊式燈泡… 但我會話舊式鎢絲燈膽 應該當暖爐嚟賣

English: So be decisive on these issues.
Chinese: 佢哋賣錯咗成過百年

English: Use your supply chain to drive good.
Chinese: 佢哋發出好少光，但產生大量熱力

English: But then it comes to your operations.
Chinese: 而家我哋嘅燈可以發出好多光 但同時只有非常小嘅熱力

English: Some things are certain, I think.
Chinese: LED 燈比傳統鎢絲燈膽慳電 85％

English: We know we'll use electricity in 20 or 30 years' time.
Chinese: 最正嘅係，LED 燈可以用超過廿年

English: We know the sun will be shining somewhere, and the wind will still be blowing in 20 or 30 years' time.
Chinese: 所以諗一諗

English: So why not make our energy out of the sun and the wind?
Chinese: 你會換七至八次手機 呢度嘅觀眾或者換得更加多

English: And why not take control of it ourselves?
Chinese: 如果你有渣車，你一世會換三至四次車

English: So we're going 100 percent renewable.
Chinese: 但 LED 唔同 你嘅細路會長大，有自己嘅下一代 然後帶埋佢哋小朋友見你 但你仲用緊同一個 LED 燈泡 LED 幫你慳咗好多電

English: By 2020, we'll produce more renewable energy than the energy we consume as a business.
Chinese: 所以 LED 燈好正

English: For all of our stores, our own factories, our distribution centers, we've installed 300,000 solar panels so far, and we've got 14 wind farms we own and operate in six countries, and we're not done yet.
Chinese: 我哋決定去做嘅嘢 唔係將 LED 吊高嚟賣 繼續賣舊式燈膽、鹵鎢燈同慳電膽

English: But think of a solar panel.
Chinese: 我哋決定，跟住嚟緊呢兩年 我哋會唔會再賣鹵鎢燈同慳電膽

English: The electricity is free.
Chinese: 我哋會盡全力賣 LED

English: Every time the sun comes out after that, the electricity is free.
Chinese: 而呢樣係企業需要做：盡全力 盡百分百嘅力 因為你唔可以再投資落舊嘢度 你只有投資新產品，減低成本 利用供應鏈，善用創意 令你嘅產品價格下降 令到所有人都買得起最好嘅燈膽 跟住佢哋就會慳到能源

English: So this is a good thing for the CFO, not just the sustainability guy.
Chinese: （掌聲） 唔單止係大家屋企都有嘅產品

English: Every business can do things like this.
Chinese: 我哋同時要諗下產品嘅原材料

English: But then we've got to look beyond our operations, and I think everybody would agree that now business has to take full responsibility for the impacts of your supply chain.
Chinese: 好明顯，回收物料創造好多機會 我哋可以做到零浪費

English: Many businesses now, fortunately, have codes of conduct and audit their supply chains, but not every business. Far from it.
Chinese: 我哋嘅循環經濟先至會有機遇

English: And this came in IKEA actually in the '90s.
Chinese: 但我哋依然依賴自然原料

English: We found there was a risk of child labor in the supply chain, and people in the business were shocked.
Chinese: 睇下棉花

English: And it was clearly totally unacceptable, so then you have to act.
Chinese: 棉花真係好有用 可能在座各位 好多都著棉花嘅衣物

English: So a code of conduct was developed, and now we have 80 auditors out in the world every day making sure all our factories secure good working conditions and protect human rights and make sure there is no child labor.
Chinese: 佢係非常好嘅紡織物

English: But it's not just as simple as making sure there's no child labor.
Chinese: 但生產過程就好污糟

English: You've got to say that's not enough today.
Chinese: 佢用到好多殺蟲劑、化肥、水

English: I think we'd all agree that children are the most important people in the world and the most vulnerable.
Chinese: 所以我哋同其他人 其他企業，同埋非牟利組織合作 實行「更優質棉花倡議」嘅計劃 直接追溯到農場 喺嗰度將用水減半 化肥減半 然後產量增加咗 對於收入低嘅棉農嚟講 六成嘅農場經營成本嚟自化肥

English: So what can a business do today to actually use your total value chain to support a better quality of life and protect child rights?
Chinese: 收入增加，成本又減半

English: We've worked with UNICEF and Save the Children on developing some new business principles with children's rights.
Chinese: 可以走出貧窮，棉農都好鍾意

English: Increasing numbers of businesses are signing up to these, but actually in a survey, many business leaders said they thought their business had nothing to do with children.
Chinese: 而家我哋已經接觸咗幾十萬嘅農民 而家我哋六成嘅棉花都係優質

English: So what we decided to do was, we will look and ask ourselves the tough questions with partners who know more than us, what can we do to go beyond our business to help improve the lives of children?
Chinese: 同樣，我哋盡曬全力

English: We also have a foundation that's committed to work through partners and help improve the lives and protect the rights of 100 million children by 2015.
Chinese: 去到 2015 我哋會百分百採用優質棉花

English: You know the phrase, you can manage what you measure?
Chinese: 我哋講下 100% 呢個目標

English: Well, you should measure what you care about.
Chinese: 大家有時會諗 100% 好難做到 公司裡面都有咁樣嘅講過

English: If you're not measuring things, you don't care and you don't know.
Chinese: 實際上，我哋發覺 100% 比 90% 或者 50% 更加容易做到

English: So let's take an example, measure the things that are important in your business.
Chinese: 如果你嘅目標要做到 90% 企業入邊嘅人都會 用盡方法唔做嗰 90%

English: Isn't it about time that businesses were led equally by men and women?
Chinese: 當目標係 100%，一切清楚 商人都鍾意直接了當 因為只有咁，你至會做到個目標

English: (Applause) So we know for our 17,000 managers across IKEA that 47 percent are women today, but it's not enough, and we want to close the gap and follow it all the way through to senior management.
Chinese: 跟住，木材 我哋知道林業可以有另一個出路

English: And we do not want to wait another hundred years.
Chinese: 但而家仍然有非法砍木嘅問題 森林砍伐依然好多 或者你可以選用有企業責任 而我哋都認同嘅林業公司

English: So we've launched a women's open network this week in IKEA, and we'll do whatever it takes to lead the change.
Chinese: 所以好簡單，我哋同森林管理委員會 以及其他過百個組織一齊合作好多年 合作有一個重點

English: So the message here is, measure what you care about and lead the change, and don't wait a hundred years.
Chinese: 過百個組織，包括非盈利組織 森林工作者聯盟同埋企業 一齊成立咗森林管理委員會 制定林業準則 確保林業健康發展

English: So we've gone from sustainability being a nice-to-do to a must-do. It's a must-do.
Chinese: 通過我哋供應鏈 同埋同合作夥伴一齊 我哋而家認可咗 3,500 萬公頃嘅森林

English: It's still nice to do, but it's a must-do.
Chinese: 幾乎係德國咁大

English: And everybody can do something on this as an individual.
Chinese: 而我哋決定嚟緊三年 我哋公司會用認可原材料多一倍

English: Be a discerning consumer.
Chinese: 所以喺環保問題上要果斷

English: Vote with your wallets.
Chinese: 用自身嘅供應鏈去推動環保

English: Search out the companies that are acting on this.
Chinese: 跟住落嚟就係實行

English: But also, there are other businesses already acting.
Chinese: 我覺得有啲嘢係好明確

English: I mentioned renewable energy.
Chinese: 當我哋知道我哋 嚟緊二、三十年仲會用電

English: You go to Google or Lego, they're going 100 percent renewable too, in the same way that we are.
Chinese: 我哋知道太陽會照住某個地方 風仍然會喺度

English: On having really good sustainability strategies, there are companies like Nike, Patagonia, Timberland, Marks & Spencer.
Chinese: 咁點解唔利用太陽同風去發電呢？

English: But I don't think any of those businesses would say they're perfect. We certainly wouldn't.
Chinese: 點解我哋唔控制佢哋呢？

English: We'll make mistakes going forward, but it's about setting a clear direction, being transparent, having a dialogue with the right partners, and choosing to lead on the issues that really count.
Chinese: 所以我哋會用 100% 可再生能源

English: So if you're a business leader, if you're not already weaving sustainability right into the heart of your business model, I'd urge you to do so.
Chinese: 到 2020 年 我哋會產生嘅可再生能源 比我哋公司需要嘅更多

English: And together, we can help create a sustainable world, and, if we get it right, we can make sustainability affordable for the many people, not a luxury for the few.
Chinese: 喺我哋所有鋪頭、工廠、物流中心 我哋已經裝咗三十萬塊太陽能板 喺 6 個國家有 14 個自己嘅風電場 呢啲都未止

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 諗下一塊太陽能板 可以喺七至八年內回到本

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 電仲係要免費
每次太陽出嚟，電都係免費

English: Today I am going to teach you how to play my favorite game: massively multiplayer thumb-wrestling.
Chinese: 呢樣唔單止 對於提出可持續發展嘅人 對於財務總監嚟講，都係好事

English: It's the only game in the world that I know of that allows you, the player, the opportunity to experience 10 positive emotions in 60 seconds or less.
Chinese: 每間公司都可以咁樣做

English: This is true, so if you play this game with me today for just one single minute, you will get to feel joy, relief, love, surprise, pride, curiosity, excitement, awe and wonder, contentment, and creativity, all in the span of one minute.
Chinese: 唔止營運，將眼光放遠 我覺得每個人都會贊成 今時今日嘅企業 需要對供應鏈負全責

English: So this sounds pretty good, right? Now you're willing to play.
Chinese: 好彩好多企業而家都有行為守則 同埋對供應鏈嘅審計 但唔係每間企業都做到

English: In order to teach you this game, I'm going to need some volunteers to come up onstage really quickly, and we're going to do a little hands-on demo.
Chinese: 而且數目遠遠唔夠 呢個問題其實喺 90 年代 曾經喺宜家發生過

English: While they're coming up, I should let you know, this game was invented 10 years ago by an artists' collective in Austria named Monochrom.
Chinese: 我哋發現供應鏈裡面 有使用童工嘅風險 而公司裡面嘅人都好震驚

English: So thank you, Monochrom.
Chinese: 好明顯呢種情況係接受唔到

English: Okay, so most people are familiar with traditional, two-person thumb-wrestling.
Chinese: 所以就要行動 於是制訂行動守則 而呢家我哋全世界有 80 個審計員 每日確保我哋所有工廠 都有好嘅工作環境 同埋保障到人權 確保無童工

English: Sunni, let's just remind them.
Chinese: 但唔係話確保無童工咁簡單

English: One, two, three, four, I declare a thumb war, and we wrestle, and of course Sunni beats me because she's the best.
Chinese: 你要知道今時今日咁樣仲未夠

English: Now the first thing about massively multiplayer thumb-wrestling, we're the gamer generation.
Chinese: 我覺得我哋都會同意 兒童係世界上最重要 又係最易受到傷害嘅一班人

English: There are a billion gamers on the planet now, so we need more of a challenge.
Chinese: 所以今日企業 點樣可以利用自己嘅價值鏈 支持更好嘅生活質素 同保護兒童權益呢？

English: So the first thing we need is more thumbs.
Chinese: 我哋同聯合國兒童基金會 同救助兒童會合作 針對兒童權益制定新嘅商業守則

English: So Eric, come on over.
Chinese: 愈嚟愈多企業簽署呢個守則 但一個調查發現，好多企業老闆 覺得佢哋企業同兒童毫無關係

English: So we could get three thumbs together, and Peter could join us.
Chinese: 所以我哋決定 同知得比我哋多嘅合作夥伴一齊 問自己最難嘅問題︰ 我哋點樣先可以喺企業以外 幫到兒童提升佢哋嘅生活質素？

English: We could even have four thumbs together, and the way you win is you're the first person to pin someone else's thumb.
Chinese: 我哋有一個基金 承諾同合作夥伴一齊 喺 2015 年之前幫一億兒童 改善生活同維護權益

English: This is really important. You can't, like, wait while they fight it out and then swoop in at the last minute.
Chinese: 你哋有冇聽過 「你能夠管理你檢討嘅嘢」？

English: That is not how you win.
Chinese: 其實你應該檢討你關心嘅嘢

English: Ah, who did that? Eric you did that.
Chinese: 如果你唔檢討 表示你唔關心，亦唔會了解

English: So Eric would have won. He was the first person to pin my thumb.

English: Now the first part of this that we need to think about and we need to process our existence, our life, immediately and repeatedly.

English: We need to process what's going on the moment it happens, not 10 minutes later, not a week later, at the moment.

English: We need to take advantage of that.

English: I just got through reading "The Great Gatsby," and I have a perfect idea of what he looks like in my head, so my own version.

English: We are meaning-making machines. It's what we do.

English: We try to make meaning out of everything that happens to us.

English: Organization helps, so we need to structure what we're doing in ways that make sense.
Chinese: 呢啲嘢都係由工作記憶完成

English: If we are providing knowledge and experience, we need to structure that.
Chinese: 佢畀我哋可以去到鋪頭買嘢 買牛奶、蛋同乳酪 更重要去買紅牛飲品同豬肉 （笑聲） 佢令我哋確定買咗要買啲嘢

English: The support may come in asking people questions, giving them a sheet of paper that has an organizational chart on it or has some guiding images, but we need to support it.

English: Now, the final piece of this, the take-home message from a working memory capacity standpoint is this: what we process, we learn.
Chinese: 我哋睇工作記憶 我哋必須認清佢容量係有限 所以佢對我哋會有好多影響

English: If we're not processing life, we're not living it.
Chinese: 你有冇試過由一個房行到另一間 但你唔記得咗點解要行過嚟？

English: Live life. Thank you.

English: (Applause)

你有冇唔記得架車喺邊？

English: I have a question: Who here remembers when they first realized they were going to die?

English: I do. I was a young boy, and my grandfather had just died, and I remember a few days later lying in bed at night trying to make sense of what had happened.
Chinese: 你有冇曾經同一班人傾偈 但發現左邊另一班人傾嘅嘢更加吸引？ （笑聲） 唔，你喺度點頭，你喺度笑 但你係唔留心嘅 直到聽到我最尾個字高音 然後你知道人哋問梗你一個問題 （笑聲） 而你真係希望答案係「否」 因為「否」正係你想講嘅嘢

English: What did it mean that he was dead?

English: Where had he gone?

English: It was like a hole in reality had opened up and swallowed him.
Chinese: 我哋可以用一啲方法

English: But then the really shocking question occurred to me: If he could die, could it happen to me too?
Chinese: 我會喺度講少少呢啲方法 呢啲方法真係幾重要 因為你嚟緊幾日會收到好多資訊

English: Could that hole in reality open up and swallow me?
Chinese: 首先，我哋個腦每日每一秒 都要不斷即時咁處理 我哋嘅生存、我哋嘅生活

English: Would it open up beneath my bed and swallow me as I slept?
Chinese: 我哋要即時知道眼前發生梗嘅事 而唔係十分鐘之後至知 亦唔係一個禮拜之後至知

English: Well, at some point, all children become aware of death.
Chinese: 我哋即時要諗嘅包括︰我同意佢嗎？

English: It can happen in different ways, of course, and usually comes in stages.
Chinese: 少咗啲咩？我想知道啲咩？

English: Our idea of death develops as we grow older.
Chinese: 我同意呢啲假設嗎？

English: And if you reach back into the dark corners of your memory, you might remember something like what I felt when my grandfather died and when I realized it could happen to me too, that sense that behind all of this the void is waiting.
Chinese: 可以知道套用到生活？

English: And this development in childhood reflects the development of our species.
Chinese: 明白目前發生嘅事 我哋就可以有經驗，之後再用得返

English: Just as there was a point in your development as a child when your sense of self and of time became sophisticated enough for you to realize you were mortal, so at some point in the evolution of our species, some early human's sense of self and of time became sophisticated enough for them to become the first human to realize, "I'm going to die."
Chinese: 我哋亦都需要重複練習

English: This is, if you like, our curse.
Chinese: 我哋同人討論啲事

English: It's the price we pay for being so damn clever.
Chinese: 我哋要將佢哋記錄低 返屋企之後，攞出筆記，思考筆記 同埋要定時練習

English: We have to live in the knowledge that the worst thing that can possibly happen one day surely will, the end of all our projects, our hopes, our dreams, of our individual world.
Chinese: 「練習」因為某啲原因令人覺得係負面

English: We each live in the shadow of a personal apocalypse.
Chinese: 但佢其實係好正面

English: And that's frightening. It's terrifying.
Chinese: 下一步，我哋就要諗得仔細同好清晰

English: And so we look for a way out.
Chinese: 好多時，我哋都覺得要 將新知識連到去已有嘅知識

English: And in my case, as I was about five years old, this meant asking my mum.
Chinese: 我哋就想倒轉

English: Now when I first started asking what happens when we die, the grown-ups around me at the time answered with a typical English mix of awkwardness and half-hearted Christianity, and the phrase I heard most often was that granddad was now "up there looking down on us," and if I should die too, which wouldn't happen of course, then I too would go up there, which made death sound a lot like an existential elevator.
Chinese: 用新知識解釋現有嘅嘢 令新知識同舊知識更有意思咁走埋一齊

English: Now this didn't sound very plausible.
Chinese: 我哋都會用圖像 因為人類天生對影像敏感

English: I used to watch a children's news program at the time, and this was the era of space exploration.
Chinese: 我哋可以善用呢個特點

English: There were always rockets going up into the sky, up into space, going up there.
Chinese: 用圖像去諗嘢 用圖畫記低事情

English: But none of the astronauts when they came back ever mentioned having met my granddad or any other dead people.
Chinese: 如果你睇梗一本書，就要連埋啲嘢

English: But I was scared, and the idea of taking the existential elevator to see my granddad sounded a lot better than being swallowed by the void while I slept.
Chinese: 就好似之前我讀《大亨小傳》一樣 我喺腦裏面構想主角個樣 咁我就有咗自己對主角容貌嘅概念

English: And so I believed it anyway, even though it didn't make much sense.
Chinese: 最後一樣係組織同支援

English: And this thought process that I went through as a child, and have been through many times since, including as a grown-up, is a product of what psychologists call a bias.
Chinese: 人類係會對事物附加意思

English: Now a bias is a way in which we systematically get things wrong, ways in which we miscalculate, misjudge, distort reality, or see what we want to see, and the bias I'm talking about works like this: Confront someone with the fact that they are going to die and they will believe just about any story that tells them it isn't true and they can, instead, live forever, even if it means taking the existential elevator.
Chinese: 人類就係咁 我哋會喺每件事裏邊搵意思

English: Now we can see this as the biggest bias of all.
Chinese: 事情嘅組織幫到我哋搵意思 所以我哋要組織 令事情易於明白

English: It has been demonstrated in over 400 empirical studies.
Chinese: 如果我哋要向人講解知識同經驗 我哋先要有組織能力

English: Now these studies are ingenious, but they're simple.
Chinese: 最後係支援

English: You take two groups of people who are similar in all relevant respects, and you remind one group that they're going to die but not the other, then you compare their behavior.
Chinese: 我哋都係由初學者開始

English: So you're observing how it biases behavior when people become aware of their mortality.
Chinese: 我哋做嘅每一件事都係朝著複雜進發

English: And every time, you get the same result: People who are made aware of their mortality are more willing to believe stories that tell them they can escape death and live forever.
Chinese: 因為我要知道事情會愈嚟愈難

English: So here's an example: One recent study took two groups of agnostics, that is people who are undecided in their religious beliefs.
Chinese: 所以我哋要加多啲支援 支援可以係向問人問題 例如畀佢哋一張紙 上面有組織圖表或者提示嘅圖片 我哋要支援

English: Now, one group was asked to think about being dead.
Chinese: 最後，我想帶出一個重點 喺工作記憶裏面 我哋個腦處理嘅嘢，就係我哋要學嘅嘢

English: The other group was asked to think about being lonely.
Chinese: 假如我哋個腦冇處理過生活大小事情 我哋就從來都冇生存過

English: They were then asked again about their religious beliefs.
Chinese: 好好過你嘅生活。多謝

English: Those who had been asked to think about being dead were afterwards twice as likely to express faith in God and Jesus.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: Twice as likely.
Even though the before they were all equally agnostic.
Chinese: 我想問一問︰ 在場有邊個仲記得自己第一次意識到 自己係要面對死亡？

English: But put the fear of death in them, and they run to Jesus.
Chinese: 我記得當時我係個細路仔 而祖父啱啱過咗身 我記得幾日後嘅夜晚我攤喺床上 想了解到底發生咗咩事

English: Now, this shows that reminding people of death biases them to believe, regardless of the evidence, and it works not just for religion, but for any kind of belief system that promises immortality in some form, whether it's becoming famous or having children or even nationalism, which promises you can live on as part of a greater whole.
Chinese: 祖父「死」到底係乜意思？

English: This is a bias that has shaped the course of human history.
Chinese: 佢去咗邊度？

English: Now, the theory behind this bias in the over 400 studies is called terror management theory, and the idea is simple. It's just this.
Chinese: 嗰刻我覺得死亡就好似 個世界有個窿打開、吞咗佢落去

English: We develop our worldviews, that is, the stories we tell ourselves about the world and our place in it, in order to help us manage the terror of death.
Chinese: 但同時我又諗到一個非常可怕嘅問題 既然祖父會死，我係唔係都會死？

English: And these immortality stories have thousands of different manifestations, but I believe that behind the apparent diversity there are actually just four basic forms that these immortality stories can take.
Chinese: 嗰個窿會唔會都打開吞咗我架？

English: And we can see them repeating themselves throughout history, just with slight variations to reflect the vocabulary of the day.
Chinese: 會唔會趁我瞓著喺床下底 打開吞咗我？

English: Now I'm going to briefly introduce these four basic forms of immortality story, and I want to try to give you some sense of the way in which they're retold by each culture or generation using the vocabulary of their day.
Chinese: 其實到某個歲數 所有細路仔都會察覺到死亡

English: Now, the first story is the simplest.
Chinese: 當然，佢哋發現嘅方式可能唔一樣 但通常都係有幾個階段嘅

English: We want to avoid death, and the dream of doing that in this body in this world forever is the first and simplest kind of immortality story, and it might at first sound implausible, but actually, almost every culture in human history has had some myth or legend of an elixir of life or a fountain of youth or something that promises to keep us going forever.
Chinese: 我哋對死亡嘅認識隨著年齡增長

English: Ancient Egypt had such myths, ancient Babylon, ancient India.
Chinese: 假如你去返隱藏咗嘅記憶 你可能會諗返起原來祖父過身時 自己都曾經諗過「我都會死﹗」 仲有就係覺得個窿喺度等緊自己

English: Throughout European history, we find them in the work of the alchemists, and of course we still believe this today, only we tell this story using the vocabulary of science.
Chinese: 呢一種童年經歷其實同 我哋人類身體發展好有關係

English: So 100 years ago, hormones had just been discovered, and people hoped that hormone treatments were going to cure aging and disease, and now instead we set our hopes on stem cells, genetic engineering, and nanotechnology.
Chinese: 當你發育嘅時候，會去到一個位 你對自己同時間嘅觸覺 都發展得好成熟 足夠令你意識到 你只係一個同樣會面對死亡嘅生物 所以喺人類進化過程裏面 有啲人對自我同時間嘅意識 都發展得好成熟 足以令佢哋第一個去意識到 「我原來會死嘅！」

English: But the idea that science can cure death is just one more chapter in the story of the magical elixir, a story that is as old as civilization.
Chinese: 或者，呢個就係對人類嘅詛咒

English: But betting everything on the idea of finding the elixir and staying alive forever is a risky strategy.
Chinese: 亦係我哋聰明所付出嘅代價

English: When we look back through history at all those who have sought an elixir in the past, the one thing they now have in common is that they're all dead.
Chinese: 我哋生存，必須要知道 惡夢可能終會成真 終有一天，我哋所有計劃、希望、夢想 同自我嘅世界都會完結

English: So we need a backup plan, and exactly this kind of plan B is what the second kind of immortality story offers, and that's resurrection.
Chinese: 而我哋各自都活喺自己嘅陰影裏面

English: And it stays with the idea that I am this body, I am this physical organism.
Chinese: 呢樣嘢係好可怕、好恐佈

English: It accepts that I'm going to have to die but says, despite that, I can rise up and I can live again.
Chinese: 所以我哋就搵方法擺脫佢

English: In other words, I can do what Jesus did.
Chinese: 由於我當時五歲，我就問媽咪

English: Jesus died, he was three days in the [tomb], and then he rose up and lived again.
Chinese: 當我問，人死嘅時候會點樣 當時我身邊嘅成年人 都用典型嘅英文語氣回答 即係混雜尷尬 同半虔誠嘅基督徒口吻 我成日聽到嘅說話 就係祖父喺「個天度望著我哋」 如果我離世嘅話…呢個當然唔會發生啦 但萬一嘅話，我都一樣會上去 咁樣講，令到死亡聽上去 就好似一部「現實存在」嘅升降機

English: And the idea that we can all be resurrected to live again is orthodox believe, not just for Christians but also Jews and Muslims.
Chinese: 但呢種講法好似唔太合理

English: But our desire to believe this story is so deeply embedded that we are reinventing it again for the scientific age, for example, with the idea of cryonics.
Chinese: 我嗰時收睇緊一個兒童嘅新聞節目 嗰陣係太空探索嘅年代

English: That's the idea that when you die, you can have yourself frozen, and then, at some point when technology has advanced enough, you can be thawed out and repaired and revived and so resurrected.
Chinese: 成日有火箭升空 升到上太空

English: And so some people believe an omnipotent god will resurrect them to live again, and other people believe an omnipotent scientist will do it.
Chinese: 但冇一個太空人返嚟之後 提過佢哋見到祖父 或者其他過咗身嘅人

English: But for others, the whole idea of resurrection, of climbing out of the grave, it's just too much like a bad zombie movie.
Chinese: 當時我有啲驚 但所謂「死後坐升降機」見祖父嘅講法 聽起上嚟，比趁我瞓著時 個窿會吞咗我嘅講法好好多

English: They find the body too messy, too unreliable to guarantee eternal life, and so they set their hopes on the third, more spiritual immortality story, the idea that we can leave our body behind and live on as a soul.
Chinese: 所以就算唔太合理，我都信咗先

English: Now, the majority of people on Earth believe they have a soul, and the idea is central to many religions.
Chinese: 而呢個由細個開始已經有嘅諗法 伴隨咗我好耐 亦都形成咗心理學家叫嘅「偏謬」

English: But even though, in its current form, in its traditional form, the idea of the soul is still hugely popular, nonetheless we are again reinventing it for the digital age, for example with the idea that you can leave your body behind by uploading your mind, your essence, the real you, onto a computer, and so live on as an avatar in the ether.
Chinese: 「偏謬」令我哋成日誤解同做錯啲嘢 令我哋誤算、錯判、扭曲事實 或者只睇到我哋想睇嘅嘢 而我所講嘅「偏謬」 係會推翻人對死亡嘅睇法 令佢哋相信死亡係假嘅 相反，佢哋可以永生 就算同佢哋講「升降機」嘅嘢

English: But of course there are skeptics who say if we look at the evidence of science, particularly neuroscience, it suggests that your mind, your essence, the real you, is very much dependent on a particular part of your body, that is, your brain.
Chinese: 佢哋都會信 我哋可以見到 呢個有關永生嘅說法係最大嘅偏謬

English: And such skeptics can find comfort in the fourth kind of immortality story, and that is legacy, the idea that you can live on through the echo you leave in the world, like the great Greek warrior Achilles, who sacrificed his life fighting at Troy so that he might win immortal fame.

English: And the pursuit of fame is as widespread and popular now as it ever was, and in our digital age, it's even easier to achieve.

English: But again, there are skeptics who doubt whether legacy really is immortality.

English: Woody Allen, for example, who said, "I don't want to live on in the hearts of my countrymen.

Chinese: 另一組要諗下寂獨

English: So those are the four basic kinds of immortality stories, and I've tried to give just some sense of how they're retold by each generation with just slight variations to fit the fashions of the day.

English: And the fact that they recur in this way, in such a similar form but in such different belief systems, suggests, I think, that we should be skeptical of the truth of any particular version of these stories.

English: The fact that some people believe an omnipotent god will resurrect them to live again and others believe an omnipotent scientist will do it suggests that neither are really believing this on the strength of the evidence.

English: Rather, we believe these stories because we are biased to believe them, and we are biased to believe them because we are so afraid of death.

English: So the question is, are we doomed to lead the one life we have in a way that is shaped by fear and denial, or can we overcome this bias?

English: Well the Greek philosopher Epicurus thought we could.

English: He argued that the fear of death is natural, but it is not rational.
Chinese: 呢樣就係改變咗 人類歷史進程嘅「偏謬」

English: Now this is often quoted, but it's difficult to really grasp, to really internalize, because exactly this idea of being gone is so difficult to imagine.

English: So 2,000 years later, another philosopher, Ludwig Wittgenstein, put it like this: "Death is not an event in life: We do not live to experience death.
Chinese: 世界觀當中有關永生嘅故事 有成千上萬個咁多 但我認為喺咁多故事之中 嚟嚟去去都只有四種基本路數 佢哋四個都喺歷史裡面一直重覆

English: And so," he added, "in this sense, life has no end."
Chinese: 只係每個時代為咗配合當時嘅語言 而改咗少少嘢

English: So it was natural for me as a child to fear being swallowed by the void, but it wasn't rational, because being swallowed by the void is not something that any of us will ever live to experience.

English: Now, overcoming this bias is not easy because the fear of death is so deeply embedded in us, yet when we see that the fear itself is not rational, and when we bring out into the open the ways in which it can unconsciously bias us, then we can at least start to try to minimize the influence it has on our lives.

English: Now, I find it helps to see life as being like a book: Just as a book is bounded by its covers, by beginning and end, so our lives are bounded by birth and death, and even though a book is limited by beginning and end, it can encompass distant landscapes, exotic figures, fantastic adventures.

English: And even though a book is limited by beginning and end, the characters within it know no horizons.

English: They only know the moments that make up their story, even when the book is closed.

English: Imagine the book of your life, its covers, its beginning and end, and your birth and your death.

English: You can only know the moments in between, the moments that make up your life.

English: It makes no sense for you to fear what is outside of those covers, whether before your birth or after your death.

English: And you needn't worry how long the book is, or whether it's a comic strip or an epic.

English: Thank you.

而我哋所有人都可以復活嘅諗法 係源於傳統嘅信念 唔只係基督教先有 就連猶太教同回教都有

English: I felt a Funeral, in my Brain, and Mourners to and fro kept treading -- treading -- till [it seemed] that Sense was breaking through -- And when they all were seated, a Service, like a Drum -- kept beating -- beating -- till I [thought] my Mind was going numb -- And then I heard them lift a Box and creak across my Soul with those same Boots of Lead, again, then Space -- began to toll, As [all] the Heavens were a Bell, and Being, [but] an Ear, and I, and Silence, some strange Race, wrecked, solitary, here -- [And] then a Plank in Reason, broke, and I fell down and down -- and hit a World, at every plunge, and Finished knowing -- then -- We know depression through metaphors.

English: Emily Dickinson was able to convey it in language, Goya in an image.

English: My mother died, a relationship I'd been in ended, I moved back to the United States from some years abroad, and I got through all of those experiences intact.
