English: Grief is explicitly reactive.
Chinese: 抑鬱嘅反面唔係快樂， 係活力

English: If you have a loss and you feel incredibly unhappy, and then, six months later, you are still deeply sad, but you're functioning a little better, it's probably grief, and it will probably ultimately resolve itself in some measure.
Chinese: 活力就係嗰時我覺得我失去咗嘅嘢

English: If you experience a catastrophic loss, and you feel terrible, and six months later you can barely function at all, then it's probably a depression that was triggered by the catastrophic circumstances.
Chinese: 每日要做嘅嘢實在太多啦

English: The trajectory tells us a great deal.
Chinese: 我想返屋企 見到電話答錄機上面閃著紅色燈 我冇咁驚 因為唔使聽到朋友留言 我就諗︰點解我要覆返咁多人嘅電話？

English: People think of depression as being just sadness.
Chinese: 或係我應該要食午餐啦 但我會諗， 我要將食物攞出嚟 擺喺個碟度 又要切、又要擺入個口度，又要吞咗去 感覺好似耶穌行十架嘅路一樣

English: It's much, much too much sadness, much too much grief at far too slight a cause.
Chinese: 而有一樣成日喺討論抑鬱症嘅時候 會忽略嘅嘢係 你知道抑鬱症係非常荒謬嘅一件事

English: As I set out to understand depression, and to interview people who had experienced it, I found that there were people who seemed, on the surface, to have what sounded like relatively mild depression who were nonetheless utterly disabled by it.
Chinese: 你知道當你經歷抑鬱症嘅時候 佢係有幾咁荒謬

English: And there were other people who had what sounded as they described it like terribly severe depression who nonetheless had good lives in the interstices between their depressive episodes.
Chinese: 你知道大部分人 會聽答錄機嘅留言同食晏 安排好沖涼、出去屋企 呢啲都係好簡單 但當你仍然係喺抑鬱症嘅控制當中 你搵唔到方法解決佢

English: And I set out to find out what it is that causes some people to be more resilient than other people.
Chinese: 之後我覺得自己做嘢做得愈嚟愈少 又諗得少、感受又愈嚟愈少

English: What are the mechanisms that allow people to survive?
Chinese: 可以話係無能

English: And I went out and I interviewed person after person who was suffering with depression.
Chinese: 跟著焦慮嚟勒

English: One of the first people I interviewed described depression as a slower way of being dead, and that was a good thing for me to hear early on because it reminded me that that slow way of being dead can lead to actual deadness, that this is a serious business.
Chinese: 如果你話俾我聽之後嗰幾個月 我都要處於抑鬱狀態 我會話︰只要佢十一月完，我就冇問題

English: It's the leading disability worldwide, and people die of it every day.
Chinese: 但係如果你同我講 我呢幾個月都要極度焦慮 我寧願割腕自殺，好過極度焦慮幾個月

English: One of the people I talked to when I was trying to understand this was a beloved friend who I had known for many years, and who had had a psychotic episode in her freshman year of college, and then plummeted into a horrific depression.
Chinese: 我嗰陣成日都會有一種感覺 好似你行路突然跣襯或者拤倒 而地下快速衝埋你度咁嘅感覺 但係嗰種恐懼感並唔係 剩係跌落地嘅半秒鐘 而係持續咗半年

English: She had bipolar illness, or manic depression, as it was then known.
Chinese: 嗰種感覺令你一直覺得好驚 但你又唔會知道你驚嘅係乜嘢

English: And then she did very well for many years on lithium, and then eventually, she was taken off her lithium to see how she would do without it, and she had another psychosis, and then plunged into the worst depression that I had ever seen in which she sat in her parents' apartment, more or less catatonic, essentially without moving, day after day after day.
Chinese: 就喺嗰個時候我開始諗 活著真係太痛苦 而唯一唔自殺嘅理由 就係因為唔想 因為我自殺會傷害到其他人

English: And when I interviewed her about that experience some years later -- she's a poet and psychotherapist named Maggie Robbins -- when I interviewed her, she said, "I was singing 'Where Have All The Flowers Gone,' over and over, to occupy my mind.
Chinese: 然後有一日，當我瞓醒 突然間覺得我中風 因為我喺床上完全郁唔到 我望住個電話，諗 「有啲唔對路， 我要打去搵人幫手」 但我連手都遞唔到 噉點拎起電話打呢？

English: I was singing to blot out the things my mind was saying, which were, 'You are nothing. You are nobody.
Chinese: 經過四個鐘頭我依煞瞓喺張床 郁都郁唔到 電話響，我用盡力咁攞起個電話 嗰個係我老豆打嚟 我話「 我遇到好大嘅麻煩， 我哋必須諗辦法解決佢。」

English: You don't even deserve to live.' And that was when I really started thinking about killing myself."
Chinese: 第二日我就開始治療同食藥

English: You don't think in depression that you've put on a gray veil and are seeing the world through the haze of a bad mood.
Chinese: 而我同時諗到一個好弊嘅問題 如果我唔係一個堅強嘅人 可以喺集中營裏面生存嘅人 噉我係乜？

English: You think that the veil has been taken away, the veil of happiness, and that now you're seeing truly.
Chinese: 如果我要靠藥物 噉藥物係咪令我做返真正嘅自己？ 定係將我變成第二個人？

English: It's easier to help schizophrenics who perceive that there's something foreign inside of them that needs to be exorcised, but it's difficult with depressives, because we believe we are seeing the truth.
Chinese: 如果藥物令我變成第二個人 噉我應該有咩感受？

English: But the truth lies.
Chinese: 我對抗抑鬱會有兩個好處

English: I became obsessed with that sentence: "But the truth lies."
Chinese: 第一就係客觀嚟講，我會有好嘅生活 如果當我好返 噉之後就會有更美好嘅嘢等住我

English: And I discovered, as I talked to depressive people, that they have many delusional perceptions.
Chinese: 第二樣就係我會得到好好嘅治療

English: People will say, "No one loves me."
Chinese: 但我好轉又復發，好轉又復發 最後我終於明白 我以後都要靠食藥同治潦生活

English: And you say, "I love you, your wife loves you, your mother loves you."
Chinese: 我就諗 ，抑鬱症到底 係化學問題定精神問題呢？

English: You can answer that one pretty readily, at least for most people.
Chinese: 需要化學治療定係心理治療？

English: But people who are depressed will also say, "No matter what we do, we're all just going to die in the end."
Chinese: 我搞唔清楚

English: Or they'll say, "There can be no true communion between two human beings.
Chinese: 跟住我明白到 我哋無論呢兩個領域嘅知識 都未夠深入去解釋事物

English: Each of us is trapped in his own body."
Chinese: 化學治療同心理治療都有佢哋嘅作用 我同時發覺抑鬱症係一種 同我哋內心深深糾纏著嘅嘢嚟 即係話我哋冇辦法將 佢由我哋人格同個性當中分離

English: To which you have to say, "That's true, but I think we should focus right now on what to have for breakfast."
Chinese: 我想講我哋對抑鬱症嘅治療方法 其實係唔係好好

English: (Laughter) A lot of the time, what they are expressing is not illness, but insight, and one comes to think what's really extraordinary is that most of us know about those existential questions and they don't distract us very much.
Chinese: 嗰啲治療都唔係好有效

English: There was a study I particularly liked in which a group of depressed and a group of non-depressed people were asked to play a video game for an hour, and at the end of the hour, they were asked how many little monsters they thought they had killed.
Chinese: 而且仲非常昂貴

English: The depressive group was usually accurate to within about 10 percent, and the non-depressed people guessed between 15 and 20 times as many little monsters -- (Laughter) as they had actually killed.
Chinese: 有好多數唔曬嘅副作用

English: A lot of people said, when I chose to write about my depression, that it must be very difficult to be out of that closet, to have people know.
Chinese: 呢啲治療嘅禍害好大

English: They said, "Do people talk to you differently?"
Chinese: 但慶幸嘅係我生活喺呢個年代 而唔係五十年前 五十年前面對抑鬱症係束手無策

English: I said, "Yes, people talk to me differently.
Chinese: 我希望五十年之後 當人聽到我呢一刻接受過嘅治療 會覺訝異點解會有人接受咁原始嘅科學

English: They talk to me differently insofar as they start telling me about their experience, or their sister's experience, or their friend's experience.
Chinese: 抑鬱症喺感情上係一個裂口

English: Things are different because now I know that depression is the family secret that everyone has.
Chinese: 如果你今日同某人結婚，然後諗 「如果我老婆過生， 我會搵另一個」 噉樣就唔係我哋所認知嘅愛情

English: I went a few years ago to a conference, and on Friday of the three-day conference, one of the participants took me aside, and she said, "I suffer from depression and I'm a little embarrassed about it, but I've been taking this medication, and I just wanted to ask you what you think?"
Chinese: 如果冇預料過會失去，噉就唔叫做愛情 預見過絕望係人變得親密嘅原動力

English: And so I did my best to give her such advice as I could.
Chinese: 人成日會撈亂三樣嘢︰ 抑鬱、哀痛同悲傷

English: And then she said, "You know, my husband would never understand this.
Chinese: 哀痛係好有反應

English: He's really the kind of guy to whom this wouldn't make any sense, so, you know, it's just between us."
Chinese: 如果你因為失去某樣嘢而非常唔開心 半年之後你仲係覺得好難過 但比起半年前好咗啲 嗰種應該哀痛 佢自己最後會慢慢消失

English: And I said, "Yes, that's fine."
Chinese: 如果你經歷過一場浩劫，感覺好慘 六個月後你只能夠僅僅噉捱落去 好可能就係浩劫發生嗰陣 同時引起你嘅抑鬱

English: On Sunday of the same conference, her husband took me aside, (Laughter) and he said, "My wife wouldn't think that I was really much of a guy if she knew this, but I've been dealing with this depression and I'm taking some medication, and I wondered what you think?"
Chinese: 噉樣嘅軌跡畀我哋了解到 抑鬱症係一件好嚴重嘅事

English: They were hiding the same medication in two different places in the same bedroom.
Chinese: 人哋覺得抑鬱症就同等於悲傷

English: (Laughter) And I said that I thought communication within the marriage might be triggering some of their problems.
Chinese: 但係抑鬱症卻係帶著太多太多嘅悲傷 同埋太多太多嘅哀痛 而一切都係由小事引起

English: (Laughter) But I was also struck by the burdensome nature of such mutual secrecy.
Chinese: 當我開始去了解抑鬱症 開始同一啲曾經患過嘅人傾嘅時候 我發現嗰啲人表現上睇起嚟 有輕微嘅抑鬱 但實際上抑鬱症令佢哋失去咗生活能力

English: Depression is so exhausting.
Chinese: 另一邊有批人聽起上嚟 有好嚴重嘅抑鬱 但佢哋卻係兩次病發之間生活得好好

English: It takes up so much of your time and energy, and silence about it, it really does make the depression worse.
Chinese: 跟著我開始搵出 係乜原因畀令某啲人比另一啲更堅強

English: And then I began thinking about all the ways people make themselves better.
Chinese: 係乜嘢機制 令人就算有抑鬱都可以生存落嚟？

English: I'd started off as a medical conservative.
Chinese: 跟著我一個又一個咁同曾經抑鬱嘅人傾

English: I thought there were a few kinds of therapy that worked, it was clear what they were -- there was medication, there were certain psychotherapies, there was possibly electroconvulsive treatment, and that everything else was nonsense.
Chinese: 其中一個人形容抑鬱症 係一個慢慢死亡嘅過程 一開頭聽到呢種講法係好事嚟 因為佢提醒咗我 慢慢步入死亡真係可以死亡 呢樣嘢係好嚴肅

English: But then I discovered something.
Chinese: 抑鬱症係全世界第一大 引致失去活動能力嘅疾病 每日都有人因為抑鬱症而離開世界

English: If you have brain cancer, and you say that standing on your head for 20 minutes every morning makes you feel better, it may make you feel better, but you still have brain cancer, and you'll still probably die from it.
Chinese: 其中一個喺我了解抑鬱症嘅時候傾嘅人 係我一個認識多年嘅好友 佢喺大學第一年有精神問題 之後惡化成幾多人驚嘅抑鬱症

English: But if you say that you have depression, and standing on your head for 20 minutes every day makes you feel better, then it's worked, because depression is an illness of how you feel, and if you feel better, then you are effectively not depressed anymore.
Chinese: 佢精神好兩極化 即係之後嘅躁狂抑鬱症

English: So I became much more tolerant of the vast world of alternative treatments.
Chinese: 經過多年鋰鹽治療 佢復完得相當唔錯 到最後醫生停咗開鋰鹽俾佢 睇下佢可唔可以唔使藥物都得 跟著佢又再度精神失常 仲惡化成我見過最嚴重嘅抑鬱症 佢坐喺佢父母間屋裏面 手腳好硬，坐喺度唔郁 日日都係咁

English: And I get letters, I get hundreds of letters from people writing to tell me about what's worked for them.
Chinese: 幾年之後我問佢呢段經歷時 佢已經係詩人同心理治療師 Maggie Robins 佢話︰「我一直重複唱著 Where Have All The Flowers Gone， 令我個腦剩係得呢首歌。

English: Someone was asking me backstage today about meditation.
Chinese: 我唱著呢首歌去掩蓋心入邊把聲， 嗰把聲就係 『你係冇用嘅， 你對世界嚟講可有可無。

English: My favorite of the letters that I got was the one that came from a woman who wrote and said that she had tried therapy, medication, she had tried pretty much everything, and she had found a solution and hoped I would tell the world, and that was making little things from yarn.
Chinese: 你根本唔配活喺呢個世界上。』 呢個時候我開始諗住自殺。」

English: (Laughter) She sent me some of them.
Chinese: 你有抑鬱嘅時候唔會諗 你戴咗一塊灰色面紗 唔會覺得自己係透過負面情緒去睇嘢

English: (Laughter) And I'm not wearing them right now.
Chinese: 你只會認為一塊 代表快樂嘅面紗被人攞走咗 你覺得宜家先係睇到真實嘅世界

English: (Laughter) I suggested to her that she also should look up obsessive compulsive disorder in the DSM.
Chinese: 同樣係人格分裂嘅病人 內心覺得有嘢需要驅趕嘅一類病人 比較容易治療 但抑鬱類型嘅病人就難啲 因為病人相信佢哋睇到真實世界

English: And yet, when I went to look at alternative treatments, I also gained perspective on other treatments.
Chinese: 但真實世界卻係講緊大話

English: I went through a tribal exorcism in Senegal that involved a great deal of ram's blood and that I'm not going to detail right now, but a few years afterwards I was in Rwanda, working on a different project, and I happened to describe my experience to someone, and he said, "Well, that's West Africa, and we're in East Africa, and our rituals are in some ways very different, but we do have some rituals that have something in common with what you're describing."
Chinese: 我成日聽到呢句說話 「但真實世界卻係講緊大話」

English: And he said, "But we've had a lot of trouble with Western mental health workers, especially the ones who came right after the genocide."
Chinese: 當我同抑鬱嘅人傾計嘅時候 我發現佢哋有好多幻覺

English: I said, "What kind of trouble did you have?"
Chinese: 佢哋會話「冇人愛我」

English: And he said, "Well, they would do this bizarre thing.
Chinese: 然後你同佢講 「我愛你，你老婆愛你， 你媽咪愛你。」

English: They didn't take people out in the sunshine where you begin to feel better.
Chinese: 你可以好快咁應返佢哋大部分人

English: They didn't include drumming or music to get people's blood going.
Chinese: 但係抑鬱症嘅人會話 「無論我哋點樣努力， 我哋最後都會死。」

English: They didn't involve the whole community.
Chinese: 或者佢哋會話 「兩個人之間唔會有真正嘅溝通。

English: They didn't externalize the depression as an invasive spirit.
Chinese: 每個人只會畀自己嘅身體困住。」

English: Instead what they did was they took people one at a time into dingy little rooms and had them talk for an hour about bad things that had happened to them."
Chinese: 你只可以回答 「冇錯，但我覺得我哋宜家應該諗， 我哋早餐食啲乜。」

English: (Laughter) (Applause) He said, "We had to ask them to leave the country."
Chinese: （笑聲） 好多時佢哋表逹嘅並唔係一種病， 而係佢哋睇嘢嘅角度 而佢哋會覺得好特別嘅嘢會係 我哋大部分人都一早知道嘅問題 呢啲問題唔會好令我哋分心

English: (Laughter) Now at the other end of alternative treatments, let me tell you about Frank Russakoff.
Chinese: 我幾鐘意一個調查 一班抑鬱症病人同一班冇抑鬱嘅人 需要分別玩電子遊戲一粒鐘 當佢哋玩完 佢哋要回答佢哋覺得喺遊戲裏面 殺咗幾多隻怪獸

English: Frank Russakoff had the worst depression perhaps that I've ever seen in a man.
Chinese: 抑鬱症嗰班人通常講到 10% 之內誤差嘅數字 至於冇抑鬱症嘅人 佢哋估嘅數字 係佢哋真正殺咗數目嘅 15-20 倍 （笑聲）

English: He was constantly depressed.
Chinese: 好多人會話，當我決定寫我嘅抑鬱症 係一個非常困難嘅決定

English: He was, when I met him, at a point at which every month, he would have electroshock treatment.
Chinese: 佢哋問︰ 「人哋同你傾計嘅時候會唔會唔同？」

English: Then he would feel sort of disoriented for a week.
Chinese: 我話︰「係， 人哋同我傾計會有唔同。」

English: Then he would feel okay for a week.
Chinese: 佢哋會同我講佢哋抑鬱症嘅經驗 可能係佢哋家姐、細妹 可能係佢哋嘅朋友

English: Then he would have a week of going downhill.
Chinese: 宜家唔同啦因為我知道 抑鬱症每個家庭都曾經有過

English: And then he would have another electroshock treatment.
Chinese: 前幾年我去咗個研討會 喺嗰個為期三日嘅研討會入面 其中一日，係星期五嚟 其中一個參加者將我拉到一旁 然後佢同我講︰ 「我有抑鬱症，呢個病令我覺得尷尬， 但係我一路有食藥。 我剩係想問下你你點樣睇？」

English: And he said to me when I met him, "It's unbearable to go through my weeks this way.
Chinese: 所以我就盡我所能答佢

English: I can't go on this way, and I've figured out how I'm going to end it if I don't get better."
Chinese: 佢跟住話︰ 「你知嗎？ 我老公永遠唔會明白架。

English: But, he said to me, "I heard about a protocol at Mass General for a procedure called a cingulotomy, which is a brain surgery, and I think I'm going to give that a try."
Chinese: 呢樣嘢對佢完全冇意義。 所以， 呢個係我哋嘅秘密。」

English: And I remember being amazed at that point to think that someone who clearly had so many bad experiences with so many different treatments still had buried in him, somewhere, enough optimism to reach out for one more.
Chinese: 我答 ︰「冇問題。」

English: And he had the cingulotomy, and it was incredibly successful.
Chinese: 跟著喺研討會嘅最後一日 佢丈夫又拉埋我一邊 （笑聲） 佢話 ︰「我老婆 如果知道我有抑鬱症嘅話， 絕對唔會覺得我係一個男人。 我有療程，有食藥。 我想知道你點諗？」

English: He's now a friend of mine.
Chinese: 佢哋兩夫妻將佢哋同一款藥 收埋喺同一間睡房嘅唔同地方

English: He has a lovely wife and two beautiful children.
Chinese: （笑聲） 我諗佢哋溝通唔係好好 導致一啲問題出現

English: He wrote me a letter the Christmas after the surgery, and he said, "My father sent me two presents this year, First, a motorized CD rack from The Sharper Image that I didn't really need, but I knew he was giving it to me to celebrate the fact that I'm living on my own and have a job I seem to love.
Chinese: （笑聲） 同時我都因為佢哋互相提防而覺得辛苦

English: And the other present was a photo of my grandmother, who committed suicide.
Chinese: 抑鬱症令人好攰

English: As I unwrapped it, I began to cry, and my mother came over and said, 'Are you crying because of the relatives you never knew?' And I said, 'She had the same disease I have.' I'm crying now as I write to you.
Chinese: 佢用咗你好多時間同精力 唔理抑鬱症只會令抑鬱症惡化

English: It's not that I'm so sad, but I get overwhelmed, I think, because I could have killed myself, but my parents kept me going, and so did the doctors, and I had the surgery.

但我哋最後仍然能夠嚟到賓夕法尼亞州

English: The case reports came in on paper.

English: We didn't have a medical team ready to go.

English: No one to figure out what tools should be used.

Chinese: 你應該叫佢哋出示證件。』」 我嘅孫會用我教嗰套答返佢哋︰ 「我知道你可以噉樣做， 但係當我哋喺車裏邊嘅時候， 請唔好噉做。 因為我同你嘅後果會好唔一樣。」

English: And these things are really a global failure.

English: The failure to prepare could allow the next epidemic to be dramatically more devastating than Ebola Let's look at the progression of Ebola over this year.

And that was just luck.

English: So those are the kinds of things we need to deal with an epidemic.

English: First, we need strong health systems in poor countries.

English: That's where mothers can give birth safely, kids can get all their vaccines.

English: taking advantage of the military's ability to move fast, do logistics and secure areas.

English: Now I don't have an exact budget for what this would cost, but I'm quite sure it's very modest compared to the potential harm.

English: These investments offer significant benefits beyond just being ready for the epidemic.

Chinese: 所以宜家你可能會有工具阻止政府 喺你電話、喺你手機裡面 一早進行嘅好多唔同形式嘅監聽 你只係可能唔清楚啲工具 有幾強大、幾安全 或者調返轉你一直通訊嘅方式有幾渣

English: It's double-sided, so it's 36 feet of composition.
Chinese: 所以我想帶出嘅訊息係 我哋需要用呢啲工具

English: It's kind of weird.

English: (Laughter) To the left, you have Jesus and the locusts.

Chinese: 話俾你哋深愛嘅人、同事知 叫佢地用加密咗嘅通訊工具

English: They go from the representational world, to this analog-mesh underworld, where they're hiding.

English: This is where the animal-headed creatures are by the lighthouse, and they're all about to commit mass suicide into the ocean.

English: The ocean is made up of thousands of elements.

English: This is a bird god tied up to a battleship.
(Laughter) Billy Graham is in the ocean; the Horizon from the oil spill; Waldo; Osama Bin Laden's shelter -- there's all kinds of weird stuff that you can find if you look really hard, in the ocean.
Chinese: 我細個喺美國山脈地區 由女同性戀者湊大 我最初嚟到紐約嗰陣 我就好似一個森林野人

English: Anyway, this is a lady creature.
Chinese: （笑聲） 嗰時頭腦超混亂 我一陣番轉頭再講

English: She's coming out of the ocean, and she's spitting oil into one hand and she has clouds coming out of her other hand.

English: Her hands are like scales, and she has the mythological reference of the Earth and cosmos in balance.

English: So that's one side of "The Triptych."
Chinese: 我諗 500 年後會有某種人猿類動物 或者外星人發現呢個盒 從中知道我哋呢個物種點樣交換諗法 或者知道我哋點樣食意粉

English: It's a little narrative thing.
Chinese: 其實我都唔係好清楚自己做乜

English: That's her hand that she's spitting into.
Chinese: 總言之，呢個諗法都幾得意 因為三十年後嘅我仲整緊呢嗰盒

English: And then, when you go to the other side, she has like a trunk, like a bird's beak, and she's spitting clouds out of her trunk.
Chinese: 我之前喺夏威夷嘅時候 鍾意行山、滑浪等等奇怪嘅活動 我嗰時仲砌緊一幅嘢俾我阿媽

English: Then she has an 18-foot-long serpent's tail that connects "The Triptych."
Chinese: 我撕爛咗本字典 將啲碎紙砌到好似 艾格尼絲 . 馬丁嘅網格噉 然後喺上面倒滿樹脂 點知有隻蜜蜂痴住咗喺上面

English: Anyway, her tail catches on fire from the back of the volcano.
Chinese: 因為我媽咪怕蜜蜂，而且會敏感 所以我唯有倒多啲樹脂落去 希望可以遮住隻蜜蜂

English: (Laughter) I don't know why that happened.
Chinese: 點知，事與願違 啲樹脂就好似放大鏡噉 將上面嘅野，包括蜜蜂，都放大咗

English: (Laughter) That happens, you know.
Chinese: 噉我點收科？ 於是就整多幾個盒

English: Her tail terminates in a cycloptic eyeball, made out of 1986 terrorist cards.
Chinese: 今次，我將電子零件 青蛙、街上執番嚟嘅樽 任何我搵到嘅嘢擺入去 因為我嘅人生一直都喺度尋尋覓覓 嘗試令唔同嘅物件之間有一個關係 用呢啲物件去串連一個故仔

English: Have you guys seen those?
Chinese: 於是我開始對住啲嘢畫呀畫 然後我發現 咦喂！原來我可以凌空畫！

English: They were made in the 1980's, they're like baseball cards of terrorists.
Chinese: 我可以畫出浮喺空中嘅線條 就好似喺案發現場圍住個屍體畫線噉

English: Way ahead of their time.
Chinese: 於是我拎件嘢出嚟 畫咗啲我想像出嚟嘅嘢

English: (Laughter) That will bring you to my latest project.
Chinese: 首先係植物 你應該睇得出似啲乜

English: I'm in the middle of two projects: One's called "Psychogeographies."
Chinese: 然後又畫咗啲奇怪嘅昆蟲同生物

English: It's about a six-year project to make 100 of these humans.
Chinese: 喺一層層嘅樹脂上面畫畫真係好好玩

English: Each one is an archive of our culture, through our ripped-up media and matter, whether it's encyclopedias or dictionaries or magazines.
Chinese: 而且仲好正添！ 因為我開始有表演接 我開始有收入 可以帶女朋友出街食晚飯 好似去 Sizzler 噉

English: But each one acts as a sort of an archive in the shape of a human, and they travel in groups of 20, 4, or 12 at a time.
Chinese: 正到要嗌出嚟啦！

English: They're like cells -- they come together, they divide.
Chinese: （笑聲） 畫畫下，我開始畫咗個人形 畫咗個真人咁高嘅樹脂雕塑 裏邊仲有仔細嘅紋路

English: And you kind of walk through them. It's taking me years.
Chinese: 呢樣嘢係好玩，但係有一個問題 我會就快死

English: Each one is basically a 3,000-pound microscope slide with a human stuck inside.
Chinese: 我唔知點算好，因為樹脂會殺死我

English: This one has a little cave in his chest.
Chinese: 晚晚我瞓覺之前都喺度諗點樣先好

English: That's his head; there's the chest, you can kind of see the beginning.
Chinese: 於是我試下用玻璃

English: I'm going to go down the body for you: There's a waterfall coming out of his chest, covering his penis -- or not-penis, or whatever it is, a kind of androgynous thing.
Chinese: 喺每一層玻璃上面畫畫 就好似你喺一塊窗上面畫完 再放另一塊窗喺上面繼續畫 然後再放另一塊，層層疊咁 形成一個立體嘅作品

English: I'll take you quickly through these works, because I can't explain them for too long.
Chinese: 於是今次真係得咗 因為我可以唔駛再用樹脂

English: There are the layers, you can kind of see it.
Chinese: 就係噉我畫窗玻璃畫咗幾年 加加埋埋成為咗一件大形作品

English: That's a body getting split in half.
Chinese: 我叫佢做「三聯畫」 三聯畫靈感主要嚟自 耶羅尼米斯 · 博斯嘅《人間樂園》 呢幅畫而家掛喺西班牙嘅 普拉多博物館入面

English: This one has two heads, and it's communicating between the two heads.
Chinese: 你哋知唔知我講緊邊幅畫？

English: You can see the pills coming out, going into one head from this weird statue.
Chinese: 好畫。呢幅畫好嘢嚟！

English: There's a little forest scene inside the chest cavity.
Chinese: 啲人話嗰時嚟講好新潮架！

English: Can you see that?
Chinese: 而家等我同你哋講解下 我呢個三聯畫作品

English: Anyway, this talk's all about these boxes, like the boxes we're in.
Chinese: 佢有 24,000 磅重、18 呎長

English: This box we're in, the solar system is a box.
Chinese: 雙面嘅，所以其實係 36 呎長

English: This brings you to my latest box.
Chinese: 有啲騎呢嘅 呢個係血噴泉

English: It's a brick box. It's called Pioneer Works.
Chinese: （笑聲） 左邊可以見到耶穌同蝗蟲

English: (Cheers) Inside of this box is a physicist, a neuroscientist, a painter, a musician, a writer, a radio station, a museum, a school, a publishing arm to disseminate all the content we make there into the world; a garden.
Chinese: 呢度有個山窿 俾呢啲個頭係動物頭嘅生物 穿梭於兩個世界之間

English: We shake this box up, and all these people kind of start hitting each other like particles.
Chinese: 佢哋會由表象世界 走到一個儀錶式嘅網狀地下世界匿埋

English: And I think that's the way you change the world.
Chinese: 呢啲生物係喺燈塔隔離 準備大規模跳海自殺

English: You redefine your insides and the box that you're living in.
Chinese: 個海有過千種唔同嘅完素

English: And you come together to realize that we're all in this together, that this delusion of difference -- this idea of countries, of borders, of religion -- doesn't work.
Chinese: 呢隻鳥神被綁喺戰船上面

English: We're all really made up of the same stuff, in the same box.
Chinese: （笑聲） 葛培理喺個海度 地平線嗰度係一達油污 仲有威利、仲有拉登嘅棲身之所 你肯俾心機去睇個海嘅話 你可以搵到好多騎呢嘅嘢

English: And if we don't start exchanging that stuff sweetly and nicely, we're all going to die real soon.
Chinese: 呢個係一隻雌性物物

English: Thank you very much.
Chinese: 佢由個海度出嚟 佢吐出啲油落一隻手度 另一隻手就有啲雲走出嚟

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 佢對手就好似天平噉 就好似神話描述噉平衡住地球同宇宙
所以幅畫嘅呢一面

English: In the year 1901, a woman called Auguste was taken to a medical asylum in Frankfurt.
Chinese: 係比較有故事性

English: Auguste was delusional and couldn't remember even the most basic details of her life.
Chinese: 佢吐油落隻手度

English: Her doctor was called Alois.
Chinese: 而當你去睇幅畫嘅另一面 佢有一個好似象鼻或者鳥咀噉嘅嘢 會吐出一舊舊雲

English: Alois didn't know how to help Auguste, but he watched over her until, sadly, she passed away in 1906.
Chinese: 佢仲有一條 18 尺長嘅蛇尾連住幅畫

English: After she died, Alois performed an autopsy and found strange plaques and tangles in Auguste's brain -- the likes of which he'd never seen before.
Chinese: 但佢條尾俾火山燒著咗

English: Now here's the even more striking thing.
Chinese: （笑聲） 我都唔係好知點解會係噉

English: If Auguste had instead been alive today, we could offer her no more help than Alois was able to 114 years ago.
Chinese: （笑聲） 但你知啦，都發生咗

English: Alois was Dr. Alois Alzheimer.
Chinese: 佢條尾最後有一個旋風形嘅眼球 係由 1986 年恐怖分子遊戲卡所整成

English: And Auguste Deter was the first patient to be diagnosed with what we now call Alzheimer's disease.
Chinese: 你哋有冇見過？

English: Since 1901, medicine has advanced greatly.
Chinese: 八十年代嘅嘢嚟 就好似恐怖份子嘅棒球明星卡噉

English: We've discovered antibiotics and vaccines to protect us from infections, many treatments for cancer, antiretrovirals for HIV, statins for heart disease and much more.
Chinese: 佢哋嗰時係新潮 （笑聲）

English: But we've made essentially no progress at all in treating Alzheimer's disease.
Chinese: 而家帶你哋睇下我最新嘅作品

English: I'm part of a team of scientists who has been working to find a cure for Alzheimer's for over a decade.
Chinese: 我而家其實做緊兩個計劃 一個叫做「心靈地圖」

English: So I think about this all the time.
Chinese: 呢個計劃大約為期六年 我要整 100 個噉樣嘅人形

English: Alzheimer's now affects 40 million people worldwide.
Chinese: 每個人形都紀錄住我哋嘅文化 人形由唔同出版刊物嘅紙碎砌成 可以係百科全書、字典或者雜誌

English: But by 2050, it will affect 150 million people -- which, by the way, will include many of you.
Chinese: 每一件作品都砌成人形 去紀錄我哋嘅世界 啲作品係一組組噉去郁 有啲 20 個一組，亦有 4 個 或者 12 個一組

English: If you're hoping to live to be 85 or older, your chance of getting Alzheimer's will be almost one in two.
Chinese: 佢哋就好似細胞咁 會黐埋一齊，亦會分開

English: In other words, odds are you'll spend your golden years either suffering from Alzheimer's or helping to look after a friend or loved one with Alzheimer's.
Chinese: 當你就噉行過喺佢哋 其實我就花用咗好多年時間

English: Already in the United States alone, Alzheimer's care costs 200 billion dollars every year.
Chinese: 每一個基本上係 一個重 3,000 磅嘅顯微鏡片 裏面有一個人係度

English: One out of every five Medicare dollars get spent on Alzheimer's.
Chinese: 呢個人心口度有一個窿

English: It is today the most expensive disease, and costs are projected to increase fivefold by 2050, as the baby boomer generation ages.
Chinese: 呢個係佢個頭，呢個係個胸 呢個就係開始時候你可以睇到嘅樣

English: It may surprise you that, put simply, Alzheimer's is one of the biggest medical and social challenges of our generation.
Chinese: 而家等我俾你哋睇下佢身體落啲嘅地方 呢度有一個瀑布由佢心口流出嚟 遮住佢下體 或者唔係下體，或者是旦一度 因為佢係雌雄同體

English: But we've done relatively little to address it.
Chinese: 等我好快噉介紹一下其他作品 因為我唔可以花太多時間解釋

English: Today, of the top 10 causes of death worldwide, Alzheimer's is the only one we cannot prevent, cure or even slow down.
Chinese: 你可以睇得出佢哋都係一層層噉嘅

English: We understand less about the science of Alzheimer's than other diseases because we've invested less time and money into researching it.
Chinese: 呢個人形嘅身體斷開兩截

English: The US government spends 10 times more every year on cancer research than on Alzheimer's despite the fact that Alzheimer's costs us more and causes a similar number of deaths each year as cancer.
Chinese: 呢個人有兩個頭 兩個頭喺度溝通緊

English: The lack of resources stems from a more fundamental cause: a lack of awareness.
Chinese: 你可以睇到有啲丸仔飛出嚟 飛到呢個奇怪人形嘅其中一個頭度

English: Because here's what few people know but everyone should: Alzheimer's is a disease, and we can cure it.
Chinese: 佢心口嗰度有個樹林

English: For most of the past 114 years, everyone, including scientists, mistakenly confused Alzheimer's with aging.
Chinese: 睇唔睇到呀？

English: We thought that becoming senile was a normal and inevitable part of getting old.
Chinese: 呢個演講嘅主題就係呢啲盒 就好似我哋身處嘅盒一樣

English: But we only have to look at a picture of a healthy aged brain compared to the brain of an Alzheimer's patient to see the real physical damage caused by this disease.
Chinese: 我哋身處喺太陽系其實都好似一個盒

English: As well as triggering severe loss of memory and mental abilities, the damage to the brain caused by Alzheimer's significantly reduces life expectancy and is always fatal.
Chinese: 等我介紹我最後一個盒

English: Remember Dr. Alzheimer found strange plaques and tangles in Auguste's brain a century ago.
Chinese: 呢個盒用磚砌成 叫做「先鋒者，做緊嘢」

English: For almost a century, we didn't know much about these.
Chinese: （歡呼聲） 呢個盒入面有一名物理學家 一名神經學家、一名畫家、一名音樂家 一名作家、一間電台、一座博物館 一間學校，同埋一間出版社 將我哋喺度做嘅嘢話俾盒外面嘅世界知 裏面仲有個花園

English: Today we know they're made from protein molecules.
Chinese: 我哋搖下個盒 將入面嘅人好似粒子咁撞嚟撞去

English: You can imagine a protein molecule as a piece of paper that normally folds into an elaborate piece of origami.
Chinese: 我諗呢個就係改變世界嘅方法

English: There are spots on the paper that are sticky.
Chinese: 重新定義自己同埋 我哋係裏面生活梗嘅呢個盒

English: And when it folds correctly, these sticky bits end up on the inside.
Chinese: 就會發現同明白到 我哋之間嘅差異只不過係錯誤嘅睇法 國家、國界、宗教都係冇意義嘅

English: But sometimes things go wrong, and some sticky bits are on the outside.
Chinese: 我哋其實都係喺同一個盒入面 由同一種物質所造成

English: This causes the protein molecules to stick to each other, forming clumps that eventually become large plaques and tangles.
Chinese: 如果我哋唔肯好好聲氣噉 去互相交換我哋所擁有嘅嘢 我哋好快就會一齊死架嘞！

English: That's what we see in the brains of Alzheimer's patients.
Chinese: 好多謝大家！

English: We've spent the past 10 years at the University of Cambridge trying to understand how this malfunction works.
Chinese: （全場鼓掌）

English: There are many steps, and identifying which step to try to block is complex -- like defusing a bomb.
Cutting one wire might do nothing.
Chinese: 喺1901年 有一個叫 Auguste 嘅女士 被送到法蘭克福嘅醫療精神病院

English: Cutting others might make the bomb explore.
Chinese: Auguste 有幻覺 甚至記唔起最簡單嘅生活細節

English: We have to find the right step to block, and then create a drug that does it.
Chinese: 佢嘅醫生係 Alois

English: Until recently, we for the most part have been cutting wires and hoping for the best.
Chinese: Alois 唔知道點樣幫助佢 但佢仍然照顧佢 直至佢不幸喺 1906 年逝世

English: But now we've got together a diverse group of people -- medics, biologists, geneticists, chemists, physicists, engineers and mathematicians.
Chinese: 病人死後，Alois 進行解剖 發現 Auguste 腦部 有唔尋常嘅班塊同物質纏結 佢從未見過呢種情況

English: And together, we've managed to identify a critical step in the process and are now testing a new class of drugs which would specifically block this step and stop the disease.
Chinese: 唔單止噉，更震撼嘅發現仲有

English: Now let me show you some of our latest results.
Chinese: 如果 Auguste 今日仍然在世 我哋同 114 年前 Alois 可以幫佢做嘅嘢一樣不多

English: No one outside of our lab has seen these yet.
Chinese: Alois 就係 Alois Alzheimer醫生

English: Let's look at some videos of what happened when we tested these new drugs in worms.
Chinese: Alzheimer 中文譯做阿茲海默 而 Auguste Deter 就係第一位病人 被診斷我哋宜家叫嘅「阿茲海默症」

English: So these are healthy worms, and you can see they're moving around normally.
Chinese: 自從 1901 年以黎 醫學發展迅速

English: These worms, on the other hand, have protein molecules sticking together inside them -- like humans with Alzheimer's.
Chinese: 我哋發現咗抗生素同發明咗疫苗 去預防傳染病 仲有好多抗癌療法 令愛滋病病毒喺抗病毒藥物 醫治心臟病嘅降膽固醇藥等等

English: And you can see they're clearly sick.
Chinese: 但係對於治療阿茲海默症 總係停滯不前

English: But if we give our new drugs to these worms at an early stage, then we see that they're healthy, and they live a normal lifespan.
Chinese: 我係一班科學家裏面嘅其中一個 我過去十年一直搵一種 治療呢個病嘅方法

English: This is just an initial positive result, but research like this shows us that Alzheimer's is a disease that we can understand and we can cure.
Chinese: 所以我成日都諗住呢樣嘢

English: After 114 years of waiting, there's finally real hope for what can be achieved in the next 10 or 20 years.
Chinese: 阿茲海默症宜家影響全球四千萬人

English: But to grow that hope, to finally beat Alzheimer's, we need help.
Chinese: 到咗 2050 年 呢個病會影響 1.5 億人 在座好多人都會係其中一個

English: This isn't about scientists like me -- it's about you.
Chinese: 如果你諗著活到 85 歲或以上 你患阿茲海默症嘅機會幾乎係二分一

English: We need you to raise awareness that Alzheimer's is a disease and that if we try, we can beat it.
Chinese: 換言之，你一係喺你嘅黃金歲月 患上阿茲海默症 一係就照顧患呢個病嘅朋友或至親

English: In the case of other diseases, patients and their families have led the charge for more research and put pressure on governments, the pharmaceutical industry, scientists and regulators.
Chinese: 單喺美國每年就已經 花費咗二千億美元去照顧呢類病人

English: That was essential for advancing treatment for HIV in the late 1980s.
Chinese: 聯邦醫療保險裏面每五蚊嘅支出 就有一蚊用咗喺阿茲海默症度

English: Today, we see that same drive to beat cancer.
Chinese: 呢個病係當今最貴嘅病 隨著戰後嬰兒潮嘅人踏入老年 預計到 2050 年 成本會增加五倍

English: But Alzheimer's patients are often unable to speak up for themselves.
Chinese: 你可能會覺得驚訝，簡單嚟講 呢個病係我哋呢一代 喺醫療同社會方面 遇到嘅其中一個最大挑戰

English: And their families, the hidden victims, caring for their loved ones night and day, are often too worn out to go out and advocate for change.
Chinese: 但我哋做咗唔係好多去應付呢個問題

English: So, it really is down to you.
Chinese: 今時今日全世界最多人死亡嘅十個原因 只有阿茲海默症係唔能夠預防 醫好或者推遲惡化

English: Alzheimer's isn't, for the most part, a genetic disease.
Chinese: 我哋對呢個病嘅認識比其他病少 因為相對其他病嘅研究 我哋投資咗少啲嘅時間同埋金錢落去

English: Everyone with a brain is at risk.
Chinese: 美國政府每一年花費喺癌症嘅研究 都比喺阿茲海默症高出十倍 即使阿茲海默症嘅醫療費用較高 而且毎年嘅死亡數字同癌症相若

English: Today, there are 40 million patients like Auguste, who can't create the change they need for themselves.
Chinese: 呢個病之所以冇資源去研究，主要原因係 啲人仲未去關注呢個病

English: Help speak up for them, and help demand a cure.
Chinese: 因為只係得少數人知道一樣嘢 但其實我哋每個人都需要知道呢樣嘢 就係阿茲海默症係一種病 而且係可以醫好嘅

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 喺過去114 年嘅大部分時間 所有人，包括科學家 都誤以為阿茲海默症係同年紀有關

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 我哋以前認為變得衰老 係老咗正常同無法避免嘅事
但只要睇下呢一幅圖 一個健康人嘅腦部 同阿茲海默症病人嘅腦部 可以睇到呢個病所做成嘅身體傷害

English: Interpreter: Piano, "p," is my favorite musical symbol.
Chinese: 仲會引致記憶同埋心理嚴重喪失 阿茲海默症對病人腦部造成損害 大大縮短病人夀命 而且往往係致命嘅

English: It means to play softly.
Chinese: 仲記得一個世紀前 Alois 喺 Auguste個 腦部 發現異常嘅斑塊同物質纏結

English: If you're playing a musical instrument and you notice a "p" in the score, you need to play softer.
Chinese: 過咗差唔多一個世紀 我哋仍然知道唔多

English: Two p's -- even softer.
Chinese: 今日我哋知道佢係用蛋白質分子構成

English: Four p's -- extremely soft.
Chinese: 你可以將蛋白質分子諗成係一張紙 用黎摺紙

English: This is my drawing of a p-tree, which demonstrates no matter how many thousands upon thousands of p's there may be, you'll never reach complete silence.
Chinese: 紙面佈滿黐粒粒嘅點

English: That's my current definition of silence: a very obscure sound.
Chinese: 如果摺得正確，啲點會喺紙嘅入邊

English: I'd like to share a little bit about the history of American Sign Language, ASL, plus a bit of my own background.
Chinese: 但有時摺錯，啲點就會喺出面

English: French sign language was brought to America during the early 1800s, and as time went by, mixed with local signs, it evolved into the language we know today as ASL.
Chinese: 噉樣令到蛋白質分子 黐埋一齊，變成一舊 最後變咗斑塊同一團纒結嘅嘢

English: So it has a history of about 200 years.
Chinese: 阿茲海默病人嘅腦部就係咁樣

English: I was born deaf, and I was taught to believe that sound wasn't a part of my life.
Chinese: 我哋喺劍橋大學花咗十年 去了解呢種病變嘅原理

English: And I believed it to be true.
Chinese: 但係裏邊有好多個步驟 要搵出邊一步去停止成個運作 係好複雜嘅嘢 好似喺拆彈一樣

English: Yet, I realize now that that wasn't the case at all.
Chinese: 剪一條電線可能拆唔到彈

English: Sound was very much a part of my life, really, on my mind every day.
Chinese: 但係剪多一條，又可能會爆炸

English: As a Deaf person living in a world of sound, it's as if I was living in a foreign country, blindly following its rules, customs, behaviors and norms without ever questioning them.
Chinese: 我哋必須搵到啱嘅一步去停咗去 然後研發一種藥可以噉樣一步到位打擊

English: So how is it that I understand sound?
Chinese: 直到最近，我哋將大部分時間 花喺阻止蛋白質演變嘅過程嗰度 希望得到好嘅結果

English: Well, I watch how people behave and respond to sound.
Chinese: 但係宜家我哋聯合不同界別嘅人士 有醫生、生物學家丶遺傳學家 化學家、物理學家、工程師同數學家

English: You people are like my loudspeakers, and amplify sound.
Chinese: 大家一齊搵出嗰個關鍵嘅步驟 宜家我哋試梗一種新藥 針對阻止關鍵嘅嗰一步 令到個病可以消失

English: I learn and mirror that behavior.
Chinese: 宜家就由我帶你哋睇下 一啲最新嘅研發結果

English: At the same time, I've learned that I create sound, and I've seen how people respond to me.
Chinese: 實驗室出面嘅人都從來未睇過

English: Thus I've learned, for example ...
Chinese: 宜家俾大家睇嘅片段 係我哋用蟲去測試新藥嗰陣發生嘅嘢

English: Don't slam the door!
Chinese: 呢啲係健康嘅蟲 你可以睇到佢哋正常咁周圍行

English: Don't make too much noise when you're eating from the potato-chip bag!
Chinese: 但呢批蟲 體內嘅蛋白質分子卻係黐埋一齊 就好似有阿茲海默症嘅人一樣

English: (Laughter) "Don't burp, and when you're eating, make sure you don't scrape your utensils on the plate."
Chinese: 好清楚睇到佢哋係病咗

English: All of these things I term "sound etiquette."
Chinese: 但如果我哋喺呢啲蟲病發初期， 俾啲新藥佢食，佢哋就會好返 可以健康生存到一般蟲嘅預期壽命

English: Maybe I think about sound etiquette more than the average hearing person does.
Chinese: 呢啲支持嘅數據只係初步嘅結果 不過類似嘅研究證明咗 我哋係可以了解阿茲海默症

English: I'm hyper-vigilant around sound.
Chinese: 個病仲可以醫得到 等咗 114 年 終於有望喺以後嘅十至廿年 人類戰勝阿茲海默症

English: And I'm always waiting in eager nervous anticipation around sound, about what's to come next.
Chinese: 為咗繼續燃點呢個希望 為咗最終能夠擊敗呢個病

English: Hence, this drawing.
Chinese: 我哋需要幫手 唔係需要好似我噉嘅科學家 而係需要你

English: TBD, to be decided.
Chinese: 你需要知道阿茲海默症係一種疾病 如果我哋肯嘗試，我哋可以打敗佢

English: TBC, to be continued.
Chinese: 至於其他病 病人同家人已經一早帶頭推動更多嘅研究 向政府丶藥劑業、科學家同監管機構 施加壓力

English: TBA, to be announced.
Chinese: 呢樣對於八十年代後期 HIV 治療嘅進步係非常重要嘅

English: And you notice the staff -- there are no notes contained in the lines.
Chinese: 今日見到同樣一股動力去對抗癌症

English: That's because the lines already contain sound through the subtle smudges and smears.
Chinese: 但阿茲海默症病人就唔能夠 表達自己嘅意見

English: In Deaf culture, movement is equivalent to sound.
Chinese: 當病人家屬，亦係隱形嘅受害人 日以繼夜照顧佢哋至親 到要出嚟推動改革嘅時候 佢哋通常都已經好疲倦

English: This is a sign for "staff" in ASL.
Chinese: 所以宜家真係靠你哋

English: A typical staff contains five lines.
Chinese: 阿茲海默症對大多數人嚟講 都唔係一個遺傳病

English: Yet for me, signing it with my thumb sticking up like that doesn't feel natural.
Chinese: 每個人都有病發可能

English: That's why you'll notice in my drawings, I stick to four lines on paper.
Chinese: 今時今日有將近四千萬嘅人 好似 Auguste 一樣 當佢哋唔能夠為自己帶嚟改變嘅時候

English: In the year 2008, I had the opportunity to travel to Berlin, Germany, for an artist residency there.
Chinese: 噉就請你哋幫佢哋發聲 要求獲得治療

English: Prior to this time, I had been working as a painter.
Chinese: 多謝

English: During this summer, I visited different museums and gallery spaces, and as I went from one place to the next, I noticed there was no visual art there.
Chinese: （掌聲)

English: At that time, sound was trending, and this struck me ...
there was no visual art, everything was auditory.
Chinese: 口譯員︰英文單詞「鋼琴」 入邊個「p」係我最鍾意嘅樂符

English: Now sound has come into my art territory.
Chinese: 佢嘅意思係輕輕演奏

English: Is it going to further distance me from art?
Chinese: 如果你演奏緊一種樂器 同埋睇到一個「p」符 咁你就需要輕輕咁去演奏個音

English: I realized that doesn't have to be the case at all.
Chinese: 如果係兩個「p」咁就要更加之輕柔

English: I actually know sound.
Chinese: 如果係四個，咁就要極度輕柔

English: I know it so well that it doesn't have to be something just experienced through the ears.
Chinese: 呢個係我畫嘅「p 樹圖」 呢幅圖展示咗 無論圖入邊有幾多個 p 你永遠都唔會做到絕對安靜

English: It could be felt tactually, or experienced as a visual, or even as an idea.
Chinese: 呢個就係而家我對安靜嘅定義︰ 「一個非常之模糊嘅音」

English: So I decided to reclaim ownership of sound and to put it into my art practice.
Chinese: 我想同大家分享一啲 關於美國手語（ASL）嘅歷史 同埋我個人嘅經歷

English: And everything that I had been taught regarding sound, I decided to do away with and unlearn.
Chinese: 喺十九世紀早期 法國手語第一次傳到美國 隨著時間，佢慢慢同當地手語融合 跟住慢慢演化成 我哋而家熟悉嘅美國手語

English: I started creating a new body of work.
Chinese: 所以佢有將近兩百年嘅歷史

English: And when I presented this to the art community, I was blown away with the amount of support and attention I received.
Chinese: 我天生失聰 其他人一直同我講 聲音唔屬於我生活一部分

English: I realized: sound is like money, power, control -- social currency.
Chinese: 所以我都相信係真嘅

English: In the back of my mind, I've always felt that sound was your thing, a hearing person's thing.
Chinese: 但係而家我意識到其實事實並唔係咁

English: And sound is so powerful that it could either disempower me and my artwork, or it could empower me.
Chinese: 聲音其實係我生活嘅一部分 講真，佢日日都喺我腦海中浮現

English: I chose to be empowered.
Chinese: 作為一個失聰嘅人 生活喺有聲音嘅世界裏邊 就好似我生活喺外國一樣 只有遵守當地規距、習慣、行為同標準 而從來都冇懷疑過

English: There's a massive culture around spoken language.
Chinese: 咁我點樣可以理解聲音？

English: And just because I don't use my literal voice to communicate, in society's eyes it's as if I don't have a voice at all.
Chinese: 我其實係通過觀察人哋對聲音嘅反應

English: So I need to work with individuals who can support me as an equal and become my voice.
Chinese: 你哋就好似我嘅揚聲器一樣擴大聲音

English: And that way, I'm able to maintain relevancy in society today.
Chinese: 我就學到同呼應你哋嘅反應

English: So at school, at work and institutions, I work with many different ASL interpreters.
Chinese: 同時，我知道我發出咗聲音 同埋我睇到你哋點樣對我嘅聲音有反應

English: And their voice becomes my voice and identity.
Chinese: 所以我就學到好多嘢，譬如話

English: They help me to be heard.
Chinese: 唔好大力關門

English: And their voices hold value and currency.
Chinese: 你食薯條嗰陣唔好俾個袋製造太多噪音

English: Ironically, by borrowing out their voices, I'm able to maintain a temporary form of currency, kind of like taking out a loan with a very high interest rate.
Chinese: （笑聲） 唔好打嗝 仲有食飯果陣 唔好用餐具去刮個碟

English: If I didn't continue this practice, I feel that I could just fade off into oblivion and not maintain any form of social currency.
Chinese: 所有呢啲嘢 我都叫佢哋做「聲音儀態」

English: So with sound as my new art medium, I delved into the world of music.
Chinese: 或者我會比正常人更加留意聲音儀態

English: And I was surprised to see the similarities between music and ASL.
Chinese: 我對聲音超級敏感

English: For example, a musical note cannot be fully captured and expressed on paper.
Chinese: 我成日好惊，會成日準備聲音出現 惊有乜嘢會發生

English: And the same holds true for a concept in ASL.
Chinese: 所以呢，一齊嚟睇下呢幅畫

English: They're both highly spatial and highly inflected -- meaning that subtle changes can affect the entire meaning of both signs and sounds.
Chinese: TBD 嘅意思係留待決定

English: I'd like to share with you a piano metaphor, to have you have a better understanding of how ASL works.
Chinese: TBC 嘅意思係留待繼續

English: So, envision a piano.
Chinese: TBA 嘅意思係留待宣布

English: ASL is broken down into many different grammatical parameters.
Chinese: 你都可以睇得到 喺呢三行入邊，係冇音符嘅

English: If you assign a different parameter to each finger as you play the piano -- such as facial expression, body movement, speed, hand shape and so on, as you play the piano -- English is a linear language, as if one key is being pressed at a time.
Chinese: 原因係呢三行其實通過化開咗嘅鉛筆痕 就已經包括埋聲音架啦

English: However, ASL is more like a chord -- all 10 fingers need to come down simultaneously to express a clear concept or idea in ASL.
Chinese: 喺聾人嘅世界入邊，動作同聲音係一樣

English: If just one of those keys were to change the chord, it would create a completely different meaning.
Chinese: 呢個係「staff」嘅美國手語

English: The same applies to music in regards to pitch, tone and volume.
Chinese: 一個典型嘅「staff」有五行

English: In ASL, by playing around with these different grammatical parameters, you can express different ideas.
Chinese: 不過我如果用手指做成咁嘅樣 就會好唔自然

English: For example, take the sign TO-LOOK-AT.
Chinese: 呢個就係點解我會喺紙上畫四行

English: This is the sign TO-LOOK-AT.
Chinese: 2008 年，我有機會 以藝術家嘅身份定居柏林

English: I'm looking at you.
Chinese: 之前呢，我就有一段時間做過做過畫家

English: Staring at you.
Chinese: 暑假期間 我參觀咗唔同嘅博物館同畫廊 當我喺唔同嘅地方參觀嗰陣 我發覺呢啲地方都冇視覺藝術

English: (Laughter) (Laughter) Oh -- busted.
Chinese: 果時，聲音係主流

English: (Laughter) Uh-oh.
Chinese: 但我令我好託異嘅係 冇一樣嘢係視覺藝術 所有嘢都係聽覺

English: What are you looking at?
Chinese: 咁而家聲音嚟到我嘅藝術世界裏面啦

English: Aw, stop.
Chinese: 但佢係唔係會令我遠離藝術呢？

English: (Laughter) I then started thinking, "What if I was to look at ASL through a musical lens?"
Chinese: 我意識到根本就唔係

English: If I was to create a sign and repeat it over and over, it could become like a piece of visual music.
Chinese: 其實我可以聽到聲音

English: For example, this is the sign for "day," as the sun rises and sets.
Chinese: 我係非常了解聲音嘅 因為我知道聲音唔剩係經耳仔感受得到

English: This is "all day."
Chinese: 仲可以通過觸摸去感受佢 可以通過雙眼去睇佢 或者甚至通過諗法去感受佢

English: If I was to repeat it and slow it down, visually it looks like a piece of music.
Chinese: 所以我決定重新擁有聲音 並且將佢融入到我嘅藝術創作當中

English: All ... day.
Chinese: 其他人教過我有關聲音嘅嘢 我決定揼曬佢哋，將佢哋忘記

English: I feel the same holds true for "all night."
Chinese: 我決定做一個同聲音有關嘅工作

English: All night.
Chinese: 當我將呢個工作介紹俾藝術社群嘅時候 見到咁多人支持同專心聽，我非常感動

English: This is ALL-NIGHT, represented in this drawing.
Chinese: 我意識到 聲音就好似錢、權力、控制咁 呢啲嘅社會話語權

English: And this led me to thinking about three different kinds of nights: "last night," "overnight," (Sings) "all night long."
Chinese: 喺我腦海裏邊，我一直覺得聲音 係屬於你哋可以聽到聲音嘅人嘅物品

English: (Laughter) I feel like the third one has a lot more musicality than the other two.
Chinese: 聲音嘅力量好大 佢可以令我同我嘅藝術黯然失色 同時佢都可以令到我更加有力量

English: (Laughter) This represents how time is expressed in ASL and how the distance from your body can express the changes in time.
Chinese: 我選擇變得更加有力量

English: For example, 1H is one hand, 2H is two hand, present tense happens closest and in front of the body, future is in front of the body and the past is to your back.
Chinese: 口語當中包含大量文化

English: So, the first example is "a long time ago."
Chinese: 而因為我唔會用我把聲去講嘢 喺社會眼中，就好似我冇得發言一樣

English: Then "past," "used to" and the last one, which is my favorite, with the very romantic and dramatic notion to it, "once upon a time."
Chinese: 所以我需要同可以平等看待我嘅人 共事、幫我發聲

English: (Laughter) "Common time" is a musical term with a specific time signature of four beats per measure.
Chinese: 通過呢種方式 我可以喺社會裏面繼續發揮影響

English: Yet when I see the word "common time," what automatically comes to mind for me is "at the same time."
Chinese: 所以喺學校同返工嗰陣時 我同好多唔同嘅美國手語傳譯員共事

English: So notice RH: right hand, LH: left hand.
Chinese: 佢哋把聲就係我嘅把聲音同我嘅身份

English: We have the staff across the head and the chest.
Chinese: 佢哋幫我，令其他人可以聽到我

English: [Head: RH, Flash claw] [Common time] [Chest: LH, Flash claw] I'm now going to demonstrate a hand shape called the "flash claw."
Chinese: 佢哋把聲蘊含價值同社會話語權

English: Can you please follow along with me?
Chinese: 諷刺嘅係，通過借用佢哋嘅聲音 我可以暫時擁有呢啲話語權 好啲似借高利貸咁

English: Everybody, hands up.
Chinese: 如果我停止呢個實踐 我就會覺得我會消失咗咁 跟住我嘅話語權就會隨之而消失

English: Now we're going to do it in both the head and the chest, kind of like "common time" or at the same time.
Chinese: 所以當聲音成為我新嘅藝術媒介時 我沈醉咗喺音樂世界裏面

English: Yes, got it.
Chinese: 令我訝異嘅係 音樂同美國手語竟然有好多相似之處

English: That means "to fall in love" in International [Sign].
Chinese: 譬如話一個音符 係冇辦法完全咁用紙紀錄低

English: (Laughter) International [Sign], as a note, is a visual tool to help communicate across cultures and sign languages around the world.
Chinese: 美國手語嘅一個概念都係咁

English: The second one I'd like to demonstrate is this -- please follow along with me again.
Chinese: 佢哋都係立體嘅 同埋字嘅結構會隨著意思唔同 而有所變化 意思就係一啲細小嘅變化 都可以改變手語同言語成個意義

English: And now this.
Chinese: 我想同你哋分享一個有關鋼琴嘅比喻 咁你哋就可以了解美國手語係點樣

English: This is "colonization" in ASL.
Chinese: 我哋係腦海中想像一個鋼琴

English: (Laughter) Now the third -- please follow along again.
Chinese: 美國手語可以分解成唔同嘅語法參數

English: And again.
Chinese: 如果你將唔同嘅語法參數 分配俾彈鋼琴嘅每隻手指 譬如話︰面部表情、身體動作 速度、手形 當你演奏鋼琴陣時… 因為英文係線型語言 就好似每次只可以表達一種音符 好似獨唱咁

English: This is "enlightenment" in ASL.
Chinese: 但係美國手語就更加似合唱 十個手指都需要同時演奏 去表達一個清晰嘅美國手語符號

English: So let's do all three together.
Chinese: 如果其中一個音符改變咗 咁成個意思都會唔同

English: Fall in love, "colonization" and "enlightenment."

English: More than 14,000 people died in an instant.

English: Thank you.

English: (Applause)

English: So we had to design in a context that we knew almost nothing about, except one thing: it would all be about verticality.

English: Of course, the skyscraper is vertical -- it's a profoundly hierarchical structure, the top always the best, the bottom the worst, and the taller you are, the better, so it seems.
Chinese: 為咗做呢啲 我哋繪製咗個好簡單嘅地形圖 顯示核電廠周圍嘅地方

English: And we wanted to ask ourselves, could a building be about a completely different quality?
Chinese: 之後我哋整埋個立視圖 灑上顏料，反映輻射嘅實時數據 我哋灑上水嚟模擬落雨

English: Could it undo this hierarchy, and could it be about a system that is more about collaboration, rather than isolation?
Chinese: 咁樣我哋就可以見到輻射塵埃 由山上沖到落河裡面 然後流到大海

English: So we took this needle and bent it back into itself, into a loop of interconnected activities.
Chinese: 呢個係一個粗略估算

English: Our idea was to bring all aspects of television-making into one single structure: news, program production, broadcasting, research and training, administration -- all into a circuit of interconnected activities where people would meet in a process of exchange and collaboration.
Chinese: 有咗呢個概念之後 我哋組織咗一次探索行動 呢次係平民最接近核電廠嘅一次

English: I still very much like this image.
Chinese: 我哋喺距離核電廠 1.5 公里嘅海面上面 因為有漁民幫手 我哋先至收集到海床上面嘅沉積物 用我哋發明嘅沉積物採集器

English: It reminds one of biology classes, if you remember the human body with all its organs and circulatory systems, like at school.
Chinese: 我哋將沉澱物放入細膠袋 然後再擺入幾百個袋 送去唔同嘅大學 然後我哋做咗個海床輻射地圖 特別針對魚類繁殖嘅河口 我希望我哋嘅工作 能夠令本地漁民 同你鍾意嘅壽司都安全啲

English: And suddenly you think of architecture no longer as built substance, but as an organism, as a life form.
Chinese: （笑聲） 你可以見到一個發展歷程 我哋由本地問題開始 到偏遠地方嘅問題，再到全球問題

English: And as you start to dissect this organism, you can identify a series of primary technical clusters -- program production, broadcasting center and news.
Chinese: 喺不同規模度做令人非常之興奮 興奮亦都在於用嘅科技都係簡單同開放

English: Those are tightly intertwined with social clusters: meeting rooms, canteens, chat areas -- informal spaces for people to meet and exchange.
Chinese: 但係同時愈嚟愈令人覺得挫折 因為我哋只係啱啱開始量度 我哋過去造成傷害

English: So the organizational structure of this building was a hybrid between the technical and the social, the human and the performative.
Chinese: 我哋仲未開始解決問題

English: And of course, we used the loop of the building as a circulatory system, to thread everything together and to allow both visitors and staff to experience all these different functions in a great unity.
Chinese: 所以我諗，或者我哋嚟一個進步 發明更加好嘅嘢解決曬所有問題

English: With 473,000 square meters, it is one of the largest buildings ever built in the world.
Chinese: 諗好之後我哋發覺課室唔夠大 我哋喺香港搵咗一個工廠大廈嘅單位 將佢改成最大空間 專注於社會同環境影響方面嘅工作

English: It has a population of over 10,000 people, and of course, this is a scale that exceeds the comprehension of many things and the scale of typical architecture.
Chinese: 佢喺香港嘅市區 一個我哋可以做木工、金工 化學、生物、光學嘅地方 基本上你可以喺呢度整到任何嘢

English: So we stopped work for a while and sat down and cut 10,000 little sticks and glued them onto a model, just simply to confront ourselves with what that quantity actually meant.
Chinese: 呢個係一個大人同細路 可以一齊玩嘅地方

English: But of course, it's not a number, it is the people, it is a community that inhabits the building, and in order to both comprehend this, but also script this architecture, we identified five characters, hypothetical characters, and we followed them throughout their day in a life in this building, thought of where they would meet, what they would experience.
Chinese: 一個大人幫小朋友實現夢想 令細路夢想可以成真嘅地方 大人都可以喺度重新體驗做細路嘅感覺

English: So it was a way to script and design the building, but of course, also to communicate its experiences.
Chinese: 學生：加速！加速！

English: This was part of an exhibition with the Museum of Modern Art in both New York and Beijing.
Chinese: 講者︰我哋問梗一啲問題，例如 我哋可唔可以用再生能源 創造未來行路嘅工具嗎？

English: This is the main broadcast control room, a technical installation so large, it can broadcast over 200 channels simultaneously.
Chinese: 或者我哋可唔可以幫老化緊嘅人口 將輪椅改裝成電動車？

English: And this is how the building stands in Beijing today.
Chinese: 塑膠、石油同輻射 都係人類留低好可怕嘅嘢 但都未算最壞 最壞嘅係對細路講大話

English: Its first broadcast live was the London Olympics 2012, after it had been completed from the outside for the Beijing Olympics.
Chinese: 我哋唔能夠再對細路仔隱瞞核突嘅真相 因為我哋需要佢哋嘅想像力 去整一啲解決方案出嚟

English: And you can see at the very tip of this 75-meter cantilever, those three little circles.
Chinese: 所以，平民科學家、生產者、夢想家 我哋一定要培育好下個世代 令佢哋關心環境同人類 咁樣佢哋先能夠做出真正改變

English: And they're indeed part of a public loop that goes through the building.
Chinese: 多謝

English: They're a piece of glass that you can stand on and watch the city pass by below you in slow motion.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: The building has become part of everyday life in Beijing.
It is there.
Chinese: 喺過去好幾個世紀 建築行業受一條著名理論魔咒所左右

English: It has also become a very popular backdrop for wedding photography.
Chinese: 「型式追隨功能」呢個理論 一度成為當代最雄心勃勃嘅理念 同時又係個帶有不良影響嘅緊箍咒 呢句話雖然令建築唔再使講求裝飾功能 但同時令建築走向 純功能同有限用途嘅方向

English: (Laughter) But its most important moment is maybe sill this one.
Chinese: 當然，建築係講功能性 但我想重新演譯 Bernard Tschumi 呢句話嘅意思

English: That's Beijing is similar to "Time Out," a magazine that broadcasts what is happening in town during the week, and suddenly you see the building portrayed no longer as physical matter, but actually as an urban actor, as part of a series of personas that define the life of the city.
Chinese: 如果「型隨小說」 我哋可以理解建築設計同建築物 為一個空間嘅故事 有關居住果度嘅人嘅故事 同埋裡面做嘢嘅人嘅故事

English: So architecture suddenly assumes the quality of a player, of something that writes stories and performs stories.
Chinese: 我哋可以想像 我哋建築物留低俾人嘅印象

English: And I think that could be one of its primary meanings that we believe in.
Chinese: 因為噉樣，我對小說感興趣嘅原因 唔係因為佢夠虛幻，而係因為真實 就好似建築對住喺裡面嘅居民 嚟講嘅意義一樣

English: But of course, there's another story to this building.
Chinese: 我哋嘅建築物都 可以話係一啲雛形、諗法 話俾人聽我哋生活空間 或者工作空間可以唔同 以至文化、媒體空間 喺現今世代可以係點嘅樣

English: It is the story of the people that made it -- 400 engineers and architects that I was guiding over almost a decade of collaborative work that we spent together in scripting this building, in imagining its reality and ultimately getting it built in China.
Chinese: 我哋嘅建築物係真嘅 佢哋係起出嚟

English: This is a residential development in Singapore, large scale.
Chinese: 佢哋係實物同想法

English: If we look at Singapore like most of Asia and more and more of the world, of course, it is dominated by the tower, a typology that indeed creates more isolation than connectedness, and I wanted to ask, how could we think about living, not only in terms of the privacy and individuality of ourselves and our apartment, but in an idea of a collective?
Chinese: 我會將我哋嘅建築物諗成係組織嘅結構

English: How could we think about creating a communal environment in which sharing things was as great as having your own?
Chinese: 佢哋核心係結構思想 就好似一個系統咁 我哋點樣令啲嘢 同時具有功能同實驗用途？

English: The typical answer to the question -- we had to design 1,040 apartments -- would have looked like this: 24-story height limit given by the planning authorities, 12 towers with nothing but residual in between -- a very tight system that, although the tower isolates you, it doesn't even give you privacy, because you're so close to the next one, that it is very questionable what the qualities of this would be.
Chinese: 我哋點樣可以令到結構 帶出一系列關係同故事呢？

English: So I proposed to topple the towers, throw the vertical into the horizontal and stack them up, and what looks a bit random from the side, if you look from the viewpoint of the helicopter, you can see its organizational structure is actually a hexagonal grid, in which these horizontal building blocks are stacked up to create huge outdoor courtyards -- central spaces for the community, programmed with a variety of amenities and functions.
Chinese: 而喺建築物裡面嘅居民 同用戶似小說一樣嘅故事 可以點樣幫棟建築物加添一啲嘅描述？ 同時建築物可以影響返呢啲故事？

English: And you see that these courtyards are not hermetically sealed spaces.
Chinese: 第二個字係我叫做嘅「故事混合體」 好多個同時進行嘅故事 喺我哋嘅建築物展開

English: They're open, permeable; they're interconnected.
Chinese: 所以我哋可以想像建築物 喺程式上、功能上 實驗上、情緒性或者社會上 係一個複雜嘅關係嚟

English: We called the project "The Interlace," thinking that we interlace and interconnect the human beings and the spaces alike.
Chinese: 呢個係中國中央電視台嘅總部 呢棟建築物係我同 Rem Koolhaas 喺 大都會建築事務嗰陣一齊設計

English: And the detailed quality of everything we designed was about animating the space and giving the space to the inhabitants.
Chinese: 2002 年當我第一次到北京果陣 城市規劃員向我哋展示一張城市藍圖︰ 過百棟高樓大廈將會出現喺中央商業區 但當時只有為數唔多嘅大樓喺度

English: And, in fact, it was a system where we would layer primarily communal spaces, stacked to more and more individual and private spaces.
Chinese: 所以喺幾乎咩都唔知嘅情況下設計 我哋只係知道，座建築會係垂直嘅

English: So we would open up a spectrum between the collective and the individual.
Chinese: 當然，高樓大廈都係垂直嘅 垂直式係其中一種嘅大廈類型 頂部永遠係最好 底部永遠係最差 似乎係，你起得越高就越好

English: A little piece of math: if we count all the green that we left on the ground, minus the footprint of the buildings, and we would add back the green of all the terraces, we have 112 percent green space, so more nature than not having built a building.
Chinese: 我哋問自己 一棟建築物可唔可以 有一個完全唔同嘅特性？

English: And of course this little piece of math shows you that we are multiplying the space available to those who live there.
Chinese: 佢可唔可以擺脫以往思維 佢可唔可以係黏埋一齊 而並非一支嘢孤零零呢？

English: This is, in fact, the 13th floor of one of these terraces.
Chinese: 所以我哋將呢支針拗彎 形成一個空間互通嘅環

English: So you see new datum planes, new grounds planes for social activity.
Chinese: 我哋想將電視製作嘅所有環節 融合到同一個結構裡面： 新聞、節目製作、廣播 資料搜集、訓練、行政 全部活動可以係呢個圈入面進行 個個可以係度見面、交流同合作

English: We paid a lot of attention to sustainability.
Chinese: 我仍然好鐘意呢幅圖

English: In the tropics, the sun is the most important thing to pay attention to, and, in fact, it is seeking protection from the sun.
Chinese: 佢令我諗返起生物堂 如果你仲記得人體構造 各種器官同循環系統就好似一座建築咁

English: We first proved that all apartments would have sufficient daylight through the year.
Chinese: 突然你會覺得建築物 唔單單係建築材料堆成嘅嘢 佢更加似一個生命體

English: We then went on to optimize the glazing of the facades to minimize the energy consumption of the building.
Chinese: 而當你開始剖析呢個生命體 你分辨到一系列嘅基本嘅技術部門 節目製作部、廣播中心、新聞部

English: But most importantly, we could prove that through the geometry of the building design, the building itself would provide sufficient shading to the courtyards so that those would be usable throughout the entire year.
Chinese: 佢哋同社交設施 例如會議室、餐廳、交談區 係一齊、唔可以分開 亦都係非正式場合俾人見面交流

English: We further placed water bodies along the prevailing wind corridors, so that evaporative cooling would create microclimates that, again, would enhance the quality of those spaces available for the inhabitants.
Chinese: 所以呢個建築物嘅組織結構係種混合體 集技術、社交、人同表演於一身

English: And it was the idea of creating this variety of choices, of freedom to think where you would want to be, where you would want to escape, maybe, within the own complexity of the complex in which you live.
Chinese: 我哋利用環形嘅特點串聯每一樣嘢 令訪客同員工都可以 喺呢個建築裡面體驗唔同用途

English: But coming from Asia to Europe: a building for a German media company based in Berlin, transitioning from the traditional print media to the digital media.
Chinese: 473,000 平方米嘅建築面積 令佢成為全世界數一數二大嘅建築物

English: And its CEO asked a few very pertinent questions: Why would anyone today still want to go to the office, because you can actually work anywhere?
Chinese: 裡面可以容納一萬人 冇錯，咁嘅規模超出咗我哋 對一般建築物嘅理解範圍

English: And how could a digital identity of a company be embodied in a building?
Chinese: 所以我們停工過一排 然後坐低，剪出一萬張貼紙仔 將佢哋貼係一個模型上面 只係單純咁想挑戰我哋自己 對數字真正嘅理解

English: We created not only an object, but at the center of this object we created a giant space, and this space was about the experience of a collective, the experience of collaboration and of togetherness.
Chinese: 但當然啦，最重要嘅唔係數字 而係人，生活喺呢棟大樓裡面嘅社群 為咗理解班人兼為建築物寫藍本 我哋創造咗五個虛擬人物 然後用一日時間睇下佢哋喺 呢棟大樓嘅生活動態 睇下佢哋會喺邊度見其他人 佢哋會經歷乜嘢

English: Communication, interaction as the center of a space that in itself would float, like what we call the collaborative cloud, in the middle of the building, surrounded by an envelope of standard modular offices.
Chinese: 呢個係描繪同設計建築嘅方法 咁當然，都係一種體會佢嘅方式

English: So with only a few steps from your quiet work desk, you could participate in the giant collective experience of the central space.
Chinese: 呢個係同現代美術館 喺北京同紐約搞嘅展覧

English: Finally, we come to London, a project commissioned by the London Legacy Development Corporation of the Mayor of London.
Chinese: 呢度係廣播控制室 安裝要求相當大 呢度可以同時播二百個頻道

English: We were asked to undertake a study and investigate the potential of a site out in Stratford in the Olympic Park.
Chinese: 呢個係佢依家喺北京嘅外貌

English: In the 19th century, Prince Albert had created Albertopolis.
Chinese: 佢做嘅第一次直播係 2012 年倫敦奧運會 嗰次之前，佢已經試過喺外面 完成北京奧運嘅轉播

English: And Boris Johnson thought of creating Olympicopolis.
Chinese: 你可以喺 75 米懸臂嗰頂睇風景 呢三個細圓圈就係

English: The idea was to bring together some of Britain's greatest institutions, some international ones, and to create a new system of synergies.
Chinese: 貫穿整棟大樓嘅開放迴廊嘅一部分

English: Prince Albert, as yet, created Albertopolis in the 19th century, thought of showcasing all achievements of mankind, bringing arts and science closer together.
Chinese: 佢哋用玻璃做 你可以企喺上面俯瞰你腳下 成個城市慢慢運作

English: And he built Exhibition Road, a linear sequence of those institutions.
Chinese: 呢棟建築已經係北京生活嘅一部分

English: But of course, today's society has moved on from there.
Chinese: 佢就係果度

English: We no longer live in a world in which everything is as clearly delineated or separated from each other.
Chinese: 佢亦將變成咗北京 一個相當受歡迎嘅婚禮攝影場地

English: We live in a world in which boundaries start to blur between the different domains, and in which collaboration and interaction becomes far more important than keeping separations.
Chinese: （笑聲） 但最重要嘅時刻可能係 當呢本《城市漫步》嘅週刊

English: So we wanted to think of a giant culture machine, a building that would orchestrate and animate the various domains, but allow them to interact and collaborate.
Chinese: 一本似倫敦《Time Out》嘅週刊 描述嗰個星期城市發生咗咩事 突然間你會發現 呢棟大樓唔單止只係一棟大樓 佢仲同時扮演梗城市嘅一員 決定咗呢個城市嘅生活

English: At the base of it is a very simple module, a ring module.
Chinese: 建築設計突然間有咗人嘅特徵 好似作家咁寫故事、表達故事

English: It can function as a double-loaded corridor, has daylight, has ventilation.
Chinese: 而我認為呢樣可以成為 其中一個我哋相信嘅建築嘅基本意義

English: It can be glazed over and turned into a giant exhibitional performance space.
Chinese: 呢棟大樓仲有另一個故事

English: These modules were stacked together with the idea that almost any function could, over time, occupy any of these modules.
Chinese: 就係建造佢嘅人嘅故事 四百個由我帶領幾乎超過十年 嘅工程師同建築師 我們一齊起呢棟大樓 想像佢成真 到最後終於喺中國內地將佢起好

English: So institutions could shrink or contract, as, of course, the future of culture is, in a way, the most uncertain of all.
Chinese: 呢個係一個係新加坡嘅大型住宅項目

English: This is how the building sits, adjacent to the Aquatics Centre, opposite the Olympic Stadium.
Chinese: 如果我哋睇下新加坡 佢同亞洲多數地方 同全世界好多地方一樣 都係以高樓大廈為主 一種普遍現象係 呢類型嘅大廈營造咗疏離感 而唔係聯繫感 而我想問 我哋可以點樣唔單止將住宅睇成係 自己既私隱、個人同住所 以至係一種集體嘅嘢 ?

English: And you can see how its cantilevering volumes project out and engage the public space and how its courtyards animate the public inside.
Chinese: 我哋要諗下點創造 一個促進社區交流嘅環境 令你樂意同人分享自己嘅嘢 ?

English: The idea was to create a complex system in which institutional entities could maintain their own identity, in which they would not be subsumed in a singular volume.
Chinese: 典型嘅解答係 我哋要設計出 1,040 間公寓 外型就好似咁︰ 當地政府法例限制樓宇只可以有 24 層高 12 棟大樓咩都冇 之間只有用剩嘅土地 相當緊密的格局 雖然住樓可以將你同其他人分隔開 但根本俾唔到你私隱 因為你離隔籬鄰居係好近 亦令人非常質疑住樓嘅質素

English: Here's a scale comparison to the Centre Pompidou in Paris.
Chinese: 所以，我建議推淋晒大廈 將垂直設計改做水平設計 將佢哋堆砌起嚟 從側面睇係不規則嘅 如果你搭直升機睇落去 你可以睇到佢嘅組織結構 水平建築物擺埋一齊會形成六邊形 務求中間有一個大嘅花園 有著好多設施同功能

English: It both shows the enormous scale and potential of the project, but also the difference: here, it is a multiplicity of a heterogeneous structure, in which different entities can interact without losing their own identity.
Chinese: 呢啲花園並唔係密閉空間

English: And it was this thought: to create an organizational structure that would allow for multiple narratives to be scripted -- for those in the educational parts that create and think culture; for those that present the visual arts, the dance; and for the public to be admitted into all of this with a series of possible trajectories, to script their own reading of these narratives and their own experience.
Chinese: 佢哋係開放、通透、互通嘅

English: And I want to end on a project that is very small, in a way, very different: a floating cinema in the ocean of Thailand.
Chinese: 我們叫呢個項目做「交錯」 好似我哋將人連埋一齊 空間都係一樣

English: Friends of mine had founded a film festival, and I thought, if we think of the stories and narratives of movies, we should also think of the narratives of the people that watch them.
Chinese: 我們設計嘅每樣細節都係想活化空間 還居民空間

English: So I designed a small modular floating platform, based on the techniques of local fishermen, how they built their lobster and fish farms.
Chinese: 事實上，呢個系統裏面 我哋既會強調公共空間 又會重視私人空間

English: There isn't any evidence to suggest that individuals have dominant sides of the brain, or to support the idea of a left-right split between logic and creativity.
Chinese: 又或者，寫呢本書嘅人係 一群嘗試為一種口頭語言 建立字母嘅中世紀學者

English: Some people may be particularly logical or creative, but that has nothing to do with the sides of their brains.
Chinese: 如果係噉，伏尼契手稿就可能 好似復活島嘅朗格朗格手稿 因為當年嘅文明已經消失 宜家就冇人睇得明

English: And even the idea of logic and creativity being at odds with each other doesn't hold up well.
Chinese: 儘管冇人明白伏尼契手稿 但係有好多人仲喺度估佢講咩

English: Solving complex math problems requires inspired creativity and many vibrant works of art have intricate logical frameworks.
Chinese: 有人認為佢喺度創造 一種新嘅書面語言 伏尼契手稿又可能係個 創造呢種語言嘅文化嘅百科全書

English: Almost every feat of creativity and logic carries the mark of the whole brain functioning as one.
Chinese: 仲有人諗伏尼契手稿嘅作者 係 13 世紀哲學家羅傑培根 培根曾經嘗試理解 所有語言共有嘅語法法則 手稿嘅作者又可能係 16 世紀 伊麗莎白時代嘅神秘主義者尊迪 尊迪曾經研究過煉藥術同占卜術
更加邊緣嘅理論認為 作者係一班意大利嘅巫婆 甚至有人諗作者係火星人

English: Thousands of years from now, we'll look back at the first century of computing as a fascinating but very peculiar time -- the only time in history where humans were reduced to live in 2D space, interacting with technology as if we were machines; a singular, 100-year period in the vastness of time where humans communicated, were entertained and managed their lives from behind a screen.
Chinese: 度橋度咗成百年後 啲科學家終於有咗啲頭緒

English: Today, we spend most of our time tapping and looking at screens.
Chinese: 第一個突破就係用碳素測年法

English: What happened to interacting with each other?
Chinese: 測到呢份手稿嘅起源 大概喺 1612 年嘅羅馬或者布拉格 佢可能係神聖羅馬帝國皇帝魯道夫二世 轉手畀佢嘅醫生 雅各布斯．希納皮亞斯

English: I don't know about you, but I feel limited inside this 2D world of monitors and pixels.
Chinese: 除咗呢哋突破 啲語言學家啱啱 暫定識別咗手稿裡邊嘅幾個文字

English: And it is this very limitation and my desire to connect with people that inspires me as a creator.
Chinese: 呢度七粒星隔离嘅文字 會唔會係 Tauran 既係 Taurus（金牛座）嘅别称 一個包含昴宿星團嘅星座？

English: Put simply: I want to create a new reality, a reality where technology brings us infinitely closer to each other, a reality where people, not devices, are the center of everything.
Chinese: 呢個字會唔會係 Centaurun 即係圖裡邊嘅 Centaurea（矢車菊）？

English: I dream of a reality where technology senses what we see, touch and feel; a reality where technology no longer gets in our way, but instead embraces who we are.
Chinese: 有可能嘅， 不過進展就好慢

English: I dream of technology on a human path.
Chinese: 如果我哋破解咗密碼， 我哋會發現咩？

English: We have all experienced technology that enables people to act more like people, products that enable natural interactions, voice controls or biometrics.
Chinese: 一個 15 世纪插圖家嘅夢記？

English: This is the next step in the evolution.
Chinese: 一堆胡言亂語？

English: This is Microsoft HoloLens, the first fully untethered holographic computer.
Chinese: 仲係一個被遺忘嘅文明嘅 失傳嘅知識？

English: Devices like this will bring 3D holographic content right into our world, enhancing the way we experience life beyond our ordinary range of perceptions.
Chinese: 你點睇嚟？

English: Now, I'm not thinking about a distant future.

We are already seeing car companies like Volvo designing cars differently with HoloLens; universities like Case Western redefining the way medical students learn; and my personal favorite, NASA is using HoloLens to let scientists explore planets holographically.
Chinese: 我地睇到人類嘅腦 係分成左右兩塊嘅

English: Now, this is important.
Chinese: 呢個結構令人都產生 一個非常普遍嘅觀點 左腦控制人嘅邏輯思維 右腦就控制人嘅創意

English: By bringing holograms into our world, I'm not just talking about a new device or a better computer.
Chinese: 但其實呢個理論並無科學嘅依據

English: I'm talking about freeing ourselves from the 2D confines of traditional computing.
Chinese: 咁點解會有呢個錯誤理論產生 佢又錯係邊度呢？

English: Put it this way: temporally adjusted, we're like cave people in computer terms.
Chinese: 人腦的確分成左右兩部分

English: We've barely discovered charcoal and started drawing the first stick figures in our cave.
Chinese: 從外層同皮質就可以睇到

English: Now, this is the perspective I apply to my work every single day.
Chinese: 內部結構 例如紋狀體 下丘腦 丘腦 同腦幹 睇上去好似由連續組織構成 但事實上 佢哋同時都受左右腦組織

English: And now for the next few minutes, I invite all of you to apply the same perspective to the journey ahead of us.
Chinese: 左右腦都控制唔同嘅身體功能 例如運動同視力

English: Now, as I put this HoloLens on, let me explain the setup a little bit.
Chinese: 右腦控制左手左腳嘅運動 反過來都係咁

English: It's probably the most risky demo we have ever done on any stage with HoloLens, and I can't think of a better place to do it than here at TED.
Chinese: 視覺系統就更加複雜

English: Momentarily, I am going to be seeing holograms right on this stage, just as clearly as I can see all of you.
Chinese: 每隻眼都分成左右兩個視野

English: Now at the same time, we have also this special camera that just walked in onstage so that all of you can share in this experience with me up on all the monitors.
Chinese: 兩隻眼嘅左視野都係右腦負責 兩隻眼嘅右視野就係左腦負責

English: So let's start our journey.
Chinese: 左右腦一齊運作先可以 睇到完整嘅畫面

English: And what better place to begin our journey, than in the computer cave of 2D.
Chinese: 科學家都唔知點解 人嘅左右腦會有交換分工

English: Let's explore the world all around us with this new lens, and understand the computer world from a brand new perspective.
Chinese: 其中一個理論係 交換分工令動物可以有更快嘅反應 所以喺動物發展神經系統之後無幾耐 就有呢個現象了

English: The computer universe is both marvelous and primitive.
Chinese: 如果一個動物睇到捕食者從左邊過來 佢最好從右邊逃走

English: As developers, we dream the different causes and then we program the different effects.
Chinese: 所以視覺同運動其實係由 左右腦兩個系統控制嘅 但就唔可以過度理解成 左右腦分別負責邏輯同創意

English: Double click on an icon, that's a cause.
Chinese: 呢個誤解來源於 18 世紀中 當 Broca 同 Wernicke 兩個神經學家研究 因創傷有溝通問題嘅病人嘅時候

English: Open an application, that's an effect.
Chinese: 佢哋發現病人嘅左顳葉有創傷 所以推測語言能力係左腦控制嘅

English: Now when we compare this to our physical universe, it is overly constraining, because our universe is not digital.
Chinese: 呢個推論好快傳播開來

English: Our universe is analog.
Chinese: 作家 Robert Louis Stevenson 曾經通過佢筆下嘅角色 Jekyll 博士和 Hyde 先生 引出理性嘅左腦 同感性嘅右腦對抗嘅諗法

English: Our universe doesn't think in terms of zero or one, true or false, or black or white.
Chinese: 但當醫生同科學家研究 缺少一個大腦半球 或者兩個大腦半球分割嘅病人

English: We exist in a world governed by quantum physics, a universe of zero and one both at the same time, a reality based on infinite probabilities and shades of gray.
Chinese: 嘅時候發現 呢個理論係錯誤的 呢啲病人表現出一系列嘅行為

English: You can see how these two worlds collide.
Chinese: 既有邏輯性嘅亦有創意性嘅 之後研究發現 當大腦運行某些功能時

English: So why are screens so pervasive in our analog life?
Chinese: 其一側會比另外一側更活躍 語言功能更加依賴左腦 而注意力更加依賴右腦

English: We see screens from the moment we wake up, to the moment we fall asleep.
Chinese: 所以一側嘅大腦可能會負責更多嘅工作 但呢個就取決於唔同系統嘅運作 而唔係個人

English: Why?
Chinese: 無任何證據證明 一個人會由一邊腦來主導 左右腦分別控制 邏輯和創意力 有啲人會特別有邏輯或者有創意

English: I think it's because computers give us superpowers.
Chinese: 但同佢哋嘅左右腦並無關係 甚至「邏輯同創意相互矛盾」嘅觀點

English: Within the digital universe, we have the power to displace space and the power to displace time.
Chinese: 都係錯嘅 解決複雜嘅數學問題需要有創意

English: It doesn't matter if you're using technology for entertainment, productivity or communication.
Chinese: 而好多充滿活力嘅藝術作品 都有復雜嘅邏輯框架

English: Think of it this way: let's all go home tonight and watch our favorite show on television.
Chinese: 幾乎每一個創造力同邏輯嘅壯舉 都係依靠左右腦一齊運作嘅功勞

English: This is theater -- time and space displaced.
As soon as I'm done with this TED Talk, I'm going to immediately call my lovely family in Seattle.
Chinese: 幾千年後 當我哋睇返電腦誕生嗰時 會覺得係一個令人著迷、好奇嘅時代 係歷史上唯一一個 人類活喺二維空間嘅時代 人類好似機械咁同科技共處 亦都係時間長河裏邊嘅一個世紀 人類喺屏幕面前通訊、娛樂、生活

English: That's displacement of space.
Chinese: 如今，我哋大部分時間都睇同襟螢幕

English: Now, these are such great superpowers that we put up with the two-dimensional limitations of our current digital world.
Chinese: 但係，人與人之間嘅交流發生咩問題？

English: But what if we didn't have to?
Chinese: 我唔知你點諗，但我覺得有限制 感覺自己限制喺 只有螢幕同像素嘅二維世界裏邊

English: What if we could have these same digital powers in our world?
Chinese: 就係咁樣嘅限制 同埋我想同人交流嘅想法 令我成爲創作人

English: You can already see glimmers of this, but I believe our children's children will grow up in a world devoid of 2D technology.
Chinese: 即係話，我想整一個全新嘅現實 科技可以無限拉近人與人之間距離 係以人爲本 而唔係以電子產品爲本

English: It's remarkable to dream of this world, a world where technology truly understands us -- where we live, work and communicate -- with tools that enhance the human experience, not machines that limit our humanity.
Chinese: 我想見到一個環境 科技會感受到 人嘅所見所聞、所感覺嘅嘢 但科技又唔會阻住我哋生活 而係能夠令人類鍾意自己

English: So how do we get there?
Chinese: 我用人類發展嘅過程去諗呢種科技

English: For me, the answer required looking at the problem from a different perspective.
Chinese: 我哋所有人都用過 一啲令人更加似返人嘅科技 一啲令人做到自然交流 聲控同埋生物統計嘅產品

English: It required sensing the world from the perspective of a machine.
Chinese: 但係科技發展嘅下一步係 微軟公司嘅全息眼鏡

English: If you're a machine trying to sense our world, how would you actually break the problem down?
Chinese: 同埋第一個無線全息圖電腦

English: You'd probably try to classify things as a human, an environment or an object.
Chinese: 呢類電子產品可以將三維全息影像 帶到嚟你眼前 係前所未有咁感知世界 有助我哋感受生活

English: But how would that machine then interact with reality?
Chinese: 我講緊嘅唔係好遠嘅將來，而係現實

English: And I can think of three ways.
Chinese: 汽車製造商沃爾沃 已經用緊全息眼鏡設計汽車 凱斯西儲大學嘅醫科生 用緊全息眼鏡學習 我最鍾意嘅美國太空總署 已經採用全息眼鏡 等科學家可以探索星球

English: First, as a machine, I would observe or I would input reality.
Chinese: 更加重要係

English: Speech recognition and biometric authentication are great examples of a machine interacting with humans from an input perspective.
Chinese: 全息眼鏡唔剩係一款新產品 或者更高級嘅電腦

English: Secondly, as a machine, I could place digital information, or output information, into reality.
Chinese: 透過將全息圖帶到我哋日常生活當中 全息眼鏡能夠將人 喺傳統二維空間裏面解放出嚟

English: Holograms are examples of a machine interacting with an environment from an output perspective.
Chinese: 打個比喻 我哋就好似原始人

English: Finally, as a machine, I could exchange energy with the world via haptics.
Chinese: 我哋啱啱搵到一嚿木炭 然後開始喺洞穴裏邊 畫第一幅線條圖畫

English: Now, imagine being able to feel the temperature of a virtual object, or better yet, imagine pushing a hologram and having it push you back with equal force.
Chinese: 宜家，等我話畀你聽 我每日做嘢嘅情景

English: With this perspective, we are able to collapse reality into a simple matrix.
Chinese: 接住落嚟嘅時間 我邀請你哋一齊感受一下明日嘅科技

English: Now here's a secret: as an engineer, I get really excited anytime I can reduce something to the matrix.
Chinese: 宜家，就等我戴上全息眼鏡 等我解釋一下裝置問題

English: From self-driving cars to smartphones to this holographic computer on my head, machines are becoming capable of understanding our world.
Chinese: 我之前喺台上做過好多次全息眼鏡示範 但今次可能係最危險嘅一次 但我諗唔到比 TED 更加適合做示範嘅場所

English: And they are starting to interact with us in significantly more personal ways.
Chinese: 好快，我會喺台上面見到全息圖影像 影像清楚到同台下嘅你哋一樣

English: Now, imagine having granular control over everything in the world.
Chinese: 期間，會有攝影機 通過大屏幕播放我睇到嘅影像 等大家可以同我一齊感受

English: Move the dial one way, and you get reality.
Chinese: 咁宜家開始啦

English: Move the dial the other way, and you get virtual reality.
Chinese: 呢樣嘢比起二維影像更加適合我哋

English: Now, imagine dialing your entire environment between virtual and real worlds.
Chinese: 等我哋用新器材探索我哋周圍嘅世界 同埋用全新角度了解電腦世界

English: I love it down here.
Chinese: 電腦世界既不可思議、原始 又係基於因果定律

English: Now, imagine if I could look at all of you and dial from real humans into elves.
Chinese: 作爲開發者 我哋要考慮唔同輸入嘅情況 然後設計出對應嘅畫面反應

English: When technology truly understands our world, it will again transform the ways we interact, the ways we work and the ways we play.
Chinese: 好似襟圖案兩下，就係輸入

English: Less than half a century ago, two courageous men landed on the moon, using computers that were less powerful than the phones in your pockets.

English: Six hundred million humans watched them on grainy, black-and-white televisions.
Chinese: 當我哋將呢啲嘢同現實世界比嘅話 就會顯示出現實世界嘅局限 因爲現實世界 唔似數碼世界嘅數字斷斷續續

English: And the world?
Chinese: 而係好似指針一樣連續進行嘅

English: The world was mesmerized.
Chinese: 現實世界唔會用 0 或者 1 啱定錯、黑或白嘅方法去諗嘢

English: Now imagine how our children and their children will experience the continued exploration of space with technology that understands this world.
Chinese: 但量子物理控制咗我哋嘅世界 我哋嘅世界會同時出現 0 同 1 令世界有灰色地帶 同無窮無盡嘅可能性

English: We already live in a world where real-time universal translators exist.
Chinese: 你可以見到現實 同數碼兩個世界點樣有衝突

English: And I can squint, and I can already see holographic telepresence in our near future.
Chinese: 咁點解螢幕喺我哋 連貫嘅生活裏面咁普遍呢？

English: In fact, since we've been lucky with our demo so far, let's try doing something else even more crazy.
Chinese: 我哋一起身睇嘅嘢就係螢幕 瞓覺前睇嘅又係螢幕

English: I invite you to experience, for the first time anywhere in the world, here on the TED stage, a real-life holographic teleportation, between me and my friend, Dr. Jeffrey Norris, from NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory.
Chinese: 點解會咁呢？

English: Finger crossed. Hi, Jeff.
Chinese: 我諗係因爲電腦畀我哋好多力量

English: Jeff Norris: Hey, Alex.
Chinese: 喺數碼世界裏邊 我哋有能力將空間替換，將時間替換

English: Alex Kipman: Phew! That worked. How are you doing today, Jeff?
Chinese: 無論你將科技用喺娛樂用途 工作上，抑或通訊上

English: (Applause) JN: Doing great. I had an awesome week.
Chinese: 想像下 我哋今晚一齊返屋企 睇我哋最鐘意嘅電視節目

English: AK: So, can you tell us a little bit, Jeff, about where you are?
Chinese: 喺呢間戲院入面，時間同空間改變咗

English: JN: Well, I'm actually in three places.
Chinese: 當我好快完咗呢場 TED 演講之後 我會即刻打畀我西雅圖嘅家人

English: I'm standing in a room across the street, while I'm standing on this stage with you, while I'm standing on Mars, a hundred million miles away.
Chinese: 呢個時候，空間改變咗

English: AK: Wow, a hundred million miles away. This is crazy!
Chinese: 可以睇到影響好大 我哋仲可以將影響 同當今數碼世界嘅二維限制結合起黎

English: Can you tell us a little bit more about where all this data from Mars is coming from?
Chinese: 但係，如果我哋無需要咁做呢？

English: JN: Absolutely.
Chinese: 如果我哋嘅數碼世界有同樣嘅影響呢？

English: This is a precise holographic replica of Mars, built from data captured by the Curiosity Mars Rover, that I can explore as easily as a place on Earth.

English: Humans are natural explorers.
Chinese: 到時將會係一個更加非凡嘅世界 當科技真真正正明白人類時 無論生活、工作定係通訊方面 我哋都會有工具提升體驗 唔會再有機械阻礙人類體驗事物

English: We can instantly understand an environment, just by being present in it.

English: We've built tools like our Mars Rover to extend our vision and lengthen our reach.
Chinese: 對我嚟講 首先要從第二個角度搵出問題

English: But for decades, we've explored from a seat behind screens and keyboards.
Chinese: 呢個需要我哋從機械角度 去睇呢個世界

English: Now, we're leaping over all of that, over the giant antennas and the relay satellites and the vastness between worlds to take our first steps on this landscape as if we were truly there.

English: Today, a group of scientists on our mission are seeing Mars as never before -- an alien world made a little more familiar, because they're finally exploring it as humans should.

English: But our dreams don't have to end with making it just like being there.

English: When we dial this real world to the virtual, we can do magical things.

English: We can see in invisible wavelengths or teleport to the top of a mountain.

English: Perhaps someday, we'll feel the minerals in a rock just by touching it.

English: We're taking the first steps.

English: But we want the whole world to join us in taking the next, because this is not a journey for a few, but for all of us.

English: AK: Thank you Jeff, this was amazing.
Chinese: 最後，機械可以通過 觸覺同世界交換能量

English: Thank you so much for joining us on the TED stage today.
Chinese: 想像下，你可以感受虛擬物件嘅溫度 或者可以推開一個虛擬圖像 然後虛擬圖像用同樣嘅力推開你

We have a more mature perspective.
