Chinese: Tracy 以前就好似我哋好多人咁 覺得用咗一日時間搵工就係好好

English: I had been tracking return to work programs since 2008, and in 2010, I started noticing the use of a short-term paid work opportunity, whether it was called an internship or not, but an internship-like experience, as a way for professionals to return to work.
Chinese: 佢想搵一份金融或者會計嘅工作 佢好努力花咗九個月上網搵工 但都係無結果

English: I saw Goldman Sachs and Sara Lee start corporate reentry internship programs.
Chinese: 我係 2011 年 6 月認識 Tracy 嗰時 Today Show 問我 可唔可以同佢一齊幫佢扭轉劣勢

English: I saw a returning engineer, a nontraditional reentry candidate, apply for an entry-level internship program in the military, and then get a permanent job afterward.
Chinese: 我第一件事就叫佢行出屋企

English: I saw two universities integrate internships into mid-career executive education programs.
Chinese: 講畀大家知佢要揾工 同埋話自己有興趣再做嘢

English: So I wrote a report about what I was seeing, and it became this article for Harvard Business Review called "The 40-Year-Old Intern."
Chinese: 我又話畀佢聽： 「你要同好多人講你搵工， 但人哋多數都唔會幫你轉達。

English: I have to thank the editors there for that title, and also for this artwork where you can see the 40-year-old intern in the midst of all the college interns.
Chinese: 你要預咗咁樣，但唔好氣餒

English: And then, courtesy of Fox Business News, they called the concept "The 50-Year-Old Intern."
Chinese: 可能就係有幾個幫你轉達， 令你有工做。」

English: (Laughter) So five of the biggest financial services companies have reentry internship programs for returning finance professionals.
Chinese: 我會講少少 Tracy 後來發生嘅事 但我想先同你哋講下 我經過 11 年離開全職工作 返到工作崗位嘅發現

English: And at this point, hundreds of people have participated.
Chinese: 就係人哋對你嘅印象會停留喺舊時

English: These internships are paid, and the people who move on to permanent roles are commanding competitive salaries.
Chinese: 即係話你再聯絡返啲人 聯絡返以前認識嘅人 嗰啲同你工作過或者一齊返學嘅人 佢哋只會記得你離職前嘅嘢

English: And now, seven of the biggest engineering companies are piloting reentry internship programs for returning engineers as part of an initiative with the Society of Women Engineers.
Chinese: 就算你隨著時間而覺得自己冇咗意義 就好似我哋好多專業人士咁 太耐唔做嘢都會咁樣

English: Now, why are companies embracing the reentry internship?
Chinese: 例如你或者會諗自己 好似咁樣嘅人

English: Because the internship allows the employer to base their hiring decision on an actual work sample instead of a series of interviews, and the employer does not have to make that permanent hiring decision until the internship period is over.
Chinese: 呢個係我嚟，揸咗成日車 人都儍咗

English: This testing out period removes the perceived risk that some managers attach to hiring relaunchers, and they are attracting excellent candidates who are turning into great hires.
Chinese: 或者我喺廚房入面

English: Think about how far we have come.
Chinese: 但係以前識得嘅人完全唔知我呢啲嘢

English: Before this, most employers were not interested in engaging with relaunchers at all.
Chinese: 佢哋只會記得以前嘅你 當你再同返佢哋聯絡 同埋當佢哋好想聽你返嚟嘅故仔 你嘅信心就會返曬嚟

English: But now, not only are programs being developed specifically with relaunchers in mind, but you can't even apply for these programs unless you have a gap on your résumé.
Chinese: 仲有一樣嘢 我離職期間好記得

English: This is the mark of real change, of true institutional shift, because if we can solve this problem for relaunchers, we can solve it for other career transitioners too.
Chinese: 就係我好難追返財經新聞

English: In fact, an employer just told me that their veterans return to work program is based on their reentry internship program.
Chinese: 我擁有金融背景 但係當我喺屋企睇住四個細路時 好難跟得上任何新聞

English: And there's no reason why there can't be a retiree internship program.
Chinese: 所以我好驚面試嗰陣 講咗間已經唔存在嘅公司

English: Different pool, same concept.
Chinese: 於是我重新訂閱華爾街日報 我每份報紙每個報導都有睇 一睇就睇咗六個月 直至我覺得可以掌握返市場脈搏

English: So let me tell you what happened with Tracy Shapiro.
Chinese: 我相信重新工作者都係優秀人才 原因係咁樣

English: Remember that she had to tell everyone she knew about her interest in returning to work.
Chinese: 諗一諗我哋嘅人生階段： 嗰啲因為照顧小孩而離職嘅人 佢哋會少啲或者冇得放產假

English: Well, one critical conversation with another parent in her community led to a job offer for Tracy, and it was an accounting job in a finance department.
Chinese: 因為我哋以前已經放咗產假

English: But it was a temp job.
Chinese: 而且我哋伴侶轉工冇咁多

English: The company told her there was a possibility it could turn into something more, but no guarantees.
Chinese: 我哋生活比較安定

English: This was in the fall of 2011.
Chinese: 我哋有豐富工作經驗

English: Tracy loved this company, and she loved the people and the office was less than 10 minutes from her house.
Chinese: 思想比較成熟

English: So even though she had a second job offer at another company for a permanent full-time role, she decided to take her chances with this internship and hope for the best.
Chinese: 我哋唔會有咗份工，先嚟尋找真我

English: Well, she ended up blowing away all of their expectations, and the company not only made her a permanent offer at the beginning of 2012, but they made it even more interesting and challenging, because they knew what Tracy could handle.
Chinese: 再加上因為我哋已經好耐無做嘢 我哋充滿幹勁，熱衷於返返崗位

English: Fast forward to 2015, Tracy's been promoted.
Chinese: 我想講講僱主嗰方面 僱主想招請重新工作者時 有兩樣憂慮

English: They've paid for her to get her MBA at night.
Chinese: 第一樣係擔心重新工作者 嘅科技知識落伍

English: She's even hired another relauncher to work for her.
Chinese: 宜家我可以話俾你聼 我曾經有一段時間 科技知識落後 但係只係嗰個時候

English: Tracy's temp job was a tryout, just like an internship, and it ended up being a win for both Tracy and her employer.
Chinese: 我好耐以前係用 Lotus 1-2-3 做財務分析

English: Now, my goal is to bring the reentry internship concept to more and more employers.
Chinese: 唔知道仲有無人記得 但後來我要學用 Excel 做財務分析

English: But in the meantime, if you are returning to work after a career break, don't hesitate to suggest an internship or an internship-like arrangement to an employer that does not have a formal reentry internship program.
Chinese: 其實唔係好難 因為好多指令都係一樣

English: Be their first success story, and you can be the example for more relaunchers to come.
Chinese: 我嗰陣覺得 PowerPoint 比較難學 但而家已經冇問題 我仲成日用 PowerPoint

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 我話畀再做嘢嘅人知 僱主期望佢哋 有基本嘅電腦文書知識

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 如果佢哋仲未跟得上 佢哋就有責任學識佢
佢哋做到喎

English: Periods.
Chinese: 第二樣令僱主擔心嘅嘢 係重新工作者唔知道自己想做乜

English: Blood.
Chinese: 我叫佢哋一定要 睇清楚究竟喺離職期間 自己嘅興趣同技術有無改到

English: Menstruation.
Chinese: 所以呢樣唔係僱主嘅工作

English: Gross.
Chinese: 而係重回工作者嘅責任 佢哋要證明畀僱主睇 佢哋可以為公司貢獻最多價值

English: Secret.
Chinese: 早喺 2010 年，我發覺一啲嘢

English: Hidden.
Chinese: 由 2008 年開始 我不斷跟進重回工作嘅計劃 喺 2010年，我注意到 市場有短期有薪工作嘅機會 無論係咪叫實習都好 但係呢啲類似實習嘅嘢 可以係專業人士返去職場嘅一個方法

English: Why?
Chinese: 我見到高盛同 Sara Lee 開始咗再次實習計劃

English: A natural biological process that every girl and woman goes through every month for about half of her life.
Chinese: 我見過一位重投工作嘅工程師 佢係一個突破傳統嘅人嚟 佢申請軍方嘅入門實習計劃 跟住得到一份長工

English: A phenomenon that is so significant that the survival and propagation of our species depends on it.
Chinese: 我見過兩間大學將實習 加入到業界行政人員職業教育計劃

English: Yet we consider it a taboo.
Chinese: 於是我寫咗一篇報告 記錄我見到嘅嘢 咁就變成咗哈佛商業評論嘅文章 叫做「40 歲的實習生」

English: We feel awkward and shameful talking about it.
Chinese: 我要多謝嗰度嘅編輯度呢個標題 仲有呢個插圖 見到有個 40 歲嘅實習生 企喺一班大專實習生裡面

English: When I got my first periods, I was told to keep it a secret from others -- even from my father and brother.
Chinese: 霍士財經新聞叫呢個概念做 「50 歲嘅實習生」

English: Later when this chapter appeared in our textbooks, our biology teacher skipped the subject.
Chinese: （笑聲） 又有五間大型財務公司 舉辦咗呢啲再入行實習計劃 畀嗰啲想重回職場嘅金融專業人士

English: (Laughter) You know what I learned from it?
Chinese: 有數以百計嘅人參加咗呢啲計劃

English: I learned that it is really shameful to talk about it.
Chinese: 個計劃係有薪實習 呢啲人後來得到長工 仲有唔錯嘅薪酬

English: I learned to be ashamed of my body.
Chinese: 而家有七間大型工程公司 由婦女工程師協會牽頭 試行同類實習計劃 畀重返職場嘅工程師

English: I learned to stay unaware of periods in order to stay decent.
Chinese: 點解啲公司支持再實習呢？

English: Research in various parts of India shows that three out of every 10 girls are not aware of menstruation at the time of their first periods.
Chinese: 因為實習可以畀僱主 根據實際嘅工作表現決定請人 而唔係靠一連串面試 僱主可以等到佢哋實習期完畢 先決定請唔請佢哋做長工

English: And in some parts of Rajasthan this number is as high as nine out of 10 girls being unaware of it.
Chinese: 試用期可以避免 經理誤判受聘嘅人會為公司帶嚟風險 而且仲可以吸引優秀嘅求職者 呢班人最後仲變成公司出色嘅員工！

English: You'd be surprised to know that most of the girls that I have spoken to, who did not know about periods at the time of their first menstruation thought that they have got blood cancer and they're going to die soon.
Chinese: 諗下我哋推動咗幾多！

English: Menstrual hygiene is a very important risk factor for reproductive tract infections.
Chinese: 實行呢啲計劃前 多數僱主都無興趣招聘重新工作者

English: But in India, only 12 percent of girls and women have access to hygienic ways of managing their periods.
Chinese: 但係而家呢啲計劃已經發展到係 好重視重新求職者 而且佢哋要求你嘅覆歷有空白 否則你就申請唔到呢個計劃

English: If you do the math, 88 percent of girls and women use unhygienic ways to manage their periods.
Chinese: 咁樣見到機構已經唔同咗 標誌住真正嘅改變 因為如果我哋可以解決職場者嘅問題 亦都可以解決其他職業過渡嘅問題

English: I was one of them.
Chinese: 有僱主啱啱同我講 佢有啲經驗豐富嘅人 因為再次實習計劃 返到工作崗位

English: I grew up in a small town called Garhwa, in Jharkhand, where even buying a sanitary napkin is considered shameful.
Chinese: 所以我會話無理由 唔搞退休人士實習計劃

English: So when I started getting my periods, I began with using rags.
Chinese: 雖然類型唔同，但係概念一樣

English: After every use I would wash and reuse them.
Chinese: 跟住等我話俾你哋聽 Tracy Shapiro 發生咗咩事

English: But to store them, I would hide and keep it in a dark, damp place so that nobody finds out that I'm menstruating.
Chinese: 仲記得佢講畀每個認識嘅人 佢有興趣出返嚟做工作

English: Due to repeated washing the rags would become coarse, and I would often get rashes and infections using them.
Chinese: 就係有一次同同區家長傾計 帶咗 Tracy 一個工作機會 嗰份係財政部門嘅會計工作

English: I wore these already for five years until I moved out of that town.
Chinese: 但只係臨時工

English: Another issue that periods brought in my life those of the social restrictions that are imposed upon our girls and women when they're on their periods.
Chinese: 公司同佢講佢可能有機會 轉到更好嘅工作 但唔擔保一定有

English: I think you all must be aware of it, but I'll still list it for the few who don't.
Chinese: 去到 2011 年秋天

English: I was not allowed to touch or eat pickles.
Chinese: Tracy 好鍾意佢間公司同埋同事 而且公司離佢屋企只係十分鐘

English: I was not allowed to sit on the sofa or some other family member's bed.
Chinese: 雖然第二間公司開出一份長工協議 但佢決定揀呢次實習嘅機會 並希望一切順利

English: I had to wash my bed sheet after every period, even if it was not stained.
Chinese: 最後佢超乎公司嘅預期 喺 2012 年頭 公司不但請佢做長工 仲畀 Tracy 做 更有趣味同有挑戰嘅工作 因為公司知道佢應付得到

English: I was considered impure and forbidden from worshipping or touching any object of religious importance.
Chinese: 去到 2015 年 Tracy 已經升職

English: You'll find signposts outside temples denying the entry of menstruating girls and women.
Chinese: 公司仲畀錢佢夜晚讀工商管理

English: Ironically, most of the time it is the older woman who imposes such restrictions on younger girls in a family.
Chinese: Tracy 佢自己仲請咗 第二個重回工作者為佢做嘢

English: After all, they have grown up accepting such restrictions as norms.
Chinese: Tracy 開頭嘅臨時工係試用嚟 就好似實習咁 咁最後對 Tracy 同僱主嚟講都係雙贏

English: And in the absence of any intervention, it is the myth and misconception that propagate from generation to generation.
Chinese: 宜家我嘅目標係 向更多僱主推銷呢個實習概念

English: During my years of work in this field, I have even come across stories where girls have to eat and wash their dishes separately.
Chinese: 但係呢段時間 如果你離職後，想出返嚟工作 唔好猶豫向嗰啲 無呢啲實習計劃嘅公司 提議佢哋安排一個咁嘅實習計劃

English: They're not allowed to take baths during periods, and in some households they are even secluded from other family members.
Chinese: 你可以成為佢哋第一個成功故事 你可以係鼓勵更多人 重回職場嘅最佳例子

English: About 85 percent of girls and women in India would follow one or more restrictive customs on their periods every month.
Chinese: 多謝

English: Can you imagine what this does to the self-esteem and self-confidence of a young girl?
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: The psychological trauma that this inflicts, affecting her personality, her academic performance and every single aspect of growing up during her early formative years?
I religiously followed all these restrictive customs for 13 years, until a discussion with my partner, Tuhin, changed my perception about menstruation forever.
Chinese: 經期

English: In 2009, Tuhin and I were pursuing our postgraduation in design.
Chinese: 血

English: We fell in love with each other and I was at ease discussing periods with him.
Chinese: 月經

English: Tuhin knew little about periods.
Chinese: 核突

English: (Laughter) He was astonished to know that girls get painful cramps and we bleed every month.
Chinese: 秘密

English: (Laughter) Yeah.
Chinese: 遮遮掩掩

English: He was completely shocked to know about the restrictions that are imposed upon menstruating girls and women by their own families and their society.
Chinese: 點解？

English: In order to help me with my cramps, he would go on the Internet and learn more about menstruation.
Chinese: 呢個係每個女仔同女人 半世人每個月都會經歷嘅 自然生理過程

English: When he shared his findings with me, I realized how little I knew about menstruation myself.
Chinese: 呢個現象好緊要 因為關乎人類生存同繁殖後代

English: And many of my beliefs actually turned out to be myths.
Chinese: 但是我哋覺得呢啲係禁忌

English: That's when we wondered: if we, being so well educated, were so ill-informed about menstruation, there would be millions of girls out there who would be ill-informed, too.
Chinese: 講呢樣嗰時又尷尬又覺得羞恥

English: To study -- to understand the problem better, I undertook a year-long research to study the lack of awareness about menstruation and the root cause behind it.
Chinese: 當我嚟咗第一次經期時 有人叫我唔好話俾人聽 連兄弟同爸爸，都唔好講

English: While it is generally believed that menstrual unawareness and misconception is a rural phenomenon, during my research, I found that it is as much an urban phenomenon as well.
Chinese: 無幾耐，當我嘅敎科書講到呢樣嘢 我嘅生物科老師竟然跳過呢個課題

English: And it exists with the educated urban class, also.
Chinese: （笑聲） 你知我從中學到乜嘢？

English: While talking to many parents and teachers, I found that many of them actually wanted to educate girls about periods before they have started getting their menstrual cycle.
Chinese: 就係學識講呢樣嘢係好羞恥

English: And -- but they lacked the proper means themselves.
Chinese: 對自己嘅身體感到難為情

English: And since it is a taboo, they feel inhibition and shameful in talking about it.
Chinese: 學識點樣唔覺經期嚟咗 咁樣就可以好莊重

English: Girls nowadays get their periods in classes six and seven, but our educational curriculum teaches girls about periods only in standard eight and nine.
Chinese: 有研究顯示印度各地方 每十個女孩就有三個 第一次嚟經都唔知道咩係月經

English: And since it is a taboo, teachers still skip the subject altogether.
Chinese: 拉賈欺坦有啲地方 每十個女仔有多到九個都唔識

English: So school does not teach girls about periods, parents don't talk about it.
Chinese: 你哋會好出奇 我同好多女仔傾過 佢哋竟然唔知第一次經期就係月經 仲以為係患咗血癌 以為要死

English: Where do the girls go?
Chinese: 經期嘅衛生係 生殖系統感染嘅最主要病因

English: Two decades ago and now -- nothing has changed.
Chinese: 印度淨係得 12％ 婦女 知道點喺經期保持衛生

English: I shared these finding with Tuhin and we wondered: What if we could create something that would help girls understand about menstruation on their own -- something that would help parents and teachers talk about periods comfortably to young girls?
Chinese: 如果你計下數 就知有 88％ 婦女經期處理得唔衛生

English: During my research, I was collecting a lot of stories.
Chinese: 我就係其中一個

English: These stories would make girls curious and interested in talking about menstruation in their close circle.
Chinese: 我係加爾克漢德省加爾赫瓦小城長大 聽到啲人連去買衛生巾 我都覺得好瘀

English: That's what we wanted.
Chinese: 初初我有經期嗰時，我用啲碎布

English: We wanted something that would make the girls curious and drive them to learn about it.
Chinese: 每次用完都會洗乾淨再用過

English: We wanted to use these stories to teach girls about periods.
Chinese: 但係收拾嗰時 就要收埋係又黑又濕嘅地方 咁樣就無人知道我月經嚟咗

English: So we decided to create a comic book, where the cartoon characters would enact these stories and educate girls about menstruation in a fun and engaging way.
Chinese: 由於重覆清洗，碎布已經粗糙 我用咗之後，成日出疹或者感染病

English: To represent girls in their different phases of puberty, we have three characters.
Chinese: 我用咗足足五年 直到我搬離呢個城市

English: Pinki, who has not gotten her period yet, Jiya who gets her period during the narrative of the book and Mira who has already been getting her period.
Chinese: 經期對我嘅生活帶嚟另外一個問題 就係嗰啲強加於 月經來潮嘅婦女嘅社會限制

English: There is a fourth character, Priya Didi.
Chinese: 我諗你哋一定好清楚 但我仲係列曬出嚟 講俾唔知嘅人聽

English: Through her, girls come to know about the various aspects of growing up and menstrual hygiene management.
Chinese: 唔准掂同食醃菜

English: While making the book, we took great care that none of the illustrations were objectionable in any way and that it is culturally sensitive.
Chinese: 唔准坐梳化或者屋企人嘅床上

English: During our prototype testing, we found that the girls loved the book.
Chinese: 每次經期完咗要洗床單 就算床單無汚糟到

English: They were keen on reading it and knowing more and more about periods on their own.
Chinese: 他們認為我唔純潔 禁止我參拜或者掂一啲聖物

English: Parents and teachers were comfortable in talking about periods to young girls using the book, and sometimes even boys were interested in reading it.
Chinese: 你會發現寺廟出面有牌路牌 禁止正在嚟緊經期嘅婦女進入

English: (Laughter) (Applause) The comic book helped in creating an environment where menstruation ceased to be a taboo.
Chinese: 真係諷刺 好多時上咗年紀嘅女人 將咁樣嘅限制對付屋企嘅細路女

English: Many of the volunteers took this prototype themselves to educate girls and take menstrual awareness workshops in five different states in India.
Chinese: 雖然咁樣，佢哋大個咗之後 將限制當作常規

Chinese: 呢三條捷徑提醒我 做設計要以人為本

English: One thing that's really interesting to me about the Dreyfus Affair is this question of why the officers were so convinced that Dreyfus was guilty.
Chinese: 肯從用家角度出發 話唔定就係企業成功嘅關鍵

English: I mean, you might even assume that they were setting him up, that they were intentionally framing him.
Chinese: 要體貼人嘅需要 要用最簡單嘅設計 如果你個設計唔夠直接 自自然有人會改返直佢

English: But historians don't think that's what happened.
Chinese: 再講，想知啲人要啲乜 最好就將設計權交畀佢哋

English: As far as we can tell, the officers genuinely believed that the case against Dreyfus was strong.
Chinese: 齋坐响寫字樓唔會幫到你

English: Which makes you wonder: What does it say about the human mind that we can find such paltry evidence to be compelling enough to convict a man?
Chinese: 不如行出去留意啲人需要啲乜

English: Well, this is a case of what scientists call "motivated reasoning."
Chinese: 最後，有賴科技進步，成個世界變化萬千

English: It's this phenomenon in which our unconscious motivations, our desires and fears, shape the way we interpret information.
Chinese: 冇一刻停落嚟

English: Some information, some ideas, feel like our allies.
Chinese: 嚟緊呢啲捷徑肯定越見越多

English: We want them to win. We want to defend them.
Chinese: 我哋要做嘅，就係搵啲合適嘅小捷徑 然後將佢哋變成路

English: And other information or ideas are the enemy, and we want to shoot them down.
Chinese: 多謝大家！

English: So this is why I call motivated reasoning, "soldier mindset."
Chinese: （鼓掌）

English: Probably most of you have never persecuted a French-Jewish officer for high treason, I assume, but maybe you've followed sports or politics, so you might have noticed that when the referee judges that your team committed a foul, for example, you're highly motivated to find reasons why he's wrong.
But if he judges that the other team committed a foul -- awesome!
Chinese: 請大家想像下 自己係個打緊仗嘅士兵

English: That's a good call, let's not examine it too closely.
Chinese: 可能係個羅馬步兵 或者係中世紀嘅弓箭手 又或者係祖魯戰士

English: Or, maybe you've read an article or a study that examined some controversial policy, like capital punishment.
Chinese: 無論你身處何時何地 有啲嘢係唔會變嘅

English: And, as researchers have demonstrated, if you support capital punishment and the study shows that it's not effective, then you're highly motivated to find all the reasons why the study was poorly designed.
Chinese: 你嘅腎上腺素會升高 你嘅行為，其實根植於 呢啲反射動作之中 呢啲用黎保護你自己 同埋打敗敵人嘅反射動作

English: But if it shows that capital punishment works, it's a good study.
Chinese: 所以依家我希望 你哋諗下喺頭先嘅情境中 自己扮演唔同嘅角色：偵察兵

English: And vice versa: if you don't support capital punishment, same thing.
Chinese: 偵察兵唔洗攻擊或者防禦

English: Our judgment is strongly influenced, unconsciously, by which side we want to win.
Chinese: 任務只係要了解情況

English: And this is ubiquitous.
Chinese: 偵察兵要行出去 畫出敵方嘅地圖 了解潛在嘅阻礙物

English: This shapes how we think about our health, our relationships, how we decide how to vote, what we consider fair or ethical.
Chinese: 偵察兵希望了解嘅係譬如 一個方便過河嘅位置 係唔係有一座橋

English: What's most scary to me about motivated reasoning or soldier mindset, is how unconscious it is.
Chinese: 不過更加重要嘅係，偵察兵希望 了解嗰度究竟有啲咩 知得越精確越好

English: We can think we're being objective and fair-minded and still wind up ruining the life of an innocent man.
Chinese: 正如真正嘅軍隊入面 士兵同偵察兵都好重要

English: However, fortunately for Dreyfus, his story is not over.
Chinese: 不過你又可以當呢啲 角色代表緊啲思維方式 比喻緊我哋喺日常生活之中 接收信息同諗嘢嘅過程

English: This is Colonel Picquart.
Chinese: 我哋今日想講嘅就係 要擁有優秀嘅判斷力 要作出精確嘅預測、正確嘅決定 主要取決於你嘅思維方式

English: He's another high-ranking officer in the French Army, and like most people, he assumed Dreyfus was guilty.
Chinese: 依家我哋可以實際 展示下呢種思維方式 我會帶住你地去 十九世紀嘅法國 喺嗰度，呢張睇落微不足道嘅紙仔 引發咗歷史上 數一數二嘅政治醜聞

English: Also like most people in the army, he was at least casually anti-Semitic.
Chinese: 1894 年，有啲法國公務員發現

English: But at a certain point, Picquart began to suspect: "What if we're all wrong about Dreyfus?"
Chinese: 垃圾桶裡面一張撕碎嘅紙 將啲紙砌返埋之後 佢哋發現隊伍裡面有人 偷偷地賣軍事機密畀德國

English: What happened was, he had discovered evidence that the spying for Germany had continued, even after Dreyfus was in prison.
Chinese: 於是佢哋開始咗個大規模嘅調查 調查結果好快指向一個人 阿弗列 ‧ 屈里弗斯

English: And he had also discovered that another officer in the army had handwriting that perfectly matched the memo, much closer than Dreyfus's handwriting.
Chinese: 佢嘅信用紀錄幾好 之前無做錯過嘢 又唔似有犯案動機

English: So he brought these discoveries to his superiors, but to his dismay, they either didn't care or came up with elaborate rationalizations to explain his findings, like, "Well, all you've really shown, Picquart, is that there's another spy who learned how to mimic Dreyfus's handwriting, and he picked up the torch of spying after Dreyfus left.
Chinese: 但係，屈里弗斯係隊伍 入面唯一一個猶太軍官 不幸嘅係，嗰時法國軍隊好歧視猶太人

English: But Dreyfus is still guilty."
Chinese: 佢哋攞屈里弗斯嘅字跡同嗰張紙做比較 發現係一致嘅 雖然其他筆跡專家 覺得冇咁似 但係無論點

English: Eventually, Picquart managed to get Dreyfus exonerated.
Chinese: 佢哋去咗屈里弗斯間屋 搵佢做間諜嘅痕跡

English: But it took him 10 years, and for part of that time, he himself was in prison for the crime of disloyalty to the army.
Chinese: 佢哋搵暈曬佢啲文件 都搵唔到證據

English: A lot of people feel like Picquart can't really be the hero of this story because he was an anti-Semite and that's bad, which I agree with.
Chinese: 佢哋反而覺得屈里弗斯一定係做緊間諜 仲超級狡猾，係佢哋嚟到之前 已經將啲罪證收起曬

English: But personally, for me, the fact that Picquart was anti-Semitic actually makes his actions more admirable, because he had the same prejudices, the same reasons to be biased as his fellow officers, but his motivation to find the truth and uphold it trumped all of that.
Chinese: 跟著落嚟，佢哋去查佢嘅個人歷史 試圖尋找犯罪嘅痕跡

English: So to me, Picquart is a poster child for what I call "scout mindset."
Chinese: 佢哋向佢嘅老師問話 發現佢喺學校學過外語 就覺得佢一定係為咗之後 做外國間諜

English: It's the drive not to make one idea win or another lose, but just to see what's really there as honestly and accurately as you can, even if it's not pretty or convenient or pleasant.
Chinese: 佢嘅老師仲話 屈里弗斯記憶力好，好到出曬名 真係太可疑啦，係咪？

English: This mindset is what I'm personally passionate about.
Chinese: 因為你知啦 間諜係需要記住好多嘢㗎嘛

English: And I've spent the last few years examining and trying to figure out what causes scout mindset.
Chinese: 呢單案件上咗法庭 屈里弗斯被判有罪

English: Why are some people, sometimes at least, able to cut through their own prejudices and biases and motivations and just try to see the facts and the evidence as objectively as they can?
Chinese: 之後，佢哋將佢帶到廣場上 依足規矩咁扯走佢嘅徽章 又將佢嘅劍折成兩段

English: And the answer is emotional.
Chinese: 呢個就係屈里弗斯降級事件

English: So, just as soldier mindset is rooted in emotions like defensiveness or tribalism, scout mindset is, too.
Chinese: 佢哋判咗佢終身監禁 將佢流放到南美洲海岸 一個叫做魔鬼島嘅荒涼小島上

English: It's just rooted in different emotions.
Chinese: 佢之後就去咗嗰度淒涼度日 寫左一封又一封信畀法國政府 求佢哋重新審過單案時 會察覺佢係無辜嘅

English: For example, scouts are curious.
Chinese: 但係大家都覺得 呢單案已經完曬

English: They're more likely to say they feel pleasure when they learn new information or an itch to solve a puzzle.
Chinese: 我覺得屈里弗斯事件 好有意思嘅一個地方 就係嗰啲官員點解咁肯定 屈里弗斯係有罪嘅呢

English: They're more likely to feel intrigued when they encounter something that contradicts their expectations.
Chinese: 你甚至會覺得 佢地設佢局 特登陷害佢

English: Scouts also have different values.
Chinese: 不過歷史學家都唔係咁諗

English: They're more likely to say they think it's virtuous to test your own beliefs, and they're less likely to say that someone who changes his mind seems weak.
Chinese: 我哋可以睇到 個啲官真係覺得 控訴屈里弗斯嘅理據十足

English: And above all, scouts are grounded, which means their self-worth as a person isn't tied to how right or wrong they are about any particular topic.
Chinese: 呢件事令人奇怪 人類個腦到底有咩問題 以至咁丁點嘅證據 都可以說服到人判佢有罪？

English: So they can believe that capital punishment works.
Chinese: 係咁嘅，科學家發現一種 叫做「動機性推理」嘅現象

English: If studies come out showing that it doesn't, they can say, "Huh. Looks like I might be wrong. Doesn't mean I'm bad or stupid."
Chinese: 係指我哋嘅潛意識 我哋嘅慾望同恐懼 塑造咗我哋分析信息嘅方式

English: This cluster of traits is what researchers have found -- and I've also found anecdotally -- predicts good judgment.
Chinese: 有啲信息，有啲諗法 對我哋嚟講好似朋友

English: And the key takeaway I want to leave you with about those traits is that they're primarily not about how smart you are or about how much you know.
Chinese: 我哋想佢地贏 我哋想護住佢哋

English: In fact, they don't correlate very much with IQ at all.
Chinese: 有啲信息好似仇人咁樣 我哋想消滅佢哋

English: They're about how you feel.
Chinese: 所以我鐘意叫動機性推理 做「士兵思維」

English: There's a quote that I keep coming back to, by Saint-Exupéry.
Chinese: 你哋就從未迫害過 猶太裔法國軍官，話佢係叛徒 我估係呱 不過你如果鍾意睇體育 或者政治新聞 你可能已經留意到 譬如，當個裁判話 你鍾意嗰隊犯規 你就會好想搵理由講 佢點解判錯咗

English: He's the author of "The Little Prince."
Chinese: 不過如果佢判另外嗰隊 犯咗規，你就會覺得好啱

English: He said, "If you want to build a ship, don't drum up your men to collect wood and give orders and distribute the work.
Chinese: 這個例子幾好 但大家唔好咁認真

English: Instead, teach them to yearn for the vast and endless sea."
Chinese: 或者，你可能啱啱先讀咗一篇 有關一啲爭議嘅文章或者研究 譬如應唔應該有死刑

English: In other words, I claim, if we really want to improve our judgment as individuals and as societies, what we need most is not more instruction in logic or rhetoric or probability or economics, even though those things are quite valuable.
Chinese: 啲研究員發現 如果你支持死刑 但係篇文話死刑無用嘅話 你就會好想搵出 呢份報告邊度寫得唔好

English: But what we most need to use those principles well is scout mindset.
Chinese: 不過如果篇文支持死刑 你就會覺得佢寫得好好

English: We need to change the way we feel.
Chinese: 反之亦然：如果你唔 支持死刑，都係一樣嘅

English: We need to learn how to feel proud instead of ashamed when we notice we might have been wrong about something.
Chinese: 我哋嘅判斷力喺無意之中 受我哋嘅立場好大影響

English: We need to learn how to feel intrigued instead of defensive when we encounter some information that contradicts our beliefs.
Chinese: 呢個現象好普遍

English: So the question I want to leave you with is: What do you most yearn for?
Chinese: 決定緊我哋點睇 健康同人際關係 點投票 點先覺得係公平或者合乎道德

English: Do you yearn to defend your own beliefs?
Chinese: 最驚嚇嘅係 動機性推理或者士兵思維 都係完全無意嘅

English: Or do you yearn to see the world as clearly as you possibly can?
Chinese: 我哋以為自己好公正、好客觀 但係都可以冤死無辜嘅人

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 不過，好彩屈里弗斯嘅故事未完

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 呢個係皮卡爾上校
佢係另外一個法軍高官 同其他人一樣，佢都覺得屈里弗斯有罪

English: Imagine you are a part of a crew of astronauts traveling to Mars or some distant planet.
Chinese: 又同其他人咁，佢都有少少反猶太

English: The travel time could take a year or even longer.
Chinese: 不過，過咗一段時間，皮卡爾開始懷疑 「我哋係唔係冤枉咗屈里弗斯？」

English: The space on board and the resources would be limited.
Chinese: 之後，佢發現 屈里弗斯坐緊監時 都繼續有人為德國通風報信

English: So you and the crew would have to figure out how to produce food with minimal inputs.
Chinese: 佢仲發現軍隊入面 有人嘅字跡同果張紙仔上嘅一模一樣 而且比起屈里弗斯嘅字跡更加似

English: What if you could bring with you just a few packets of seeds, and grow crops in a matter of hours?
Chinese: 於是，佢向上級匯報佢嘅發現 不過令佢失望嘅係，佢哋一係就唔上心 一係就兜個大圈，合理化啲新發現 譬如「皮卡爾，你只不過 發現咗另一個間諜 模仿咗屈里弗斯嘅字跡。 喺屈里弗斯坐監之後接手間諜工作。

English: And what if those crops would then make more seeds, enabling you to feed the entire crew with just those few packets of seeds for the duration of the trip?
Chinese: 不過屈里弗斯都係有罪嘅。」

English: Well, the scientists at NASA actually figured out a way to do this.
Chinese: 最尾，皮卡爾成功幫屈里弗斯洗脫罪名

English: What they came up with was actually quite interesting.
Chinese: 但係就用咗整整十年 期間佢自己都因為 對軍隊不忠坐咗陣監

English: It involved microorganisms, which are single-celled organisms.
Chinese: 好多人覺得皮卡爾唔係成件事嘅英雄 因為佢都歧視猶太人，我同意呢點

English: And they also used hydrogen from water.
Chinese: 不過，對我黎講，正因為皮卡爾反猶太 佢嘅舉動更加令人佩服 因為佢都同其他軍官有一樣嘅偏見 有同樣嘅原因可能作出唔公正嘅判斷 但佢尋找、堅持真相嘅動力將功補過

English: The types of microbes that they used were called hydrogenotrophs, and with these hydrogenotrophs, you can create a virtuous carbon cycle that would sustain life onboard a spacecraft.
Chinese: 對於我嚟講 皮卡爾係「偵察思維」嘅典範

English: Astronauts would breathe out carbon dioxide, that carbon dioxide would then be captured by the microbes and converted into a nutritious, carbon-rich crop.
Chinese: 冇支持或反對任何觀點 而係純粹發現事實所在 盡量真實準確嘅事實 即使啲事實唔光彩、唔方便人 唔討人歡喜

English: The astronauts would then eat that carbon-rich crop and exhale the carbon out in the form of carbon dioxide, which would then be captured by the microbes, to create a nutritious crop, which then would be exhaled in the form of carbon dioxide by the astronauts.
Chinese: 呢個就係我熱愛嘅思維

English: So in this way, a closed-loop carbon cycle is created.
Chinese: 過去幾年，我試圖探索同發現 「偵察思維」係點樣形成嘅

English: So why is this important?
Chinese: 點解有啲人，有啲時候 能夠摒棄自己嘅偏見、主觀同埋動機 嘗試用最客觀嘅眼光 去睇清事實同證據

English: We need carbon to survive as humans, and we get our carbon from food.
Chinese: 答案就係情感上

English: On a long space journey, you simply wouldn't be able to pick up any carbon along the way, so you'd have to figure out how to recycle it on board.
Chinese: 就好似士兵思維係出於 譬如防禦或者親疏有別嘅情感 偵察思維都係

English: This is a clever solution, right?
Chinese: 不過係出於唔同嘅情感

English: But the thing is, that research didn't really go anywhere.
Chinese: 譬如，偵察者有好奇心

English: We haven't yet gone to Mars. We haven't yet gone to another planet.
Chinese: 佢哋學到新嘢時 或者解開難題時 就會好開心

English: And this was actually done in the '60s and '70s.
Chinese: 如果佢哋發現有嘢 違背咗佢哋嘅假設 就會覺得好奇

English: So a colleague of mine, Dr. John Reed, and I, were interested, actually, in carbon recycling here on Earth.
Chinese: 偵察者都有唔同嘅價值觀

English: We wanted to come up with technical solutions to address climate change.
Chinese: 佢哋覺得驗證自己嘅觀念 係一種美德 而唔會覺得 改變諗法係一種軟弱嘅行為

English: And we discovered this research by reading some papers published in the '60s -- 1967 and later -- articles about this work.
Chinese: 最後，偵察者係腳踏實地嘅 佢哋作為人嘅自尊唔係取決於 佢哋對於特定議題嘅諗法係對定錯

English: And we thought it was a really good idea.
Chinese: 佢哋可能覺得死刑係有用嘅

English: So we said, well, Earth is actually like a spaceship.
Chinese: 但如果有研究話死刑係冇用嘅 佢哋會諗「係，我諗錯咗， 但都唔代表我差勁或者蠢」

English: We have limited space and limited resources, and on Earth, we really do need to figure out how to recycle our carbon better.
Chinese: 研究員發現呢啲性格特點 ——而我都係啲故事中發現 預示咗人嘅判斷能力高低

English: So we had the idea, can we take some of these NASA-type ideas and apply them to our carbon problem here on Earth?
Chinese: 我最想比你知道嘅就係 係呢啲性格特點同你醒唔醒無關 同你識幾多嘢都無關

English: Could we cultivate these NASA-type microbes in order to make valuable products here on Earth?
Chinese: 其實同智商都冇咩數據上嘅關係

English: We started a company to do it.
Chinese: 主要都係同情感有關

English: And in that company, we discovered that these hydrogenotrophs -- which I'll actually call nature's supercharged carbon recyclers -- we found that they are a powerful class of microbes that had been largely overlooked and understudied, and that they could make some really valuable products.
Chinese: 我成日引用聖埃克絮佩里

English: So we began cultivating these products, these microbes, in our lab.
Chinese: ——即係《小王子》嘅作者所講

English: We found that we can make essential amino acids from carbon dioxide using these microbes.
Chinese: 「如果你想造船， 唔好叫人地收集木頭、發號施令、 分配工作，

English: And we even made a protein-rich meal that has an amino acid profile similar to what you might find in some animal proteins.
Chinese: 而係要教識佢哋嚮往 無邊無際嘅大海。」

English: We began cultivating them even further, and we found that we can make oil.
Chinese: 換句話講 如果我哋真係想改善判斷能力 不論係作為係個人或者社會 我哋最需要嘅唔係更多嘅邏輯構建 比喻、機會率又或經濟學 儘管呢啲嘢都好有價值

English: Oils are used to manufacture many products.
Chinese: 不過要好好利用呢個理論 我哋最需要嘅係偵查思維

English: We made an oil that was similar to a citrus oil, which can be used for flavoring and for fragrances, but it also can be used as a biodegradable cleaner or even as a jet fuel.
Chinese: 我哋需要改變自己嘅感觀

English: And we made an oil that's similar to palm oil.
Chinese: 我哋需要學習 喺發現自己諗錯嘢時 覺得自豪而唔係羞恥

English: Palm oil is used to manufacture a wide range of consumer and industrial goods.
Chinese: 需要學習如何喺發現一啲 同我哋觀念牴觸嘅資訊時 覺得好奇而唔係戒備

English: We began working with manufacturers to scale up this technology, and we're currently working with them to bring some of these products to market.
Chinese: 所以，我想問你哋嘅問題係 你最想要嘅係咩？

English: We believe this type of technology can indeed help us profitably recycle carbon dioxide into valuable products -- something that's beneficial for the planet but also beneficial for business.
Chinese: 你想防禦自己嘅觀念？

English: That's what we're doing today.
Chinese: 定係想盡可能睇到真實嘅世界？

English: But tomorrow, this type of technology and using these types of microbes actually could help us do something even greater if we take it to the next level.
Chinese: 多謝各位

English: We believe that this type of technology can actually help us address an issue with agriculture and allow us to create a type of agriculture that's sustainable, that will allow us to scale to meet the demands of tomorrow.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: And why might we need a sustainable agriculture?
Well, actually, it is estimated that the population will reach about 10 billion by 2050, and we're projecting that we will need to increase food production by 70 percent.
Chinese: 想像一下你係去火星或者其他遙遠星球 嘅其中一個宇航員

English: In addition, we will need many more resources and raw materials to make consumer goods and industrial goods.
Chinese: 旅程時間可能長達一年 或者甚至更長

English: So how will we scale to meet that demand?

English: Well, modern agriculture simply cannot sustainably scale to meet that demand.

English: There are a number of reasons why.

English: One of them is that modern agriculture is one of the largest emitters of greenhouse gases.
Chinese: 如果嗰啲作物可以生產更多嘅種子 令你可以用其中嘅幾包種子 全程養活整個團隊，又會點？

English: In fact, it emits more greenhouse gases than our cars, our trucks, our planes and our trains combined.
Chinese: NASA 嘅科學家已經諗到可行嘅方法

English: Another reason is that modern ag simply takes up a whole lot of land.
Chinese: 佢哋嘅諗法非常有趣

English: We have cleared 19.4 million square miles for crops and livestock.
Chinese: 其中包括單細胞微生物

English: What does that look like?
Chinese: 科學家同時運用水入面嘅氫氣

English: Well, that's roughly the size of South America and Africa combined.

English: Let me give you a specific example.
Chinese: 宇航員會呼出二氧化碳 二氧化碳會畀嗰啲微生物吸收 轉化成一種含有豐富營養同碳嘅作物

English: In Indonesia, an amount of virgin rainforest was cleared totaling the size of approximately Ireland, between 2000 and 2012.
Chinese: 之後宇航員食用嗰啲含豐富碳嘅作物 宇航員會以二氧化碳呼出 又會畀微生物吸收 生產新嘅營養作物 之後碳又會畀宇航員 以二氧化碳呼出

English: Just think of all of the species, the diversity, that was removed in the process, whether plant life, insects or animal life.
Chinese: 咁樣就建立咗一個閉環碳循環

English: And a natural carbon sink was also removed.
Chinese: 點解呢樣嘢咁重要？

English: So let me make this real for you.

English: This clearing happened primarily to make room for palm plantations.
Chinese: 喺漫長嘅太空旅途中 根本就冇可能喺途中搵到碳 所以你要諗點樣喺飛船上循環利用碳

English: And as I mentioned before, palm oil is used to manufacture many products.
Chinese: 呢個係一個聰明嘅方法，係唔係？

English: In fact, it is estimated that over 50 percent of consumer products are manufactured using palm oil.
Chinese: 但問題係，呢個研究並冇實行過

English: And that includes things like ice cream, cookies ...
Chinese: 我哋未去過火星，亦未去過其他星球

English: It includes cooking oils.
Chinese: 事實上呢個研究 喺 60、70 年代就已經完成

English: It also includes detergents, lotions, soaps.

English: You and I both probably have numerous items in our kitchens and our bathrooms that were manufactured using palm oil.
Chinese: 我哋想搵到應對氣候變化嘅 技術性解決方法

English: So you and I are direct beneficiaries of removed rainforests.
Chinese: 通過閱讀 1967 年及以後嘅論文 我哋發現咗呢個研究

English: Modern ag has some problems, and we need solutions if we want to scale sustainably.
Chinese: 我哋覺得呢個真係一個好主意

English: I believe that microbes can be a part of the answer -- specifically, these supercharged carbon recyclers.
Chinese: 我哋認為，地球就好似一艘太空船

English: These supercharged carbon recyclers, like plants, serve as the natural recyclers in their ecosystems where they thrive.
Chinese: 我哋嘅空間、資源都有限 喺地球上，我哋確實需要 思考點樣更有效去循環利用碳

English: And they thrive in exotic places on Earth, like hydrothermal vents and hot springs.
Chinese: 所以我哋有一個諗法 可唔可以將呢啲 NASA 式嘅主意 用嚟解決地球上嘅碳問題？

English: In those ecosystems, they take carbon and recycle it into the nutrients needed for those ecosystems.
Chinese: 我哋可唔可以培養呢啲 NASA 式微生物 用嚟喺地球上生產有價值嘅物品？

English: And they're rich in nutrients, such as oils and proteins, minerals and carbohydrates.
Chinese: 我哋創立咗一間公司嚟研究

English: And actually, microbes are already an integral part of our everyday lives.
Chinese: 喺呢間公司，我哋發現呢啲氫營養菌 事實上我叫佢哋 大自然嘅「強勁碳循環機」 我哋發現佢哋係一種強大嘅微生物 佢哋畀嚴重忽視、未被深入研究 而且佢哋確實可以生產 一啲有價值嘅產物

English: If you enjoy a glass of pinot noir on a Friday night, after a long, hard work week, then you are enjoying a product of microbes.
Chinese: 所以我哋開始喺實驗室 培養呢啲產物同微生物

English: If you enjoy a beer from your local microbrewery -- a product of microbes.
Chinese: 我哋發現可以利用呢啲微生物 將二氧化碳合成必需氨基酸

English: Or bread, or cheese, or yogurt.
Chinese: 我哋甚至可以製作蛋白質營養餐 其中嘅必需氨基酸外形 同一啲動物蛋白質嘅氨基酸相似

English: These are all products of microbes.
Chinese: 我哋開始更進一步培養 發現我哋可以生產油

English: But the beauty and power associated with these supercharged carbon recyclers lies in the fact that they can actually produce in a matter of hours versus months.
Chinese: 油可以用嚟大量生產好多產品

English: That means we can make crops much faster than we're making them today.
Chinese: 我哋生產咗一種類似檸檬油嘅油 除咗可以摞嚟調味、製造香水 佢仲可以摞嚟做生物可降解清潔劑 甚至係噴氣燃料

English: They grow in the dark, so they can grow in any season and in any geography and any location.
Chinese: 跟住我哋又生產咗一種類似棕櫚油嘅油

English: They can grow in containers that require minimal space.
Chinese: 棕櫚油可以用嚟生產唔同嘅 消費品同工業品

English: And we can get to a type of vertical agriculture.
Chinese: 我哋開始同製造商合作大量生產 依家我哋合作 將其中一啲產品推出市場

English: Instead of our traditional horizontal agriculture that requires so much land, we can scale vertically, and as a result produce much more product per area.
Chinese: 我哋相信呢種技術可以幫助我哋 將二氧化碳有效轉化為有價值嘅產品 一啲同時對地球 同商業都有益嘅產品

English: If we implement this type of approach and use these carbon recyclers, then we wouldn't have to remove any more rainforests to make the food and the goods that we consume.
Chinese: 呢啲就係我哋依家做緊嘅事

English: Because, at a large scale, you can actually make 10,000 times more output per land area than you could -- for instance, if you used soybeans -- if you planted soybeans on that same area of land over a period of a year.
Chinese: 但以後，如果我哋要更上一層 呢種技術同呢種微生物嘅應用 會幫助我哋完成一啲更加偉大嘅事

English: Ten thousand times over a period of a year.
Chinese: 我哋相信呢種技術 可以幫助我哋解決農業問題 可以畀我哋發展出一種可持續農業 令我哋可以滿足到未來嘅要求

English: So this is what I mean by a new type of agriculture.
Chinese: 點解我哋需要一個可持續農業呢？

English: And this is what I mean by developing a system that allows us to sustainably scale to meet the demands of 10 billion.
Chinese: 事實上，根據預測 到咗 2050 年 世界人口將會達到大概一百億 我哋預計糧食產量要提高70%

English: And what would be the products of this new type of agriculture?
Chinese: 同時，我哋會需要更多嘅資源、原材料 去生產消費品、工業品

English: Well, we've already made a protein meal, so you can imagine something similar to a soybean meal, or even cornmeal, or wheat flour.
Chinese: 咁我哋要點樣滿足呢個需求？

English: We've already made oils, so you can imagine something similar to coconut oil or olive oil or soybean oil.
Chinese: 依家嘅現代農業滿足唔到呢個需求

English: So this type of crop can actually produce the nutrients that would give us pasta and bread, cakes, nutritional items of many sorts.
Chinese: 原因有好多

English: Furthermore, since oil is used to manufacture multiple other goods, industrial products and consumer products, you can imagine being able to make detergents, soaps, lotions, etc., using these types of crops.
Chinese: 其中一個就係現代農業 係溫室氣體嘅其中一個最大排放源

English: Not only are we running out of space, but if we continue to operate under the status quo with modern agriculture, we run the risk of robbing our progeny of a beautiful planet.
Chinese: 事實上，佢溫室氣體嘅排放總量 比我哋嘅汽車、貨車、飛機 同埋火車嘅排放總量仲要大

English: But it doesn't have to be this way.
Chinese: 另一個原因就係佢佔據咗大面積嘅土地

English: We can imagine a future of abundance.
Chinese: 我哋為作物、牲畜騰出咗

English: Let us create systems that keep planet Earth, our spaceship, not only from not crashing, but let us also develop systems and ways of living that will be beneficial to the lives of ourselves and the 10 billion that will be on this planet by 2050.
Chinese: 一千九百四十萬平方英里 即係點樣？

English: Thank you very much.
Chinese: 大概就係南美洲同非洲加起嚟咁大

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 等我舉一個具體嘅例子
喺印尼，從 2000 年到 2012 年 大概有同成個愛爾蘭咁大嘅 原始熱帶雨林畀移除咗

English: I am British.
Chinese: 我哋可以想像到 畀趕離家園嘅物種數量之大 植物、昆蟲、動物，無一倖免

English: (Laughter) (Applause) Never before has the phrase "I am British" elicited so much pity.
Chinese: 同時，一個天然碳匯都難逃一劫

English: (Laughter) I come from an island where many of us like to believe there's been a lot of continuity over the last thousand years.
Chinese: 咁等我講得更加真實一啲

English: We tend to have historically imposed change on others but done much less of it ourselves.
Chinese: 呢次移除係為咗種植棕櫚樹

English: So it came as an immense shock to me when I woke up on the morning of June 24 to discover that my country had voted to leave the European Union, my Prime Minister had resigned, and Scotland was considering a referendum that could bring to an end the very existence of the United Kingdom.
Chinese: 就好似我之前所講 棕櫚油用於大量生產好多種產品

English: So that was an immense shock for me, and it was an immense shock for many people, but it was also something that, over the following several days, created a complete political meltdown in my country.
Chinese: 事實上，根據估計 超過 50％ 嘅消費品都離不開棕櫚油

English: There were calls for a second referendum, almost as if, following a sports match, we could ask the opposition for a replay.
Chinese: 其中包括雪糕、曲奇

English: Everybody was blaming everybody else.
Chinese: 仲有食用油

English: People blamed the Prime Minister for calling the referendum in the first place.
Chinese: 同埋清潔劑、乳液、肥皂

English: They blamed the leader of the opposition for not fighting it hard enough.
Chinese: 好可能你同我嘅廚房、浴室裏面 都有大量嘅由棕櫚油 製成嘅生活用品

English: The young accused the old.
Chinese: 所以你同我都係 移除熱帶雨林嘅罪魁禍首

English: The educated blamed the less well-educated.
Chinese: 現代農業存在住一啲問題 如果想可持續發展 我哋就需要解決方法

English: That complete meltdown was made even worse by the most tragic element of it: levels of xenophobia and racist abuse in the streets of Britain at a level that I have never seen before in my lifetime.

English: People are now talking about whether my country is becoming a Little England, or, as one of my colleagues put it, whether we're about to become a 1950s nostalgia theme park floating in the Atlantic Ocean.
Chinese: 呢種強勁嘅碳循環機 比如植物，喺佢哋成長嘅生態系統中 扮演著「自然循環機」嘅角色

English: (Laughter) But my question is really, should we have the degree of shock that we've experienced since?
Chinese: 佢哋喺地球嘅特殊地貌生長 比如海底熱泉、溫泉

English: Was it something that took place overnight?
Chinese: 喺嗰啲生態系統，佢哋吸收碳 將碳再生為生態系統所需嘅營養

English: Or are there deeper structural factors that have led us to where we are today?
Chinese: 佢哋含有豐富營養 譬如油脂、蛋白質 礦物質、碳水化合物

English: So I want to take a step back and ask two very basic questions.
Chinese: 事實上，微生物已經成為 我哋日常生活嘅一部分

English: First, what does Brexit represent, not just for my country, but for all of us around the world?
Chinese: 如果辛苦工作咗一個漫長嘅星期 你喺星期五晚品嘗一杯葡萄酒 咁其實你就係品嘗緊微生物嘅產物

English: And second, what can we do about it?
Chinese: 如果你品嘗當地小型啤酒廠嘅一種啤酒 都係一種微生物嘅產物

English: How should we all respond?
Chinese: 或者係麵包、芝士、酸奶

English: So first, what does Brexit represent?
Chinese: 呢啲全部都係微生物嘅產物

English: Hindsight is a wonderful thing.
Chinese: 但呢哋強勁碳循環機嘅魅力、力量在於 佢哋嘅生產力係數以小時計 而唔係以月嚟計算

English: Brexit teaches us many things about our society and about societies around the world.
Chinese: 咁就意味著我哋可以 以比依家更快嘅速度去種作物

English: It highlights in ways that we seem embarrassingly unaware of how divided our societies are.
Chinese: 作物可以喺黑暗中生長 即係可以喺任何季節 任何地理環境、任何地方生長

English: The vote split along lines of age, education, class and geography.
Chinese: 佢哋可以喺佔地最小嘅容器生長

English: Young people didn't turn out to vote in great numbers, but those that did wanted to remain.
Chinese: 咁我哋就可以開發一種垂直農業

English: Older people really wanted to leave the European Union.
Chinese: 同佔地廣闊嘅傳統水平農業唔同 我哋可以向上發展 從而提高單位土地嘅產量

English: Geographically, it was London and Scotland that most strongly committed to being part of the European Union, while in other parts of the country there was very strong ambivalence.
Chinese: 如果我哋利用呢啲碳循環機 實行呢種方法 咁我哋就唔再需要為食物、消費品 而移除任何熱帶雨林

English: Those divisions are things we really need to recognize and take seriously.
Chinese: 因為通過大規模種植 實際上你可以種出 – 比如種大豆 如果你喺同一片土地種植大豆 一年之後 你會比原先得到多出一萬倍嘅單位產量

English: But more profoundly, the vote teaches us something about the nature of politics today.
Chinese: 一年時間收穫係比原先產量嘅一萬倍

English: Contemporary politics is no longer just about right and left.
Chinese: 呢個就我所講嘅新型農業

English: It's no longer just about tax and spend.
Chinese: 呢個亦係我所講嘅發展一個系統 嚟滿足一百億人口需求嘅系統

English: It's about globalization.
Chinese: 咁呢種新型農業可以生產乜嘢？

English: The fault line of contemporary politics is between those that embrace globalization and those that fear globalization.
Chinese: 我哋已經整咗一種蛋白質餐 咁你可以想像到一啲類似黃豆餐 或者甚至係粟米粉、小麥麵粉嘅產品

English: (Applause) If we look at why those who wanted to leave -- we call them "Leavers," as opposed to "Remainers" -- we see two factors in the opinion polls that really mattered.

English: The first was immigration, and the second sovereignty, and these represent a desire for people to take back control of their own lives and the feeling that they are unrepresented by politicians.
Chinese: 所以呢種作物實際上可以生產 富含營養嘅意大利麵、麵包 蛋糕、各種營養食品

English: But those ideas are ones that signify fear and alienation.
Chinese: 而且，既然油可以用嚟生產多種物品 工業品、消費品 你可以想像利用呢種作物 都可以生產清潔劑、肥皂、乳液等等

English: They represent a retreat back towards nationalism and borders in ways that many of us would reject.
Chinese: 如果我哋繼續用依家嘅現代農業種植 就唔單止面臨土地資源匱乏嘅問題 仲會有風險令我哋啲子孫 失去呢個美麗嘅星球

English: What I want to suggest is the picture is more complicated than that, that liberal internationalists, like myself, and I firmly include myself in that picture, need to write ourselves back into the picture in order to understand how we've got to where we are today.
Chinese: 但係用新型農業就可以避免

English: When we look at the voting patterns across the United Kingdom, we can visibly see the divisions.
Chinese: 我哋可以想像一個富足嘅未來

English: The blue areas show Remain and the red areas Leave.
Chinese: 等我哋嚟創造唔單止可以 避免地球毀滅、太空船墜毀 仲可以發展造福我哋 以及 2050 年一百億人口生活嘅 生態系統同生活方式

English: When I looked at this, what personally struck me was the very little time in my life I've actually spent in many of the red areas.
Chinese: 好多謝大家

English: I suddenly realized that, looking at the top 50 areas in the UK that have the strongest Leave vote, I've spent a combined total of four days of my life in those areas.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: In some of those places, I didn't even know the names of the voting districts.

It was a real shock to me, and it suggested that people like me who think of ourselves as inclusive, open and tolerant, perhaps don't know our own countries and societies nearly as well as we like to believe.
Chinese: 我係英國人

English: (Applause) And the challenge that comes from that is we need to find a new way to narrate globalization to those people, to recognize that for those people who have not necessarily been to university, who haven't necessarily grown up with the Internet, that don't get opportunities to travel, they may be unpersuaded by the narrative that we find persuasive in our often liberal bubbles.
Chinese: （笑聲） （掌聲） 「我係英國人」呢句說話 從來未引起過咁多人同情

English: (Applause) It means that we need to reach out more broadly and understand.
Chinese: （笑聲） 我嚟自一個島國 好多人都相信 過去咁多年有好多嘢持續發生緊

English: In the Leave vote, a minority have peddled the politics of fear and hatred, creating lies and mistrust around, for instance, the idea that the vote on Europe could reduce the number of refugees and asylum-seekers coming to Europe, when the vote on leaving had nothing to do with immigration from outside the European Union.
Chinese: 歷史上，我哋傾向改變其他國家 但好少改變自己

English: But for a significant majority of the Leave voters the concern was disillusionment with the political establishment.

English: This was a protest vote for many, a sense that nobody represented them, that they couldn't find a political party that spoke for them, and so they rejected that political establishment.
Chinese: 所以成件事對於我嚟講都幾震撼 對於好多人嚟講都係 但呢件事幾日後 發展成我國家嘅一個政治危機

English: This replicates around Europe and much of the liberal democratic world.

English: We see it with the rise in popularity of Donald Trump in the United States, with the growing nationalism of Viktor Orbán in Hungary, with the increase in popularity of Marine Le Pen in France.

English: The specter of Brexit is in all of our societies.
Chinese: 人民指責首相 話佢當初做咩搞公投

English: So the question I think we need to ask is my second question, which is how should we collectively respond?
Chinese: 啲人鬧在野黨黨魁唔夠努力爭取

English: For all of us who care about creating liberal, open, tolerant societies, we urgently need a new vision, a vision of a more tolerant, inclusive globalization, one that brings people with us rather than leaving them behind.
Chinese: 後生指控老人家

English: That vision of globalization is one that has to start by a recognition of the positive benefits of globalization.
Chinese: 受過教育責備無受過良好教育嘅

English: The consensus amongst economists is that free trade, the movement of capital, the movement of people across borders benefit everyone on aggregate.
Chinese: 危機裏面最不幸嘅事 令成個危機更差 仇外同種族情緒充斥喺英國街頭 去到我前所未見嘅水平

English: The consensus amongst international relations scholars is that globalization brings interdependence, which brings cooperation and peace.

English: Thank you.

English: (Applause)

English: When Goldilocks walks into the room determines the answer that we get in the story.

English: They're not static things. They change.

English: They vary. They evolve.
And atmospheres do the same.

English: This can't happen on Mars today.

English: Well, one idea is it escaped away to space.

English: Atmospheric particles got enough energy to break free from the gravity of the planet, escaping away to space, never to return.

English: Comets have tails that are incredibly visible reminders of atmospheric escape.

English: But Venus also has an atmosphere that escapes with time, and Mars and Earth as well.

English: It's just a matter of degree and a matter of scale.

English: How do atmospheres get their energy for escape?

English: Number one, sunlight.

English: Light emitted from the sun can be absorbed by atmospheric particles and warm the particles.

English: Yes, I'm dancing, but they -- (Laughter) Oh my God, not even at my wedding.

English: (Laughter) They get enough energy to escape and break free from the gravity of the planet just by warming.

English: A second way they can get energy is from the solar wind.

English: These are particles, mass, material, spit out from the surface of the sun, and they go screaming through the solar system at 400 kilometers per second, sometimes faster during solar storms, and they go hurtling through interplanetary space towards planets and their atmospheres, and they may provide energy for atmospheric particles to escape as well.

English: This is something that I'm interested in, because it relates to habitability.

English: If Papa Bear's bowl is too hot, and Mama Bear's bowl is too cold, shouldn't Baby Bear's bowl be even colder if we're following the trend?

English: This has to play into habitability.

English: But maybe there are other things we should be thinking about.

English: I could talk to you about a lot of different characteristics of these three planets that may influence habitability, but for selfish reasons related to my own research and the fact that I'm standing up here holding the clicker and you're not -- (Laughter) I would like to talk for just a minute or two about magnetic fields.

English: Earth has one; Venus and Mars do not.

English: Magnetic fields are generated in the deep interior of a planet by electrically conducting churning fluid material that creates this big old magnetic field that surrounds Earth.

English: If you have a compass, you know which way north is.

English: Venus and Mars don't have that.

English: (Laughter) Does this influence habitability?

English: Well, how might it?
Chinese: 定係喺之前係暖嘅呢？

English: Many scientists think that a magnetic field of a planet serves as a shield for the atmosphere, deflecting solar wind particles around the planet in a bit of a force field-type effect having to do with electric charge of those particles.

English: I like to think of it instead as a salad bar sneeze guard for planets.

English: (Laughter) And yes, my colleagues who watch this later will realize this is the first time in the history of our community that the solar wind has been equated with mucus.

English: (Laughter) OK, so the effect, then, is that Earth may have been protected for billions of years, because we've had a magnetic field.

English: Atmosphere hasn't been able to escape.

English: Other scientists think that magnetic fields may act more like the sails on a ship, enabling the planet to interact with more energy from the solar wind than the planet would have been able to interact with by itself.

English: The sails may gather energy from the solar wind.

English: If you've ever experienced them, it's magnificent.

English: We know the energy is getting in.

English: We're trying to measure how many particles are getting out and if the magnetic field is influencing this in any way.

English: It's designed to measure atmospheric escape.

English: And we can decide whether magnetic fields are important for habitability or not.

English: Once we have that answer, why should you care?

English: I mean, I care deeply ...

English: And financially as well, but deeply.

English: (Laughter) First of all, an answer to this question will teach us more about these three planets, Venus, Earth and Mars, not only about how they interact with their environment today, but how they were billions of years ago, whether they were habitable long ago or not.

English: It will teach us about atmospheres that surround us and that are close.

English: For example, the Kepler spacecraft, which is built and controlled here in Boulder, has been observing a postage stamp-sized region of the sky for a couple years now, and it's found thousands of planets -- in one postage stamp-sized region of the sky that we don't think is any different from any other part of the sky.

English: We've gone, in 20 years, from knowing of zero planets outside of our solar system, to now having so many, that we don't know which ones to investigate first.

English: Any lever will help.

English: In fact, based on observations that Kepler's taken and other similar observations, we now believe that, of the 200 billion stars in the Milky Way galaxy alone, on average, every star has at least one planet.

English: In addition to that, estimates suggest there are somewhere between 40 billion and 100 billion of those planets that we would define as habitable in just our galaxy.
Chinese: 呢件你成世人都以為嘅事 如果仔細諗下，可能冇咁簡單

English: We have the observations of those planets, but we just don't know which ones are habitable yet.
Chinese: 當然，行星溫度取決於佢同太陽嘅距離

English: It's a little bit like being trapped on a red spot -- (Laughter) on a stage and knowing that there are other worlds out there and desperately wanting to know more about them, wanting to interrogate them and find out if maybe just one or two of them are a little bit like you.

English: You can't do that. You can't go there, not yet.
Chinese: 但係我哋可能需要考慮其他事情

English: And so you have to use the tools that you've developed around you for Venus, Earth and Mars, and you have to apply them to these other situations, and hope that you're making reasonable inferences from the data, and that you're going to be able to determine the best candidates for habitable planets, and those that are not.

English: In the end, and for now, at least, this is our red spot, right here.

English: This is the only planet that we know of that's habitable, although very soon we may come to know of more.

English: But for now, this is the only habitable planet, and this is our red spot.

English: I'm really glad we're here.

English: Thanks.

English: (Applause)

（笑聲） 磁場會影響適居性嗎？

English: Mom, who are these people?

English: It was an innocent question from my young daughter Alia around the time when she was three.

English: She asked, "Mom, why is it that here where we live, and back in Lebanon, where grandma and grandpa live, we never see the pictures of powerful women on the walls?

English: I had grown up in my hometown in Lebanon, the younger of two daughters to a very hard-working pilot and director of operations for the Lebanese Airlines and a super-supportive stay-at-home mom and grandma.

English: So Arab women of my generation have had to become our own role models.

English: We have had to juggle more than Arab men, and we have had to face more cultural rigidity than Western women.
Chinese: 我哋喺金星同地球都有類似嘅量度

English: As a result, I would like to think that we poor, oppressed women actually have some useful, certainly hard-earned lessons to share, lessons that might turn out useful for anyone wishing to thrive in the modern world.

English: Here are three of mine.

English: ["Convert their sh*t into your fuel."] (Laughter) (Applause) There is this word that everybody is touting as the key to success: resilience.

English: In my previous job, well before my current firm, I was working with a man we will call John.

English: I had teamed up with John and was working hard, hoping he would notice how great I was and that he would come to support my case to make partner at the firm.

Chinese: 有件「大白鯊」服裝掛咗喺 我鎮上面嘅一間士多 我媽媽肯定係聽到我同人哋講 我覺得士多件衫幾咁型 所以喺萬聖節嘅前幾日 送咗我呢件大白鯊衫 件事係完全出乎曬我嘅意料

English: The day of the experiment shoot comes up, and I step out of my car in this costume, and my crew takes a look at me ...
Chinese: 依家，我成日聽到 某個年齡層嘅人喺度抱怨 依家啲細路仔唔知自己嘅生活有幾好 咁就等我舉個簡單嘅例子嚟講下 呢啲細路入門級扮演服裝 係依家你喺網上可以買到嘅

English: and start suppressing their church giggles.
Chinese: 呢件就係…

English: They're like, "(Laugh sound)."
Chinese: 我媽買畀我嘅大白鯊衫 （笑聲） 鯊魚塊面薄到好似張紙咁 圍嘴上面仲要黏住張《大白鯊》廣告

English: And I feel two distinct things at this moment.
Chinese: （笑聲） 但我就係鍾意佢

English: I feel total embarrassment over the fact that it's so nakedly clear to my crew that I'm completely into wearing this costume.
Chinese: 幾年之後 爸爸帶我去睇一部叫做《聖劍》嘅電影

English: (Laughter) But the producer in my mind reminds myself that in the high-speed shot in slow-mo, that flowing coat is going to look beautiful behind me.
Chinese: 事實上我叫佢帶我去睇兩次 而且對我嚟講係好大件事 因為呢部電影係一部限制級嘅 R 片

English: (Laughter) Five years into the "MythBusters" run, we got invited to appear at San Diego Comic-Con.
Chinese: 不過唔係血腥場面、內臟 或者女性胸部吸引我去睇多一次

English: I'd known about Comic-Con for years and never had time to go.
Chinese: 雖然呢啲都幾有吸引力 （笑聲） 係盔甲吸引我

English: This was the big leagues -- this was costuming mecca.
Chinese: 我覺得《聖劍》嘅盔甲真係好靚好型

English: People fly in from all over the world to show their amazing creations on the floor in San Diego.
Chinese: 騎士著住好閃嘅 好似塊鏡咁反光嘅盔甲

English: And I wanted to participate.
Chinese: 仲有，騎士去到邊度都著住件盔甲

English: I decided that I would put together an elaborate costume that covered me completely, and I would walk the floor of San Diego Comic-Con anonymously.
Chinese: 佢哋著住盔甲食飯，又著住盔甲瞓覺

English: The costume I chose?
Chinese: （笑聲） 我就諗︰「唔通佢哋解讀緊我嘅思想？

English: Hellboy.
Chinese: 我都想喺任何時候都著住件盔甲！」

English: That's not my costume, that's actually Hellboy.
Chinese: （笑聲） 所以我又返去搵我最鍾意嘅材料︰ 手工嘅材料 有波紋嘅硬紙皮 我同我自己整咗套盔甲 加咗護頸，配埋一匹白馬

English: (Laughter) But I spent months assembling the most screen-accurate Hellboy costume I could, from the boots to the belt to the pants to the right hand of doom.
Chinese: 雖然我已經將佢賣咗 但我哋可以睇下張相

English: I found a guy who made a prosthetic Hellboy head and chest and I put them on.
Chinese: （笑聲） （掌聲） 呢個係我受到《聖劍》啓發 而整嘅唯一一套盔甲

English: I even had contact lenses made in my prescription.
Chinese: 幾年之後 我說服咗我爸爸動手整返件啱身嘅盔甲

English: I wore it onto the floor at Comic-Con and I can't even tell you how balls hot it was in that costume.
Chinese: 大概過咗一個月，佢幫我升級咗材料 從硬紙皮 到叫做「遮雨板」嘅 鋁製屋頂材料 仲有一種我一直都好鍾意嘅連接材料︰ POP 鉚釘

English: (Laughter) Sweating! I should've remembered this.
Chinese: 成個月，我哋都喺度小心翼翼咁 整一套鋁製鉸接式 有好多混合波紋嘅盔甲

English: I'm sweating buckets and the contact lenses hurt my eyes, and none of it matters because I'm totally in love.
Chinese: 我哋喺頭盔度鑽咗幾個窿，方便我透氣 咁啱喺萬聖節之前整好咗 於是我就著住佢去返學

English: (Laughter) Not just with the process of putting on this costume and walking the floor, but also with the community of other costumers.
Chinese: 依家，呢樣嘢冇幻燈片可以畀你哋睇到 因為我無呢套盔甲嘅相

English: It's not called costuming at Cons, it's called "cosplay."
Chinese: 但我有著住佢去返學 當時有個年刊攝影師喺走廊度周圍影相 佢從來都冇搵到我 後來發覺係有原因嘅

English: Now ostensibly, cosplay means people who dress up as their favorite characters from film and television and especially anime, but it is so much more than that.
Chinese: 有啲嘢喺我著住套鋁製盔甲 去返學個時完全無諗到嘅

English: These aren't just people who find a costume and put it on -- they mash them up.
Chinese: 當時係第三期數學班 我企喺課室嘅後面 因為我著住套盔甲根本就坐唔低

English: They bend them to their will.
Chinese: （笑聲） 呢個係我冇預到嘅第一件事

English: They change them to be the characters they want to be in those productions.
Chinese: 之後我嘅老師好擔心咁望住我 隔住大概半個課室問我有冇事

English: They're super clever and genius.
Chinese: 我諗：老師你冇嘢掛？我有冇事？ 我依家著住套盔甲啊！

English: They let their freak flag fly and it's beautiful.
Chinese: 我係度享受緊我…… 就喺我準備要話畀佢知我有幾爽嗰時 我見到成間課室開始向左傾斜 跟住就消失喺呢條長長嘅隧道 之後我喺校醫室醒返

English: (Laughter) But more than that, they rehearse their costumes.
Chinese: 我因為套盔甲中暑虛脫而暈咗

English: At Comic-Con or any other Con, you don't just take pictures of people walking around.
Chinese: 當我醒返嗰時 我冇因為喺成班同學面前暈低而尷尬 反而我諗，邊個摞走咗我套盔甲？ 我套盔甲喺邊度？

English: You go up and say, "Hey, I like your costume, can I take your picture?"
Chinese: 好，講緊幾年後 我同幾個同事一齊受聘請去 同探索頻道做一檔 叫做《流言終結者》嘅節目

English: And then you give them time to get into their pose.
Chinese: 大概有 14 年嘅時間 我都喺度學習點樣去訂立實驗方法 同埋點樣喺電視上面講故事

English: They've worked hard on their pose to make their costume look great for your camera.
Chinese: 同時我又好早就知道 服裝可以對講故事起到舉足輕重嘅作用

English: And it's so beautiful to watch.
Chinese: 我用服裝令我哋講述嘅故事 更加幽默、清晰，有喜劇效果、有色彩

English: At subsequent Cons, I learn Heath Ledger's shambling walk as the Joker from "The Dark Knight."
Chinese: 後來當我哋做一集《垃圾搜尋》 我又有更深一層嘅體會 我領悟到服裝對我有更深嘅意義

English: I learn how to be a scary Ringwraith from "Lord of the Rings," and I actually frighten some children.
Chinese: 喺《垃圾搜尋》呢一集 我哋想回答嘅問題係： 跳入一個大型垃圾裝卸卡車係唔係 真係好似電影裏面演嘅咁安全？

English: I learned that "hrr hrr hrr" -- that head laugh that Chewbacca does.
Chinese: （笑聲） 呢一集係打算分成兩部份進行

English: And then I dressed up as No-Face from "Spirited Away."
Chinese: 一部份係我哋接受特技演員嘅訓練 學識從建築物跳到氣墊上面

English: If you don't know about "Spirited Away" and its director, Hayao Miyazaki, first of all, you're welcome.
Chinese: 而第二部份就係嚟真嘅 大型垃圾裝卸卡車會裝滿緩衝物料 俾我哋跳入去

English: (Laughter) This is a masterpiece, and one of my all-time favorite films.
Chinese: 我想呢兩部份 做到唔同嘅視覺效果 之後我諗︰「好， 既然第一部份我哋喺度訓練緊， 咁我哋就應該著住運動衫。 唔得！不如將 『特技訓練生』印喺衫後面，

English: It's about a young girl named Chihiro who gets lost in the spirit world in an abandoned Japanese theme park.
Chinese: 話畀人知係訓練嘅。」

English: And she finds her way back out again with the help of a couple of friends she makes -- a captured dragon named Haku and a lonely demon named No-Face.
Chinese: 但係到咗第二部份 我想要視覺衝擊嘅效果 「我知道啦！ 我會著成《黑客帝國》 嘅 Neo 咁。」 （笑聲） 所以我就去咗海特街

English: No-Face is lonely and he wants to make friends, and he thinks the way to do it is by luring them to him and producing gold in his hand.
Chinese: 買咗啲好靚、及膝、有皮帶扣嘅長靴

English: But this doesn't go very well, and so he ends up going on kind of a rampage until Chihiro saves him, rescues him.
Chinese: 跟住我又喺 eBay 度搵到一件褸

English: So I put together a No-Face costume, and I wore it on the floor at Comic-Con.
Chinese: 仲有一副墨鏡 為咗戴墨鏡，我仲要特登戴隱形眼鏡

English: And I very carefully practiced No-Face's gestures.
Chinese: 做實驗嘅日子終於嚟嘞 我著住呢套衫落車 之後我嘅劇組人員都望住我

English: I resolved I would not speak in this costume at all.
Chinese: 個個人都喺度揞住嘴偷笑

English: When people asked to take my picture, I would nod and I would shyly stand next to them.
Chinese: 就好似咁 （大笑聲）

English: They would take the picture and then I would secret out from behind my robe a chocolate gold coin.
Chinese: 呢一刻我有一種冰火兩重天嘅感覺

English: And at the end of the photo process, I'd make it appear for them.
Chinese: 非常尷尬 因為喺我同事睇嚟 我對呢套衫已經癡迷到走火入魔

English: Ah, ah ah! -- like that.
Chinese: （笑聲） 不過我腦裏面把聲喺度提醒我 喺高速鏡頭嘅慢動作裏面 我件風褸迎風飄揚嗰時肯定好型

English: And people were freaking out.
Chinese: （笑聲） 同《流言終結者》做咗五年節目之後 我哋收到聖地牙哥國際動漫展嘅邀請

English: Holy crap! Gold from No-Face! Oh my god, this is so cool!
Chinese: 我都知道咗呢個動漫展好多年 但係都冇時間去

English: And I'm feeling and I'm walking the floor and it's fantastic.
Chinese: 呢場動漫展好比 服裝界嘅盛事、服裝界嘅麥加

English: And about 15 minutes in something happens.
Chinese: 啲人從世界各地飛過去 展示佢哋嘅驚世嘅作品

English: Somebody grabs my hand, and they put a coin back into it.
Chinese: 我都想去參加

English: And I think maybe they're giving me a coin as a return gift, but no, this is one of the coins that I'd given away.
Chinese: 我決定要精心製作一套 會將我從頭包到落腳嘅戰服 咁就冇人知道我喺 聖地牙哥國際動畫展嗰度

English: I don't know why.
Chinese: 我揀咗邊件衫？

English: And I keep on going, I take some more pictures.
Chinese: 地獄男爵

English: And then it happens again.
Chinese: 嗰個唔係我件衫 嗰個真係地獄男爵嚟！

English: Understand, I can't see anything inside this costume.
Chinese: （笑聲） 但係我洗咗幾個月嘅時間 盡可能還原地獄男爵喺螢屏上嘅形象 從佢嘅長靴，到皮帶，到長褲 再到「毀滅之右手」

English: I can see through the mouth -- I can see people's shoes.
Chinese: 我搵人整咗地獄男爵頭部同胸部 跟住我將佢哋著上身

English: But the third time someone gives me back a coin, I want to know what's going on.
Chinese: 我甚至搵到咗心水嘅隱形眼鏡

English: So I sort of tilt my head back to get a better view, and what I see is someone walking away from me going like this.
Chinese: 我著住呢套衫行入動漫展 講真，著住件衫真是好鬼熱

English: And then it hits me: it's bad luck to take gold from No-Face.
Chinese: 熱到你無法想像 （笑聲） 大汗淋漓！我早就應該醒起

English: In the film "Spirited Away," bad luck befalls those who take gold from No-Face.
Chinese: 我不停咁飚汗，隱形眼鏡又好傷我對眼 但係呢啲都唔緊要 因為我愛上咗角色扮演

English: This isn't a performer-audience relationship; this is cosplay.
Chinese: （笑聲） 不單止係因為可以著上套衫 喺動漫展度行 仲因為我可以見到其他角色扮演者

English: We are, all of us on that floor, injecting ourselves into a narrative that meant something to us.
Chinese: 但搞清楚，動漫展裏面嘅裝扮 係叫做「角色扮演」

English: And we're making it our own.
Chinese: 表面上，角色扮演就係 人著到佢哋最鍾意嘅電影電視角色咁 尤其係著到日本動漫咁 但係當中含義唔係咁簡單

English: We're connecting with something important inside of us.
Chinese: 佢哋唔係搵到套衫著上身算 佢哋將角色同自己融合起嚟

English: And the costumes are how we reveal ourselves to each other.
Chinese: 佢哋令套衫嘅角色 跟住自己嘅諗法去做

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 當佢哋著住套衫個時 佢哋將角色變成心中想要嘅角色

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 佢哋係犀利嘅天才
佢哋做出好靚嘅嘢令人嘆服

English: What do you do if you had to figure out the information behind 11.5 million documents, verify it and make sense of it?
Chinese: （笑聲） 除此之外，佢哋仲會排練

English: That was a challenge that a group of journalists had to face late last year.
Chinese: 喺聖地牙哥，或者任何其他嘅動漫展 你唔係淨係同 個啲行黎行去嘅人影相

English: An anonymous person calling himself John Doe had somehow managed to copy nearly 40 years of records of the Panamanian law firm Mossack Fonseca.
Chinese: 實際上你會行上去講 「嘿，我好鍾意你件衫， 唔知可不可以影相？」

English: This is one of many firms around the world that specialize in setting up accounts in offshore tax havens like the British Virgin Islands, for rich and powerful people who like to keep secrets.
Chinese: 之後你俾佢哋時間去擺甫士

English: John Doe had managed to copy every spreadsheet from this firm, every client file, every email, from 1977 to the present day.
Chinese: 佢哋好努力咁擺姿勢 就為咗你部相機可以影到靚嘅畫面

English: It represented the biggest cache of inside information into the tax haven system that anyone had ever seen.
Chinese: 而呢一幕真係好靚，我會將佢記低

English: But it also presented a gigantic challenge to investigative journalism.
Chinese: 喺後來嘅動漫展裏面 我去學 Heath Ledger 喺《黑暗騎士》裏面 扮演小丑一角嘅蹣跚步履

English: Think about it: 11.5 million documents, containing the secrets of people from more than 200 different countries.
Chinese: 我去學點樣扮成《指環王》嘅恐怖戒靈 跟住我真係嚇親一啲細路仔

English: Where do you start with such a vast resource?
Chinese: 我仲學識咗「呵呵笑」 就好似楚巴卡喺《星球大戰》裏面咁笑

English: Where do you even begin to tell a story that can trail off into every corner of the globe, and that can affect almost any person in any language, sometimes in ways they don't even know yet.
Chinese: 然後我扮成《千與千尋》嘅無面男

English: John Doe had given the information to two journalists at the German newspaper Süddeutsche Zeitung.
Chinese: 如果你唔知道《千與千尋》 同埋佢嘅導演宮崎駿嘅話 我係好樂意講解下

English: He said he was motivated by -- and I quote -- "The scale of the injustice that the documents would reveal."
Chinese: （笑聲） 呢部電影真係一部傑作 一直都係我其中一齣最鍾意嘅電影

English: But one user alone can never make sense of such a vast amount of information.
Chinese: 喺電影裏面 一個叫荻野千尋嘅女仔喺 日本嘅一個廢棄公園嘅 靈異世界嗰度蕩失路

English: So the Süddeutsche Zeitung reached out to my organization in Washington, DC, The International Consortium of Investigative Journalists.
Chinese: 喺幾個朋友嘅幫助之下 佢又重新搵到出返嚟嘅路 其中兩個朋友 一個叫做白龍，一條被捉嘅龍嚟 另一個叫做無面男，孤獨魔鬼嚟

English: We decided to do something that was the very opposite of everything we'd been taught to do as journalists: share.
Chinese: 無面男好孤單，佢好想同人做朋友 佢認為交朋友嘅方法 就係將佢哋誘惑到自己身邊 再喺手上變出金幣

English: (Laughter) By nature, investigative reporters are lone wolves.
Chinese: 但係呢種方法唔係咁好用 所以最後佢性情暴變 直到荻野千尋拯救咗佢，佢先至平靜返

English: We fiercely guard our secrets, at times even from our editors, because we know that the moment we tell them what we have, they'll want that story right away.
Chinese: 我著上無面男套衫 行入聖地牙哥國際動漫展嘅會場

English: And to be frank, when you get a good story, you like to keep the glory to yourself.
Chinese: 我非常認真咁練習無面男嘅動作

English: But there's no doubt that we live in a shrinking world, and that the media has largely been slow to wake up to this.
Chinese: 我決定著住呢套衫個時唔出聲

English: The issues we report on are more and more transnational.
Chinese: 當有人想同我影相個時，我會點頭 同埋會好怕羞咁企喺佢哋隔籬

English: Giant corporations operate on a global level.
Chinese: 當佢哋影相 我會偷偷地從我件長袍後面 摞出一塊朱古力金幣

English: Environmental and health crises are global.
Chinese: 等佢哋影完相之後，我會送佢哋金幣

English: So, too, are financial flows and financial crises.
Chinese: 啊，啊，啊！——就好似咁

English: So it seems staggering that journalism has been so late to cover stories in a truly global way.
Chinese: 之後佢哋就會非常興奮

English: And it also seems staggering that journalism has been so slow to wake up to the possibilities that technology brings, rather than being frightened of it.
Chinese: 「天啊！無面男嘅金幣！ 難以置信，太犀利啦！」

English: The reason journalists are scared of technology is this: the profession's largest institutions are going through tough times because of the changing way that people are consuming news.
Chinese: 我好享受，之後我繼續喺動漫展度行

English: The advertising business models that have sustained reporting are broken.
Chinese: 大概喺 15 分鐘之後，有件事發生咗

English: And this has plunged journalism into crisis, forcing those institutions to reexamine how they function.
Chinese: 有人捉住咗我嘅手 佢哋俾返金幣我

English: But where there is crisis, there is also opportunity.
Chinese: 我覺得佢哋喺度回禮 但係唔係，呢個明明係我送出去嘅金幣

English: The first challenge presented by what would eventually become known as the Panama Papers was to make the documents searchable and readable.
Chinese: 但我唔知道點解佢哋咁做

English: There were nearly five million emails, two million PDFs that needed to be scanned and indexed, and millions more files and other kinds of documents.
Chinese: 於是我繼續行，我又影咗更多嘅相

English: They all needed to be housed in a safe and secure location in the cloud.
Chinese: 但又有人俾返金幣我

English: We next invited reporters to have a look at the documents.
Chinese: 你要知道，著住套衫嗰時 我乜都睇唔到

English: In all, reporters from more than 100 media organizations in 76 countries -- from the BBC in Britain to Le Monde newspaper in France to the Asahi Shimbun in Japan.
Chinese: 我可以通過面具嘅嘴睇到 啲人嘅鞋、佢哋講嘅嘢、佢哋對腳

English: Native eyes on native names, we called it, the idea being, who best to tell you who was important to Nigeria than a Nigerian journalist?
Chinese: 但係喺第三次有人將個金幣俾返我嗰時 我想知道到底發生咗啲乜嘢

English: Who best in Canada than a Canadian?

English: Kkhh!

English: How were paper birch and Douglas fir communicating?

English: Well, it turns out they were conversing not only in the language of carbon but also nitrogen and phosphorus and water and defense signals and allele chemicals and hormones -- information.
Chinese: 喺後面追住我 我舉住個注射器過我個頭 一邊拍蚊，一邊跳到架貨車度 我心諗 難怪啲科學家鍾意留喺實驗室啦！

English: And you know, I have to tell you, before me, scientists had thought that this belowground mutualistic symbiosis called a mycorrhiza was involved.
Chinese: （笑聲） 我等咗一個鐘

English: Mycorrhiza literally means "fungus root."

English: You see their reproductive organs when you walk through the forest.

English: They're the mushrooms.

English: The mushrooms, though, are just the tip of the iceberg, because coming out of those stems are fungal threads that form a mycelium, and that mycelium infects and colonizes the roots of all the trees and plants.
Chinese: 於是我行出架貨車，開始做嘢

English: And where the fungal cells interact with the root cells, there's a trade of carbon for nutrients, and that fungus gets those nutrients by growing through the soil and coating every soil particle.
Chinese: 我行近第一棵樺樹，掹個袋落嚟

English: The web is so dense that there can be hundreds of kilometers of mycelium under a single footstep.
Chinese: 將部蓋勒計數器擺近啲葉度

English: And not only that, that mycelium connects different individuals in the forest, individuals not only of the same species but between species, like birch and fir, and it works kind of like the Internet.
Chinese: 咔！

English: You see, like all networks, mycorrhizal networks have nodes and links.

English: We made this map by examining the short sequences of DNA of every tree and every fungal individual in a patch of Douglas fir forest.
Chinese: 樺樹已經吸收咗啲放射性氣體

English: In this picture, the circles represent the Douglas fir, or the nodes, and the lines represent the interlinking fungal highways, or the links.

English: The biggest, darkest nodes are the busiest nodes.

English: We call those hub trees, or more fondly, mother trees, because it turns out that those hub trees nurture their young, the ones growing in the understory.

English: And if you can see those yellow dots, those are the young seedlings that have established within the network of the old mother trees.

English: In a single forest, a mother tree can be connected to hundreds of other trees.

English: And using our isotope tracers, we have found that mother trees will send their excess carbon through the mycorrhizal network to the understory seedlings, and we've associated this with increased seedling survival by four times.
Chinese: 係樺樹同杉樹傾偈嘅聲音 樺樹問︰「喂，有冇嘢要幫手?」

English: Now, we know we all favor our own children, and I wondered, could Douglas fir recognize its own kin, like mama grizzly and her cub?
Chinese: 杉樹話︰「有呀，你畀啲碳我得唔得？

English: So we set about an experiment, and we grew mother trees with kin and stranger's seedlings.
Chinese: 我俾塊遮光布擋住咗呀。」

English: And it turns out they do recognize their kin.

English: Mother trees colonize their kin with bigger mycorrhizal networks.

English: They send them more carbon below ground.

English: They even reduce their own root competition to make elbow room for their kids.

English: When mother trees are injured or dying, they also send messages of wisdom on to the next generation of seedlings.
Chinese: 事實擺在眼前

English: So we've used isotope tracing to trace carbon moving from an injured mother tree down her trunk into the mycorrhizal network and into her neighboring seedlings, not only carbon but also defense signals.

English: And these two compounds have increased the resistance of those seedlings to future stresses.

English: So trees talk.

English: (Applause) Thank you.

English: Through back and forth conversations, they increase the resilience of the whole community.

English: (Laughter) So let's come back to the initial point.

English: Forests aren't simply collections of trees, they're complex systems with hubs and networks that overlap and connect trees and allow them to communicate, and they provide avenues for feedbacks and adaptation, and this makes the forest resilient.

English: That's because there are many hub trees and many overlapping networks.

English: Now, massive disturbance at this scale is known to affect hydrological cycles, degrade wildlife habitat, and emit greenhouse gases back into the atmosphere, which creates more disturbance and more tree diebacks.

English: And third, when we do cut, we need to save the legacies, the mother trees and networks, and the wood, the genes, so they can pass their wisdom onto the next generation of trees so they can withstand the future stresses coming down the road.

English: Thank you.

English: (Applause)

經過反反覆覆嘅對話 佢哋增強咗成個團體嘅適應力

English: And then I went online and found thousands of people all over the world living with the same symptoms, similarly isolated, similarly disbelieved.

English: I was diagnosed with myalgic encephalomyelitis.
You've probably heard it called "chronic fatigue syndrome."

English: For decades, that's a name that's meant that this has been the dominant image of a disease that can be as serious as this.

English: The key symptom we all share is that whenever we exert ourselves -- physically, mentally -- we pay and we pay hard.
Chinese: [ Jennifer Brea 對聲音敏感

English: If I try to walk half a block, I might be bedridden for a week.

English: It is a perfect custom prison.

English: It doesn't matter what you once were; you can't do it anymore.

English: It's been four years, and I've still never been as well as I was the minute before I walked home from my neurologist's office.

English: But it gave me hope that I could be treated.
