English: I came together with patients around the world, and we started to fight.
Chinese: 喺 1980 年 歇斯底里症正式改名為「轉化症」

English: We have filled the void with something wonderful, but it is not enough.
Chinese: 神經科醫生喺 2012 年幫我診症嘅時候 佢完全跟隨緊佛洛伊德嘅說話 今時今日 女性被診斷呢個病嘅機會 比男性多 2-10 倍

English: I still don't know if I will ever be able to run again, or walk at any distance, or do any of those kinetic things that I now only get to do in my dreams.
Chinese: 問題係歇斯底里理論或者心理病理論 係永遠無辦法證實

English: But I am so grateful for how far I have come.
Chinese: 個理論本身係無證據 以肌痛性腦脊髓炎為例，你會發現 心理學嘅解釋窒礙生物學嘅研究

English: Progress is slow, and it is up and it is down, but I am getting a little better each day.
Chinese: 喺全球，肌痛性腦脊髓炎 係其中一個研究資助最少嘅病

English: I remember what it was like when I was stuck in that bedroom, when it had been months since I had seen the sun.
Chinese: 喺美國，每年喺每個愛滋病人身上 用咗大概 2,500 美金 多發性硬化症病人就 250 美金 而肌痛性腦脊髓炎病人就只用 5 美金

English: I thought that I would die there.
Chinese: 呢件事唔係突然間嚟

English: But here I am today, with you, and that is a miracle.
Chinese: 我唔只係唔好彩

English: I don't know what would have happened had I not been one of the lucky ones, had I gotten sick before the internet, had I not found my community.
Chinese: 無視我呢個病係一個決定 係由應該要保護我哋嘅機構 做嘅一個決定

English: I probably would have already taken my own life, as so many others have done.
Chinese: 我哋唔知點解有時肌痛性腦脊髓炎 喺家族入面發生 唔知點解你幾乎每次感染 腸道病毒、人類疱疹病毒第四型 以至到 Q 型流感嘅時候 肌痛性腦脊髓炎就會病發 又或者點解佢影響女性 比男性多兩至三倍

English: How many lives could we have saved, decades ago, if we had asked the right questions?
Chinese: 呢啲嘢比我嘅病重要得多

English: How many lives could we save today if we decide to make a real start?
Chinese: 當初我病嘅時候 舊朋友都有樂意幫我

English: Even once the true cause of my disease is discovered, if we don't change our institutions and our culture, we will do this again to another disease.
Chinese: 之後我發覺自己 同一班就嚟 30 歲嘅女士一樣 身體面臨崩潰

English: Living with this illness has taught me that science and medicine are profoundly human endeavors.
Chinese: 最得人驚嘅係到底我哋面對緊嘅麻煩 有幾多係被認真咁對待

English: Doctors, scientists and policy makers are not immune to the same biases that affect all of us.
Chinese: 我知道有個女士 患咗一種自身免疫結締組織病 好多年都係話問題喺佢個頭度

English: We need to think in more nuanced ways about women's health.
Chinese: 由發病到診斷 佢條食道完完全全被破壞 佢無辦法再食嘢

English: Our immune systems are just as much a battleground for equality as the rest of our bodies.
Chinese: 另一個患咗卵巢癌嘅女士 好多年都係話佢只係提早咗更年期

English: We need to listen to patients' stories, and we need to be willing to say, "I don't know."
Chinese: 我有一個大學朋友 佢腦腫瘤曾經被誤診為焦慮症

English: I don't know is a beautiful thing.
Chinese: 呢個就係令我擔心嘅原因︰ 自從 1950 年代開始 患自身免疫病嘅比例增加三倍

English: I don't know is where discovery starts.
Chinese: 45% 最後確診患咗 一種已知嘅自身免疫病嘅人 初時被診斷患咗軟骨炎

English: And if we can do that, if we can approach the great vastness of all that we do not know, and then, rather than fear uncertainty, maybe we can greet it with a sense of wonder.
Chinese: 就好似以前嘅歇斯底里症咁 所有診斷都同性別拉上關係

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 75% 嘅自身免疫病嘅病人都係女性 某啲疾病甚至 90% 都係女性

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 就算女性係容易患上呢啲病 呢啲都唔係女性專有嘅病
肌痛性脊髓炎出現喺小朋友 亦出現喺過百萬男性身上

English: I write about food. I write about cooking.
Chinese: 正如某個病人同我講 我哋畀呢個病侵擾我哋…… 如果你係女性，人哋就話你誇大癥狀 但如果你係男性 人哋就叫你堅強、振作

English: I take it quite seriously, but I'm here to talk about something that's become very important to me in the last year or two.
Chinese: 男性甚至更難診斷

English: It is about food, but it's not about cooking, per se.
Chinese: 雖然我嘅頭腦唔似以前咁

English: I'm going to start with this picture of a beautiful cow.
Chinese: 但無論點 我仲抱有希望

English: I'm not a vegetarian -- this is the old Nixon line, right?
Chinese: 有好多病一開始都被認為係精神方面嘅 直至科學發現佢哋嘅生物機制

English: But I still think that this -- (Laughter) -- may be this year's version of this.
Chinese: 喺腦電圖測到大腦異常活動之前 癲癇病人可能被強制送入精神病院

English: Now, that is only a little bit hyperbolic.
Chinese: 喺斷層掃描同磁力共振發現腦病變之前 多發性硬化有可能誤診為 歇斯底里性麻痺

English: And why do I say it?
Chinese: 以前，我哋認為胃潰瘍 只係因為壓力而形成 到依架我哋發現 幽門螺旋菌先係罪魁禍首

English: Because only once before has the fate of individual people and the fate of all of humanity been so intertwined.
Chinese: 肌痛性腦脊髓炎從未好似其他病咁 得到科學嘅幫助 但係呢個情況已經開始改變

English: There was the bomb, and there's now.
Chinese: 喺德國，科學家開始 搵自身免疫病嘅證據 日本搵緊腦炎症嘅證據

English: And where we go from here is going to determine not only the quality and the length of our individual lives, but whether, if we could see the Earth a century from now, we'd recognize it.
Chinese: 喺美國，史丹福科學家喺度搵緊 能量代謝達16 個標準差嘅異常情況

English: It's a holocaust of a different kind, and hiding under our desks isn't going to help.
Chinese: 喺挪威，研究人員 為一種喺某啲病人身上 可以完全緩解癌症嘅藥 進行緊第三階段嘅臨床實驗

English: Start with the notion that global warming is not only real, but dangerous.
Chinese: 仲畀到希望我嘅就係病人嘅韌力

English: Since every scientist in the world now believes this, and even President Bush has seen the light, or pretends to, we can take this is a given.
Chinese: 我哋透過網絡走埋一齊 分享自己嘅故事

English: Then hear this, please.
Chinese: 我哋讀晒現有嘅研究

English: After energy production, livestock is the second-highest contributor to atmosphere-altering gases.
Chinese: 我哋用自己嚟做實驗

English: Nearly one-fifth of all greenhouse gas is generated by livestock production -- more than transportation.
Chinese: 我哋要成為自己嘅科學家同醫生 我哋一定要咁做

English: Now, you can make all the jokes you want about cow farts, but methane is 20 times more poisonous than CO2, and it's not just methane.
Chinese: 我慢慢咁喺呢度加 5%，嗰度加 5% 直到有一日，我可以行出屋企

English: Livestock is also one of the biggest culprits in land degradation, air and water pollution, water shortages and loss of biodiversity.
Chinese: 我仍然要做一啲荒謬嘅訣擇︰ 我今日坐係花園 15 分鐘，定係洗頭好？

English: There's more.
Chinese: 但係我仍然相信我可以好返

English: Like half the antibiotics in this country are not administered to people, but to animals.
Chinese: 我除咗有一個病咗嘅身體，咩都好好

English: But lists like this become kind of numbing, so let me just say this: if you're a progressive, if you're driving a Prius, or you're shopping green, or you're looking for organic, you should probably be a semi-vegetarian.
Chinese: 得到正確嘅幫助，或者有一日我會好返

English: Now, I'm no more anti-cattle than I am anti-atom, but it's all in the way we use these things.
Chinese: 我同世界各地嘅病人一齊對抗呢個病

English: There's another piece of the puzzle, which Ann Cooper talked about beautifully yesterday, and one you already know.
Chinese: 我哋將美好嘅事物填滿空虛 但咁係唔夠

English: There's no question, none, that so-called lifestyle diseases -- diabetes, heart disease, stroke, some cancers -- are diseases that are far more prevalent here than anywhere in the rest of the world.
Chinese: 我仍然唔知我仲可唔可以跑、行路 依架呢啲嘢只可以喺夢度做

English: And that's the direct result of eating a Western diet.
Chinese: 但係嚟到呢度我都好感恩

English: Our demand for meat, dairy and refined carbohydrates -- the world consumes one billion cans or bottles of Coke a day -- our demand for these things, not our need, our want, drives us to consume way more calories than are good for us.
Chinese: 進展係慢 有時好 有時壞 但係每一日都好一啲

English: And those calories are in foods that cause, not prevent, disease.
Chinese: 我記得匿埋係睡房好幾個月 不見天日嘅感覺

English: Now global warming was unforeseen.
Chinese: 我以為我會死喺嗰度

English: We didn't know that pollution did more than cause bad visibility.
Chinese: 但係我今日喺呢度，同你哋一齊 呢個就係奇蹟

English: Maybe a few lung diseases here and there, but, you know, that's not such a big deal.
Chinese: 如果我唔係幸運嘅一群 如果我喺互聯網出現之前病 如果我搵唔到同病相憐嘅人

English: The current health crisis, however, is a little more the work of the evil empire.
Chinese: 我唔知我會點 大概我會好似好多其他人咁已經自殺

English: We were told, we were assured, that the more meat and dairy and poultry we ate, the healthier we'd be.
Chinese: 如果我哋幾十年前問啱問題 可以救返幾多人？

English: No. Overconsumption of animals, and of course, junk food, is the problem, along with our paltry consumption of plants.
Chinese: 如果今日我哋真真正正開始 又可以救返幾多人？

English: Now, there's no time to get into the benefits of eating plants here, but the evidence is that plants -- and I want to make this clear -- it's not the ingredients in plants, it's the plants.
Chinese: 如果我哋唔改變我哋嘅體制同文化 就算搵到我個病嘅真正原因 我哋都會喺其他病重蹈覆轍

English: It's not the beta-carotene, it's the carrot.
Chinese: 呢個病教識咗我 科學同醫學都深受人類追求嘅

English: The evidence is very clear that plants promote health.
Chinese: 醫生、科學家同政策制訂者 都同普通人一樣受偏見影響

English: This evidence is overwhelming at this point.
Chinese: 我哋要喺微細之處諗諗女性嘅健康

English: You eat more plants, you eat less other stuff, you live longer.
Chinese: 我哋嘅免疫系統同身體其他部分一樣 需要顧及

English: Not bad.
Chinese: 我哋要聽病人嘅故事 亦要肯講「我唔知」

English: But back to animals and junk food.
Chinese: 「我唔知」係一件美好嘅事

English: What do they have in common?
Chinese: 「我唔知」先會有探索

English: One: we don't need either of them for health.
Chinese: 如果我哋做到「我唔知」 如果我哋可以接觸眾多嘅未知 而唔係怕當中嘅不確定性 我哋或者可以讚歎地欣賞其中

English: We don't need animal products, and we certainly don't need white bread or Coke.
Chinese: 多謝

English: Two: both have been marketed heavily, creating unnatural demand.
Chinese: 多謝

English: We're not born craving Whoppers or Skittles.
Three: their production has been supported by government agencies at the expense of a more health- and Earth-friendly diet.
Chinese: 我寫有關食物同煮嘢嘅文章

English: Now, let's imagine a parallel.
Chinese: 我對呢件事好認真 但我響度想講一啲 呢兩年嚟對我嚟講好重要嘅嘢

English: Let's pretend that our government supported an oil-based economy, while discouraging more sustainable forms of energy, knowing all the while that the result would be pollution, war and rising costs.
Chinese: 呢樣嘢係有關食物嘅，但唔係講煮食本身

English: Incredible, isn't it?
Chinese: 我先用一張好靚嘅母牛相做開場白

English: Yet they do that.
Chinese: 我唔係素食者…尼克遜成日都講呢句，係咪呀？

English: And they do this here. It's the same deal.
Chinese: 但我就覺得 (觀眾笑) 呢張可能係今年嘅版本

English: The sad thing is, when it comes to diet, is that even when well-intentioned Feds try to do right by us, they fail.
Chinese: 咁講只係有少少誇張啫

English: Either they're outvoted by puppets of agribusiness, or they are puppets of agribusiness.
Chinese: 點解我咁講？

English: So, when the USDA finally acknowledged that it was plants, rather than animals, that made people healthy, they encouraged us, via their overly simplistic food pyramid, to eat five servings of fruits and vegetables a day, along with more carbs.
Chinese: 因為史上系依樣野之前只有一次，個人嘅命運 同全人類嘅命運 有咁緊密相連過

English: What they didn't tell us is that some carbs are better than others, and that plants and whole grains should be supplanting eating junk food.
Chinese: 以前係原子彈，而依家就係呢一刻

English: But industry lobbyists would never let that happen.
Chinese: 而我哋依家行嘅路唔單止決定 個人生命嘅質素同長短 仲決定一個世紀以後 我哋望返地球嗰陣，仲會唔會認得出佢

English: And guess what?
Chinese: 呢次某程度係一個大屠殺 而逃避並唔係辦法

English: Half the people who developed the food pyramid have ties to agribusiness.
Chinese: 我哋開始知道全球暖化 唔單止係真嘅，而且仲好危險

English: So, instead of substituting plants for animals, our swollen appetites simply became larger, and the most dangerous aspects of them remained unchanged.
Chinese: 依家個個科學家都相信有全球暖化 就算布殊總統都話佢明白依個事實，又或者佢系扮明白 呢啲嘢可以係前提

English: So-called low-fat diets, so-called low-carb diets -- these are not solutions.
Chinese: 咁大家請聽住

English: But with lots of intelligent people focusing on whether food is organic or local, or whether we're being nice to animals, the most important issues just aren't being addressed.
Chinese: 家畜係繼能源生產之後 第二大導致大氣層變化嘅氣體嘅生產者

English: Now, don't get me wrong.
Chinese: 近五分一嘅溫室氣體 係由畜牧產生 占嘅比重仲大過交通工具

English: I like animals, and I don't think it's just fine to industrialize their production and to churn them out like they were wrenches.
Chinese: 任你想點用牛放屁嚟講笑都得 問題係甲烷比二氧化碳有毒二十倍 而且佢哋製造嘅唔止甲烷

English: But there's no way to treat animals well, when you're killing 10 billion of them a year.
Chinese: 生畜仲係土地退化，空氣、食水污染 食水短缺同生物多樣性降低嘅促成者

English: That's our number. 10 billion.
Chinese: 仲有

English: If you strung all of them -- chickens, cows, pigs and lambs -- to the moon, they'd go there and back five times, there and back.
Chinese: 全國有一半嘅抗生素 唔係用響人度，係用咗響禽畜度

English: Now, my math's a little shaky, but this is pretty good, and it depends whether a pig is four feet long or five feet long, but you get the idea.
Chinese: 但呢啲清單聽得多會麻木，我只係想話 如果你走在時代尖端 如果你揸緊環保車，或者支持綠色消費 又或者你搵緊有機食物嚟食 咁你都應該係半素食嘅

English: That's just the United States.
Chinese: 係，我反對食牛肉，好似反原子彈咁樣 但我反對嘅係我哋人類用呢啲嘢嘅方式

English: And with our hyper-consumption of those animals producing greenhouse gases and heart disease, kindness might just be a bit of a red herring.
Chinese: 你地都應該已經知道既 安古柏響尋日精彩嘅演講講到 呢個現象嘅其中一個構成部份

English: Let's get the numbers of the animals we're killing for eating down, and then we'll worry about being nice to the ones that are left.
Chinese: 無容置疑，諗都唔駛諗，啲所謂都市病 好似糖尿病，心臟病，中風，某啲癌症 呢啲病響呢度 都比世界其他地方普遍

English: Another red herring might be exemplified by the word "locavore," which was just named word of the year by the New Oxford American Dictionary.
Chinese: 呢啲病係西方飲食嘅直接結果

English: Seriously.
Chinese: 我哋追求肉、奶製品、精製過嘅碳水化合物 全世界一日飲咗以億樽計嘅可樂 我哋對呢啲嘢嘅需求，唔係必需嘅，只係慾望 令我哋食咗太多卡路里

English: And locavore, for those of you who don't know, is someone who eats only locally grown food -- which is fine if you live in California, but for the rest of us it's a bit of a sad joke.
Chinese: 而呢啲卡路里唔會防止疾病，仲反而引起病痛

English: Between the official story -- the food pyramid -- and the hip locavore vision, you have two versions of how to improve our eating.
Chinese: 無人預計到有全球暖化

English: (Laughter).
Chinese: 我哋唔知污染原來唔止令能見度差咗咁簡單

English: They both get it wrong, though.
Chinese: 仲可能令人有一啲肺部嘅疾病 但你知道，呢啲都唔係咩大不了

English: The first at least is populist, and the second is elitist.
Chinese: 重要係，依家嘅健康危機 比阻止邪惡帝國更加棘手

English: How we got to this place is the history of food in the United States.
Chinese: 人哋同我哋講，向我哋保證 家畜、奶製品、家禽食得越多 我哋就會越健康

English: And I'm going to go through that, at least the last hundred years or so, very quickly right now.
Chinese: 錯。唔駛講，過量攝取肉類同垃圾食物 而蔬果食得少之有少係個問題

English: A hundred years ago, guess what?
Chinese: 今次無時間講食蔬果有乜好處 但我想講清楚，最重要係蔬菜本身 唔係蔬菜入面嘅成份，係菜本身

English: Everyone was a locavore: even New York had pig farms nearby, and shipping food all over the place was a ridiculous notion.
Chinese: 唔係B-胡蘿蔔素，係紅蘿蔔本身重要

English: Every family had a cook, usually a mom.
Chinese: 證據好清楚咁顯示蔬菜促進健康

English: And those moms bought and prepared food.
Chinese: 響呢方面嘅證據係不可置疑

English: It was like your romantic vision of Europe.
Chinese: 食多啲蔬果，食少啲其他嘢，你就長命啲

English: Margarine didn't exist.
Chinese: 聽落唔錯丫

English: In fact, when margarine was invented, several states passed laws declaring that it had to be dyed pink, so we'd all know that it was a fake.
Chinese: 講返肉食同垃圾食品

English: There was no snack food, and until the '20s, until Clarence Birdseye came along, there was no frozen food.
Chinese: 佢地有乜共通點？

English: There were no restaurant chains.
Chinese: 第一，我哋唔駛為咗健康而食呢啲嘢

English: There were neighborhood restaurants run by local people, but none of them would think to open another one.
Chinese: 我哋唔需要肉類製品 當然我哋亦唔需要白麵包同可樂

English: Eating ethnic was unheard of unless you were ethnic.
Chinese: 第二，呢兩樣嘢都做好多推廣 製造唔自然嘅需求

English: And fancy food was entirely French.
Chinese: 我哋唔係生出嚟就淨食三文治或者彩虹糖

English: As an aside, those of you who remember Dan Aykroyd in the 1970s doing Julia Child imitations can see where he got the idea of stabbing himself from this fabulous slide.
Chinese: 第三，呢啲食物嘅生產有政府機構支持 而且代價系取代左一種更健康、更環保嘅飲食方式

English: (Laughter) Back in those days, before even Julia, back in those days, there was no philosophy of food.
Chinese: 我哋一齊幻想下有對平行線

English: You just ate.
Chinese: 假設政府支持以石油經濟 又唔支持可持續發展嘅能源種類 而且佢知道後果會係 污染、戰爭、成本上升

English: You didn't claim to be anything.
Chinese: 不可思議呀呵？

English: There was no marketing. There were no national brands.
Chinese: 但佢地係要咁做

English: Vitamins had not been invented.
Chinese: 佢哋就響度做呢啲嘢，係一樣㗎咋

English: There were no health claims, at least not federally sanctioned ones.
Chinese: 可惜嘅係，講到飲食習慣 就算聯邦政府好心地咁 想為我哋撥亂反正，都衰咗

English: Fats, carbs, proteins -- they weren't bad or good, they were food.
Chinese: 一係佢哋投票輸咗畀農業企業嘅傀儡 又或者佢哋就係農業企業嘅傀儡

English: You ate food.
Chinese: 所以當美國農業部最終承認 蔬果而唔係肉類令人健康之後 佢哋用過份簡化嘅食物金字塔去鼓勵我哋 每日食五份蔬果 同埋食多啲碳水化合物

English: Hardly anything contained more than one ingredient, because it was an ingredient.
Chinese: 佢哋無講嘅係有啲碳水化合物係好啲 而蔬果同全穀食物 應該取代晒垃圾食物

English: The cornflake hadn't been invented.
Chinese: 但業界嘅說客又點會畀呢啲嘢發生

English: (Laughter) The Pop-Tart, the Pringle, Cheez Whiz, none of that stuff.
Chinese: 你估下實情係點？

English: Goldfish swam.
Chinese: 諗呢個食物金字塔嘅人入面有一半 同農業企業有關係

English: (Laughter) It's hard to imagine. People grew food, and they ate food.
Chinese: 所以蔬菜唔單指無取代到肉 我哋吃肉嘅胃口反而越變越大 而當中對身體最危險嘅影響仍然無變

English: And again, everyone ate local.
Chinese: 嗰啲所謂低脂飲食、低澱粉質飲食 都唔係解決方法

English: In New York, an orange was a common Christmas present, because it came all the way from Florida.
Chinese: 但好多聰明人 只著眼啲食物係咪有機或者本地嘅 或者係咪善待啲動物 但最重要嘅問題就無觸及到

English: From the '30s on, road systems expanded, trucks took the place of railroads, fresh food began to travel more.
Chinese: 唔好誤會

English: Oranges became common in New York.
Chinese: 我好鍾意動物 我唔認同將佢哋嘅生產過程工業化 粗製濫造啲肉類出嚟

English: The South and West became agricultural hubs, and in other parts of the country, suburbs took over farmland.
Chinese: 但當你一年殺成百億動物嗰陣 就無辦法講點善待啲動物

English: The effects of this are well known. They are everywhere.
Chinese: 呢個係我哋呢度嘅數字，一百億

English: And the death of family farms is part of this puzzle, as is almost everything from the demise of the real community to the challenge of finding a good tomato, even in summer.
Chinese: 如果將啲雞呀、牛呀、豬呀、羊呀 動物排成一列去月球 條隊由呢度到月球可以來回五次

English: Eventually, California produced too much food to ship fresh, so it became critical to market canned and frozen foods.
Chinese: 我啲數學麻麻地，但系計依嘀都仲系夠用既 仲要視乎隻豬係四呎定五呎長 不過你明啦

English: Thus arrived convenience.
Chinese: 呢個數淨係計美國入面咋喎

English: It was sold to proto-feminist housewives as a way to cut down on housework.
Chinese: 我哋過度食用呢啲肉類 產生咁多溫室氣體，引起咁多心臟疾病 呢啲慈悲似乎只係用嚟轉移視線

English: Now, I know everybody over the age of, like 45 -- their mouths are watering at this point.
Chinese: 我哋殺咗啲動物，食咗佢哋 然後諗下要點樣對剩低嘅動物好啲

English: (Laughter) (Applause) If we had a slide of Salisbury steak, even more so, right?
Chinese: 另一個煙幕可以用「土食主義者」做例子 呢個詞啱啱畀新牛津美語大辭典稱為本年度嘅風雲詞彙

English: (Laughter) But this may have cut down on housework, but it cut down on the variety of food we ate as well.
Chinese: 講真㗎

English: Many of us grew up never eating a fresh vegetable except the occasional raw carrot or maybe an odd lettuce salad.
Chinese: 土食主義者就係 一啲只食本土種植嘅食品嘅人 如果你住加州就無問題 但其他人嚟講就難度好高

English: I, for one -- and I'm not kidding -- didn't eat real spinach or broccoli till I was 19.
Chinese: 響正統嘅食物金字塔 同時興嘅土食主義之間 大家有兩款版本點去食好啲

English: Who needed it though? Meat was everywhere.
What could be easier, more filling or healthier for your family than broiling a steak?
Chinese: 但雙方都諗錯方向

English: But by then cattle were already raised unnaturally.
Chinese: 第一款至少都想普及一啲，而第二款直頭係精英主義

English: Rather than spending their lives eating grass, for which their stomachs were designed, they were forced to eat soy and corn.
Chinese: 我哋變成咁樣，就要由美國食物史講起

English: They have trouble digesting those grains, of course, but that wasn't a problem for producers.
Chinese: 而我依家帶你哋 好快咁睇下過去一百年係點

English: New drugs kept them healthy.
Chinese: 一百年前係點樣？

English: Well, they kept them alive.
Chinese: 個個都係食本地生產嘅食物 運啲食物去第二度簡直妙想天開

English: Healthy was another story.
Chinese: 每個屋企都有廚師，多數係由阿媽做埋

English: Thanks to farm subsidies, the fine collaboration between agribusiness and Congress, soy, corn and cattle became king.
Chinese: 佢地買材料同煮嘢食

English: And chicken soon joined them on the throne.
Chinese: 就好似你哋幻想中浪漫嘅歐洲咁樣

English: It was during this period that the cycle of dietary and planetary destruction began, the thing we're only realizing just now.
Chinese: 人造牛油未出現

English: Listen to this, between 1950 and 2000, the world's population doubled.
Chinese: 其實人造牛油面世時 有幾個州份都通過話要佢哋染成粉紅色 等啲人知呢啲唔係真牛油

English: Meat consumption increased five-fold.
Chinese: 嗰陣都未有零食，到二十年代 發明家貝爾塞發明急凍技術，至有急凍食品

English: Now, someone had to eat all that stuff, so we got fast food.
Chinese: 嗰陣無連鎖餐廳

English: And this took care of the situation resoundingly.
Chinese: 得一嗰由本地人開畀鄰居嘅食肆 無人諗住要開多間分店

English: Home cooking remained the norm, but its quality was down the tubes.
Chinese: 傳統飲食係聞所未聞，除非你本身係小數民族啦

English: There were fewer meals with home-cooked breads, desserts and soups, because all of them could be bought at any store.
Chinese: 啲花巧食物全部都係嚟自法國

English: Not that they were any good, but they were there.
Chinese: 講開又講，如果你記得七十年代 丹‧艾克洛德扮茱莉亞‧查爾德嘅話 睇到呢張圖你就知點解佢有咁嘅諗頭

English: Most moms cooked like mine: a piece of broiled meat, a quickly made salad with bottled dressing, canned soup, canned fruit salad.
Chinese: (笑) 響茱莉亞出名之前 嗰陣都無乜人提倡飲食文化

English: Maybe baked or mashed potatoes, or perhaps the stupidest food ever, Minute Rice.
Chinese: 食嘢就係食嘢

English: For dessert, store-bought ice cream or cookies.
Chinese: 唔駛提倡啲乜嘢主義

English: My mom is not here, so I can say this now.
Chinese: 嗰陣無市場推廣，無全國性品牌

English: This kind of cooking drove me to learn how to cook for myself.
Chinese: 維他命丸都未有

English: (Laughter) It wasn't all bad.
Chinese: 亦都無健康宣稱，連聯邦法例批准嘅都無

English: By the '70s, forward-thinking people began to recognize the value of local ingredients.
Chinese: 脂肪、澱粉質、蛋白質，都無分好壞，佢哋只係食物

English: We tended gardens, we became interested in organic food, we knew or we were vegetarians.
Chinese: 你就只係食食物

English: We weren't all hippies, either.
Chinese: 好多時啲嘢食好少多過一個材料 因為佢哋本身就係材料

English: Some of us were eating in good restaurants and learning how to cook well.
Chinese: 嗰陣未發明粟米片

English: Meanwhile, food production had become industrial. Industrial.
Chinese: (笑) 甜夾心餅、薯片、芝士醬，呢啲嘢都未有

English: Perhaps because it was being produced rationally, as if it were plastic, food gained magical or poisonous powers, or both.
Chinese: 當時金魚係游水（註：不是金魚餅）

English: Many people became fat-phobic.
Chinese: (笑) 好難想像。嗰陣自己種嘢食，然後食種出嚟嘅嘢食

English: Others worshiped broccoli, as if it were God-like.
Chinese: 講多一次，佢哋食本地出產嘅食物

English: But mostly they didn't eat broccoli.
Chinese: 響紐約，聖誕節送橙好普遍 因為橙要由佛羅里達州運嚟

English: Instead they were sold on yogurt, yogurt being almost as good as broccoli.
Chinese: 三十年代起，道路系統擴展 貨車取代鐵路 新鮮食物開始越運越遠

English: Except, in reality, the way the industry sold yogurt was to convert it to something much more akin to ice cream.
Chinese: 橙響紐約變得唾手可得

English: Similarly, let's look at a granola bar.
Chinese: 南部同西部成為農業重鎮 其他地方嘅農地變成近郊

English: You think that that might be healthy food, but in fact, if you look at the ingredient list, it's closer in form to a Snickers than it is to oatmeal.
Chinese: 帶嚟嘅影響深遠，到處可見

English: Sadly, it was at this time that the family dinner was put in a coma, if not actually killed -- the beginning of the heyday of value-added food, which contained as many soy and corn products as could be crammed into it.
Chinese: 家庭式農場嘅消失是其中一環 就好似從真正社區沒落 到夏天都難搵一個靚蕃茄咁 都係影響嘅一部份

English: Think of the frozen chicken nugget.
Chinese: 最後加州出產太多食物，運都運唔晒 所以推廣罐頭和急凍食品在所必行

English: The chicken is fed corn, and then its meat is ground up, and mixed with more corn products to add bulk and binder, and then it's fried in corn oil.
Chinese: 於是用方便嚟做賣點

English: All you do is nuke it. What could be better?
Chinese: 呢啲食物以原女性主義嘅主婦作對象 等佢哋做少啲家務

English: And zapped horribly, pathetically.
Chinese: 我知道過咗大約四十五歲嘅觀眾 見到實流晒口水

English: By the '70s, home cooking was in such a sad state that the high fat and spice contents of foods like McNuggets and Hot Pockets -- and we all have our favorites, actually -- made this stuff more appealing than the bland things that people were serving at home.
Chinese: (笑) (掌聲) 如果有幅漢堡扒嘅圖片，你哋流多啲口水添，係咪？

English: At the same time, masses of women were entering the workforce, and cooking simply wasn't important enough for men to share the burden.
Chinese: (笑) 雖然咁樣會做少咗家務 但亦會減少左我哋食嘅食物嘅種類

English: So now, you've got your pizza nights, you've got your microwave nights, you've got your grazing nights, you've got your fend-for-yourself nights and so on.
Chinese: 我地好多人成長嗰陣除咗有時食下生紅蘿蔔 或者生菜沙律之外，好少會食新鮮蔬果

English: Leading the way -- what's leading the way?
Chinese: 以我為例，唔係講笑 到十九歲至食到真嘅菠菜同西蘭花

English: Meat, junk food, cheese: the very stuff that will kill you.
Chinese: 邊個需要食呢啲嘢呢？周圍都有肉食

English: So, now we clamor for organic food.
Chinese: 有啲乜野比煎塊扒畀屋企人食更加 容易，飽肚、或健康？

English: That's good.
Chinese: 嗰陣啲牛已經唔係用天然方法飼養

English: And as evidence that things can actually change, you can now find organic food in supermarkets, and even in fast-food outlets.
Chinese: 牛嘅胃系設計嚟食草既 但啲人硬系要迫佢食大豆同粟米 都唔由得佢食草

English: But organic food isn't the answer either, at least not the way it's currently defined.
Chinese: 啲牛當然消化唔到啲穀物 但呢啲唔係生產者嘅間題

English: Let me pose you a question.
Chinese: 新嘅葯物會維持佢哋健康

English: Can farm-raised salmon be organic, when its feed has nothing to do with its natural diet, even if the feed itself is supposedly organic, and the fish themselves are packed tightly in pens, swimming in their own filth?
Chinese: 應該話會令佢哋繼續生存

English: And if that salmon's from Chile, and it's killed down there and then flown 5,000 miles, whatever, dumping how much carbon into the atmosphere?
Chinese: 健唔健康係另一回事

English: I don't know.
Chinese: 多得農業補貼 呢啲農業企業同國會嘅微妙合作方式 大豆、粟米、牛隻大行其道

English: Packed in Styrofoam, of course, before landing somewhere in the United States, and then being trucked a few hundred more miles.
Chinese: 之後雞都加埋入去添

English: This may be organic in letter, but it's surely not organic in spirit.
Chinese: 呢個時期就係 飲食同地球毀滅嘅循環開端 呢樣嘢到依家我哋至意識到

English: Now here is where we all meet.
Chinese: 聽清楚 一九五零年至二千年之間，全球人口增加一倍

English: The locavores, the organivores, the vegetarians, the vegans, the gourmets and those of us who are just plain interested in good food.
Chinese: 但系肉食攝取就增加五倍

English: Even though we've come to this from different points, we all have to act on our knowledge to change the way that everyone thinks about food.
Chinese: 咁實有啲人食咗多出黎既肉，所以我哋有左快餐

English: We need to start acting.
Chinese: 咁就徹底解釋咗呢個問題

English: And this is not only an issue of social justice, as Ann Cooper said -- and, of course, she's completely right -- but it's also one of global survival.
Chinese: 響屋企煮嘢食都仲係普遍，但質素已經每況愈下

English: Which bring me full circle and points directly to the core issue, the overproduction and overconsumption of meat and junk food.
Chinese: 越來越少有屋企整嘅麵包、甜品同湯 因為全部呢啲嘢都可以響舖頭買到

English: As I said, 18 percent of greenhouse gases are attributed to livestock production.
Chinese: 唔係話買返嚟質素好啲，只不過係買就有得吃

English: How much livestock do you need to produce this?
Chinese: 大部份媽咪好似我阿媽咁煮飯 一塊烤肉，用樽裝沙律醬撈成嘅沙律 罐頭湯，罐頭生果沙律

English: 70 percent of the agricultural land on Earth, 30 percent of the Earth's land surface is directly or indirectly devoted to raising the animals we'll eat.
Chinese: 可能有焗薯同薯蓉 又或者食史上最唔駛用腦嘅食物：即食飯

English: And this amount is predicted to double in the next 40 years or so.
Chinese: 甜品就係響出面買嘅雪糕或者曲奇餅

English: And if the numbers coming in from China are anything like what they look like now, it's not going to be 40 years.
Chinese: 我阿媽唔在場，我可以講你知

English: There is no good reason for eating as much meat as we do.
Chinese: 因為呢啲咁嘅廚藝驅使我去學煮嘢食畀自己

English: And I say this as a man who has eaten a fair share of corned beef in his life.
Chinese: (笑) 都唔一定係壞事嚟嘅

English: The most common argument is that we need nutrients -- even though we eat, on average, twice as much protein as even the industry-obsessed USDA recommends.
Chinese: 七十年代，思想先進嘅人 開始意識到本地食材嘅價值

English: But listen: experts who are serious about disease reduction recommend that adults eat just over half a pound of meat per week.
Chinese: 於是自己整個花園，對有機食品有興趣 我哋認識或者成為素食人士

English: What do you think we eat per day? Half a pound.
Chinese: 我哋唔係做咗嬉皮士

English: But don't we need meat to be big and strong?
Chinese: 有啲人仲仍然去幫襯好餐廳，學下點煮好餸

English: Isn't meat eating essential to health?
Chinese: 同時食物嘅生產過程變得工業化，叫工業化

English: Won't a diet heavy in fruit and vegetables turn us into godless, sissy, liberals?
Chinese: 可能因為畀人認為可以好似 塑膠咁系生產線到啤出嚟 食物獲得神奇或者有害嘅力量，甚至兩者都有

English: (Laughter) Some of us might think that would be a good thing.
Chinese: 好多人對肥胖有恐懼

English: But, no, even if we were all steroid-filled football players, the answer is no.
Chinese: 另一啲人當西蘭花係神咁拜

English: In fact, there's no diet on Earth that meets basic nutritional needs that won't promote growth, and many will make you much healthier than ours does.
Chinese: 但好多時佢哋都唔食西蘭花

English: We don't eat animal products for sufficient nutrition, we eat them to have an odd form of malnutrition, and it's killing us.
Chinese: 取而代之，西蘭花就連埋乳酪咁一齊賣 乳酪好似同西蘭花咁好

English: To suggest that in the interests of personal and human health Americans eat 50 percent less meat -- it's not enough of a cut, but it's a start.
Chinese: 而事實上，業界銷售乳酪嗰陣 係將孔酪變到好似雪糕咁

English: It would seem absurd, but that's exactly what should happen, and what progressive people, forward-thinking people should be doing and advocating, along with the corresponding increase in the consumption of plants.
Chinese: 同樣，睇下啲穀類果仁棒球場

English: I've been writing about food more or less omnivorously -- one might say indiscriminately -- for about 30 years.
Chinese: 以為呢啲嘢食會健康啲 但你睇返原料表 原來佢似朱古力棒多過以燕麥

English: During that time, I've eaten and recommended eating just about everything.
Chinese: 好可惜，呢個時候家庭式晚餐就算唔係一命嗚呼 都已經進入昏迷狀態 嗰啲可以塞幾多就塞幾多大豆同粟米製品 嘅增值食品 開始繁盛起嚟

English: I'll never stop eating animals, I'm sure, but I do think that for the benefit of everyone, the time has come to stop raising them industrially and stop eating them thoughtlessly.
Chinese: 睇下啲急凍雞塊

English: Ann Cooper's right.
Chinese: 啲雞係用粟米餵大，啲肉同粟米製品 攪埋一齊，等佢大舊啲同黏得埋一齊 然後放入粟米油度炸

English: The USDA is not our ally here.
Chinese: 你只需要放入微波爐叮，有乜好過咁？

English: We have to take matters into our own hands, not only by advocating for a better diet for everyone -- and that's the hard part -- but by improving our own.
Chinese: 然後狼吞虎嚥咁食落肚

English: And that happens to be quite easy.
Chinese: 到七十年代，響屋企煮嘢食呢樣嘢己經到咗慘不忍睹嘅地步 一啲好似麥樂雞同叮叮食物 咁嘅高脂多調味料嘅食品 仲有其他我哋鍾意食嘅嘢 相比之下，起自家煮嘅 淡而無味嘅嘢食，呢類食物吸引人得多

English: Less meat, less junk, more plants.
Chinese: 同時，大量女性投入勞動市場 男人唔覺得煮嘢食重要到 要渠去做呢樣野

English: It's a simple formula: eat food.
Chinese: 於是我哋依家薄餅就當一餐，微波爐叮嘢食當一餐 放任咁想吃就吃又系一餐， 自己照顧自己都系一餐，諸如此類

English: Eat real food.
Chinese: 乜嘢食物獨當一面？

English: We can continue to enjoy our food, and we continue to eat well, and we can eat even better.
Chinese: 肉類，垃圾食物，芝士 呢啲嘢食都會拿你命

English: We can continue the search for the ingredients we love, and we can continue to spin yarns about our favorite meals.
Chinese: 依家我哋大大聲要有機食品

English: We'll reduce not only calories, but our carbon footprint.
Chinese: 係好事嚟嘅

English: We can make food more important, not less, and save ourselves by doing so.
Chinese: 證明啲事情其實會改變 依家響超市 甚至響快餐店都搵到有機食物

English: We have to choose that path.
Chinese: 但有機食物都唔係答案 至少唔係好似依家咁界定有機

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 我問下你哋
啲三文魚食嘅係有機，但同天然飲食無關嘅飼料 又畀人養響窄窄嘅圍入面 響自己啲污糟嘢入面游水 呢啲養殖三文魚可以叫有機嗎？

English: (Music) Roughly 43,000 years ago, a young cave bear died in the rolling hills on the northwest border of modern day Slovenia.
Chinese: 又如果啲三文魚來自智利，響嗰度劏 然後運去五千哩外，釋放唔知幾多碳入大氣層 呢啲又點算有機？

English: A thousand years later, a mammoth died in southern Germany.
Chinese: 我唔知道

English: Yes, he probably had ongoing depression.

English: He had experienced triggering events at the school that left him feeling debased and humiliated and mad.

English: Thank you.

嗰個時候，佢堅信 如果佢死咗，佢嘅细路仔會更好 於是佢準備自殺

我從佢同其他人身上學到 我哋對自殺嘅抉擇 同我哋諗買邊駕車 或者星期六去邊度玩嘅嗰種選擇 係好唔同

English: When I was a kid, I was the quintessential nerd.

English: (Laughter) I grew up in a small town in the dusty plains of north Texas, the son of a sheriff who was the son of a pastor.

English: Getting into trouble was not an option.

English: Now, in scientific terms, we call this a very bad idea.

English: Yes.

English: Yes.

English: But it's always there, supporting us, connecting us to each other and showing us the beauty of the universe.
Chinese: 你可能冇注意到 但事實確實係咁

English: So if you ever feel lost, stop and listen for your song.
Chinese: （吉他聲） 等我嚟講得簡單啲 生活本身似乎好無聊 但係帶嚟咗節拍、心跳

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 再加埋你生活中嘅事 加啲質感 家人朋友 一切令到你生活和諧嘅嘢 而喺你嘅歌裏面 就係和聲 抑揚頓挫 一切多音調嘅因素

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 就創造咗優美嘅和絃同節奏
（吉他聲） 你就喺度

English: Are you tired of your boss?
Chinese: 你喺一切之上 控制韻律節奏 因為你就係旋律本身

English: (Laughter) Are you tired of going to work and making money for other people?
Chinese: 事物可能會改變、發展 但係無論我哋做咩 我哋本身都冇變到

English: And who are those people anyways?
Chinese: 就好似雖然旋律發生咗改變 首歌都仲係嗰首歌

English: Those people that make money from your work.
Chinese: 無論你做咩 節奏都伴隨著你 仲有節拍同心跳

English: Well, they're capitalists.
Chinese: 我畢業之後 去咗大學 一切都消失咗

English: They have capital, and they use your labor to make more capital.
Chinese: 當我啱到大學嗰時 我覺得好迷茫

English: So if you're tired of going to work and making money for other people, then you're probably like me -- just tired of capitalism.
Chinese: 雖然有時我都幾鍾意大學生活嘅 但有時 我覺得自己好似被遺棄咗 只能夠自己照顧自己

English: Which is ironic, because I'm a capitalist.
Chinese: 就好似我從熟悉嘅環境 被流放到陌生環境 冇節奏、冇和聲 原來嘅生活不復返 剩低我自己 （吉他聲） 寂靜，同自己嘅旋律

English: (Laughter) I own a small business -- Rco Tires in Compton.
Chinese: 但呢一切都開始動搖 因為我唔知道自己喺度做緊咩

English: A few years ago, when I read Van Jones, and he wrote, "Let's make green collar jobs in the hood," I took him really seriously.
Chinese: 我冇任何自己嘅和絃 或者節奏 或者感知節拍嘅拍打

English: So I cofounded, own and operate a tire recycling company, and I'm really proud of what we've done.
Chinese: （吉他聲） 之後我開始聽其他聲音

English: So far, we've recycled a hundred million pounds of rubber.
Chinese: （吉他聲） 異常 跑調嘅音樂

English: That's 21 million gallons of oil diverted from landfills into new products.
Chinese: 而我聽得越多 我嘅旋律就越似佢哋

English: (Cheers) We also employ about 15 guys -- mostly people of color, most of whom are felons, and we pay above the minimum wage, and we are now proud members of the United Steelworkers Union.
Chinese: 逐漸，我開始迷失自我 就好似我被海水沖走咗

English: (Applause) Now, Rco is not a cooperative now.
Chinese: 之後下一刻 （吉他聲） 我可以聽到

English: It's a privately held company with community-minded ownership, but I would like it to become one.
Chinese: 我感受得到

English: I would like for them to fire the boss -- that's me.
Chinese: 呢個就係我

English: (Laughter) And I'm going to tell you why, but first, let me tell you how we got started.
Chinese: 我就喺度

English: So a lot of people ask, "How did Rco come to be?"
Chinese: 我與眾不同 我冇頹廢

English: And I have to be really honest.
Chinese: 只不過發生咗啲改變

English: I leveraged my white privilege.
Chinese: 我通過音樂嚟處理生活中嘅變化

English: So, here's how white privilege worked for me and Rco.
Chinese: 音樂同生活之間有種美妙嘅聯繫

English: My white grandmother was born on her family's plantation in Arkansas in 1918.
Chinese: 既可以通向現實 同時又可以逃離現實

English: She traveled with her white father west, following the oil boom.
Chinese: 音樂係你嘅一部份

English: And he held various union oil jobs -- jobs which would have never been given to my black great-grandfather, had he lived here at the time.
Chinese: 你同音樂相輔相成

English: Granny became a hairdresser and then got a loan with her husband who built their home in West Los Angeles -- a loan which would never have been given to a black family at the time.
Chinese: 音樂唔單止只指揮我哋嘅生活 而且仲「創作」埋

English: And after my grandfather passed away, my granny was able to keep that house because she had his pension and his health care from a state job which he held, which again, would have never been given to a black man before the anti-discrimination act of the 1960s.
Chinese: 咁講好似有啲誇張 但係聽我講 音樂係我哋 同我哋周圍一切嘅基本

English: So, you fast-forward 30 years, and I graduate, and I want to start my own business with a pile of debt and a credit card, and no experience in the tire industry.
Chinese: 音樂畀咗我激情 而物理曾經都係我嘅興趣

English: But I had what most people didn't have.
Chinese: 我學得越多 就發現越多佢哋之間嘅聯繫 特別係弦理論

English: I had a clean, safe, free place to live.
Chinese: 我知道呢個只係眾多物理理論中嘅一個 但係佢話畀我知

English: I moved in with my grandmother, and I was able to rent our first warehouse, buy our first truck, pay our first employees, because I didn't have to worry about paying myself, because I didn't need to feed myself, because I am the direct beneficiary of generations of white privilege.
Chinese: 弦理論嘅一方面，最簡單嘅方式 係呢個： 物質由原子組成 原子由質子、中子同電子組成 而佢哋又由誇克組成

English: Now, telling the story of white privilege is important because very often people say, "Oh, we want more companies like yours.
Chinese: 「弦理論」就係咁嚟噶喇

English: We want more Rco's, we want more black-owned businesses, female-led, triple bottom line, Ban the Box, green manufacturing companies," right?
Chinese: 理論認為誇克係由細連續串組成 而呢啲連續串嘅震動就形成咗一切事物

English: But the question we have to ask is, where is the wealth?
Chinese: 加來 道雄 曾經喺一個 叫做「果殼中嘅宇宙」 嘅講座中講過 「弦理論係最簡單嘅 宇宙嘅四種力 萬有引力、電磁力 強相互力、弱相互力 都可以睇成音樂

English: Where is the money?
Chinese: 細細個橡筋演奏嘅音樂」

English: Where's the capital in our communities to build the types of businesses that we want?
Chinese: 喺講座度，佢進一步解釋咗 物理就係呢啲「弦」嘅和諧法則 而化學，就好似呢啲「弦」嘅旋律 宇宙，就係「弦嘅交響樂」

English: And in telling a story of the white side of my family, I needed a dozen ways where blacks were excluded from the economy, whereas the white side of my family was able to gain access and traction, and build wealth ...
Chinese: 呢啲「弦」支配著宇宙 組成一切我哋所見所知嘅嘢

English: Primarily because racism and capitalism are best homies, but -- (Laughter) but what that means is that when we ask ourselves, "Why are our communities broke?" -- Like, we're not just broke because we're broke; we're broke for a reason.
Chinese: 佢哋係音符 但又創造、連接我哋

English: Historical context really does matter.
Chinese: 正如你所見 音樂無處不在

English: But our history tells another story as well.
Chinese: （吉他聲） 當我望向世界 我見到音樂就喺我哋身邊

English: There's this incredible book called "Collective Courage," which is the story of how thousands of African Americans have been able to build businesses and schools, hospitals, farming cooperatives, banks, financial institutions -- entire communities and sovereign economies, without a lot of capital.
Chinese: 當我望向我自己 我見到音樂

English: And they did it by working together and leveraging their community assets and trusting each other and putting solidarity first -- not just profits by any means necessary.
Chinese: 而我嘅生活都被音樂定義咗

English: And they didn't have to wait around for celebrities and athletes to bring their money back to the hood.
Chinese: 我通過音樂搵到自我

English: However, if you are a celebrity or an athlete, and you're listening to this, please feel free to bring your money.
Chinese: 音樂 無處不在

English: (Laughter) But they did it through cooperative economics, because they knew that capitalism was never going to finance black liberation.
Chinese: 音樂會變化 增長或減少

English: So, there are so many great examples in this book, and I suggest that everybody just read it because it answers the question I asked earlier, which was where are we going to get the wealth to build the types of business that we want.
Chinese: 但佢一直喺度 支持著我哋 將我哋之間聯結起嚟 畀我哋睇宇宙嘅美麗

English: And the answer is going to have to be cooperative economics.
Chinese: 所以如果你覺得迷茫 就停低聽你自己嘅音樂

English: There's a lot of different versions of cooperativism.
Chinese: 多謝

English: What I'm talking about today is worker ownership.
Chinese: （掌聲）

English: You may not have heard of worker ownership, but it's been an incredible tool for black economic liberation for a century, and it's also working all over the world right now.
You may have heard of Black Wall Street or maybe the Zapatistas, but I'll give you an example that's a little bit closer to home.
Chinese: 你憎唔憎你老細？

English: Right now, today, in South Bronx, is the country's largest worker-owned company.
Chinese: （笑聲） 你係咪好厭 同人打工？

English: It's called Cooperative Home Care Associates, and it was founded by black and Latinx home care workers who are now able to pay themselves living wages, they have full-time hours, they have benefits and a pension, through their membership as a unit of SEIU.
Chinese: 啲老細又係咩人呢？

English: And these women owners now receive a dividend back on their ownership every year that the company has been profitable, which has been most years.
Chinese: 佢哋用你嘅勞力來賺錢

English: So they're able to really enjoy the fruits of their labor because they fired the boss.
Chinese: 佢哋就係資本家

English: They don't have any big investors.
Chinese: 佢哋有資本 然後用你嘅工作成果來賺錢

English: They don't have fat-cat CEOs or absentee owners taking the profit out of the company.
Chinese: 所以，如果你唔想返工 幫人賺錢 你可能好似我噉 好憎資本主義

English: They each pay in about 1,000 dollars over time in order to gain ownership, and now they own their job.
Chinese: 好諷刺，因為我係資本家

English: Now, there's hundreds of more examples of companies like this springing up all across the country.
Chinese: （笑聲） 我擁有一家小型企業 喺康普頓嘅 Rco 車呔回收公司

English: And I'm so inspired by what they're doing, because it really represents an alternative to the type of economy we have now, which exploits all of us.
Chinese: 幾年前，我睇過范瓊斯寫嘅一本書 裡面講：「我哋應該喺貧窮社區 創造綠領工作機會。」 我好認真對待佢呢番話

English: It also represents an alternative to waiting around for big investors to bring chain stores, or big-box stores to our communities, because honestly, those types of developments, they steal resources from our communities.
Chinese: 於是我同人創立 擁有同經營一間車呔回收公司 我以我哋嘅成就為傲

English: They put our mom-and-pop shops out of business, they make our entrepreneurs into wage workers, and they take money out of our pocket and send it to their shareholders.
Chinese: 目前為止，我哋回收咗一百萬磅橡膠

English: So, I was so inspired by all these stories of resistance and resilience that I got together with a few people here in Los Angeles, and we created LUCI.
Chinese: 將二千一百萬加侖嘅廢油 從垃圾崗回收去咗新產品度

English: LUCI stands for the Los Angeles Union Cooperative Initiative, and our objective is to create more worker-owned businesses here in Los Angeles.
Chinese: （歡呼聲） 我哋請咗大概十五名員工 多數係有色人種 多數有案底 我哋俾嘅人工多過法定最低工資 而且我哋好自豪 係美國鋼鐵工人聯合會嘅會員

English: So far, in the last year, we've created two: Pacific Electric, an electrical company, and Vermont Gage Carwash, which is right here in South-Central, some of you guys might be familiar with it.
Chinese: （掌聲） 到目前為止，Rco 唔係合作社

English: This long-time carwash is now owned and operated by its 20 workers, all of whom are union members as well.
Chinese: 而係一家服務社區嘅私有公司 不過，我希望佢成為一家合作社

English: (Applause) So you might be wondering why the focus on union-worker ownership, but there's a lot of good reasons why the labor movement is a natural ally to the worker-ownership movement.
Chinese: 仲希望佢哋會炒咗個老細 即係我

English: To build these companies that we want in our community, we need a few things.
Chinese: （笑聲） 我話俾你知點解 先講吓我哋係點開始

English: We're going to need money, people and training.
Chinese: 有好多人問： 「Rco 係點嚟嘅呢？」

English: Unions have all of those things.
Chinese: 老實同你講

English: America's working class has been paying union dues for decades, and with it, our unions have been building dignified, decent, and democratic workplaces for us.
Chinese: 我利用咗我嘅白人特權

English: However, union jobs are on the steep decline, and it's time for us to start calling on our unions to really bring all of their financial and political capital to bear in the creation of new, union, living-wage jobs in our communities.
Chinese: 我點用白人特權呢？

English: Also, union halls are full of union members who understand the importance of solidarity and the power of collective action.
Chinese: 我嘅白人阿婆 1918 年 喺阿肯色州一個家族種植園度出世

English: These are the types of folks that want more union businesses to exist, so let's build them with them.
Chinese: 因為石油業好旺，佢同佢爹哋 就搬咗去西部

English: Learning from our unions, learning from our past, learning from our peers, are all going to be very important to our success, which is why I'd like to leave you with one last example and a vision for the future ...
Chinese: 太公做過各種石油工會裡邊嘅工 係我黑人太爺仲在生時 絕對冇得做嘅工

English: and that vision is Mondragon, Spain.
Chinese: 我外婆做咗一名理髮師 然後同我阿公摞到 當時黑人絕對摞唔到嘅貸款 喺羅省西部起咗間屋住

English: Mondragon, Spain is a community built entirely around worker cooperatives.
Chinese: 我阿公過咗身之後 我外婆仲可以繼續住喺嗰度 因為佢有阿公嘅 政府撫恤金同醫療福利 喺 20 世紀 60 年代 通過嘅反歧視法之前 黑人係冇相同嘅權益

English: There's 260-plus businesses here, manufacturing everything from bicycles to washing machines to transformers.
Chinese: 之後 30 年 （即 90 年代） 我畢咗業 想自己創業 即使我成身債， 得一張信用卡 而且對車輪行業冇任何認識同經驗

English: And this group of businesses now employs 80,000 people and earns more than 12 billion euros in revenue every year.
Chinese: 但係我有一樣好多人都冇嘅嘢

English: And all of the companies there are owned by the people that work in them.
Chinese: 我有個乾淨、安全、唔使錢嘅地方住

English: They've also built universities and hospitals and financial institutions.
Chinese: 我搬咗去同我阿婆住 我可以租到我哋嘅第一間倉庫 買我哋嘅第一部貨車 出糧俾我哋嘅第一批員工 因為我唔使擔心要自己出錢 因為我唔使養自己 因為我係代代白人特權嘅直接受益人

English: I mean, imagine if we could build something like this in South-Central.
Chinese: 我講呢個白人特權嘅故事，係因為 好多人時常話 「我哋想要多啲好似你噉嘅公司。

English: The late mayor of Jackson had a similar idea.
Chinese: 我哋想要多啲 Rco。 我哋想要多啲黑人擁有嘅企業， 女人帶領嘅、三重底線嘅 『禁止查問（有冇犯罪紀錄）』嘅 綠色廠商。」

English: He wanted to turn his entire city into a Mondragon-like cooperative economy, calling his ambitious plan "Jackson Rising."
Chinese: 不過我哋要問一下 啲財富喺邊度嚟嘅呢？

English: And when I look at Mondragon, I see really what working-class people can do for ourselves when we work together and make decisions for ourselves and each other and our communities.
Chinese: 啲錢喺邊度嚟嘅呢？

English: And what's really incredible about Mondragon is that while we are dreaming about them, they are dreaming about us.
Chinese: 喺我哋嘅社區創業 本錢喺邊度嚟嘅呢？

English: This community in Spain has decided to launch an international initiative to create more communities like it all over the world, by linking up with unions, by supporting organizations like LUCI, and by educating folks about the worker-ownership model.
Chinese: 我嘅白人親戚係度賺錢時 佢哋用咗好多方法 包括喺經濟上排斥黑人 來得到創業 同賺錢嘅機會

English: Now, here's what you can do to be a part of it.
Chinese: 因為種族主義同資本主義係好兄弟 （笑聲） 既係話，我哋問： 「我哋嘅社區點解咁窮？」嗰時 我哋窮唔淨係因為我哋窮 我哋冇錢係有原因

English: If you're a union member, go to your union meetings, and make sure that your union has a worker-ownership initiative, and become a part of it.
Chinese: 明白歷史背景真係好重要

English: If you're an entrepreneur, if you have a small business, or you're interested in starting one, then link up with LUCI or another organization like us to help you get started on the cooperative model.
Chinese: 我哋嘅歷史仲有另一個故事

English: If you're a politician, or you work for one, or you just like talking to them, please get the city, state, federal and county legislation passed that we need in order to fund and support worker-owned businesses.
Chinese: 有本好書，叫做《集體勇氣》 講成千上萬嘅美國黑人係點樣 唔使用好多錢 建立咗企業、學校 醫院、農業合作社 銀行、同金融機構 一個完整嘅社區同獨立嘅經濟體系

English: And for everybody else, learn about our history, learn about our models, and seek us out so can support us, you can buy from us, invest in us, lend to us and join us, because it's really going to take all of us in order to build the more just and sustainable and resilient economy that we want for ourselves and our children.
Chinese: 佢哋之所以成功，係因為佢哋齊心合作 利用公有資產 互相信任 團結一致 而唔係不擇手段咁牟利

English: And with that, I would like to leave you with a quote from Arundhati Roy, and she writes ...
Chinese: 佢哋唔使等娛樂圈同體育明星 帶啲錢返嚟社區

English:
Our strategy should not be only to confront Empire, but to lay siege to it. 
To deprive it of oxygen. 
To mock it. 
To shame it. 
With our art, our literature, our music, our brilliance, our joy, our sheer relentlessness -- and our ability to tell our own stories. 
Not the stories that we're being brainwashed to believe. 
The corporate revolution will collapse if we refuse to buy what they're selling -- their ideas, their version of history, their wars, their weapons, their sense of inevitability. 
Because know this: They be few and we be many. 
They need us more than we need them. 
Another world is not only possible, she's on her way. 
And on a quiet day, I can hear her breathing.
Chinese: 不過，如果你係娛樂圈或者體育明星 又喺度聽緊我講嘢 歡迎你隨時帶啲錢返嚟

English: Thank you.
Chinese: （笑聲） 佢哋成功係透過合作經濟 因為佢哋知道 資本主義永遠都唔會喺經濟上解放黑人

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 呢本書有好多好正嘅例子 我建議大家讀呢本書 因為佢解答咗我之前嘅問題 就係問我哋想創立嘅理想企業 需要嘅本錢喺邊度
答案就係喺合作經濟嗰度

English: Cities are like siblings in a large polygamous family.
Chinese: 合作經濟形式都有好多種

English: Each one has a unique personality and is headed in a distinct direction.
Chinese: 今日我淨係講工人所有制

English: But they all have somewhat shared origins.
Chinese: 你可能未聽講過工人所有制 佢喺近百年嘅黑人經濟解放 有好大嘅作用 而且喺世界各地都有成效

English: Sometimes I think postcolonial cities are like the children of the two least-favorite wives, who are constantly being asked, "Ah, why can't you be more like your sister?"
Chinese: 你可能聽過黑人華爾街 或者聽過薩帕塔民族解放軍 不過我嚟畀個近期啲，本國嘅例子

English: (Laughter) The "why" of cities is largely the same, no matter where they are: an advantageous location that makes trade and administration possible; the potential for scalable opportunities for the skilled and unskilled alike; a popular willingness to be in constant flux and, of course, resilience.
Chinese: 宜家，喺南布朗克斯 有全國最大嘅工人擁有公司

English: The "how" of cities, however, is a whole other story.
Chinese: 佢叫做居家護理夥伴合作社 由黑人同拉丁裔人創立 出嘅糧真係夠員工生活 員工個個可以做全職 佢哋作為服務行業雇員國際工會成員 有福利同退休金

English: How are they run?
Chinese: 佢哋每年公司分紅 人人有份 幾乎年年都有

English: How do they grow?
Chinese: 佢哋能夠享受自己嘅工作成果 因為佢哋炒咗個老細

English: How do they decide who belongs and who doesn't?
Chinese: 冇巨額投資人

English: Lagos is my home.
Chinese: 冇中飽私囊嘅 行政總裁或者業主

Chinese: 喺箴言裡面講述，如果你笑的話，你會變得快樂， 人人都知，喺真實嘅。

English: Thank you. Bless you, bless you.
Chinese: 第二種困難去遵守的規則喺， 果啲規則會為我們帶來小麻煩 在21世紀嘅美國。

English: But it was interesting because I had some very preconceived notions about, for instance, evangelical Christianity, and I found that it's such a wide and varied movement that it is difficult to make generalizations about it.
Chinese: 可能最清晰嘅例子喺是向通姦嘅人丟石頭。

English: There's a group I met with called the Red Letter Christians, and they focus on the red words in the Bible, which are the ones that Jesus spoke.
Chinese: （笑聲） 但喺依樣喺聖經裏面好大嘅一部分。 所以我想我一定要回應依個問題。

English: That's how they printed them in the old Bibles.
Chinese: 所以,我真喺囉石頭丟一個通姦者。

English: And their argument is that Jesus never talked about homosexuality.
Chinese: 件事喺咁發生嘅--我當時喺公園裏頭，著住一身聖經式嘅裝扮-- 涼鞋同白色的大袍-- 你知道，頭先講過因為外在會影響內在嘅情況下,

English: They have a pamphlet that says, "Here's what Jesus said about homosexuality," and you open it up, and there's nothing in it.
Chinese: 我想知道依一身聖經嘅衣著可以點樣改變我嘅思想。

English: So, they say Jesus did talk a lot about helping the outcasts, helping poor people.
Chinese: 然後個男人走過來同我講， ＂點解你要著成咁樣？＂

English: So, this was very inspiring to me.
Chinese: 然後我向佢解釋我嘅的計劃， 然後佢話，＂我喺一個姦夫，咁你會用石頭丟我嗎？＂

English: I recommend Jim Wallis and Tony Campolo.
Chinese: 然後我話，＂好!這當然最好不過啦!＂

English: They're very inspiring leaders, even though I disagree with much of what they say.
Chinese: （笑聲） 於是我喺我個袋裡面囉咗幾舊石頭， 我已經隨身攜帶咗了好幾星期， 希望一有機會就--當然，果啲喺細石頭-- 但係個男人搶咗我手上嘅石頭。

English: Also, thou shalt not disregard the irrational.
Chinese: 佢其實係一個七十多歲嘅老人家，

English: This one was very unexpected because, you know, I grew up with the scientific worldview, and I was shocked learning how much of my life is governed by irrational forces.
Chinese: 不過佢仍然係一個姦夫，而且係好嬲果種，

English: And the thing is, if they're not harmful, they're not to be completely dismissed.
Chinese: 他搶去了我的石塊。 然後投擲在我的臉中，當時我覺得我可以－ 以眼還眼，我可以報復，所以投擲一塊於他身上。

English: Because I learned that -- I was thinking, I was doing all these rituals, these biblical rituals, separating my wool and linen, and I would ask these religious people "Why would the Bible possibly tell us to do this? Why would God care?"
Chinese: 所以，這是我投石的經驗，這容許我 去用較嚴肅的方法去談及這些重要的課題，

English: And they said, "We don't know, but it's just rituals that give us meaning."
Chinese: 為什麼聖經在某方面能這樣的蠻不講理， 但又在某些地方充滿智慧

English: And I would say, "But that's crazy."
Chinese: 我們應該怎樣看待聖經？

English: And they would say, "Well, what about you?
Chinese: 我們應該是從原意出發， 像是一種Scalia(美國大法官)式的聖經？

English: You blow out candles on top of a birthday cake.
Chinese: 聖經是怎樣寫成的？

English: If a guy from Mars came down and saw, here's one guy blowing out the fire on top of a cake versus another guy not wearing clothes of mixed fabrics, would the Martians say, 'Well, that guy, he makes sense, but that guy's crazy?'" So no, I think that rituals are, by nature, irrational.
Chinese: 但其實，由於這是一個科技的集會， 我書中曾提到聖經其實令我想起了 維基百科，因為它是由各種各樣的作者和編輯編成 在這幾百年裏。

English: So the key is to choose the right rituals, the ones that are not harmful -- but rituals by themselves are not to be dismissed.
Chinese: 它還某程度上進化了。

English: And finally I learned that thou shall pick and choose.
Chinese: 它並不是一本隨天上掉下來的書。

English: And this one I learned because I tried to follow everything in the Bible.
Chinese: 所以我想我最後會告訴你， 是一些易於記住的重要道理， 我在這一年學到的。

English: And I failed miserably.
Chinese: 第一，你不應該硬性地跟隨字面上去理解聖經的意思。

English: Because you can't.
Chinese: 這很早就已經顯然易見。

English: You have to pick and choose. And anyone who follows the Bible is going to be picking and choosing.
Chinese: 因為你這樣的話，你會變成一個瘋漢， 投石於姦夫，又或是，再多舉一個例子，

English: The key is to pick and choose the right parts.
Chinese: 好的,這是另一個--我真的用了一點時間去牧羊。

English: There's the phrase called cafeteria religion, and the fundamentalists will use it in a denigrating way, and they'll say, "Oh, it's just cafeteria religion.
Chinese: （笑聲） 這是一個很輕鬆的職業。我大力推介。

English: You're just picking and choosing."
Chinese: 但這條規則－聖經說你不能觸碰女人， 於每個月的某些日子，還有, 你不能坐在曾經被經期婦女坐過的椅子。

English: But my argument is, "What's wrong with cafeterias?"
Chinese: 我的妻子覺得這很侮辱女人, 所以她把我們家的每個座位都坐了一遍。 我要在那一年中站了不少時間。 直至我買給自己可以隨身攜帶的椅子。

English: I've had some great meals at cafeterias.
Chinese: 所以,你知道的,我遇到一個創世論者.

English: I've also had some meals that make me want to dry heave.
Chinese: 我去了他們的博物館，

English: So, it's about choosing the parts of the Bible about compassion, about tolerance, about loving your neighbor, as opposed to the parts about homosexuality is a sin, or intolerance, or violence, which are very much in the Bible as well.
Chinese: 他們是終極的字面跟隨者，

English: So if we are to find any meaning in this book, then we have to really engage it, and wrestle with it.
Chinese: 這真令人眼界大開，因為他們根本不是蠢人來的。

English: And I thought I'd end with just a couple more.
Chinese: 我賭他們的智商跟相信進化論的人一樣。

English: There's me reading the Bible.
Chinese: 只是他們有很強烈的信仰， 執著於聖經上的字面解釋 他們扭曲所有的數據以滿足他們的模式。

English: That's how I hailed taxicabs.
Chinese: 他們通過這些令人驚訝的心理訓練來做到這一點。

English: (Laughter) Seriously, and it worked. And yes, that was actually a rented sheep, so I had to return that in the morning, but it served well for a day.
Chinese: 然而我要說的是,這博物館很華麗。

English: So, anyway, thank you so much for letting me speak.
Chinese: 他們真的做得很好。
如果你到過肯塔基州, 就是這--你可以去看關於大洪水的電影, 他們在天花板上裝灑水器 當播放到洪水畫面時便淋水在你身上.

English: I was six when I had the first chance to learn what patience means.
Chinese: 所以,不管你怎樣看待創世論者,我覺得他們很荒誕, 他們做得很好。

English: My grandmother gave me a magic box as a birthday present, which neither of us knew would become a gift for life.
Chinese: （笑聲） 另一個道理是該感恩。

English: I became obsessed with magic, and at 20, I became an amateur dove magician.
Chinese: 這是重要的一課因為我在禱告時， 我在感恩禱告，這是一件對於無神論者而言很怪的事情。

English: This act of magic requires that I train my doves to sit and wait inside my clothing.
Chinese: 但我每天常常都在感恩,任何時間, 我開始改變了自己看事情的角度，

English: As a young magician, I was always in a rush to make them appear, but my teacher told me the secret to the success of this magical act is to make my doves appear only after they've waited patiently in my tuxedo.
Chinese: 而且我開始了解身邊數以百計的小事情， 那些如意的事情，那些小得我不會發覺的事。 我把他們的發生當作理所當然的--但不是把視線集中於 少數不如意的事情。

English: It has to be a mindful kind of patience, the kind that took me some years to master.
Chinese: 所以，這是我快樂的秘訣， 只是去記得我來會場的途中， 車子沒有翻掉，我沒有在上樓梯時滑倒，

English: When life took me to Shanghai seven years ago, the mindful patience I learned became almost impossible to practice.
Chinese: 這是一件精彩的事。

English: In China, where everyone and everything is in a hurry, you need to outperform over 1.3 billion other people to build a better life.
Chinese: 第三，你要尊敬別人，

English: You hack the system, bend the rules, circumvent the boundaries.
Chinese: 這個是出人意表的因為我這年開始的時候， 是一個不可知論者，到了年末， 我變成一個給朋友叫作尊敬的不可知論者,我十分喜愛這個名稱。

English: It is the same when it comes to food ...
Chinese: 我現在嘗試將這個活動變為潮流.

English: except that when it comes to food, impatience can have dire consequences.
Chinese: 所以如果大家想參加的話， 最基本的概念是，無論有沒有神的存在， 總有一些重要和美麗的神聖的想法, 而且我們的儀式是很神聖的。

English: In the haste to grow more, sell more, 4,000 years of agriculture in a country of rich natural resources is spoiled by the overuse of chemicals and pesticides.
Chinese: 安息日是很神聖的。

English: In 2016, the Chinese government revealed half a million food safety violations in just nine months.
Chinese: 我這年其中一樣美好的事，就是守安息日, 因為我是個工作狂，當我有了這樣的一天， 當不能工作--真的大大改變了我一生。

English: Alarmingly, one in every four diabetics in the world now comes from China.
Chinese: 所以,這是神聖的概念，無論有沒有上帝也好.

English: The stories around food are scary and somewhat overwhelming, and I told myself it's time to bring a mindful patience into the impatience.
Chinese: 你都不應把它公式化。

English: When I say mindful patience, I don't mean the ability to wait.
Chinese: 這種體會是因為我 用了很多時間跟隨了不同的宗教團體， 在美國各地。因為我想它 不只是我個人的旅程。

English: I mean knowing how to act while waiting.
Chinese: 我想探討美國的宗教，

English: And so, while I wait for the day when a sustainable food system becomes a reality in China, I launched one of China's first online farmers market to bring local, organically grown produce to families.
Chinese: 因此我用了不少時間在福音派基督教、哈西德教派和阿米希教派。

English: When we went live, 18 months ago, the food we could sell then was somewhat dismal.
Chinese: 我感到自豪因為 我覺得我是美國唯一一個 能在宗教討論時說服到一個耶和華見證。

English: We had no fruit and hardly any meat to sell, as none that was sent to the lab passed our zero tolerance test towards pesticides, chemicals, antibiotics and hormones.
Chinese: （笑聲） 在三個半小時後，他看一看他的手表， 他說，＂我不得不走了。＂

English: I told our very anxious employees that we would not give up until we've met every local farmer in China.
Chinese: （笑聲） 謝謝大家。

English: Today, we supply 240 types of produce from 57 local farmers.
Chinese: 謝謝。祝福你，祝福你。

English: After almost one year of searching, we finally found chemical-free bananas grown in the backyards of villagers on Hainan Island.
Chinese: 但這是很有趣的， 因為我有一些先入為主的思想，例如， 福音派基督教，我發現， 這次一個很廣泛的運動， 是很難一概而論的。

English: And only two hours away from Shanghai, on an island that even Google Maps does not have coordinates for, we found a place where cows eat grass and roam free under the blue sky.
Chinese: 我認識一隊人叫紅字基督徒， 他們集中研究在聖經裏的紅字， 那些是耶穌所說的話--

English: We also work hard on logistics.
Chinese: 在舊聖經中都是以紅色印上去的。

English: We deliver our customers' orders in as fast as three hours on electric vehicles, and we use biodegradable, reusable boxes to minimize our environmental footprint.
Chinese: 他們的論點是耶穌從來沒有講過同性戀。

English: I have no doubt that our offerings will continue to grow, but it will take time, and I know a lot more people are needed to shape the future of good food.
Chinese: 他們有一本小冊子說著, 這是耶穌曾就同性戀所說的話, 然而你把它打開,發覺當中空白一片。

English: So last year, I founded China's first food tech accelerator and VC platform to help start-ups to shape the future of good food the way they want, be that through using edible insects as a more sustainable source of protein or using essential oils to keep food fresh for longer.
Chinese: 所以，他們說耶穌曾說過很多有關幫助被抛棄的人的事， 幫助窮人的事。

English: So, you may still ask: Why are you trying to build a sustainable food system by driving a patient movement in a country where it's almost a crime to take it slow?
Chinese: 所以這對我有很大的啟發。

English: Because, for me, the real secret to success is patience -- a mindful kind of patience that requires knowing how to act while waiting, the kind of patience I learned with my grandmother's magic box.
Chinese: 我會推介Jim Wallace 和Tony Campolo,

English: After all, we do not inherit the earth from our ancestors.
Chinese: 他們是非常鼓舞人心的領袖,縱使我不認同, 他們多數的言論。

English: We borrow it from our children.
Chinese: 還有,你不可以忽略不理性的事情.

English: Thank you.
Chinese: 這個發現令我驚訝非常,因為,你們知道, 我從科學化的角度中成長, 然而我十分震驚的發現我的生命 是由非理性的力量所操控.

English: (Applause)
Chinese: 還有的是,就算那些力量不是有害的, 他們不可以完全去除的。
因為我學會了，當我在想－ 我做了這些儀式，這些聖經上的儀式， 區分羊毛和麻布質料。 我問那些虔誠的人， ＂為什麼聖經要我們做這些東西？為什麼上帝會注意這些事情？＂

English: I'd like to talk to you today about the scale of the scientific effort that goes into making the headlines you see in the paper.
Chinese: 他們會回答，＂我們不知道, 但這些儀式給與我們某些特定意義。＂

English: Headlines that look like this when they have to do with climate change; and like this when they have to do with air quality or smog.
Chinese: 我會說，＂這是不可理喻的。＂

English: They're two branches of the same field of atmospheric science.
Chinese: 他們回答，＂那麼你又怎樣？＂

English: Recently, the headlines looked like this when the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, or IPCC, put out their report on the state of understanding of the atmospheric system.
Chinese: 你吹熄了生日蛋糕上的蠟燭

English: They wrote almost 1,000 pages on the topic, and all of those pages were reviewed by another 400-plus scientists and reviewers from 113 countries.
Chinese: 如果火星來的人看見,他會說 有一個人正在吹熄了生日蛋糕上的火光。 對比於一個不穿混合纖維衣服的人， 火星人會不會說，＂這個人很正常，＂ ＂但那個人是變態的嗎？＂ 不是，所以我覺得那些儀式在自然層面來說，是不理性的。

English: It's a big community; such a big community, in fact, that our annual gathering is the largest scientific meeting in the world.
Chinese: 所以重點是要挑選正確的儀式， 那些無害的儀式--但是儀式本身 他們不會給忽略的。

English: Over 15,000 scientists go to San Francisco every year for that.
Chinese: 最後，我學到了大家應該有所選擇。

English: Every one of those scientists is in a research group, and every research group studies a wide variety of topics.
Chinese: 我學了這個因為 我嘗是跟迶聖經中的所有的事，

English: For us at Cambridge, it's as varied as the El Niño Oscillation, which affects weather and climate, to the assimilation of satellite data, to emissions from crops that produce biofuels, which is what I study.
Chinese: 但我淒慘地失敗。

English: And in each one of these research areas, of which there are even more, there are PhD students, like me, and we study incredibly narrow topics, things as narrow as a few processes or a few molecules.
Chinese: 因為你不可以，

English: And one of the molecules I study is called isoprene, which is here.
Chinese: 所以你要挑選，任何人要遵守聖經的話， 也要挑選。

English: It's a small organic molecule.
Chinese: 重點在於挑選正確的部分。

English: The weight of a paper clip is approximately equal to 900 zeta-illion -- 10 to the 21st -- molecules of isoprene.
Chinese: 有一個詞彙叫做"自助餐式宗教" 基本主義的人會把它視為有詆毀性般去使用。 他們會說，＂這只是自坐助餐式宗教。＂

English: But despite its very small weight, enough of it is emitted into the atmosphere every year to equal the weight of all the people on the planet.
Chinese: 你只是在挑你喜歡的東西。

English: It's a huge amount of stuff. It's equal to the weight of methane.
Chinese: 但我的論點是，＂自助餐又有什麼問題呢？＂

English: And because it's so much stuff, it's really important for the atmospheric system.
Chinese: 我在自助餐廳有吃得很開心的經驗。

English: Because it's important to the atmospheric system, we go to all lengths to study this thing.
Chinese: 亦曾遇到一些難吃得令人噴飯的

English: We blow it up and look at the pieces.
Chinese: 所以，這是關於怎樣挑選聖經裡有關同情心的部分， 有關包容，有關愛你的近鄰， 跟反對＂同性戀等於罪＂ 又或是不寬容，或暴力, 在聖經裡也相當的多。

English: This is the EUPHORE Smog Chamber in Spain.
Chinese: 所以我們要在這本書找出任何意義， 我們必須全身投入，並且奮戰不懈。

English: Atmospheric explosions, or full combustion, takes about 15,000 times longer than what happens in your car.
Chinese: 我想臨走前多給大家幾個例子。

English: But still, we look at the pieces.
Chinese: 這是我正在閱讀聖經.

English: We run enormous models on supercomputers; this is what I happen to do.
Chinese: 這是我如何招呼的士。

English: Our models have hundreds of thousands of grid boxes calculating hundreds of variables each, on minute timescales.
Chinese: （笑聲） 認真的，而且有效的--且是的, 那其實是一只租來的羊, 所以我必須在早上歸還牠,但是牠整天都被好好的照顧。

English: It takes weeks to perform our integrations, and we perform dozens of integrations in order to understand what's happening.
Chinese: 所以,無論如何,謝謝你們讓我來演講。

English: We also fly all over the world looking for this thing.
I recently joined a field campaign in Malaysia -- there are others.
Chinese: 六歲個陣我第一次知道人要有耐性

English: We found a global atmospheric watchtower there in the middle of the rainforest, and hung hundreds of thousands of dollars' worth of scientific equipment off this tower, to look for isoprene and other things while we were there.
Chinese: 我嫲嫲畀咗我一個魔术盒作為生日禮物 但係我哋都唔知佢會成為我一生嘅恩赐

English: This is the tower in the middle of the rainforest from above, and the tower from below.
Chinese: 我開始沉迷魔術 20 歲，我成為一名業餘白鴿魔術師

English: On part of that field campaign we even brought an aircraft with us.
Chinese: 呢種魔術表演需要我訓練我嘅白鴿 籬喺我件衫裏面等待

English: And this plane, the model BAe-146, which was run by FAAM, normally flies 120 to 130 people, so maybe you took a similar aircraft to get here today.
Chinese: 因為後生衝動 我成日都急於將白鴿放出嚟 但係我嘅老師話 魔術藝術成功嘅秘訣 就係等我嘅白鴿 喺燕尾服裏面夠曬耐性 先放出嚟

English: But we didn't just fly it.
Chinese: 要做到咁需要極大嘅耐性 我用咗好多年先至做到

English: We were flying at 100 meters above the top of the canopy to measure this molecule -- incredibly dangerous stuff.
Chinese: 當七年前我嚟到上海 我學識嘅極大耐心幾乎冇用

English: We have to fly at a special incline to make the measurements; we hire military and test pilots to do the maneuvering; we need special flight clearance.
Chinese: 喺中國，任何人任何事都好急 你想過好啲嘅生活 就要比其他十三億人做得更好

English: As you come around the banks in these valleys, the forces can get up to two Gs; the scientists must be completely harnessed in in order to make measurements while on board.
Chinese: 咁就會有人做黑客，違法規則 遊走於法律嘅邊緣

English: So as you can imagine, the inside of the aircraft doesn't look like one you'd take on vacation.
Chinese: 甚至食品行業都係咁

English: It's a flying laboratory we took to make measurements of this molecule.
Chinese: 但唔同嘅係 冇耐性對食品嘅影響不堪設想

English: We do all this to understand the chemistry of one molecule.
Chinese: 因為急於生產同銷售 呢個國家四千年嚟嘅豐富農耕資源 都因濫用化肥、殺蟲劑被破壞

English: And when one student like me has some sort of inclination or understanding about that molecule, they write one scientific paper on the subject.
Chinese: 2016 年，短短九個月間 中國政府就頒佈咗 成百萬條食品安全條例

English: And out of that field campaign we'll probably get a few dozen papers on a few dozen processes or molecules.
